Together with his wife, Teresa Elias i Mabràs, he initiated a lineage of local businessmen, promoters and urbanizers. His successors were Joaquim Castelló Elias and Josep Maria Castelló Puig Oriol.

carrer.name: Castelló, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Josep Castelló-Galvany i Quadras (1829 - 1880). Local landowner.

carrer.name: Castells, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Manuel Castells i Carles (Pobleta, Pallars Jussà, 1843 - Barcelona, 1904). Patent leather manufacturer. In 1874, he bought the lands and a house where he installed his factory. Promoter of the Castells housing estate. Married to Maria Juncosa i Ripoll. His successors were his sons Agustí and Manuel Castells i Juncosa.

carrer.name: Castells, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after the local owner, Manuel Castells i Carles, or rather after his son Manuel Castell i Juncosa (Barcelona, 1872 - 1912), in the samy way there is another passageway dedicated to his daughter-in-law, Maria Dolors Barnola i Grau.

carrer.name: Castellterçol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Vallès Oriental. Street within the Coll neighborhood, where most streets are named after Catalan towns and villages.

carrer.name: Castellví, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Castellví de la Marca, borough of Alt Penedès. Street within the Torre Baró borough, where most streets are named after villages and places of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Casteràs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Carmen Casteràs, mother of the owner of the lands around 1920, Feliu Casanovas i Casteràs.

carrer.name: Castor, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Group of streets within the Guineueta neighborhood, named after animals.

carrer.name: Catalana, Plaça
carrer.descripcio: Square so named in memory of the "Catalan Fountain" there used to be.

carrer.name: Catalunya, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Belongs to a group of passageways running into Indústria street.

carrer.name: Catalunya, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Or Catalonia Square. Catalonia was constituted at the end of the X century as a group of Counties within the Spanish March, reaching its political and cultural plenitude between the XIII and XV century. Its organization as a State ends in 1714, when it is integrated into the Spanish State.

carrer.name: Catalunya, Moll de
carrer.descripcio: Pier closing the Industria basin in the South.

carrer.name: Catalunya, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: In its lower section, this boulevard used to cross the Malla torrent, formerly Ariga torrent, already mentioned in documents dating back to 1089. Old boulevard named Catalunya (Catalonia) after the square it crosses.
carrer.anteriors: Cataluña; Eusebio Güell (without effectiveness); Cataluña; Isabel II (before being opened)

carrer.name: Catània, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town in Sicily. Street of the Besòs neighborhood, within a street group named after Italian villages and towns.

carrer.name: Catasús, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Catasús i Nadal (Pla del Penedès, Alt Penedès, 1879 - Barcelona, 1945). Owner. In 1923, he bought some land at the places called "la pedrera de Tardà" (Tardà quarry) and "Can Dragó".

carrer.name: Catedral, Avinguda de la
carrer.descripcio: Avenue leading to the Cathedral. Construction on the present gothic Cathedral started in 1296, under King Jaume II. But beneath, rests of the former Romanesque Cathedral, built by Ramon Berenguer the Elder, and of the primitive paleochristian Basilica have been found.

carrer.name: Caterina Albert, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Gardens named after Caterina Albert i Paradís (L'Escala, Alt Empordà, 1869 - 1966). Novelist, narrator, playwright, and naturalist poet, known under the pseudonym of Víctor Català.

carrer.name: Cavallers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: North of Can Canet de la Riera, an estate comprising lands extending over 13 'mujadas' (83,366 m2) in the XIX century, 898 'canas' (1,396 m2) dedicated to agriculture, besides there was an orchard, and the rest uncultivated land. No relation could be found between the name 'cavallers' and the nearby Cavaller farm, south of the Can Canet estate. It is said that, as there was a "carrer de les Dames" (Ladies' street), there had to be a Chevaliers' street, too.

carrer.name: Cecs de la Boqueria, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: By orders of the Town Council (XV century), blind street prayers and beggars were obliged to live in houses of this street. The name of the neighborhood where the street is, 'Boqueria', was added to' cecs' (the blind).

carrer.name: Cecs de Sant Cugat, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: The same as "Cecs de la Boqueria", this street running into Sant Cugat square is where the blinds were obliged to live.

carrer.name: Celrà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Gironès. Street within Ramon Albó housing estate, where streets are named after towns and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Cementiri de Collserola, Carretera del
carrer.descripcio: A road leading to the Nord or "Collserola" cemetery. It starts at the road leading from Horta to Cerdanyola and ends in the municipal land of Montcada i Reixac.

carrer.name: Cementiri de Sant Gervasi, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Road leading to the Sant Gervasi cemetery.

carrer.name: Cementiri de Sarrià, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Road leading to the Sarrià cemetery.

carrer.name: Cementiri d'Horta, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square facing the Horta cemetery.

carrer.name: Cendra, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Corruption of the family name Sendre or Sendra, owner of the small houses that occupied the street side in front of the fence of the Jerònimes' orchard.

carrer.name: Centelles, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after this borough of Osona, which gave name to the family who had the Palace of Centelles, of the Dukes of Solferino, in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Central, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Square so named because of the old power plant, installed by Doctor Andreu in order to grant the electric power supply for the blue tramway.

carrer.name: Central de Nou Barris, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Public park within the area delimited by the streets: Vilalba dels Arcs, Marie Curie, Lorena, Doctor Pi i Molist, and Albert Einstein. Named after the district where it is located.

carrer.name: Centre, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street situated more or less in the center of the Guinardó housing estate.

carrer.name: Centre, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: This was the central square in the urbanization project for the lands limiting with Les Corts, property of the Count of Bell-lloc. The project was approved by the Town Hall of Sants in 1873.

carrer.name: Cep, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: This "Vine Street", together with the "carrer de l'Espiga" (Ear Street) at the other side of the square named "del Congrés Eucarístic" (of the Eucharistic Congress), remind us of the basic elements of bread and wine, and of their transubstantiation.

carrer.name: Cera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Means Wax street. It seems that the name comes from a wax bleacher shop there had been on this street.

carrer.name: Ceràmica, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street surrounding a housing estate of the Montbau neighborhood. The passageways parting from this street are named after colors: violet, blue, pink, yellow, and white. So this is colorful ceramics.

carrer.name: Cerdà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Joan Sardà i Artés, married to Maria Ribó i Sagristà, owner of these lands in the XIX century, when he bought them from Pere Vintró.

carrer.name: Cerdanyola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Cerdanyola del Vallès, borough of Vallès Occidental. Street so named in memory of the fact that in 1385, this town made a petition to be integrated into Barcelona through a procedure known as 'carreratge', by which the borough is considered as a street of Barcelona. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the capital city.

carrer.name: Cerignola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Fact of Arms of Cerignola (Pulla, Italy, April 28, 1503), occurred during the war between Louis XII of France and Ferran the Catholic, was decisive for the division of the Kingdom of Naples, which both together had seized from Frederic II of Naples. The army was constituted by mercenaries, many of them Catalans, under the orders of Gonzalo Fernández de Córdoba, the Great Captain.

carrer.name: Cermeño, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Juan Martín Cermeño (? - Barcelona, 1773). Military engineer. His was the project for the Barceloneta neighborhood, based on a former project of the Marquis of Verboom, similar to the English urbanization of Georgetown in Menorca. Construction started in 1753.

carrer.name: Cervantes, Parc de
carrer.descripcio: Park named after Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra (Alcalá de Henares, 1547 - Madrid, 1616), the most universal of all Spanish writers.

carrer.name: Cervantes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra (Alcalá de Henares, 1547 - Madrid, 1616). The most famous writer in Spanish language of all times, who achieved worldwide prestige after publishing the 'Don Quijote' in 1605.

carrer.name: Cervelló, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Baix Llobregat, and also name of an old noble Catalan family, constituted in the X century by a certain Ansulf (or Assolf), probably of German or Frank origin. The most illustrious descendants of this family were Guerau Alemany de Cervelló and the Guillem. Humbert Cervelló was Bishop of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Cervera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Cervera is a borough of La Segarra, and also the name of an old aristocratic Catalan family, so named after the town of origin.

carrer.name: Cèsar Martinell, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Gardens named after Cèsar Martinell i Brunet (Valls, Alt Camp, 1888 - Barcelona, 1973). Architect and art historian. His spirit of the nineteenth century and Gaudí's teachings culminated in a series of agricultural buildings at different points of Catalonia, specially in the Camp of Tarragona region, some of them declared as property of cultural interest. He also dedicated to monument restoration. He was Secretary of the Associació d'Amics de l'Art Vell (Association of Friends of Ancient Art), Dean of the Association of Architects, and founder of the Centre d'Estudis Gaudinistes. He did a great job as historian of art and architecture. His book about Gaudi's life and works entitled 'Gaudí, su vida, su teoría, su obra' (1967) is still fundamental for everybody who wishes to know a little more about this genius of modern architecture. Name proposed by Maria Martinell and Germà Vidal.

carrer.name: César Vallejo, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after César Vallejo (Santiago de Chuco, Peru, 1892 - Paris, 1938). Peruvian poet, narrator, essayist. Specially relevant are his posthumous poems: 'España, aparta de' 'mí este cáliz' (Spain, take this chalice from me)(1937-1938).

carrer.name: Cesare Cantù, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Cesare Cantù i Gallavresi (Brivio, Brianza, Como province, 1804 - Milano, 1895). Italian politician, historian, and writer. He participated in the Giovane Italia movement. As soon as Lombardy was free (1889), he was elected member of the Italian Parliament. His most remarkable work as historian is his extensive 'Storia Universale' (1838-1846).

carrer.name: Ceuta, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after this Spanish town in Northern Africa, on the other side of the Strait of Gibraltar, annexed to the Spanish Crown by Felipe II (1580).

carrer.name: Ceuta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Spanish town in North Africa. Street running into the Gibraltar square.

carrer.name: Las Chafarinas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Chafarinas Islands under Spanish sovereignty (Rey, Isabel II, y Congreso) in the Mediterranean, near the Moroccan coast. Street name approved together with that of Alhucemas.

carrer.name: Chapí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ruperto Chapí y Lorente (Villena, Alto Vinalopó, 1851 - Madrid, 1909). Compositor of operas and zarzuelas (operettas). Founder of the Sociedad de Autores, Compositores y Editores de Música (Society of Authors, Composers and Music Editors).

carrer.name: Chapí, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway running into the street with the same name.

carrer.name: Charlie Rivel, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Josep Andreu i Laserre (Cubelles, Garraf, 1896 - 1983). Clown of international renown, famous all over the world by his pseudonym Charlie Rivel.

carrer.name: Charlot, Placeta de
carrer.descripcio: Carmel Tusquellas i Forcén (Barcelona 1893 - 1967). Comical bullfighter known as "Charlot's. His debut was at the Arenas of Barcelona in 1916 and since then he popularized the 'xarlotades'. Name proposed by the Centre d'Estudis Populars of Roquetes.

carrer.name: Chopin, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fryderik Franciszeck Chopin Krzyzanowska (Zelazowa-Wola, Warsaw, Poland, 1810 - Paris, France, 1849). World-famous Polish composer and pianist.

carrer.name: Ciceró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Marcus Tullius Cicero (Arpino, 106 b.Ch. - Formia, 43 b.Ch.). Orator, writer, politician, and philosopher of ancient Rome, considered as one of the first Roman lawyers.

carrer.name: Cid, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Cid, by-name of Arab origin (sidi = sir) by which Rodrigo Díaz de Vivar (Vivar, Castile, 1043 - Valencia, Horta 1099) was known. His person was mythified in literature ('Cantar del mio Cid'). According to History, he was a noble warrior under several different monarchs. His victory in single combat with Jimeno Garcés of Navarra (towards 1066) won him the by-name Campeador.

carrer.name: Ciències, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: This street "of Sciences" goes with that of Lletres (Humanities), both converging with Dante Alighieri street.

carrer.name: Cienfuegos, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town in Cuba, in the Las Villas province. Integrated in a group of streets named after places and towns of Cuba and of the Antilles.

carrer.name: Cifuentes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Guadalajara. The most eminent person of this County was Fernando de Silva-Meneses y Sfondrato, 13th Count of Cifuentes (1666 - 1749). He was Deputy in Sardinia of King Archduke Charles III, who named him Grandee of Spain in 1717, bestowing upon him the Toisón de Oro (Golden Fleece). In Sardinia, it took his best efforts to get sufficient money and troops together to fight against Philip V of Castile, who had confiscated his properties.

carrer.name: Cigne, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A typical street of Gràcia. As the neighboring l'Oreneta street, this is dedicated to a bird, too, this time to the swan.

carrer.name: Cimal, Passeig del
carrer.descripcio: Promenade leading up to the peak of "Puig de Sant Joan".

carrer.name: Cinc Torres, Passatge de les
carrer.descripcio: Named so because of the first five houses built in this passageway.

carrer.name: Cinca, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Cinca river in the Ebro basin, tributary of the Segre.

carrer.name: Circumval·lació, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street so named because it ran around a local estate.

carrer.name: Circumval·lació, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Promenade bordering the Ciudadella Park in the South.

carrer.name: Cirera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street already mentioned with the same name in documents of the XVI century, probably named after a noble Ça Cirera family.

carrer.name: Cirerers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the sherry tree. In this area of Pedralbes, also the following street names can be found: Ametllers (almond tree), Avellaners (chestnut tree) and Nogueres (walnut tree).

carrer.name: Cirici Pellicer, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Alexandre Cirici i Pellicer (Barcelona, 1914 - 1983). Essayist and art critic, politician. Doctor of History. Professor of design at the Eina School, and of art sociology at the University of Barcelona. He also dedicated to illustrating books and painting. Founding member of several associations, he organized the Museum of Contemporaneous Art of Barcelona (1960).

carrer.name: Cisell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: One of the group of streets within the Zona Franca neighborhood, named after materials and tools used in industry.
carrer.anteriors: Cincel; Centauro (not considered); Prat Vermell (from old times)

carrer.name: Cisquer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Village within the borough of La Vansa i Fórnols (Alt Urgell). The street belongs to a group of streets within Eduard Aunós housing estate, named after villages and places of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Cistellet, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street within Ramon Albó housing estate, where streets are named after Catalan villages, in this case supposedly after Cistella, village of Alt Empordà, but changing one letter in order to avoid duplicity with the existing Castellet street.

carrer.name: Císter, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Refers to the Cistercian Order, a modified branch of the Benedictine Order. The street was so named because there is a Monastery of Cistercian nuns.
carrer.anteriors: Nueva Belén; Cister; Nueva Belén, before 1885

carrer.name: Ciudad Real, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town of Castile-La Mancha.

carrer.name: Ciureny, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Path named after an edible mushroom of the 'Boletus castaneus' and 'Boletus bulbosus' species.

carrer.name: Ciutadans, Passatge dels
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named "Citizens" as proposed by Otili Alba, a neighbor living in this street, probably a fan of the French Revolution.

carrer.name: Ciutadella, Parc de la
carrer.descripcio: Park of the Citadel, in memory of the fortress called Ciutadella, built where the old Ribera neighborhood used to be, a short time after Barcelona was conquered by the troops loyal to Philip V, in 1714.

carrer.name: Ciutadella, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after this borough of Menorca.

carrer.name: Ciutadella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Menorca.

carrer.name: Ciutat, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street facing the old front façade of the Town Hall, built in 1399-1402 by the master builder Arnau Bargués, and the sculpturers Jordi Joan and Pere Sanglada.

carrer.name: Ciutat d'Asunción, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Capital city of Paraguay. This was the first street in the industrial area of the Bon Pastor neighborhood, where streets are named after villages and towns of Latin America.

carrer.name: Ciutat de Balaguer, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Borough of La Noguera. The Town Hall of Balaguer applied for this street name in a document dated June 23, 1926. The petition was denied on November 15, 1926, claiming that "naming streets after towns and villages is a serious cause of disturbance, among other reasons because it generates frequent errors in mail interchange". Years later this problem was solved by adding the words 'city of' before the city name.
carrer.anteriors: Ciudad de Balaguer; Babilònia, 05/09/1907; San Bartolomé, before 1893

carrer.name: Ciutat de Granada, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Capital of the Andalusian province of the same name. To avoid confusion with an already existing Granada street, the city name is preceded by the words 'city of'.
carrer.anteriors: Granada, 07/07/1942; San Quintín, 07/03/1939; Martí Vilanova, 09/12/1931; Pablo Iglesias, 04/02/1931; San Quintín, 14/06/1927; Cataluña, before 1900; Núm. 47 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Ciutat de Mallorca, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: In the Porta neighborhood there are many streets named after Balearic towns and villages.

carrer.name: Ciutat de Mallorca, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: Promenade named after this borough of Western Majorca, later called Palma according to the "Nova Planta" Decree.

carrer.name: Ciutat d'Elx, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Baix Vinalopó.

carrer.name: Civader, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Documents dating back to the XV century mention as a neighbor of this street a certain barley seller called Mateu. It is then possible that the street name comes from this or any other barley seller.

carrer.name: Clarà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Village within the borough of Argentona (Maresme), around the Monastery of Clarà, a Benedictine Priorate near Orrius. Street within the housing estate Baró de Viver, where streets are named after towns and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Clarà Ayats, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Clarà i Ayats (Olot, Garrotxa, 1878 - Barcelona, 1958). Sculpturer of the "Novecento". Tireless worker. Honorary Medal at the International Fair of Barcelona (1929). Grand Prix in 1954, at the Spanish-American Bienale. He had his own museum in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Clara Campoamor, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Clara Campoamor i Rodríguez (Madrid, 1888 - Lausanne, Switzerland, 1972). Politician, jurist, and writer. Parliament Deputy for the Radical Party (1931-1933). She defended the women's right to vote.

carrer.name: Claramunt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Village of the borough of Fígols de la Conca (Pallars Jussà). This street is in the Milans del Bosch housing estate, where streets are named after places and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Claravall, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Burgundy Monastery, third Cistercian foundation, located within the Diocese of Langres, now Troyes. Here used to live Saint Bernard Calvó. This street was so named in memory of the old Monastery of Santa Maria de Valldonzella.

carrer.name: Clariana, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Clariana de Cardener, borough of Solsonès. The street is in the Baró de Viver housing estate, where streets are named after places and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Claudi Güell, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Promenade named after Claudi Güell i López (Comillas, Cantabria, 1879 - Barcelona, 1918), son of Eusebi Güell i Bacigalupi, who received the Viscounty of Güell in 1911.

carrer.name: Claudi Sabadell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Claudi Sabadell i Sostres (Barcelona, 1860 - 1944). Manufacturer. He lived in house Number 3 of Portolà street, and paid the construction of the stairs descending from this street to the República Argentina avenue, thus preventing neighbors from falling down a dangerous slope.

carrer.name: Clavell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the flower. Nearby is the Lliri (iris) street. Names chosen by the urbanizers.

carrer.name: Clementina Arderiu, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Clementina Arderiu i Voltas (Barcelona, 1889 - 1976). Poet.

carrer.name: Clip, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway called CLIP, corresponding to the initial letters of the street names bordering the block: Córcega, Lepant, Indústria, and Padilla.

carrer.name: Clos de Sant Francesc, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Refers to the fence of 'Hort de Vilana', an estate with a very high fence and a manor with gothic windows, demolished in 1970. After the Vilana family, the owners were Ponsich, Miralles d'Imperial, and Marfà.
carrer.anteriors: Cercado de San Francisco; Clos de Sant Francesc; Cercado de San Francisco; Clos de Sant Francesc (Town Hall of Sarrià); San Francisco

carrer.name: Clot, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The neighborhood within the former township of Sant Martí de Provençals, the name of which comes from 'Clot de la Mel', a depressed rural area around the Comtal irrigation channel, with many vegetable gardens supplying Barcelona with fresh vegetables.
carrer.anteriors: Clot de la Mel?; Ctra. de Ribas

carrer.name: Clot, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: Park named after the neighborhood where it is located.

carrer.name: Clot de la Mel, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Gardens within one of the oldest neighborhoods of Sant Martí de Provençals, called "Cros", which means "deep hollow", for the fields laying in depressions. This neighborhood was built little by little along the ancient Roman road. As there were many flowers, bushes, and trees planted among the vegetable fields, and also plenty of rosemary, beehives were installed (see "Ca dels Seguers, passatge de") to get honey. Due to the excellence of the honey obtained, this place was later called "Clot de la Mel".

carrer.name: Clota, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Square named after the neighborhood where it is located.

carrer.name: Clotés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after an old local family, whose name already appears in the hearth-tax records dating back to the beginning of the XVI century.
carrer.anteriors: San Agustín (a section); Lletra F (Casa Falcó)

carrer.name: Clotilde Cerdà, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Gardens named after Clotilde Cerdà i Bosch (Barcelona, 1852 - Santa Cruz de Tenerife, 1926). Very successful harp concertist, world-wide known as Esmeralda Cervantes. She taught to play the harp in the harem of the Turkish Sultan. She was married to the Brazilian capitalist Grossmann. In 1919, she returned to Barcelona.

carrer.name: Cobalt, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street in the Zona Franca neighborhood, where streets are named after materials and tools used in industry.

carrer.name: Còdols, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Còdols means pebbles. But the street name actually comes from "codals", place where the Collserola torrent flowed into the sea, at the foot of the Tàber.

carrer.name: Codonyer, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the quince tree, within a street group named after trees and bushes.

carrer.name: Coello, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after Claudio Coello (Madrid, 1642 - 1693). Spanish painter, an expert in the fresco painting technique, and in religious and portrait painting.

carrer.name: Coïmbra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Portuguese town Coimbra, together with the nearby streets at Horta, Lisboa and Porto.

carrer.name: Coll, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Enric Coll i Masadas (Barcelona, 1843 - 1915). Lawyer and owner. He inherited 7 'mujadas' (45,048.5 m2) of land from his uncle Pacià Masadas i Teixidor.

carrer.name: Coll, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: In 1933, Esteve Coll i Ubach (Alòs, Noguera, 1895 - Barcelona, 1969) was the owner of an inner passageway, which was named after him when more constructions were added. Formerly it was called "passageway to the internal houses". The site was at a place known as "taulat d'en Llimona", property of Delfí Artós i Mornau in the XIX century.

carrer.name: Coll de Finestrelles, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: The name of this square near 'Petras Albas' already appears in documents dating back to 1068.

carrer.name: Coll del Portell, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: Avenue named after the Coll del Portell -a hill between the Turó de Móra (or "del Carmel") and the Turó de la Rovira- at the confluence of the road to Carmel, the Santuari street, and the Gran Vista street, following the borderline between the former townships of Gràcia, Horta, and Sant Martí de Provençals.

carrer.name: Coll del Portell, Pas del
carrer.descripcio: Cross-street of the avenue named the same.

carrer.name: Coll del Portell, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passageway at the right side of the Eixample, following the track of the former road to the Port del Portell mountain pass, which was the borderline between the former townships of Barcelona, Sant Martí de Provençals, and Gràcia.

carrer.name: Coll i Alentorn, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Miquel Coll i Alentorn (Barcelona, 1904 - 1990). Though a professional textile engineer, he had a deep vocation for culture, to which he dedicated his utmost efforts. Since his early youth, he assumed a firm compromise with politics, joining the Democratic Union Party from the very beginning, always defending his ideals of fraternity, justice, democracy, and freedom for our people. President of the Catalan Autonomic Chamber (1984-1988). Gold Medal of the Generalitat.

carrer.name: Coll i Vehí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Coll i Vehí (Torrent d'Empordà, Baix Empordà, 1823 - Girona, 1876). Writer and critic. He was one of the founding members of Barcelona's Casino (1849), and member of the Academy of Fine Letters of Barcelona. He used the pseudonym Garibay.
carrer.anteriors: Coll y Vehi; San Miguel y San Matías

carrer.name: Collblanc, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In the Hospitalet neighborhood. The old name of Collblanc that appears in documents dating back to 986 was' Terrarios Albos', now the name of a neighborhood of Hospitalet, on the borderline with Barcelona, determined by the "riera Blanca" (white brook).

carrer.name: Collegats, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after a gorge opened by the Noguera Pallaresa river between La Pobla de Segur and Gerri de la Sal. According to Villarrubia, this is the name of the owner.

carrer.name: Collserola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Old place-name appearing in documents dating as far back as 988.

carrer.name: Colom, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Christopher Columbus (1451 ? - Valladolid, 1506). Navigator at the service of the Crown of Castile, discoverer of America. In the XVIII century, a theory came up that Columbus was Catalan. But Genoese notarial (1470) and judicial (1479) documents seem to confirm that he was original from Genoa.

carrer.name: Colom, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Promenade named after Christopher Columbus, the discoverer of America.
carrer.anteriors: Colón; Ctra. Casa Antúnez (a section); Bajo Muralla

carrer.name: Colòmbia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Latin American country. Colombia was a Spanish Colony from 1499 to 1819, the year when it declared its independence as Republic of Great Colombia, with jurisdiction over New Grenada, Venezuela, Ecuador, and Panama, Simon Bolivar being the elected President.

carrer.name: Colomer, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after Rosa Colomer i Castell, owner of a piece of land of 5 'mujadas' (32,177.5 m2), inherited from Eudald Capdevila i Balderich.

carrer.name: Colomines, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The origin of this street name is unknown. Most probably it was the name of a family established in this street already in the XIV century.

carrer.name: Coloms, Passatge dels
carrer.descripcio: Means Pigeon Passageway. Also the popular name of a street near the Sant Josep Market, and the street "de les Cabres" (goats) and "de la Petxina" (shells).

carrer.name: Colònia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the German city Cologne, in North-Rhine Westphalia.

carrer.name: Colònia Bausili, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after Andreu Bausili Abadal (Barcelona, 1833 - 1890). Manufacturer. Founder of the Bausili settlement.

carrer.name: Colònia del Tibidabo, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Settlement South of the central core of Tibidabo.
carrer.anteriors: Mayor del Tibidabo; Colonia del Doctor Andreu

carrer.name: Comalada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Family name of one of the promoters who urbanized this street.

carrer.name: Comandant Benítez, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Julio Benítez y Benítez (Burgo, Malaga, 1878 - Melilla, 1921). Major who found a heroic death at the Igueriben outpost (Melilla) in 1921, after a siege lasting five days.
carrer.anteriors: Comandante Benítez; Núm. 10 (Plan of Les Corts)

carrer.name: Comandant Llança, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Rafael de Llança i de Valls-Morera (XIX century). Lieutenant-Colonel of Infantry. He participated in the Russian Campaign (1812) commanding a corps in Napoleon's army. This street was named after him because he was an ancestor of the promoter of this settlement, Ignasi Llança.
carrer.anteriors: Comandante Llanza; Font del Llavallol; Lletra B (Ignacio Llanzá residential area)

carrer.name: Comas, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Josep Comas i Masferrer (Barcelona, 1842 - 1908). Liberal politician. Manufacturer. Town Councilor of Barcelona, President of the County Council, life-time Senator. Owner of the lands.

carrer.name: Comas d'Argemí, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after Josep Comas d'Argemí (Barcelona, 1838 - 1907). Owner of the lands, made over to him in a deed in his favor by Marià de Montoliu i de Rocabruna. He was married to Filomena Serrallonga i Planas.

carrer.name: Comas i Solà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Comas i Solà (Barcelona, 1868 - 1937). Astronomer. In 1911, he founded the Astronomic Society of Spain and America. He controlled the installation of the Fabra Observatory. Director of the Astronomy Service of the Generalitat.

carrer.name: Combinació, Baixada de la
carrer.descripcio: Old name of the Chapí street, which it joins.

carrer.name: Comerç, Placeta del
carrer.descripcio: Little enlargement, starting point of the Comerç street.

carrer.name: Comerç, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Typical square of Sant Andreu, formerly a market place where birds and books were sold, and a meeting point for singing or discussing politics in the XIX century.

carrer.name: Comerç, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street so named in memory of the trade activities with the many ships mooring in the port of Barcelona. This street was planned to provide the port with an easier access in times when the Via Laietana was not yet open.

carrer.name: Comercial, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: So named at the same time as the Comerç street was given its name, when the "Born" market opened on November 28, 1870.

carrer.name: Comercial, Plaça
carrer.descripcio: Square in front of the Born market.

carrer.name: Cometa, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Body with a long queue in the skies of the solar system. The street was so named when the Halley comet crossed the skies of Barcelona (1834).

carrer.name: Companyia, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Popular name, supposedly because there had been a company in the passageway.

carrer.name: Comtal, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: This street was opened in the XIV century near the walls of the Palace of Valldaura, the Counts of Barcelona had outside the city wall.

carrer.name: Comte Borrell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Borrell II of Barcelona (? before 934 - Urgell, 992). Count of Barcelona, Girona, and Osona (942-992), and Count of Urgell (948-992). His government greatly contributed to constitution of a Catalan national personality, when refusing to pay vassalage to the Frank King in 988.

carrer.name: Comte de Güell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Eusebi Güell i Bacigalupi (Barcelona, 1846 - 1918). Manufacturer and Maecenas of architect Antoni Gaudí. Economist and publicist. Councilor of Barcelona (1875). Provincial Deputy (1878) and Senator. President of the Catalan Center. Sponsor of Catalan culture, he was president and preserver of the Floral Games (1900). Member of the Academy of Sant Jordi of Barcelona. He was married to Isabel López i Bru.
carrer.anteriors: Conde de Güell; Núm. 32 (Plan of Les Corts)

carrer.name: Comte de Noroña, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Gaspar María de Nava Álvarez de Noroña (Castellón de la Plana, Plana Alta, 1760 - Madrid, 1815). Spanish writer and military. General in the Independence War (1809). As commander of the Miño Division, he took part in the Battle of Sampayo Bridge, decisive for Marshall Ney's withdrawal from Portugal and Galicia.

carrer.name: Comte de Salvatierra, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Maestre i Laborde-Boix (Valencia, Horta, 1872 - 1920). Politician, member of the Conservative Party. Mayor of Valencia (1903-1904 y 1913-1915), Civil Governor of Cadiz, Seville, and Barcelona (1919-1920). He was killed by anarchists.
carrer.anteriors: Conde de Salvatierra; Narciso Oller; Conde de Salvatierra

carrer.name: Comte de Santa Clara, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Procopi de Bassecourt i de Bryas (Barcelona, 1740 - 1820). Second Count of Santa Clara and Baron of Maials. Governor of Louisiana and Florida, and Commander-in-Chief of Cuba and of Catalonia (1802-1808).
carrer.anteriors: Conde de Santa Clara; Santa Clara

carrer.name: Comte de Sert, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Francesc de Paula Sert i Badia (Barcelona 1863 - 1919), Count of Sert.

carrer.name: Comte de Sert, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc de Paula Sert i Badia (Barcelona, 1863 - 1919). Mechanical engineer, Big Cross of Naval Merit. Title conferred to him in 1904.
carrer.anteriors: Conde de Sert; Núm. 13 (S.A. El Tibidabo residential area)

carrer.name: Comte d'Urgell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jaume II of Urgell, called the Wretched (Balaguer, Noguera, 1378/1380 - Castle of Játiva, 1433). Count of Urgell and Viscount of Àger. Baron of Entenza. Son of Pere II of Urgell and of Margarita de Montferrat. He was imprisoned and destituted from his County by Fernando de Antequera.
carrer.anteriors: Urgel, 07/03/1939; Conde de Urgel; Urgel; Núm. 20 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Comte Tallaferro, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Bernard I of Besalú (? before 970 - Provence, 1020). Sole Count of Besalú (994-1020). Son of Oliba Cabreta and Ermengarda, brother of Oliba, Bishop of Vic. In the XII century, narrators of epic deeds gave him the by-name Tallaferro. Immortalized in Jacint Verdaguer's poem 'Canigó'.

carrer.name: Comtes, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: So named because of the palace of the Counts of Barcelona, standing at the same place since the X century. There are vestiges of the XI century palace in the outer walls.

carrer.name: Comtes de Bell-lloc, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Title conferred to Ramon de Bell-lloc i de Macip, Earl of Bell-lloc, Chief Jury of Girona, by the Archduke Charles of Austria (Habsburg) in 1707. The street was so named because the Counts were owners of the land urbanized by Joaquim de Mercader i de Belloch, Count of Bell-lloch, towards the end of the XIX century. His heir was Arnau de Mercader i de Zufia.

carrer.name: Comtessa de Pardo Bazán, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Emilia Pardo-Bazán i de la Rua-Figueroa (La Coruña, 1851 - Madrid, 1921). Novelist, essayist, and Galician feminist. Professor of literature in doctorate courses at the University of Madrid. She cultivated literary criticism, philosophy, chronicles, monograph, theater, and history.

carrer.name: Comtessa de Sobradiel, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street was opened in 1860, when the Minor Royal Palace was demolished. The Sobradiel family inherited the lands from the Requesens, the former owners who urbanized the place (1853).

carrer.name: Conca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Cuenca, town and province of Castile-La Mancha.
carrer.anteriors: Cuenca; Anselmo Lorenzo; Luchana (a section); Cardoner (a section)

carrer.name: Conca de Tremp, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Depression in the center of Pallars Jussà, in the Catalan Pyrenees, opening towards the Noguera Pallaresa valley.
carrer.anteriors: San Juan (a section); Cº o ctra. del Carmelo

carrer.name: Concepció, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Passageway of the Immaculate Conception. Catholic doctrine according to which the Virgin Maria would have been preserved from original sin since the moment of her conception, defined as a dogma of faith by Pope Pius IX in 1854.

carrer.name: Concepción Arenal, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Galician sociologist, pedagogue, and essayist (Ferrol, La Coruña, 1820 - Vigo, 1893). She promoted the society of the Red Cross to assist to the wounded of the Charlist War, and the foundation called "La constructora benéfica para casas de obreros" (benefic constructors of workers' homes). She concentrated her fight on three fronts: the workers' rights, the reform of the Penal Code, and the defense of women's rights.

carrer.name: Concili de Trento, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The XIX Ecumenical Council, celebrated at Trent, Italy, between 1545 and 1563, in three distinct periods under the Popes Paul III, Julio III, and Pius IV.
carrer.anteriors: Concilio de Trento; Consejo de Ciento (3rd section); Lletra Ll (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Concòrdia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Formerly called "del Setge de 1714" (street of the siege of 1714). The present name, 'Concòrdia', was approved in 1927. During the Second Republic (1933-1939), the street recovered its former name, which was changed back to 'Concòrdia' in 1939.
carrer.anteriors: Sitio de 1714; Concòrdia; Sitio de 1714; Laurel

carrer.name: Concòrdia, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: The parish church of Our Lady of the Remedies was built between 1846 and 1849, before the landowners of Les Corts, Closas, Gelabert, and Cuyàs, had transferred their lands. Josep Closas i Pagès made over a part of his property to the Town Hall or Administration Board of the parish church of Les Corts, where the square and a 30 spans wide free access were to be built, subject to the condition that the lands would go back to the property of Can Closes, if the other landowners decided to retract from their compromise. The name Concordia makes reference to these agreements, established between the aforesaid owners, and with the Town Hall.

carrer.name: Conflent, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Region within the Principality of Catalonia, in northern Catalonia. Capital of the Prada district.

carrer.name: Congost, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The Congost river is one of the main streams integrating the Besòs river.

carrer.name: Congrés, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Since the XIX century, many important congresses took place in Barcelona, for example the International Congress of the Catalan Language in 1906.

carrer.name: Congrés Eucarístic, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square so named in memory of the International Eucharistic Congress celebrated in Barcelona on May 1952.

carrer.name: Conrad Xalabarder, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Conrad Xalabarder i Puig (Caldes de Montbui, Vallès Oriental, 1899 - Barcelona, 1979). Doctor of medicine. He dedicated his life to fighting tuberculosis, and was one of the first promoters of electronic microscopy studies in Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: Mare de Déu de Lorda, 12/06/1980; Nuestra Señora de Lourdes, before 1942

carrer.name: Conradí, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway formerly named 'Coradino', a corruption of 'Conradino', in memory of Conrad V of Hohenstaufen (Wolfstein, Bavaria, ? - Naples, 1258). Duke of Suabia, King of Sicily and of Jerusalem.

carrer.name: Conreria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In memory of the Carthusian hospice (Conrería de la Cartuja) of Montalegre, at the northern border of the township of Tiana (Maresme), where formerly was a Cloister that offered asylum to the people evacuated from the Barceloneta neighborhood during the yellow fever epidemic in 1870.

carrer.name: Consell de Cent, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The "Council of the Hundred", established in the XIII century, was the Consultative Assembly of the City Council of Barcelona, and was abolished in 1714 by the "nova planta" decree. It was made up of five executive Councilors, and a deliberating council of over a hundred sworn-in outstanding men, representing all statuses of society, initially excluding the military status. Its jurisdiction extended from Molins de Rei to Montcada and from Montgat to Castelldefels.
carrer.anteriors: Consejo de Ciento; Lletra Ll (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Consell de la Vila, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square so named in memory of the old institution in charge of the Government and Administration of Sarrià, when Sarrià was an independent township, which celebrated its last meeting on October 27, 1714. Later, when the new regime was implanted by the "Nova Planta" decree, only the Town hall subsisted, undergoing several reformations as times were changing, until November 4, 1921, when Sarrià was integrated into Barcelona. (AHCB:RiC).

carrer.name: Consellers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: So named in memory of the former Councilors of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Consolat de Mar, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: So named because here was the "Consulate of the Sea", also called "Bar Association of the Sea", the special jurisdiction competent in all affairs related with trade and navigation, between the XII and the XIX century.

carrer.name: Consorts Sans Bernet, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Sans i Graus (Barcelona, 1861 - 1927), married to Magdalena Bernet i Font (Barcelona, 1864 - 1932). Co-founders of the benefic association of Catholic Schools for workers' children.

carrer.name: Constança, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Constance of Sicily (Sicily, 1247 - Barcelona, 1302). Queen of Catalonia-Aragon and of Sicily, wife of Pere II, mother of Saint Elizabeth. Dante mentions her in the 'Purgatory' as "la buona Costanza".
carrer.anteriors: Constanza; Ángeles, o Nuestra Señora de los Ángeles, 07/09/1878

carrer.name: Constància, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Name chosen by the urbanizer of this passageway. The owner was Josep Aloy i Romaní.

carrer.name: Constantí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Tarragonès.

carrer.name: Constantinoble, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Capital of the Byzantine Empire, later of the Ottoman Empire. Under Emperor Constantine I, Constantinople was built on the same spot where ancient Byzantium had been. In 1930, the name of this city was changed into Istanbul.

carrer.name: Constel·lacions, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Square named Constellations, those random agglomerations of stars, identified by astrology, and later by astronomy, according to their apparently fixed position in the sky.

carrer.name: Constitució, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Refers to the Constitution of 1869, a sequel of the September Revolution of 1868, by which Queen Isabel (Elizabeth) II was overthrown. That time, this street and many others were given names of progressist ideals, such as Progrés, Llibertat, Riego, etc., by members of the Liberal Union Party.

carrer.name: Contradic, Moll del
carrer.descripcio: Pier South of the Morrot basin.

carrer.name: Conveni, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Group of neighboring streets with related names: Cooperació (co-operation), Confiança (confidence), Negoci (business).

carrer.name: Conxita Badia, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Concepció Badia i Millàs (1897 - 1975). Soprano. She taught singing at the Superior Conservatoire of Music of Barcelona. Her specialty was the 'lied'. She had been disciple and performer of Enric Granados.

carrer.name: Conxita Supervia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Concepción Supervia i Pascual (Barcelona, 1895 - London. 1936). Mezzo-soprano. She studied at the Conservatoire of the Liceo, Barcelona's opera house. Her debut was in 1909, at the Colon Theater in Buenos Aires, and in 1912 at the Liceo with the opera 'Carmen'.

carrer.name: Copèrnic, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Nicholas Copernicus (Thorn-Fravenburg, 1473 - 1543). Polish astronomer. He studied and worked alternatively in Poland and Italy, and is considered the founder of modern astronomy.
carrer.anteriors: Copérnico, 27/10/1876; Negrevernís, partly on 05/01/1876, the other on 25/01/1927; Batlle de Cork, 21/11/1921 (without effectiveness)

carrer.name: Copons, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Named after an old noble Catalan family, known since before the XIII century. There was a Ponç de Copons, Abbot of Poblet during the first half of the XIV century. The most famous was Francesc de Copons i Navia, Count of Tarifa, military during the Independence War, and Commander-in-Chief of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Corçà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Baix Empordà, and street in Barcelona, so named in memory of the fact that in 1442, this town made a petition to be integrated into Barcelona through a procedure known as 'carreratge'.

carrer.name: Cordelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Irrigation Plan which included the lands presently belonging to La Maquinista.

carrer.name: Corders, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: So named because of the rope manufacturers or sellers who formerly were installed in this street. Their existence as guild corporation dates back to the beginning of the XIV century.

carrer.name: Còrdova, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Capital and province of Cordoba, in Andalusia, famous in history for its Caliphate. Since those times, the relationship between Cordoba and Catalonia remains marked by the expedition of a Catalan army of ten thousand men, under Ramon Borrell, Count of Barcelona, and Ermengol I, Count of Urgell, in 1010.

carrer.name: Corint, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Corinth, town in the Peloponese, in Greece, running into the Atenes (Athens) street.

carrer.name: Cornet i Mas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Maria Cornet i Mas (Sarrià, 1839 - Barcelona, 1916). Mechanical engineer. Director of the factory 'La Maquinista Terrestre y Marítima'. Politician. Author of the Born market (1874-1876) together with master builder Josep Fontseré i Mestres. Deputy for Sarrià. This street was named after him by municipal agreement, because he prevented Sarrià from being included in the Royal Decree about Annexation to Barcelona, of 1897.
carrer.anteriors: Cornet i Mas; Mediona, before 1897; Unión (a section)

carrer.name: Cornudella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Cornudella de Montsant, borough of Priorat. Street within the Ramon Albó housing estate, where streets are named after towns and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Coroleu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Coroleu i Inglada (Barcelona, 1839 - 1895). Historian and politician. He took part in the foundation of the Catalan Center, and actively co-operated with the Bases of Manresa.
carrer.anteriors: Puerto Rico; Nuestra Señora del Pilar

carrer.name: Coronel Sanfeliu, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Sanfeliu i Codina (Prat de Llobregat, Baix Llobregat, 1839 - Barcelona, 1899). Commander of Volunteers under General Prim in the Africa Campaign, known for his deeds during the Battle of Castillejos (1860), where he died being a captain, promoted to coroner after his death. He had lived in the street named after him in 1927. He was named favorite son of Sant Martí de Provençals.

carrer.name: Corral, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: So named because of a former corral measuring 13.60 x 53 meters, there was at Number 15 of Bartomeu Pi street, and Number 16 of Corral street. In the beginning of the XX century, several ceramists and other craftsmen installed their workshops here, as can be read in the registrar description of 1916. The corral doesn't exist any more.

carrer.name: Corretger, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Probably so named because of the saddlers established in this street, whose guild dates back to 1424.

carrer.name: Correu Vell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: So named because the first Post Office of Barcelona opened its doors here during the first third of the XVIII century.

carrer.name: Còrsega, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Corsica, the now French island in the Mediterranean, has strong historical links with Catalonia. In 1297, it was conferred in feud to Jaume II by Pope Boniface VIII, a relationship with the Crown of Catalonia-Aragon that extinguished in 1458, when King Alfons IV died.

carrer.name: Còrsega, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway running into the street of this name.

carrer.name: Cortada, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the family that owned and urbanized this part of Horta. The main street within this urbanized area was named Rambla de Cortada, later changed to Campoamor street.
carrer.anteriors: Cortada; Santa Eulàlia; Núm. 44 (Plan of enlaces)

carrer.name: Cortines, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Named after the owners family of this place.

carrer.name: Cortit, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after an important Catalan family, originally from Gra, a village belonging to the town hall of Florejacs (Segarra). monsignor Joan Cortit, Gentleman of the XIV and XV century. When Jaume II, Count of Urgell, called the Wretched, rebelled against Ferran of Trastamara in Spring of 1413, the Gentleman Joan Cortit followed him. After the revolt was crushed on October 31, 1414, he was interrogated in the process against Jaume II, in the presence of Vice-Chancellor Bernat de Gualbes. This street was opened in the beginning of the century XIX in the lands owned by Joan Antoni de Peguera i Miquela de Borràs, and later by Joan B. de Ros i de Molins, and partly property of Pacià Masadas. Though it has always been thought that the Cortit family was the owner of this place, there are no documents supporting this theory.

carrer.name: Corts, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Old township in the area around Barcelona belonging to Sarrià until 1836, when it became independent. Integrated into Barcelona in 1897.

carrer.name: Corts, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Square so named on proposal of the Council of the Les Corts District, in agreement with the neighbors.

carrer.name: Corts, Travessera de les
carrer.descripcio: Cross-street within the former township of Les Corts.

carrer.name: Corts Catalanes, Gran Via de les
carrer.descripcio: The old 'Corts Catalanes' (Catalan Parliament). The meeting of the County Court summoned in 1098 by Ramon Borrell was the first parliament session there is notice of. Properly, the 'Corts Catalanes' date back to 1192, when a popular representation participates for the first time in an assembly for peace and truce.
carrer.anteriors: Av. de José Antonio Primo de Rivera, 07/03/1939; Av. de las Cortes Catalanas, 04/02/1931; Cortes, before 1900; Lletra N (Cerdà plan); Núm. 11 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Corunya, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after A Coruña, province and city of Galicia.
carrer.anteriors: San Quintín; Gómez de Baquero (Andrenio); Martí Vilanova; San Quintín; Cataluña

carrer.name: Costa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: So named because it runs uphill.

carrer.name: Costa, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after Josep Costa i Pujol (Badalona, Barcelonès, 1866 - Barcelona, 1951). Owner of the lands, bought in 1924 from Manuel Maria Sivatte i Llopart.

carrer.name: Costa, Moll de la
carrer.descripcio: Pier in front of the Morrot station.

carrer.name: Costa Brava, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Catalan coast going from Blanes to the French border.

carrer.name: Costa Daurada, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Catalan coast going from the Ebro delta to the Llobregat delta.

carrer.name: Costa del Putget, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Passageway running up the Putget hill.

carrer.name: Costa i Cuxart, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Cebrià Costa i Cuxart (Valencia, Horta, 1817 - Barcelona, 1886). Botanist. Lecturer of Botanic at the University of Barcelona (1847).
carrer.anteriors: Antoni Costa i Cuxart; Alfons Aiguavives

carrer.name: Costa Pacheco, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Maria de la Concepció Costa i Pacheco, daughter of Concepció Pacheco i Càrcer, owner of the lands.

carrer.name: Costa Rica, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Republic of Central America.

carrer.name: Costabona, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the massif in the Pyrenees, where, among others, the towns of Prats de Molló and Setcases can be found. Street in the neighborhood called Ciutat Meridiana, where most streets are named after Catalan mountains.

carrer.name: Cotoners, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: The cotton weavers guild dates back to 1433, and had its home in this street during centuries. Cotton weavers were already represented in the first Town Council of 1257.

carrer.name: Coure, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the copper, a noble metal the symbol of which is Cu.

carrer.name: Mare de Déu del Pilar (Carmel), Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: So named in memory of Maria del Pilar de la Barre i Díaz de Manso, sister of Agustí and Maria de los Reyes, heirs of the Mas Falcó estate, owners of the lands.

carrer.name: Craywinckel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Manuel Felipe de Craywinckel i de Pechmann (1752 - 1815). First owner of 15 'mujadas' (approx. 98.000 m2) of land belonging to the Frare Negre estate. His successors were Manuel Lluís de Craywinckel i Craywinckel, married to Salustiana Fernández, and Josep Joaquim Craywinckel i Craywinckel, married to María del Sagrario Hurtado i Palomeque (Toledo, 1791 - 1866).

carrer.name: Crèdit, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named "Credit", because it was built in 1875 by the 'Sociedad Catalana General de Crédito', on the site formerly occupied by the 'Castell Nou' (New Castle).

carrer.name: Crehuet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Crehuet i Pujolà, owner of the lands he bought in 1787. His heir was his son Antoni Crehuet i Barceló, and in 1876, the brother of the latter, Francesc Crehuet i Barceló.

carrer.name: Cremat Gran i Xic, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: The name of Carrer Cremat Gran (Great Burnt Street) and Carrer Cremat Xic (Small Burnt Street) goes back to some events that took place in the 15th century, when a baker's at the Carrer d'En Jaume des Fonts, as it was then called, burnt down. Popular memory gave this street name a fame that has endured over the centuries. This street was also well known, as Carrer de la Sal, for the traders and salt carriers who established themselves there.
carrer.anteriors: Sal, before 1500 ; Jaume des Fonts, before 1390

carrer.name: Cresques, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Father and son. Eminent representatives of the Catalan-Majorcan cartographic school. Cresques Abraham (Ciudad de Mallorca, 1381 - ?). Jewish cartographer, compass maker, watchmaker, and builder of nautical instruments. Jafuda Cresques (Ciudad de Mallorca ? - Barcelona, 1410). Jewish cartographer, son of the former.

carrer.name: Cretes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Matarraña. Street within the Bon Pastor neighborhood, where most streets are named after places and villages of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Creu Coberta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Border cross mentioned in documents of the XIV century. In the XV century, there is mention of a cross at the Coll de la Creu (Cross Hill), where the unfortunate condemned were hanged. In 1573, the Town Councilors charged Pere Ferré with the task of building a new cross, as the old one was in bad shape. In 1823, this cross was removed, and later replaced by a cross from the former cemetery of Santa Maria del Pi.
carrer.anteriors: Cruz Cubierta; Cº de Madrid; Cº Real; Cº Ant. de la Cruz Cubierta; Cº del Portal de San Antonio; Cº Ant. de San Antonio

carrer.name: Creu de Magòria, Placeta de
carrer.descripcio: Small square around a cross within the medieval township of Magòria.

carrer.name: Creu de Pedralbes, Jardins de la
carrer.descripcio: Gardens around the boundary cross next to the Monastery of Pedralbes.

carrer.name: Creu dels Molers, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: So named because of the cross there was on the old road to the Montjuïc quarries, now transformed into this street.

carrer.name: Creu Roja, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Square named after the International Red Cross, an international organization, set up to help soldiers wounded in acts of war. It was founded in 1863 by the Swiss citizen Jean-Henri Dunant. The Red Cross was introduced in the Catalan Countries in 1872, with the creation of the local committee of Barcelona, which later undertook the steps necessary to build the Red Cross Hospital of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Crillon, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Louis Antoine Berton des Balbes (Avignon, France, 1717 - Madrid, 1796). Duke of Crillon and of Mahon. French military at the service of Charles III of Spain. He conquered Menorca, recovering the island from English dominion (1782). Commander-in-Chief of the Kingdoms of Valencia and Murcia (1782).

carrer.name: Crisantem, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the chrysanthemum, a perennial plant giving plenty of flowers. Street within a street group named after plants and flowers: Begònia (begonia), Hortènsia (hydrangea), Gessamí (jasmine), Dàlia (dahlia), Lotus.

carrer.name: Cristóbal de Moura, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: First Marquis of Castel-Rodrigo (Lisbon, 1538 - Madrid, 1613). Portuguese politician at the service of Castile, main negotiator to get Portugal under the dominion of Felipe II. He was Viceroy of Portugal (1600-1603, 1608-1612).
carrer.anteriors: Vilanova (part of 3rd section); Lletra R (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Croia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town in Albania, capital of the region named the same, which had belonged to Catalonia from 1451 to 1459. Then it belonged to Venice until 1468, when it was occupied by the Turks.

carrer.name: Cros, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the chemical factory opened at Sants in 1817 by François Cros Dupuy (Montpellier, 1768 - Barcelona, 1831).

carrer.name: Cuba, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Country of Central America, island of the Antilles, in the Caribbean. A Spanish colony until 1898, when Cuba became an independent country by virtue of the Treaty of Paris.

carrer.name: Cubelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Garraf. Street so named in memory of the fact that in 1417 this city made a petition to be integrated into Barcelona through a procedure known as 'carreratge', by which the borough is considered as a street of Barcelona. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city.

carrer.name: Cucurulla, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It is said that in the Middle Ages, this street was called "de la Figuera Cucurella", which was here already before the area was urbanized.

carrer.name: Cucurulla, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named the same as the street.

carrer.name: Cultura, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Means "Culture Square", so named at the neighbors' request after a sculpture contest.

carrer.name: Cunit, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Baix Penedès, within the Tarragona province.

carrer.name: Curt, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Means "short street".

carrer.name: Cuyàs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street between Moianès street and Gavà street. In 1834, Joan Bas, tailor master, sold some land on this spot to Lluís Cuyàs i Closas, who died in 1835. His son Pau Cuyàs Burés (1784 - 1866), farmer, and his heir Lluís Cuyàs i Estaper, consolidated this street name.

carrer.name: Cuzco, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: City of Peru. Street within the Bon Pastor industrial estate, where streets are named after villages and towns of Latin America.

carrer.name: D, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: In the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, streets designated with letters run in the North-South direction, while streets designated with numbers run in the East-West direction.

carrer.name: Dagueria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Name derived from the cutlers who used to be and trade in this street. The name is anterior to the XVI century. In one house of this street died the miracle-worker Saint Joseph Oriol in 1702.

carrer.name: Dàlia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In 1953 names of flowers were given to the streets of this place, without any index of streets and squares.

carrer.name: Dalmàcia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Region of western Croatia. Alfons IV of Catalonia-Aragon aimed to dominate Dalmatia to establish his sovereignty rights on the people of that area. This is not a title of the King of Spain despite of the statement in a communal document.
carrer.anteriors: Buena Salud, 1931; Dalmacia; Buena Salud (Town Hall of Sarrià); San Rafael, before 1888

carrer.name: Dalmases, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Catalan family, owner of vast lands in that place. We highlight Carmen de Dalmases i d'Olivart, de Ferrer, Corbera, Terré, Cordelles i Gomar (Barcelona 1842 - 1920). Married with Trinitat de Foncuberta i de Perramon in 1863. In the 1980 index of streets and squares this dedication was changed in favor of Pau Ignasi de Dalmases i Ros (Barcelona 1670 - 1718). Doctor of Arts and Philosophy, an erudite and diplomatic person.

carrer.name: Dalmau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josephine Dalmau i Rosell, owner, daughter of Joseph Dalmau i Prats, velvet tradesman, and of Teresa Rosell Codinach. Married with Antoni Daunas i Serra, veil weaver, obtained the lands, in 1855, thanks to a permanent sale in his favor by Joseph Fillol i Fita, chemist. In 1875 his hereditary son, Evarist Daunas i Dalmau, and his brothers, sold Emili Cros i Isaac the lands.

carrer.name: Dalmau de Creixell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Empordà, XII-XIII centuries). Knight of Pere I and of Jaume I. He fought in the battle of Muret (1213). He settled down in Toulouse, took part in the fights against the Croats of Simon de Montfort. He was attributed the role of major general in the battle of the Plains of Toulouse (1212) although he most likely not participated in it. The street name was approved by request of Rafael Torrent i Garrigolas.

carrer.name: Dalt, Ronda de
carrer.descripcio: Corresponds to the route formerly named II Cinturó or highway B-20.

carrer.name: Dalt, Travessera de
carrer.descripcio: Street that connected the royal Madrid road with the Ribes road, without going through Barcelona.

carrer.name: Dames, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Probably to accommodate in this street ladies of the palace of the Virreyes built in the Pla de Palau. Víctor Balaguer believes that the name was given with a satirical meaning.

carrer.name: Damià Forment, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Valencia, Horta ? XV century - Santo Domingo de la Calzada, Castile 1540). Imaginary Renaissance sculptor, son and follower of Pau Forment.

carrer.name: Dansa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street located within the Montbau neighborhood, forming a group of roads with similar names.

carrer.name: Dante, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Dante Alighieri (Alaghieri) (Florence 1265 - Ravenna 1321), Italian poet of international renown.

carrer.name: Dante Alighieri, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Refers to the same dedication of the square. Dante is a diminutive name of Durante, Dant, in Catalan.

carrer.name: Danubi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Refers to the Danube, river of Central Europe.

carrer.name: Daoíz i Velarde, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Luis Daoíz and Torres (Seville 1767 - Madrid 1808). Pedro Velarde and Santiyàn (Muriedas, Santander 1779 - Madrid 1808). Military heroes of May 2.
carrer.anteriors: Daoíz y Velarde, before 1980; Santo Tomás, 05/01/1905

carrer.name: Dardanels, Passatge dels
carrer.descripcio: Passage referring to the Straits which connects the Mediterranean Sea with the Black Sea, more specifically the Sea of Marmara with the Aegean Sea. It is located within the port area of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Darnius, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Alt Empordà. The street is within the Ramon Albó housing estate, where the streets are named after Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Das, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Baixa Cerdanya, at the foot of the Tosa d'Alp.

carrer.name: Davant del Portal Nou, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Toponym which reminds us of the Nou gate of Barcelona's walls.

carrer.name: Degà Bahí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Francesc Bahí i Fontseca (Blanes, Selva 1775 - Barcelona 1841). Doctor of Medicine and botanist. President of the Academy of Natural Science and Arts (1833). Director of the botanical garden of Barcelona. In 1815 wrote the 'Memoirs of agriculture and arts', where he advises the central administration on the procedures to be used in agriculture, especially on fallow farmland and fertilizers. He was inspector of lower degree of medicine and honorary doctor of the King of Spain. His name was proposed in the XIX century with little success, until it was approved in 1929. In a 1930 communal document, the street is likely named after the "Senior president of the Bar Association (?) of this town at the beginning of the French occupation, deserver because of his great patriotism and the persecution he suffered for that cause". In a transcription of the documents of the period we can read: "Everyone was amazed that the General Duhesme did not say anything to the Doctor Joan Bahí, senior member of the legislative body, and neither to the 40 mayors of the other quarters who were formerly in Barcelona". The doctor Bahí was master of the pharmacist corps.

carrer.name: Degollada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Degollada i Guitart (Puigcerdà, Cerdanya 1799 - Barcelona 1876). Lawyer and liberal politician, promoted, togheter with Francesc Castanys, the development of the Poblenou neighborhood. President of the Central Board - or Supreme Board - of Barcelona in 1843, he clashed with the government of the general Espartero. Defeated, he had to go into exile. Owner of four 'mujadas' (one 'mujada' corresponds to 4,896.5 square meters) and three houses in this place.

carrer.name: Deià, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Western Majorca.

carrer.name: Demestre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Important landowning family of Sarrià. We highlight Josep Demestre i Ibern, Magí Demestre and Jacint Demestre, notary of Barcelona between 1866 and 1883. The street opened into the lands of the Castellnou.
carrer.anteriors: Oriol Martí; Demestre; Oriol Martí (Town Hall of Sarrià); Pi y Margall (a section); Vistahermosa (a section), before 1888

carrer.name: Democràcia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: So named in 1979 to commemorate the newly obtained democracy.

carrer.name: Demòstenes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Demosthenes (Athens 384 B.C. - Calaurea 322 B.C.). Politician and eminent orator.

carrer.name: Dénia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of La Marina Alta, Alicante, famous for its history. Kingdom of Taifa. It was the seat of a county, a dukedom and a marquisate.

carrer.name: Descans, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The residents thought that the street had to be named so since they could enjoy its peace and rest.

carrer.name: Descartes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: René Descartes (Turena 1596 - Stockholm 1650). French philosopher and scientist, known as well with the Latinized name of 'Cartesius'. He is considered the father of modern philosophy.

carrer.name: Desert, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In the past, here used to be a chapel dedicated to Saint Eulalia, whose evidence is given since 1463, when, according to tradition, the saint woman was born there during the Roman period. The Capuchins settled down in this place in 1578. The name of 'desert' was given, in the XVI century, to certain monasteries or hermitages situated in a deserted area.

carrer.name: Desfar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Estate of the Far, one of the titles of the ancient Marquises of Castellbell, whose ancestral home, called Sitjar, was located near this street. The lands belonged to the estate House Solà, property of Pere Solà i Morera, paisan who died in 1764.

carrer.name: Deu i Mata, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Deu i Mata (Barcelona 1846 - 1916). Landowner and industrialist. Philanthropist. Married with Magdalena Majó i Deu. The street name was proposed by the residents and the outstanding figures of Les Corts.
carrer.anteriors: Aguiluchos, 1936 (not official); Deu y Mata, 28/01/1918; Gelabert del Coscoll (joined to it), 23/11/1911; Saldoni (a section), 05/09/1907; Castellbó, 05/09/1907; San Francisco, 08/09/1848

carrer.name: Diagonal, Avinguda
carrer.descripcio: Popular toponym referring to the avenue which crosses diagonally the urban expansion area of Barcelona.
carrer.anteriors: Generalísimo Franco, 07/03/1939; Catorce de Abril, 16/04/1931; Alfonso XIII, 13/01/1925; Argüelles (a section), 29/03/1922; Nacionalidad Catalana (a section), 29/03/1922; Argüelles, 10/11/1874; Gran Via Diagonal, 1865
carrer.districtes: EIXAMPLE (02) LES CORTS (04) SARRIÀ-SANT GERVASI (05) GRÀCIA (06) SANT MARTÍ (10)

carrer.name: Diagonal Mar, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Public space resulting from the new arrangement plan for the Vila Olímpica of Poblenou.

carrer.name: Diagonal Mar, Parc de
carrer.descripcio: Park designed between the streets of Llull, Selva de Mar, Josep Pla and the Garcia Fària avenue, within the district of Sant Martí de Provençals.

carrer.name: Diamant, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Integrated in a group of streets named so in the street index because of a jeweler's intervention during the urbanization project, around 1850 (Maragda, Or, Robí, Topazi).

carrer.name: Diana, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street name refers to neighborhood of the borough of Saint Jordi Desvalls, Gironès. Street belonging to the housing group Ramon Albó, where most of the streets are named after old Catalan places and towns.

carrer.name: Diligències, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Evocation of the old transport vehicles. Street located within the Can Clos neighborhood. In this area Antoni Mirats i Mas owned a plot of land named "lo Clos", until 1853.

carrer.name: Diluvi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The street name was given in a popular way, referring to the quantity of water that used to accumulate in the low part of the street when the Olla torrent was flowing down.

carrer.name: Dipòsit, Moll del
carrer.descripcio: Pier which reminds of the deposit, old toponym of the place.

carrer.name: Dipòsit, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passage named after an important reservoir.

carrer.name: Diputació, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the County Council of the General, that is, the 'Generalitat', financial and military organization of the Principality established in a permanent way starting from the 'Cortes' (Spanish Parliament) in the year 1413.

carrer.name: Doctor Aiguader, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Jaume Aguadé i Miró (Reus, Baix Camp 1882 - Mexico 1943). He was mayor of Barcelona (1931-1933), politician, doctor and journalist.

carrer.name: Doctor Andreu, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Salvador Andreu i Grau (Barcelona 1841 - 1928). Doctor of Pharmacy and pioneer of the pharmaceutical industry in the Peninsula. His medicine 'pectoral paste' was one of the first specifics prepared in our country. He was a supporter of the urbanization plan.

carrer.name: Doctor August Pi i Sunyer, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1879 - Mexico1965). Physiologist. Writer and politician. Head of Department of Barcelona's Faculty of Medicine. Member of the Culture Council of the 'Generalitat' and of the Governing Committee of the UAB (1933-39).

carrer.name: Doctor Balari i Jovany, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Josep Balari i Jovany (Barcelona 1844 - 1904). Philologist, historian and stenographer. Arts and Law graduate at the UB.

carrer.name: Doctor Bové, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Bové i Salvador (Reus, Baix Camp 1869 - Badalona, Barcelonès 1915). Canon and historian.

carrer.name: Doctor Cadevall, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Cadevall i Diars (Castellgalí, Bages 1846 - Terrassa, Vallès Occidental 1921). Botanist and geographer. Doctor of Natural Science (1871), he devoted himself to teaching in Terrassa.

carrer.name: Doctor Cararach Mauri, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Josep Cararach i Mauri (1877 - 1969). He started the university course of Medicine at the Faculty of Barcelona and took his degree when he was twenty-three years old, at the University of Madrid. In 1905 has been elected councilman of the IX district. His town council's administration has been really effective, and he achieved lots of improvements in his district.

carrer.name: Doctor Carulla, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Valenti Carulla i Margenat (Sarrià 1864 - Barcelona 1923). Doctor, professor, rector of the University of Barcelona (1919). He was given the Marquisate of Carulla.
carrer.anteriors: Pi y Margall (a section); Doctor Carulla, before 1922; Vistahermosa (a section)

carrer.name: Doctor Castelló, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Pere Castelló i Ginestar (Guissona, Segarra 1771 - Madrid 1850). Military doctor and surgeon of the Royal family. He was given the title of Marquis of the Health (1846).

carrer.name: Doctor Coll, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Jaume Ramon Coll i Domènec (Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Baix Llobregat 1839 - Barcelona 1883). Doctor, director of the Anatomical Museum, head of department of the surgical clinics of the Faculty of Medicine of Barcelona. It is still an open question what connection with the landowning family, especially with Amàlia de Bacardí i de Casanovas, married to Josep Enric Coll i Masadas, can be evidenced.

carrer.name: Doctor Comas i Llaberia, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Cèsar Comas y Llaberia (Barcelona 1874 - 1956). Radiologist, writer and photographer. He introduced the radiology into Spain. Got his degree in Madrid with the doctoral thesis entitled 'The menthol and its therapeutic applications'. Founded a medical office together with his cousin Agustí Prió, in 1898. He was in charge of the radiology department in the Holy Cross Hospital (Hospital de la Santa Creu) (1902), Hospital of Our Lady of the Sacred Heart (Hospital de Nuestra Señora del Sagrado Corazón) (1903), Provincial Maternity and Foundling Hospital (Casa Provincial de Caritat) (1904), Clinical Hospital of the University of Barcelona (Hospital Clínic) (1908), Provincial Charity House (Casa Provincial de la Caritat) (1909). Doctor of the Roentgenology Department of the Hospital of the Holy Cross and Saint Paul (Hospital de Sant Pau). Author of more than 60 publications, translations, radiological exposures and the execution of more than 50 biographical articles. Among his photographic works it is worth mentioning the pictures describing Barcelona's life between the end of the XIX century and the beginning of the XX century. He masterly dominated the technique and the precision in any radiological reports.

carrer.name: Doctor Dou, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Ramon Llàtzer de Dou i de Bassols (Barcelona 1742 - Cervera, Segarra 1832). Jurist, politician and economist. Canon of Barcelona. Last chancellor of the University of Cervera. Presided over the 'Cortes' of Cadiz between September 24, 1810 and October 24, 1810.

carrer.name: Doctor Ferrer i Cajigal, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Angel Antonio Ferrer y Cajigal (Santander 1886 - Burgos 1936). Doctor. Professor of History and Morbid Anatomy. Senior member of the Faculty of Medicine of Barcelona. Twice he has been Member of Parliament, one for Cadiz and the other for Port of Saint Maria. He was the creator of a Morbid Anatomy museum in Barcelona (1924). He was dismissed from his post as professor by the August 26, 1936 decree of the 'Generalitat'. Died in Burgos from typhus.
carrer.anteriors: Jardines Hermenegildo Giner de los Rios; Jardines del Príncipe de Asturias

carrer.name: Doctor Farreras i Valentí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Pere Farreras i Valentí (Barcelona 1916 - 1968). Doctor and professor. Prominent collaborator of the doctor Pedro i Pons. Director of the Haematological School. Published the manual Internal Medicine.

carrer.name: Doctor Ferran, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Jaume Ferran i Clua (Corbera de Ebro, Terra Alta 1852 - Barcelona 1929). Doctor and bacteriologist. He discovered the vaccine against cholera.

carrer.name: Doctor Fleming, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: These gardens were dedicated to Alexander Fleming. It affords a more appropriate place to make floral offerings than the traditional place on the Rambla near the Virreina palace.

carrer.name: Doctor Fleming, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Alexander Fleming (Scotland 1881 - London 1955). British bacteriologist who discovered the antibiotics. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1945.

carrer.name: Doctor Font i Quer, Carrer del
