carrer.descripcio: This street was dedicated to Pivotes Font i Quer (Lleida, Segrià 1888 - Barcelona 1964). Doctor of Pharmacy and graduate in Chemistry. Director of the Museum of Natural Sciences of Barcelona (1921). He published a 'Dictionary of Botany '(1933). (PC:en).

carrer.name: Doctor Francesc Darder, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: (Sant Feliu de Guíxols, Baix Empordà 1640 - Barcelona 1731). Founder of religious Charity organization to give the invalid hospitalized people assistance.

carrer.name: Doctor Giné i Partagàs, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Baptista Giné i Partagàs (el Pla de Cabra, Alt Camp 1836 - Barcelona 1903). Hygienist doctor, creator of the Medical Institute of Barcelona. Senior member of the Faculty of Medicine and advocate of the Clinical Hospital (Hospital Clínic).
carrer.anteriors: Doctor Giner y Partagàs; Monturiol, 05/09/1907; Santa Ana, before 1900

carrer.name: Doctor Ibáñez, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Martín Ibáñez de Villanueva (Minaya, Albacete 1620 - Reggio Calabria, Italy 1695). Archbishop. He took his degree in 1653. Senior member of the University. He excelled as a preacher. The street name dedication to this important figure was carried out eliminating lots of possibilities and, above all, taking into account the context and the year of approval. This street leads to the facade of the parish church of Les Corts dedicated to the Virgin Mary of the 'Remedio'.

carrer.name: Doctor Ignasi Barraquer, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square dedicated to Ignasi Barraquer i Barraquer (Barcelona 1884 - 1965), ophthalmologist. In 1947 founded in Barcelona the Barraquer Institute for the study, the investigation and the teaching of the ophthalmology.

carrer.name: Doctor Joaquim Pou, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Pou (Vic, Osona 1748 ? - Barcelona 1809). Priest. Military chaplain. Rector of the Citadel that intervened in the unsuccessful conspiration of the Ascension, which should have occurred on May 11, 1809, against the French Occupation. He was executed on June 3, 1809.
carrer.anteriors: Doctor Marti y Juliá; Doctor Joaquin Pou; Doctor Marti y Juliá; Adolfo Max

carrer.name: Doctor Joaquín Albarrán, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: (Sagua la Grande, Cuba 1860 - París 1912). Cuban doctor who studied Medicine in Barcelona. One of the great creators of modern urology.

carrer.name: Doctor Letamendi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Josep de Letamendi i de Manjarrés (Barcelona 1828 - Madrid 1897). Doctor, philosopher, musician, painter and poet.

carrer.name: Doctor Letamendi, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named as the above street and passage.

carrer.name: Doctor Marañón, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: Avenue dedicated to Gregorio Marañón and Posadillo (Madrid 1887 - 1960). Doctor, historian and Spanish essayist.

carrer.name: Doctor Modrego, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Gregorio Modrego i Casaus (El Buste, Zaragoza 1890 - Barcelona 1967). Bishop of Barcelona and archbishop (1942-1967).

carrer.name: Doctor Nubiola i Espinós, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Pere Nubiola i Espinós (Barcelona 1878 - 1956). Doctor, obstetrician. He has been professor of obstetrics since 1917.

carrer.name: Doctor Pere Franquesa, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Pere Claver Franquesa i Ubach (Manresa, Bages 1903 - Barcelona 1986). General practitioner of the neighborhood and poet. Together with the president Lluís Companys he created the health areas. During the Civil War he was major doctor. After imprisonment, he became doctor of the Modelo prison. He was court-martialed, but the Pope Pio XII asked for reprieve. Moreover, he was doctor of the Poble Sec football team and he is still considered a great benefactor of this neighborhood, that is why the residents proposed his name for the street dedication.

carrer.name: Doctor Pi i Molist, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Emili Pi i Molist (Barcelona 1824 - 1892). Doctor and writer. Supporter and director of the Mental Institute of the Holy Cross (Institut Mental de la Santa Creu).

carrer.name: Doctor Pi i Molist, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The street receives its name from the same dedication of the street.

carrer.name: Doctor Ribas i Perdigó, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Manuel Ribas i Perdigó (Barcelona 1859 - 1927). Doctor and president of the Academy of Medicine of Barcelona (1924-1927).

carrer.name: Doctor Rizal, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: José Protasio Rizal y Alonso (Calamba, Laguna 1861 - Manila 1896). Doctor of the University of Madrid, he was shot in Manila on December 30, 1896. Writer, national hero of the Philippine independence.
carrer.anteriors: Alcalá de Guadaira; Doctor Rizal; Alcalá de Guadaira; Doctor Rizal; Carmen

carrer.name: Doctor Robert, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Bartomeu Robert i Yarzábal, a doctor and politician, was born in Tampico, Mexico, on 19th October 1842. He was a doctor at the Hospital de la Santa Creu, where he received the Chair of Medical Pathology in 1875. He was a member of numerous scientific societies both in Spain and abroad; he presided over the Academy and the Laboratory of Medical Sciences. He presided over numerous international medical congresses in Berlin, Rome and Moscow, and played an outstanding role during the yellow fever epidemic in Barcelona in 1870, and the cholera epidemic in 1885. He presided over the Ateneu Barcelonès between 1881-1882 and again between 1900-1901, and over the Societat d'Amics del País between 1898-99. It was as a representative of the latter that, together with the presidents of other entities, he delivered a message to Queen Maria Cristina in 1898 asking for reforms that would lead to de-centralization on behalf of Catalonia. He was appointed Mayor of Barcelona in 1899, but tendered his resignation in mid-October of that year, after an economic conflict between Catalonian manufacturers and the Government. His resignation earned him great popularity. He was the President of the Lliga Regionalista when it was founded in 1901. He died in Barcelona, on 10th April 1902, in the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 248.

carrer.name: Doctor Roig i Raventós, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Josep Roig i Raventós (Sitges, Garraf 1883 - Barcelona 1966). Doctor and writer, he worked in the Maternity Hospital and he specialized in pediatrics and obstetrics.

carrer.name: Doctor Roux, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Pierre Paul Emile Roux (Confolens 1853 - Paris 1933). French bacteriologist. Since 1904 he has been headmaster of the Pasteur Institute.

carrer.name: Doctor Salvador Cardenal, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Cardenal i Fernàndez (Valencia, Horta 1852 - Barcelona 1928). Doctor and surgeon. Headmaster of the Hospital of the Sacred Heart of Barcelona (Hospital del Sagrat Cor) (1879-1928).

carrer.name: Doctor Samuel Hahnemann, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Christian Friederich Samuel Hahnemann (Meissen, Dresden 1755 - Paris 1843). German doctor, founder of the homoeotherapy.

carrer.name: Doctor Santponç, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Santponç i Roca (Barcelona 1756 - 1821). Doctor and inventor. Head of the military medical services during the Independence War (1808-1814).

carrer.name: Doctor Serrat, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Manuel Serrat i Puigbò (Ripoll, Ripollès 1863 - Barcelona 1916). Doctor who deserved the title of "doctor of the poor" for his devotion to the humble classes, especially in Sant Martí de Provençals. He was also town councilor of Barcelona City Council and chairman of the 'Foment Martinenc'.

carrer.name: Doctor Torent, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Torent i Torrabadella (Granollers, Vallès Oriental 1826 - Barcelona 1882). Surgeon. He distinguished himself in fighting against the epidemic cholera in 1854 and in 1865. He was doctor in the Maternity Hospital and senior member of the Hospital of the Holy Cross (Hospital de la Santa Creu).

carrer.name: Doctor Torres, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passage named after Ramon Torres i Casanovas (Barcelona 1877 - 1922). Surgeon. Professor of surgical pathology of the Faculty of Medicine of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Doctor Trueta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: This street receives its name from Josep Trueta i Raspall (Barcelona 1897 - 1977). Surgeon. Professor of orthopedics at the University of Oxford. Member of the National Catalan Board of London (1940). He received the gold medal of Barcelona (1976) and the gold medal of Sant Jordi of the County Council of Barcelona (Diputació de Barcelona).

carrer.name: Doctor Valls, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Pau Valls i Bonet (Reus, Baix Camp 1814 - Barcelona 1888). Legal adviser. Professor of the Faculty of Law of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Doctor Zamenhof, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Lejzer Ludwik Zamenhof (Bialystok 1859 - Warsaw 1917). Polish linguist who created the Esperanto, artificial language whose name derives from the pseudonym of the linguist himself. He was an oculist by profession. In 1909 visited Barcelona to participate to a congress. He was commander of the order of Isabella the Catholic.

carrer.name: Doctors Dolsa, Jardins dels
carrer.descripcio: Tomàs Dolsa i Ricart (la Canonja, Tarragonès 1819 - Barcelona 1909). Alienia doctor. He created the Dolsa Foundation, which established the Psychiatric Institute in the district of Les Corts (1863). When he retired his son Lluís Dolsa i Ramon (Vila-seca de Solcina, Tarragonès 1850 - Barcelona 1908) succeeded him. Forerunner of modern sociotherapy.

carrer.name: Doctors Trias i Pujol, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: This street was probably named after Antoni Trias i Pujol (Badalona, Barcelonès 1891 - Santa Cristina d'Aro, Baix Empordà 1970), surgeon and professor of surgical pathology, or after Joaquim Trias i Pujol (Badalona, Barcelonès 1887 - Barcelona 1964): surgeon, professor of topographic anatomy and of therapeutics and surgical pathology. Senior member of the Faculty of Medicine (1931-1939).

carrer.name: Dolça de Provença, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Dolça I de Provenza (1095 - 1127). Countess of Barcelona and Provence, viscountess of Millau, Gavaldà and part of Carlat. Was the third wife of Ramon Berenguer III of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Dolors Aleu, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Dolors Aleu i Riera (Barcelona 1857 - 1913). Doctor. She was the first woman who has ever obtained the title of doctor in the Spanish country. Specialist in gynecology and childhood medicine during more than 25 years. He was in charge of the surgery of the Rambla de Cataluña and later of the Torre Aleu. Worked as doctor in the Charity House of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Dolors Masferrer i Bosch, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Dolors Masferrer i Bosch was born in Barcelona on 8th June 1857, heiress to, and later the owner of, Can Sòl de Dalt. At the age of fourteen she inherited half of the property from her mother, and the other half from a great-aunt of hers. In 1883 she commissioned the architect Camil Oliveras with the project to develop Can Sòl de Dalt, for which she was awarded a license that same year. She ceded the thoroughfares to the municipality, as well as a plot of land where the town hall could be built, and another for the building of municipal schools. Dolors Masferrer died in Barcelona, on 14th February 1905, in the Carrer de la Canuda, 13. She was married to her cousin, Josep Comas i Masferrer.

carrer.name: Dolors Monserdà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Dolors Monserdà i Vidal (Barcelona 1845 - 1919). Writer. She was awarded in several floral games. She was the driving force of different social and feminist works.
carrer.anteriors: Dolores Monserdá; Kaid Ismail?; San Juan

carrer.name: Domènech, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jacint Feliu Domènech i Sastre (Barcelona ? - Madrid 1863). Government minister and senator of the kingdom. Mayor of Barcelona (1835). Owner of the lands where this street was opened. Was married with Lluïsa Serra i Salgado but his three daughters heired: Clotilde, Adela and Carolina. Adela Domènech was married with Josep Llinàs, teacher of the central training college.

carrer.name: Domènech i Montaner, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Lluís Domènech i Montaner (Barcelona 1849 - 1923). Architect, historian and politician. One of the prominent figure within world modernism. Professor and headmaster of the Architectural School of Barcelona (1901).

carrer.name: Domingo, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passage named after Antoni Domingo i Mascaró (Arboç, Baix Penedès 1813 - Barcelona 1880). Owner of the lands which were acquired from Joaquim de Mercader. He was married with Bàrbara Arau i Campos.

carrer.name: Domínguez i Miralles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street refers to the family name of landowners located in Sarrià and Sant Gervasi during the XIX century. The street crossed the estate which was property of the Ponsich i d'Alòs family.

carrer.name: Dominics, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: The street receives its name from the members of the religious order of Predicators founded by Saint Domingo of Guzmán who owned an estate in this street, starting from 1630, named "Torre Gomis".

carrer.name: Don Quixot, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Passage referring to the world-famous novel published by Cervantes in 1605. Approved as 'Don Quijote', it became standardized since it corresponds to a proper name that has a translation into every foreign language.

carrer.name: Dormitori de Sant Francesc, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The name derives from the street that it originally crossed, that is the present Josep Anselm Clavé street. Within the street was located, since 1278, the monastery of Franciscans made up of several dependencies used as one night accommodations for the pilgrims that asked for. The tradition used to say that Saint Francis himself was put up in this place.
carrer.anteriors: Dormitorio de San Francisco; Moll Vell

carrer.name: Dorotea Chopitea, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Dorotea Chopitea i de Villota (Santiago de Chile 1816 - Barcelona 1891). She was the driving force of the first Salesian foundation of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Dos de Maig, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the popular rebellion in Madrid that triggered the war against Napoleon in 1808.

carrer.name: Dos de Maig, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passage in memory of the episode happened on May 2. It has the same dedication as the street above.

carrer.name: Dosrius, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Maresme.

carrer.name: Dragó, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Related to Can Dragó, old farm of Sant Andreu.

carrer.name: Drassana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In this place, a long time before the construction of the street, there was an important shipyard where various ships were built, with small or large tonnage-seize, well-known in all the Mediterranean Sea because of the quality of its shipbuilding.

carrer.name: Drassanes, Moll de les
carrer.descripcio: The Pier is located in front of the monument dedicated to Columbus and is near the old shipyards from which its name derives.

carrer.name: Drassanes, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: The square dedication is the same as the avenue that is located within the junction of the Josep Carner avenue.

carrer.name: Drassanes, Avinguda de les
carrer.descripcio: The avenue is situated in front of the historical shipyards of Barcelona, started by Joan II and roughly built in the XIV century. After the rippers' war they were occupied by military forces, and were used as headquarters till recent time. Nowadays they form the Maritime museum.

carrer.name: Drets Humans, Jardins dels
carrer.descripcio: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is an exposition of the fundamental guarantees recognised to individuals by the United Nations' member states. This Declaration consists of a Preamble and 30 Articles. It was approved by the UN Assembly, in Paris, on December 10th 1948. It found its inspiration in the North American and French Declarations of 1776 and 1789, respectively. It strengthens Human Rights in a more concrete and complete way, confirming the equality among the races of mankind. The name of this street, together with those of other thoroughfares in the area, refers to the struggle for peace and human rights.

carrer.name: Duana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street dedicated to the 'Duana' (in Catalan) that is the customs, the governmental agency authorized to inspect goods and baggage entering a country. The street corresponds to the back façade of the new customs office (present Civil Government) built in 1790-1792 by order of the minister of Treasury, the count of Roncalli.

carrer.name: Dublín, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Dublin, Irish City and capital of the state itself.

carrer.name: Dubte, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: It is so short that we can only doubt whether considering this as a street. This is why people called this the square of "doubt". According to Joan Amades the name derives from a spring located in the street: three peasants of the region of Saint Anthony were disputing the ownership of the land giving rise to that stream, since everyone was convinced that it was the same vein carrying water towards his kitchen garden and that his waterwheel pulled out. As they could not reach an agreement owing to lack of evidence for the origin, decided to nickname the spring as the one of "doubt".
carrer.data: 10/03/1995 ((change of location, from street to square))

carrer.name: Duc de la Victòria, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Joaquín Baldomero Fernández Álvarez Espartero, named Baldomero Espartero (La Granátula, Castile-La Mancha 1793 - Logroño 1879). Soldier and politician. Duke of Victòria and of Morella, prince of Bergara and count of Lutxana. He reached a possible mention to the throne before of the election of Amadeus I of Savoy.

carrer.name: Duc de Medinaceli, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Square dedicated to Luis de la Cerda y de la Vega (XVI century). Count and Lord of Medinaceli, Cogolludo and Arcos de Jalón. Dukedom conferred by the Catholic Kings in 1479. He was descendant of the Montcada family, which had given the land for the monastery of Saint Francis. After the demolition of the monastery he claimed the right to this land. Formerly named Saint Francis square, then square of the Friars minor (XVI century), because it was in front of the Franciscan monastery located in that place in the XIII century.
carrer.anteriors: Manuel Azaña; Duque de Medinaceli; Barcas

carrer.name: Duc de Rivas, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Ángel Saavedra Ramírez de Baquedano (Córdoba 1791 - Madrid 1865). Dramatist and poet. Liberal politician and later conservative. Ambassador in Naples and Paris and President of the Council of State (1863).

carrer.name: Duero, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Referring to the Duero, river of the Iberian Peninsula.
carrer.anteriors: Vasca (without effectiveness); Valencia; San Joaquin; San Baltasar

carrer.name: Dulcet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Dulcet i Albareda (Barcelona 1791 - 1862). Wife of Vicenç Bacigalupi who sold some lands belonging to the property estate Vinyalet in 1853. The surrounding lands belonged to Eusebi Güell i Bacigalupi.

carrer.name: Duoda, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Duona, a writer and countess of Barcelona in the IX century, whose origins are unknown. She married on June 29, 824 in the palatine chapel of Aachen Bernard of Septimania, count of Tolosa, of Narbona and of Barcelona (826-832 and 835-844). Confined in Usès (Septimania, South Languedoc) wrote between 841 and 843 a manual dedicated to her son Guillem who had been claimed by his husband when he was 16: 'Liber manualis' (Library of Catalonia). This is a manual aimed at guiding the education of teenagers. The fact that it was written by a laic woman is really unusual, since the ecclesiastic writers had the monopoly of the written culture at that time. The street name was proposed by the Group 'Dona' of the Town Council for the Social Welfare.

carrer.name: Duquessa d'Orleans, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street named after Luisa María Adelaida de Borbón Penthièvre (Paris 1753 - 1821). Mother of Louis Philip I, King of France (1830-1848). Married in 1769 Louis Philip, duke of Orleans, the so-called 'Felip Igualtat'. Getting away from the French Revolution lived in the house number 1 of this street. This is why the street took her name.
carrer.anteriors: Roses y Arús; Duquesa de Orleans; Paz

carrer.name: Duran i Bas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street dedicated to Manuel Duran i Bas (Barcelona 1823 - 1907). Legal adviser and politician. Senior member of the bar Association (1885-1891). Secretary of the 'Ayuntamiento' of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Duran i Borrell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name derives from Eugeni Duran i Borrell (Barcelona 1851 - 1937). He was doctor and landowner, inherited the lands of the property estate Móra from his parents Joan Duran i Sagrera, surgeon, and Josepa Borrell i Pou. His son Francesc d'Assís Duran i Funosas, lawyer, succeeded him.

carrer.name: E, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: This is one of the most important streets in the area. The Urban Development Committee approved the Partial Arrangement Plan for the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, where, with few exceptions, streets designated with letters run in the North-South direction, while streets designated with numbers run in the East-West direction.

carrer.name: Ebre, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the Spanish river. The Greeks named it the river of Iberia from which the name Ebro is derived.

carrer.name: Edison, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Thomas Alva Edison (Milan, Ohio 1847 - Orange, New Jersey 1931). Self-taught American inventor. His most well known inventions are: the phonograph (1877), the incandescent light bulb and (1879) and the wireless induction telegraph system (1885).

carrer.name: Eduard Fontserè, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eduard Fontserè i Riba (Barcelona 1870 - 1970). Meteorologist and seismologist. He was in charge of Barcelona's time service which, from 1891, established the official time in the city. He set up the observatory in the city's Fabra neighborhood. He was a professor of geodesy and rational mechanics at the University of Barcelona (1900) and taught geodesy and astronomy from 1932. He established the Pluviometric Network of Catalonia and the Balearics. Member of the Science Institute (1909), director of the department of seismology and meteorology at the Fabra Observatory (1912). Creator of Catalonia's Weather Service. President of Barcelona's Athenaeum (1934). President of both the IEC Science Department (1942) and Catalonia's Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics Society. His bibliography comprises some 180 works.

carrer.name: Eduard Toda, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eduard Toda i Güell (Reus, Baix Camp 1855 - Poblet, Conca de Barberà 1941). Diplomat, writer and archaeologist. He bequeathed most of his collections to the city.

carrer.name: Eduard Toldrà, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eduard Toldrà i Soler (Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1895 - Barcelona 1962). Musician and composer.

carrer.name: Eduard Torroja, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Eduard Torroja i Miret (Madrid 1899 - 1961). Engineer. He built the first laminated arches in Spain and the grandstand at Les Corts football stadium.

carrer.name: Eduard Tubau, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: An open street in an area known as "vinya d'Amell". It was owned first by Duke Almenara Alta, then by Àgueda de Martorell Fivaller and finally by Pere Borràs Trinxant. A connection with the businessman Eduard Tubau i Soler (1855 - 1928), has been unable to be made. Investigations are currently in progress.

carrer.name: Eduardo Conde, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eduardo Conde Giménez (Madrid 1840 - Sarrià 1914). Merchant. He founded the stores El Siglo. He donated land to the city.

carrer.name: Egipcíaques, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Between 1579 and 1699 one of the houses in this street served as a refuge for women who had decided to retire from a 'licentious life'. They led a life of penitence in imitation of Saint María Egipcíaca, and thus the house became known as the "Casa de les Egipcíaques". It was built over the grounds of the "La Galera" women's prison.

carrer.name: Eguilaz, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Luis de Eguilaz y Eguilaz (Sanlúcar de Barrameda 1830 - Madrid 1874). Spanish writer and playwright.

carrer.name: Eivissa, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the island of Ibiza on the Balearic archipelago. Known as 'Ebusus' in Roman times, the Carthaginians named it 'Ibusim' and the Greeks 'Pitiüsa' (an area abounding in pine trees).

carrer.name: Eiximenis, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Fray Francesc d'Eiximenis (Girona 1327 - Perpignan, Roussillon 1409). Writer, Franciscan monk. An authority on political and social literature and local Catalan customs.
carrer.anteriors: Rafael G. Carcer; Eiximenis; Rafael G. Carcer; Lletra A (plan from the enlargement of Sant Andreu)

carrer.name: Elies Ortíz, Jardí d'
carrer.descripcio: Elies Ortíz Garrido (Barcelona 1920 - 1991). Local leader. A man of firm Christian and social beliefs, he dedicated his life to the problems of others, and especially to the most deprived (he was successful in a well-known eviction case in 1947). He was responsible for several projects in the Can Tunis neighborhood aimed at improving the neighborhood. With this idea in mind he set up the 'Centro Social de Can Tunis', the 'Hermandad de Ahorros de Can Tunis' fund and was the president of the Can Tunis Housing Co-operative. When he died he was the president his local Neighbourhood Association in Font de la Guatlla. Proposal put forward by Sants-Montjuïc borough.

carrer.name: Elies Pagès, Avinguda d'
carrer.descripcio: A sign which read "Joan Campany (alias Pagès)" was put up in an area of orchards to make clear who owned the land. Over time the locals adopted the wording of the sign to establish the street's name. Joan Campany was a reputable flower grower. The road went through the Mas Carbonell property, owned by Ramon Carbonell i Vinyals. According to a census taken in 1845 the land belonged to Pere Pagès i Colomer. Four underground water galleries ran across the land, the most important of which was the Carbonell gallery. An association comprising of dozens of members exploited it.

carrer.name: Elisa, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Elisa Musitu i Garcia-Navarro (Barcelona 1843 - 1891). Wife to Felip Bertran i d'Amat, lawyer (Barcelona 1836 - 1911). He named the road when it was built across some land he owned. It is possible that the road was really named after his daughter: Elisa Bertran i Musitu (1888 - 1941), as later approval was given to the naming of the street 'calle de Musitu', dedicated to Elisa Musitu i Garcia-Navarro.

carrer.name: Elisabets, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Name derived for the same reasons as the street name.

carrer.name: Elisabets, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the convent in the same street founded in 1552 by Joana Forners d'Arbeca. It belonged to the nuns of the order of Saint Elizabeth of Hungary, popularly known as "Elisabets".

carrer.name: Elisard Sala, Jardins d'
carrer.descripcio: Elisard Sala i Casassas (1913 - 1970). Musician, ceramist and sculptor. He set up the children's chorus 'La Trapa' in 1960.

carrer.name: Elisenda de Pinós, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Elisenda de Pinós i de Fenollet, de Montcada i de Saportella. Mother to Queen Elisenda de Montcada, she founded the Pedralbes Monastery. In other documents she is referred to as Elionor rather than Elisenda.
carrer.anteriors: Elionor de Pinós; Lletra B (Casa Mora)

carrer.name: Elisi, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: A place of peace and happiness where legend has it the virtuous go in the afterlife. Elysian Fields. Named on a whim by urban developers.

carrer.name: Elkano, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Juan Sebastián Elkano (Guetaria 1486 - Pacific Ocean 1526). Basque mariner. He was the first person to sail round the world (1522) on his ship the 'Victoria'. The original Basque spelling of his surname has been maintained.

carrer.name: Emancipació, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: As the street's original name, Cervantes, was duplicated, it was replaced by its new name in 1907 and was linked to the claims made by workers.

carrer.name: Emèrita Augusta, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Taken from the Roman name for the town of Mérida in Extremadura. Named at the suggestion of Catalonia's field Marshal who hailed from Mérida.

carrer.name: Emili Mira i López, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Emili Mira i López (Cuba 1896 - Petrópolis, Brazil 1964). Psychiatrist. Consultant at the Pere Mata Institute and director of the Sant Boi mental hospital (1936-1939). He made significant contributions in the fields of psychiatry and psychology in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Emili Roca, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Emili Roca i Solà (Barcelona 1846 - 1918). Priest to the parish of Santa Eulalia de Vilapicina. He donated the land and buildings which make up the parish's community center
carrer.anteriors: Emilio Roca, 1939; Anselmo Turmeda, 1931; Emilio Roca, 1929; Acacias (2nd section)

carrer.name: Emili Vendrell, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Emili Vendrell i Ibars (Barcelona 1893 - 1962). Tenor. Outstanding performer of traditional Catalan songs. Trained at the Orfeó Català lyric theatre where he performed in Spanish operettas.

carrer.name: Emili Vilanova, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Emilio Vilanova i March (Barcelona 1840 - 1905). Local writer.

carrer.name: Emma de Barcelona, Jardins d'
carrer.descripcio: She was born between 880 and 885 AD at an unattested place. She was the first Abbess of the monastery of Sant Joan de Ter (later known as Sant Joan de les Abadesses), which was built for her by her parents, Count Guifré and Countess Guinedilda, in 885. She governed the Abbey directly from 897, and in 899 she obtained from King Charles the Simple a precept of immunity and protection. She is considered one of the most notable women in the history of Catalonia subsequent to the Moorish invasion. She promoted the re-population of Central Catalonia, which had been completely abandoned, and consecrated and endowed many churches. In 921 she gave all her private goods to the monastery. She died in 942, in the town of Sant Joan de les Abadesses, in the Ripollès region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Empordà, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the Ampurdà region in the northwestern part of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Empúries, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Ancient Catalan coastal settlement on the Golf of Roses. Founded by the Greeks as 'Emporion', meaning a place of maritime trade.

carrer.name: Enamorats, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: This street runs along the former "camí dels Enamorats", a pathway that went from Sant Martí to Barcelona called 'Torrent dels Enamorats'. The oldest known reference is made to a house mentioned in 1698 called "casa dels enamorats".
carrer.anteriors: Enamorados; Ctra. de l'Àngel Baix; Ctra. de los Enamorados

carrer.name: Encarnació, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Doctrine according to which Christ personifies the human nature of the divine God. In general terms, the bodily manifestation of a supernatural being. In a religious context, a divine manifestation. The Incarnation of the Son of God.

carrer.name: Encarnació, Pas de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reasons as the street and the passageway.

carrer.name: Encarnació, Passadís de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reasons as the street and the passageway.

carrer.name: Encarnació, Passatge de l'
carrer.descripcio: Like the street, dedicated to the Incarnation of the Son of God born of womb of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

carrer.name: Encuny, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the word meaning 'stamp' in Catalan. Forms part of the Zona Franca neighborhood where commonly used tools and industrial materials are made.
carrer.anteriors: Troquel; Pléyades (not considered); Cº Puente de las Vacas

carrer.name: Energia, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the two previous streets.

carrer.name: Enginyeria, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Industrial studies were officially created in Spain in 1850, and the School of Barcelona was one of the first four to open its doors. Madrid, Seville and Bergara were the other three. On the occasion of the 150th anniversary of the Barcelona School of Industrial Engineering, the Barcelona Town Council decided to commemorate the occasion with this dedication to Industrial Engineering.

carrer.name: Enric Bargés, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Bargés i Pombo (Barcelona 1842 - Madrid 1906). Field marshal in Granada (1891) and Catalonia (1901-1902). Fought in Africa and in the Carlist wars.
carrer.anteriors: Enrique Bargés; Lletra J (map of Les Corts)

carrer.name: Enric Casanovas, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Casanovas i Roig (Barcelona 1882 - 1948). Sculptor. The street was originally named after Anna Casanovas i Querol (Ibarra 1862 - Barcelona 1938), wife to Joan Boada i Mauri, owner of the land in the area known as "Varal del Butxí", which he bought from Víctor Magarola in 1884. The name was changed to avoid confusion with the 'calle Casanova' and the passageway 'passatge de Casanovas'.

carrer.name: Enric Clarasó, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Clarasó i Daudí (Sant Feliu del Racó, Vallès Occidental 1856 - Barcelona 1941). Sculptor. Won the gold medal at the 1900 International Exhibition, Paris. He exhibited with the likes of Santiago Rusiñol and Ramon Casas.

carrer.name: Enric Giménez, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Giménez i Lloberas (Barcelona 1866 - 1939). Theatre actor. Stage director. Teacher of declamation at the School of Dramatic Arts.

carrer.name: Enric Granados, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Granados i Campiña (Lleida, Segrià 1867 - at sea, near Dieppe 1916). Composer and pianist. Together with Albéniz he founded the Catalan modern school of piano.
carrer.anteriors: Enrique Granados; Universidad, before 1900; Núm. 25 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Enric Morera, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Enric Morera i Viura (Barcelona 1865 - 1942). Composer. His felicitous pieces 'La Santa Espina' and 'L'Empordà' comprise some of the best examples of Catalonia's musical heritage.

carrer.name: Enric Sanchis, Passeig d'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the passageway.

carrer.name: Ensenyança, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the convent, established by the sisters of the Company of Mary, on the grounds of what had once been the Bishop of Tarragona's palace. They arrived from Béziers in the 17th century (1650) and devoted themselves to teaching. Their convent, 'la Purísima Concepción de Nuestra Señora', was popularly known as "La Enseñanza".

carrer.name: Entença, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Berenguer d'Entença i de Montcada (? - church of San Nicolás, river Nestos 1307). He led a group of soldiers who were supporters of Roger de Flor whom he hoped to succeed by organizing the renowned 'venganza' (revenge).

carrer.name: Epir, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: From the Greek 'Epeiros'. A region to the northeast of Greece, near Albania. It lay on the border of the Catalan duchy of Neopatria.

carrer.name: Equador, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: South American state. It adopted the name of the great imaginary circle, perpendicular to the earth's axis of rotation, which divides the earth's surface in two.

carrer.name: Erasme de Janer, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Erasme de Janer i de Gònima (Barcelona 1791 - 1862). Mayor of Barcelona in 1846. Industrialist. One of the founder members and president of the 'Caixa d'Estalvis' saving's bank.

carrer.name: Ercilla, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Alonso de Ercilla y Zúñiga (Madrid 1533 - 1594). Spanish poet. Famous for his epic 'La Araucana' (1569).

carrer.name: Ercilla, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Ermengarda, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: The popular belief is that this street is dedicated to Ermengarda, mother of the abbot Oliba (mid-10th century - 1013). Countess of Cerdanya, wife to Count Oliba Cabreta. He became governor of Vallespir in 933. Given its relative proximity to the street 'calle del Vallespir', the popular belief could well be true although it might just be a coincidence.

carrer.name: Escala, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Alt Empordà region. The street is among those in the Ramon Albó estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Escales de Can Caralleu, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the steps on the Can Caralleu housing estate.

carrer.name: Escar, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Serves as a reminder of the trenches that were dug on the beaches to launch ships.

carrer.name: Escipió, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Strictly speaking, 'calle dels Escipió'. It would seem that the name makes reference to two brothers: Publius Cornelius Scipio (? - 211 BC), consul and Roman general serving in the army in Hispania, and Cneo Cornelius Scipio (? - 211 BC) who, sent to Hispania with his brother, disembarked in Empúries and conquered all the settlements on the coast as far as the Ebro Delta. The two brothers led the Roman attack south of the river Ebro. Both died in battle, falling to the troops of Asdrúbal Barca, Asdrúbal Giscon i Magon and the Masinisa cavalry. Despite the explanation above it is thought that the street is really dedicated Publius Cornelius Scipio, known as the African (234 - 184 BC). Consul and Roman general serving in the army in Hispania, he was, respectively, the son and nephew of the above-mentioned.

carrer.name: Escòcia, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: A constituent country of the United Kingdom comprising the northern part of Great Britain as well as the Hebrides, Shetland Islands, and Orkney Islands

carrer.name: Escòcia, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Escolapi Càncer, Avinguda d'
carrer.descripcio: Escolapi Càncer i Duaso (Huesca, Aragon 1869 - Barcelona 1951). Administrator to Manuel Maria de Sivatte i Llopart, owner of the land in the Torre Baró area.

carrer.name: Escoles, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: There used to be state owned schools in the street.

carrer.name: Escoles, Passatge de les
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the state owned music school.

carrer.name: Escoles Pies, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: The big school 'Escuelas Pías de Barcelona, 'founded in 1894, is found at the top of this street'.'

carrer.name: Escorial, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Borough of New Castille, where Felipe II had a monastery built bearing the same name.

carrer.name: Escornalbou, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: The barony. Located at the castle-monastery of Escornalbou (Baix Camp region), through the crown it is linked to the archbishops of Tarragona

carrer.name: Escudellers, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: During the Middle Ages the potters' guild was set up in this street. Pottery was made using the yellowish clay from a nearby hill which had been exploited since Roman times.
carrer.anteriors: Ollers (together with Escudellers Blancs); Trentaclaus; Muralla vieja, 1820 ?

carrer.name: Escudellers, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Escudellers Blancs, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the potters who worked with white clay to produce fine ceramics.

carrer.name: Escuder, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Miquel Escuder i Castellà (Terrassa, Vallès Occidental 1835 - Barcelona 1908). Industrialist. He made sewing machines in the Barceloneta neighborhood.

carrer.name: Escuder, Riera d'
carrer.descripcio: Took its name from the old country house Ca n'Escuder.

carrer.name: Escull, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Originally named in honour of the town of Arrecife in Lanzarote. 'Escull' is a result of the linguistic standardisation of the word 'arrecife,' which literally means a "reef".

carrer.name: Escullera, Passeig de l'
carrer.descripcio: Extension of the street 'paseo de Joan de Borbó' (named in tribute to the Count of Barcelona). It runs along the dyke 'dique de l'Est', which is made of blocks in defence against the waves.

carrer.name: Escultor Canet, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Canet (14th century - before 1431). Sculptor who worked on the choir of the Cathedral of Barcelona and the monumental tomb for bishop Ramon d'Escales. He was responsible for the carvings on the 'Mirador' doorway at Mallorca Cathedral.

carrer.name: Escultor Llimona, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Josep Llimona i Bruguera (Barcelona 1864 - 1934). He obtained the Fortuny scholarship in 1880 to study in Rome. An officially recognised sculptor, he was decorated by the governments of France and Italy, and was awarded the highest medal of merit that can be conferred by the city of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Escultor Ordóñez, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Bartolomé Ordóñez (Burgos ? - Carrara, Italy 1520). He lived in Barcelona. Responsible for the wall of the retrochoir in the Cathedral of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Escultor Ramir Rocamora, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: Ramir Rocamora i Bernat (Reus, Baix Camp 1877 - Verges, Baix Empordà 1939). Sculptor. He obtained a scholarship from the Reus town authorities to study at the Académie des Beaux-Arts, Paris.

carrer.name: Escultors Claperós, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Claperós (Barcelona ? - 1460) and Joan Claperós (? - 1467), son of the former. Sculptors and master builders. They worked on the construction of the Cathedral of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Escultura, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: As a homage the art of sculpture.

carrer.name: Església, Camí de l'
carrer.descripcio: Once led to the church of San Juan de Horta.

carrer.name: Església, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from Sant Joan parish church. Work on the building started in 1878 on the grounds of property belonging to the "Virreina", wife to Viceroy Amat.

carrer.name: Església, Carretera de l'
carrer.descripcio: Leads to Vallvidrera parish church, built in 1540, and to the more modern 'villa Joana'.

carrer.name: Espalter, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Espalter i Rosas. A manufacturer from Barcelona who opened the street at the end of the 18th century (1798), gave the road its name. According to J. Amades the street may be named after a very famous doctor also called Joaquim Espalter.

carrer.name: Espanya, Moll d'
carrer.descripcio: Dock located on the 'dársena del Comercio 'dock.

carrer.name: Espanya, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Comes from the Latin 'Hispania', used in antiquity to describe the Iberian peninsula.

carrer.name: Espanya Industrial, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: It used to lead straight up to the main entrance of the textile factory bearing this name, also known as "El Vapor Nou". Founded by the Muntadas i Campeny brothers in 1847.

carrer.name: Espanya Industrial, Parc de l'
carrer.descripcio: Embraced the name of the textile factory bearing the same name that used to stand here.

carrer.name: Esparreguera, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Borough in Baix Llobregat.

carrer.name: Esparteria, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Name originating from before the second half of the 15th century, taken form the esparto workers who set up trade in this street. Jaume de Gualbes lived here in the 15th century. The famous inn 'Ca l'Afartapobres' began business in this street in 1804.

carrer.name: Esparver, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the bird of prey the sparrow hawk.

carrer.name: Espasa, Avinguda d'
carrer.descripcio: Josep Espasa i Anguera (la Pobla de Cérvoles, Garrigues 1840 - Barcelona 1911). Publisher. Together with his brother Pau he founded the publishing house Espasa Germans (Espasa-Calpe).

carrer.name: Espaseria, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Named prior to 1633 owing to the swordsmiths' guild established here. The guild rules date from 1413 and evidence of activity can be traced back to 1390.

carrer.name: Esperança, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Dedicated to the Virgin Mary. The street was built on land belonging to Joan Casamitjana i Constansó.

carrer.name: Esperança, Passatge de l'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from "'esperanza'" (hope), the wish that what we desire will be fulfilled

carrer.name: Espiell, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Josep Espiell i Vilasau (Barcelona 1782 - 1863). Owner of the land known as 'la Porrasa', which had belonged to Josep de Silva, Marquis of Santa Cruz. Josep Espiell i Vilasau put the administration of his affairs into the hands of his bother Miquel. His nephews, Francesc y Ramon Espiell i Ruíz, inherited the property in 1863.

carrer.name: Espiell, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the road.

carrer.name: Espiga, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Together with the street 'calle del Cep' (vine) it is reminiscent of the elements of bread and wine on which the idea of transubstantiation is based. These byways are located on either side of the' plaza del Congrés Eucarístic'.

carrer.name: Espinagosa, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Spring and fertile pastureland found not far away from the street.

carrer.name: Espinauga, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Hamlet in the borough of Llanars (Ripollès). The street is among those in the Ramon Albó estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona

carrer.name: Espinoi, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Approved as del Espinoy street, ethimologically could refer to a place full of bramble buches or thorny patches. The version wich alludes to Esteve Espinoy, architect of the XVIII century in Madrid, has not been confirmed yet and according to the most probable theory it is the name of a real estate of Moià owned by the promoter of the housing estate.

carrer.name: Espíria, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Feminine form of 'Espiridió'. Espiridió Gibert i Mornau (1830 - 1889). Landowner. Married to Maria Anna Serra Chopitea. Most likely connected with the leasehold of property in this passageway to Salvador Prat-Gibert i Reixach and Llorenç Serra i Clarós.

carrer.name: Esplugues, Avinguda d'
carrer.descripcio: Esplugues de Llobregat. Leads to the borough bearing this name in the Baix Llobregat area.

carrer.name: Espolsa-sacs, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: A group of monks belonging to the order 'la Congregación de la Penitencia de Nuestro Señor Jesucristo', founded by Joan Bo in 1200, arrived in Barcelona in 1216. Their habit looked like a sack with sleeves so they were known as the "monks in sacks". They would clean their habits and shake them free of parasites in the alleyway where they resided, thus giving rise to the street's name.

carrer.name: Esports, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Leads to the Can Caralleu sports' complex.

carrer.name: Espronceda, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: José de Espronceda y Delgado (Almendralejo 1808 - Madrid 1842). Spanish poet and politician.

carrer.name: Espronceda, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: José de Espronceda y Delgado (Almendralejo 1808 - Madrid 1842). Spanish poet.

carrer.name: Esquirol, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Has borne the same name since the 15th century. Possibly derived from the surname of a family associated with the street.

carrer.name: Esquirol Volador, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Originally called 'calle de l'Esquirol' (squirrel). When the neighborhood was built (1958), animal names were used in naming the streets. Replaced by its current name (1984) as a street in the city's old quarter already bore this name.

carrer.name: Est, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: The street, originally 'calle de l'Alba,' was renamed in 1904 after the brothels in the area closed down to "erase all traces of the old name, and its ill repute". Some brothel owners asked for the name to be changed in 1894.

carrer.name: Estació, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Leads straight into the square in front of Sant Andreu railway station.

carrer.name: Estació, Passatge de l'
carrer.descripcio: Leads straight into the square in front of Sant Andreu railway station.
carrer.anteriors: Estación; Ferrocarril (also known with this name)

carrer.name: Estació, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: In front of Sant Andreu railway station.

carrer.name: Estadella, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: The neighborhood. The area's former toponym.

carrer.name: Estadella, Torrent d'
carrer.descripcio: The area's former toponym.

carrer.name: Estadi, Avinguda de l'
carrer.descripcio: Leads to Montjuïc stadium.

carrer.name: Estany, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from tin, the metal. Forms part of the Zona Franca neighborhood where commonly used tools and industrial materials are made.

carrer.name: Estartit, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Village in the borough of Torroella de Montgrí (Baix Empordà).

carrer.name: Estatut, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: Took the name of the avenue nearby. Dedicated to the Statute of Autonomy for Catalonia.

carrer.name: Estatut de Catalunya, Avinguda de l'
carrer.descripcio: Organic law passed on 18th December, 1979. Statute of Autonomy for Catalonia.

carrer.name: Estefania de Requesens, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Estefania de Requesens i Roís de Liori ( ? - Barcelona 1549). Baroness of Castellvell and Molins de Rei. Daughter of Catalonia's governor Lluís de Requesens i Joan de Soler, Count of Palamós. She married Juan de Zúñiga i Avellaneda, son of the Count of Miranda, tutor to Prince Felipe of Girona (the future Felipe II of Spain).

carrer.name: Estel, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: A very short street in the center of old Barcelona between the streets 'carrer de les Tàpies' 'and Nou de la Rambla'. Possibly named in reference to the passing of a comet, but a dedication to the Virgin Mary should not be ruled out.

carrer.name: Esteràs, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Elisa Esteràs i Font (Valladolid, Castille 1867 - Barcelona 1935). Daughter of Nicolàs Esteràs i Sánchez, army colonel, and Montserrat Font i Riera, landowner.

carrer.name: Esteve Terradas, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Esteve Terradas i Illa (Barcelona 1883 - Madrid 1950). Mathematician. Industrial and civil engineer. Professor at the universities of Zaragoza and Barcelona and at the School of Aeronautics, Madrid. Oversaw the building of the railway network in the Community of Catalonia. Managing director of Spain's Telephone Company and of IEC. Member of the organisation for scientific research' Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas'.
carrer.anteriors: Esteban Terradas; Ra. de Jecceli; Ra. de Llachsali

carrer.name: Estocolm, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Stockholm, capital of Sweden. Commemorates the 1912 Olympic Games held there.

carrer.name: Estoril, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Estoril, a Portuguese town. The nearby streets of Lisboa (Lisbon), Tajo (Tagus) and Porto (Oporto) probably inspired the name.

carrer.name: Estruc, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: As far back as the 14th century the street was know as 'Astruc', according to a royal decree dating from 1358. Records also show that a landowner called Estruc Ça Carrera had a house built there in the 15th century. The name, therefore, is taken from a family name. A register of the Jewish neighborhood dating from 6th June 1383 mentions: Astruc Abenefeia, secretary of Barcelona's Jewish neighborhood; Astruc Bonafós, physician; Astruc Mossè Mahir; Astruc Satorra; Astruc de Ripoll; Astruc Jusef Leví; Astruc Vides, and Astruc Massana. It would therefore seem that 'Astruc' was a common name at that time.

carrer.name: Estudiant, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: A students' hostel that could once be found here gave the street its name.

carrer.name: Estudis, Carreró dels
carrer.descripcio: Name taken from the rooms formerly occupied by painters, sculptors, etc., which they used as studios.

carrer.name: Eterna Memòria, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: In 1847 Maria Miquela de Borràs i de Valls, widow to Peguera, married for the second time to Matias Ramon de Casanovas, asked the authorities of Sant Martí permission to divide a piece of land that she owned in the Camp de l'Arpa area. Her proposal was to open four wide streets which she wished to name Don Juan de Peguera, Beato Miguel, Virgen del Carmen and Eterna Memoria (Eternal Remembrance). She judged this to be a fitting tribute to her dead husband who had made her happy.

carrer.name: Eucaliptus, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Popular meeting place in the Torre Baró neighborhood where a fountain and picnic area existed until 1969.

carrer.name: Euclides, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: (3rd century B.C) Greek mathematician.

carrer.name: Eugeni D'Ors, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eugeni D'Ors i Rovira (Barcelona 1881 - Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1954). Writer and philosopher. Lawyer. Doctor of Philosophy and Arts. Director of public education in the Community. General secretary of the Institute For Catalan Studies.

carrer.name: Europa, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from Europe, the continent.

carrer.name: Europa, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from Europe, the continent.

carrer.name: Eusebi Güell, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Eusebi Güell i Bacigalupi (Barcelona 1846 - 1918). Industrialist and patron of the arts. Patron of the architect Gaudí. City counsellor for Barcelona (1875), member of parliament and senator. Promoted Catalan culture. In 1908 he was made Count of Güell. As owner of the land between Pedralbes Monastery and Diagonal (av. Pedralbes) he requested that a road link the two.

carrer.name: Eusebi Planas, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Eusebi Planas i Franquesa (Barcelona 1833 - 1897). Sketcher, watercolourist and lithographer.

carrer.name: Euterpe, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Greek Muse of music. Daughter of Zeus and Mnemosyne.

carrer.name: Evarist Arnús, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Evarist Arnús i de Ferrer (Barcelona 1820 - 1890). Financier. Founded Barcelona's Lyric Theatre (1881). Presided the Casa de Caridad and was one of the promoters of the 1888 Universal Exhibition.

carrer.name: Exèrcit, Avinguda de l'
carrer.descripcio: In homage to the armed forces.

carrer.name: Exposició, Passeig de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the 1929 International Exhibition.

carrer.name: Extremadura, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Region in western Spain.

carrer.name: Ezequiel Boixet, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Ezequiel Boixet i Castells - pseudonym, Juan Buscón - (Lleida, Segrià 1849 - Barcelona 1914). Journalist and narrator. Director of the newspaper 'La Vanguardia'.

carrer.name: F, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: In the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, the streets, with few exceptions, are streets designated with letters in the North-South direction, while streets designated with numbers run in the East-West direction.

carrer.name: Fabià Puigserver, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Fabià Puigserver i Plana, a scenographer and theatrical director, was born in Olot, in the Catalan region of La Garrotxa, on 28th October 1938. He spent his childhood in France, and from 1951 lived in Poland, where he obtained a degree in Scenography at Warsaw's High School of Fine Arts. In 1959 he returned to Barcelona where he finally established himself on his own by carrying out decorative work for theatre groups. He obtained a degree in Scenography from the Institut del Teatre de Barcelona, where he became the Head of the Scenography Department and a member of the Studies Committee. He was awarded the Spanish National Prize for Scenography in 1975, the International Medal of Los Angeles, the Gold Medal of Valladolid and the Gold Medal of the Latin Theatre Cycle of Barcelona. He founded the Teatre Lliure (Free Theatre) of Barcelona in 1976. He was awarded the FAD prize for his scenography. In 1985 he obtained the Ciutat de Barcelona prize. He died in Barcelona on 30th July 1991, in the Carrer de la Diputació, 329.

carrer.name: Fabra i Puig, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Fabra i Puig (Barcelona 1866 - 1944). Second Marquis of Alella. Industrial engineer and politician. Mayor of Barcelona between 1922 and 1923. And Roman Fabra i Puig, Marquis of Masnou, brother of the above-mentioned. Managing directors of the spinning works 'Hilaturas Fabra i Coats'. The opening of the street was commemorated by a plaque from the workers of the factory as a sign of gratitude.

carrer.name: Fabra i Puig, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the avenue 'passeig Fabra I Puig'. This section of the avenue is geographically distinguishable from the rest and lies between the roads 'Gran de Sant Andreu ' and 'Concepción Arenal.'

carrer.name: Fàbrica, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Despite their agricultural origins, the appearance of the boroughs of Sants and Sant Andreu adapted to the demands of industry (particularly the textile industry). The name of this street is a reminder of this change.

carrer.name: Fages, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Neighborhood in the borough of Santa Pau (Garrotxa). The street is among those in the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Faig, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the beech tree ('faig'), a deciduous tree that can grow to up to 30 m, having smooth grey bark, with serrated, unlobed leaves with fine downy hairs.

carrer.name: Far, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Gives access to the lighthouse ('far').

carrer.name: Farell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Farell, 'Ipso Farello', records of this place name date from 1073. It is located on what is now known as 'Morrot', the summit of Montjuïc. This is in no way connected to the name of the street found in what was once 'Coll dels Enfocats', name dating from 991. The road was built on land belonging to Josepa de Sarriera i de Copons, Marchioness of Moià.

carrer.name: Farga, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the San José forge ('farga') that used to stand here.

carrer.name: Farigola, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Also known as 'passatge lletra B'.

carrer.name: Farigola, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Name derived from the 'Farigola' stream and the inn 'Hostal de la Farigola' that was once located in this street. The land belonged to the school 'San Benedicto de Monges' run by a Benedictine order from Tarragona.

carrer.name: Farnés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Sebastià Farnés i Badó (Sant Feliu de Codines, Vallès Oriental 1854 - Barcelona 1934). Lawyer, stenographer and writer. It was originally dedicated to Francesc Farnés i Rubió, insurance actuary and landowner.

carrer.name: Fastenrath, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Johannes Fastenrath (Remscheid 1839 - Cologne 1908). German Hispanist. Corresponding member of the Spanish Academy, the National Academy of History and the San Fernando Academy. He wrote works in German, Spanish, Catalan and French.

carrer.name: Fàtima, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Shrine. Place of pilgrimage in Santarém (Portugal).

carrer.name: Favència, Via
carrer.descripcio: Part of the Roman name for Barcelona: 'Civitas Iulia Augusta Paterna Faventia' 'Barcino'.
carrer.anteriors: Sesenta Metros; Garreta; Sesenta Metros; Lletra Ll (connection map)

carrer.name: Federico García Lorca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Fuente Vaqueros, Andalusia 1898 - Viznar, Granada 1936). Poet and dramatist. Theatre director, creator of a travelling theatre company.

carrer.name: Feijoo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Benito Jerónimo Feijoo y Montenegro (Casdemiro, Galicia 1676 - Oviedo 1764). Galician writer and erudite. Benedictine monk. Professor of theology at the San Vicente monastery (Monforte de Lemos) and at the University of Oviedo.

carrer.name: Feixa Llarga, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Former name of the area.

carrer.name: Felanitx, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in Eastern Majorca. The street is located in the Porta neighborhood, where most of the street names are dedicated to towns and villages on the Balearic Islands.

carrer.name: Felip Bertran i Güell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1901 - 1965). Industrialist. He was responsible for the rebuilding Santa Maria de Poblet Monastery.

carrer.name: Felip de Malla, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1370 - 1431). Writer, orator, politician and clergyman. He studied theology in Paris where he taught until 1407. He returned to Barcelona in 1408 and took over the posts he had gained by merit during his absence: canon for the Cathedral and the Pi parish rector (1407). He played a decisive role in the succession of the crown in favor of Fernando de Antequera and in eradicating the Eastern Schism.

carrer.name: Felip Gil, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Felip Gil i Julià (Barcelona 1790- 1848). In 1857 Josep Lluís i Oliva conceded a piece of land in the area to Felip Gil. His wife, Manuela Martínez i Mena, bequeathed the land to their son Felip Gil Martínez Mena in 1886.

carrer.name: Felip II, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Valladolid 1527 - El Escorial 1598). King of Castile, Catalonia and Aragon, and Portugal. Son of Charles V and Isabel of Portugal. On 7th February 1564 he arrived in Valdonzella and the next day entered Barcelona as king of the Catalans.
carrer.anteriors: Felipe II; Bach de Roda; Felipe II; Bach de Roda (2nd section); Comercio

carrer.name: Felipe de Paz, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Felip de Paz i de Solà (Terrassa, Vallès Occidental 1742 - Barcelona 1818 ?) Soldier. Field Marshal (1809). During the French occupation he was commander-in-chief of the engineering corps, as a result of which he was persecuted. In April 1809, he managed to escape from Barcelona to Tarragona where he continued to fight against Napoleon. He was made a Knight of the order 'Gran Cruz de San Hermenegildo'. His father, Felipe de Paz, was a lieutenant in the Portuguese Mountain Dragoons.

carrer.name: Felipe de Paz, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Feliu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Feliu Casanova i Casteràs (Barcelona 1872 - 1960). Landowner. Married to Maria Riera Estapé, daughter to Salvador Riera i Giralt, local landowner.

carrer.name: Feliu, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Land belonging to Feliu Homs, and before that to Pere Brasó. Bequeathed to Bonaventura Homs i Mari (1836 - 1876).

carrer.name: Feliu Casanova, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Feliu Casanova i Casteràs (Barcelona 1872 - 1960). Local landowner. The existence of the roads 'calle de Feliu Casanova' and 'calle de Casteràs', makes us inclined to think that the passageway was indeed dedicated to Feliu Casanova i Casteràs.

carrer.name: Feliu Casanova, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Feliu Casanova i Casteràs (Barcelona 1872 - 1960). Landowner. The fact that when the area was developed a street was dedicated to his mother makes us think that this street is named after his father Feliu Casanova. It should be remembered he had already had one street named after him, 'calle Feliu' in the Guinardó borough, when he married the daughter of the owner of property in the area.

carrer.name: Feliu i Codina, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Feliu i Codina (Barcelona 1845 - Madrid 1897). Dramatist and journalist.

carrer.name: Fèlix Macià, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fèlix Macià i Bonaplata (Barcelona 1838 - 1891). Engineer and writer. Mayor of Barcelona (1890).

carrer.name: Fèlix Martí Alpera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (El Cabanyal, Valencia, Horta 1875 - Barcelona 1946). Teacher.

carrer.name: Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Poza de la Sal, Castile 1928 - Shaktoolik, Alaska 1980). Spanish natural scientist. He studied medicine and dentistry but soon became involved with a national wildlife conservation program. He became very popular by making television documentaries about animals and their behavior in the wild.

carrer.name: Fenals, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fenals d'Aro. Seaside town in the borough of Castell d'Aro (Baix Empordà). The street is located in the Trinitat Nova neighborhood, where most of the street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the Costa Brava.

carrer.name: Fènix, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Sacred bird which the Greeks and Romans believed to be the emblem of immortality. It owes its name to the ornamental palm tree from India, of the genus 'phoenix,' which was in the square when it was opened.

carrer.name: Ferlandina, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A deformation of 'Fernandina', the name of the dukes who had a palace in this street. The most famous of the dukes was García de Toledo, Marquis of Vilafranca and Duke of Fernandina. He was an admiral of the royal fleet and was pursued by the Catalan fighters for independence, the rippers ('els segadors)', the day after the uprising known as the 'Corpus de Sang'. The duke's servants were killed and his palaces burnt for having supported the Count of Santa Coloma.

carrer.name: Fernán Caballero, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pseudonym of the author Cecília Böhl de Faber (Morges, Switzerland 1796 - Seville 1877). She wrote novels in Spanish.

carrer.name: Fernández Duró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jesús Fernández Duró (1880 - Sant Joan Lohitzune 1908). Balloonist. He was the first person to try to make a longitudinal crossing of the Mediterranean

carrer.name: Fernando de los Ríos, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Fernando de los Ríos Urrutia (Ronda, Malaga 1879 - New York 1949). Politician and writer. Socialist. Member of the provisional government during the Republic. He later held successive posts as minister of public education and ambassador in Washington during the 1936-1939 Civil War.

carrer.name: Fernando Pessoa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fernando Antonio Nogueira Pessoa (Lisbon 1888 - 1935). Portuguese poet. He spent his childhood in South Africa. He wrote some of the most original works in Portuguese literature. Together with Sá Carneiro, he was a pioneer in his country's vanguard movements.

carrer.name: Fernando Poo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Island in Equatorial Guinea. Named after Fernão do Pó, the Portuguese navigator who discovered the island in 1472. The island was given up to Spain after a treaty was signed in 1778 between the queen of Portugal, Maria Pia, and King Charles III of Spain. It gained autonomy in 1964 and became part of the Independent Republic of Equatorial Guinea in 1968.

carrer.name: Fernando Primo de Rivera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fernando Primo de Rivera y Orbaneja (Jerez de la Frontera 1879 - Monte Arruït 1921). Lieutenant colonel who died in action during the campaign in Morocco.

carrer.name: Ferradura, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the unusual horseshoe shape of the passageway. It is located between the streets 'carrer de Cantàbria 'and 'carrer de Santander'.

carrer.name: Ferran, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street was originally dedicated to King Fernando VII of Spain (San Ildefonso 1784 - Madrid 1833). The opening of the road coincided with a visit he made to Barcelona in 1827. On March 1st 1827, after much discussion, the city authorities agreed to rename the street from Ferran VII to Ferran. Thus, the street no longer honored the absolutist king.
carrer.anteriors: Fernando; Fivaller; Fernando VII; Fernando; Fernando VII; Duque de la Victoria; Fernando VII; Mayor del Duque de la Victoria, before 1843; Fernando VII, before 1820

carrer.name: Ferran Agulló, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Agulló i Vidal (Girona 1863 - Santa Coloma de Farners, Selva 1933). Poet, journalist and writer of comedies.

carrer.name: Ferran Casablancas, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Casablancas i Planell (Sabadell, Vallès Occidental 1874 - Barcelona 1960). Textile manufacturer. He invented a device to thread cotton, patented in many countries and used by the main textile factories worldwide.
carrer.anteriors: Fernando Casablancas; Virgen de la Paz; Pl. Ganduxer, 29/03/1876

carrer.name: Ferran Junoy, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Junoy i Vernet (Girona 1862 - Barcelona 1932). Engineer. Managing director of the workshops called 'La Maquinista Terrestre i Marítima '(1917) in this same street.
carrer.anteriors: Fernando Junoy; Lletra F (plan from the enlargement of Sant Andreu)

carrer.name: Ferran Puig, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Puig i Gibert (Girona 1815 - Barcelona 1901). Industrialist and politician. In 1838 he founded the industry which was later to become 'Fabra and Coats'. Owner of the hilly area of the city 'el Putget', where the street is located. Councilor for the Town Hall of Barcelona (1855) and senator for Girona (1881-1894).
carrer.anteriors: Fernando Puig; Galbany; Pje. de la Concepción

carrer.name: Ferran Reyes, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Fernando Reyes Garrido (Granada 1877 - Barcelona 1937). Industrial engineer. Head of Barcelona's railway division. He designed the layout and oversaw the work on the city's underground system.

carrer.name: Ferran Soldevila, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Soldevila i Zubiburu (Barcelona 1894 - 1971). Historian, writer and archivist. He taught the history of Catalonia at the Librarians' School ('Escuela de Bibliotecarias') and at Barcelona's Autonomous University. Member of the Institute for Catalan Studies and the Academy of Fine Letters of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Ferran Turné, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ferran Turné i Carbonell (Barcelona 1877 - 1921). Defender of the humble and supporter of the working classes, as was his teacher and friend, the poet and dramatist Ignasi Iglésias. His works include 'La cadena', 'Els' 'culpables', etc.

carrer.name: Ferran Valentí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Majorca ? - 1476). Humanist. Writer. He worked closely with Italian Humanists.

carrer.name: Ferran Valls i Taberner, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1888 - 1942). Jurist and historian. He studied for a degree in Philosophy and Fine Arts in Barcelona and for his doctorate in Madrid. University professor in Spanish history in Murcia. Full member of the Institute for Catalan Studies. Director of the Royal Archives of Aragon and of Barcelona's University Library. He represented the political party 'la Lliga' in Catalonia's parliament (1932) and in the national parliament (1935).
carrer.anteriors: Ferran Valls y Taberner; Núm. 2 (Monterolas hill)

carrer.name: Ferrer Bassa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 14th century). Painter. The first Catalan painter of international standing. He painted the Sant Miquel chapel in Pedralbes Monastery (1346).

carrer.name: Ferrer de Blanes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Ferrer was a priest who lived for many years in the town of Blanes and was hence known as 'Ferrer de Blanes ' (Vidreres, Selva 1445 - Blanes, Selva 1523). Cosmographer, writer and merchant. The Catholic Monarchs consulted him regarding Columbus' plans as he was noted for his knowledge of the Alexandrine line of demarcation in the territories discovered by Spain and Portugal.

carrer.name: Ferrer i Vidal, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Ferrer i Vidal (Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1817 - Barcelona 1893). Textile manufacturer. Economist. Member of parliament and senator for the conservative party.

carrer.name: Ferreria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name makes a reference to the original forge ('ferreria') in this street owned by the Girona brothers. The forge was destroyed by fire and was moved to the Poblenou area of the city.
carrer.anteriors: Herrería; Rbla. de la Herreria de San José

carrer.name: Ferrers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the forge originally called 'Mare de Déu del Remei' or 'Can Girona', and then 'Mocosa' until the early 90s.

carrer.name: Ferro, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Forms part of the Zona Franca neighborhood, where the streets are named after commonly used tools and industrial materials.

carrer.name: Ferrocarril, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The street takes its name from the Mataró railway line, which once ran nearby. It was opened on 28th October 1848 (the first in Spain).

carrer.name: Ferrocarrils Catalans, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Catalan Railway company, which was founded in 1919 when several companies amalgamated.

carrer.name: Festa Major, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: For many years all kinds of festivals were celebrated in this street. The street takes its name from the main local festival, the 'Festa Major.'

carrer.name: Fígols, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fígols de la Conca. Borough in Pallars Jussà.

carrer.name: Figueres, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Eusebi Figueras i Rosés (1815 - 1879). Mayor of the Sant Gervasi borough and landowner.

carrer.name: Figuerola, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Laureà Figuerola i Ballester (Calaf, Anoia 1816 - Madrid 1903). Writer and economist. He was the Minster of Finance in 1869, and then Minister of Justice during the Serrano and Prim governments. He presided the act which marked the beginning of the demolition of the fortress built in Barcelona by Philip V. He founded the teacher training school 'la Escuela Normal de Barcelona'.

carrer.name: Filatures, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the spinning mill ('filatures').

carrer.name: Filipines, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: The archipelago in the Pacific Ocean. It was under Spanish rule between 1571 and 1898. It gained autonomy in 1898 and was made independent from the United States in 1946.

carrer.name: Finestrat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In 1718 the barony of Finestrat (1691) was passed down to the descendants of Jacint Forner i Bernabeu, Lord of Finestrat i de Benasau, the Pasqual de Pobil family who owned the land where the road was built.

carrer.name: Finestrelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name is recorded in documents dating from 981. An area within the old city limits of Barcelona where the river Besòs crosses the hills of Collserola. The street lies between the old Vallbona barracks and the borough of Sant Andreu de Palomar.

carrer.name: Finestrelles, Camí de
carrer.descripcio: The name is adopted from the mountain pass 'Coll de Finestrelles', documented in 1068, it runs where the pathway 'camí de Pedralbes' once lay.

carrer.name: Finlàndia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Finland, the Scandinavian country in northern Europe.

carrer.name: Firmament, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: An open space in the Rectoret en Vallvidrera neighborhood, where many street names are dedicated to the subject of astronomy.

carrer.name: Fisas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Fisas i Torns (1803 - 1843). Farmer, owner of the land in the area and of the farmhouse bearing the same name.

carrer.name: Física, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street name, meaning 'physics', forms a pair with the street running parallel 'carrer de la Química', meaning 'chemistry'.

carrer.name: Fitor, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town and borough of Fonteta, in the Baix Empordà region. The street is among those in the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Flaçà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Gironès region. The street is among those in the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Flandes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Western area on the North European Plain.

carrer.name: Flandes, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The title of Josep de la Barre i de Taberner. Baron of la Barre de Flandes and of Pechmann (Madrid ? - 1855). Owner of the land known as Mas Falcó.

carrer.name: Flassaders, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: At one time blanket makers ('flassaders) 'traded in this street. Their guild rules date back to 1331.

carrer.name: Flaugier, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Bernat Flaugier (Lo Martegne, Provence 1757 - Barcelona 1813). A painter from Provence who settled in Barcelona around the year 1773. He was the principal at the school of fine arts 'l'Escola de Belles Arts de Llotja' (1809).

carrer.name: Flix, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Ribera del Ebro region

carrer.name: Flor, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from an old and noble Catalan family called 'de la Flor '(RiC). Joan Amades offers two other versions of the name's origins: first, because Saint Josep Oriol had lived in the street and was known by his contemporaries as the flower ('flor') of chaplains; the other is that it was the name of a brothel.

carrer.name: Flor de Lliri, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In 1444 an inn opened in this street bearing this name. During the 15th century it was one of Barcelona's most renowned inns where luminaries of the time would stay when they passed through the city. The inn's distinguishing mark was a shield on which a large lily had been painted.

carrer.name: Flor de Neu, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: As happened with all the other names in the Prosperitat neighborhood, such as 'Aritjols', 'del Vinyar, del Pou 'or' del Molí', the street was named on a whim by urban developers.

carrer.name: Florència, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Florence, capital of Tuscany. The street forms a pair with another in the same area, 'carrer de Gènova' (Genoa).

carrer.name: Floresta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Borough in Les Garrigues which borders on the Pla d'Urgell region. The street is in the Milans de Bosch housing estate, where the streets are named after towns and villages in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Florida, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Peninsula in the southeast United States. Discovered by Vicente Yàñez Pinzón in 1498. Ponce de León claimed it in the name of Spain in 1513.

carrer.name: Floridablanca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: José Moñino y Redondo, Count of Floridablanca (Murcia 1728 - Seville 1808). Statesman. He is famous for organizing the 1787 census of Spain. The name was adopted despite initial opposition by Víctor Balaguer.

carrer.name: Floristes de la Rambla, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Pays tribute to the florists ('floristes') on the 'Rambla'.

carrer.name: Flors, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: A very old name by which the street has always been known.

carrer.name: Flors de Maig, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: The name of a poem set to music composed by Josep Anselm Clavé.

carrer.name: Flos i Calcat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Flos i Calcat (Arenys de Mar, Maresme 1856 - Barcelona 1929). Pedagogue, calligrapher and author. He founded the Association for the Protection of Education in Catalan at Sant Jordi School, amongst others. He made an outstanding contribution at the Catalan Language International Congress (1906) with his methods of teaching Catalan grammar to children.

carrer.name: Fluvià, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon de Berenguer de Fluvià (Catalonia 14th century - Saboya 15th century). Knight, councilor, captain and one of Jaume d'Urgell 's principal supporters in the battle against Fernando de Trastámara.

carrer.name: Foc, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Takes is name from the word meaning 'fire' in Catalan. It is a basic element used in the metallurgical industry, which serves as a reference for many street names in the Zona Franca neighborhood.

carrer.name: Foc Follet, Carrer del
