carrer.descripcio: It is thought that the street is named in memory of a play written by Ignasi Iglésias in 1899.

carrer.name: Foix, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the country of Foix, in the Languedoc region.

carrer.name: Foixarda, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: Pathway leading to the place bearing this name.

carrer.name: Foixarda, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A bush, which grows to between 20 to 80cm, having spear or spatulate-shaped, leaves and blue flowers. It grows in woodland, thickets and dry scrubland.

carrer.name: Folc, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Folc de Cardona (Bellpuig, Urgell 1467 - Naples 1522). Folc is the surname preferred by members of the Cardona lineage who were descended from Ramon Folc, son to Julián, Count of Anjou and nephew to Charlemagne.

carrer.name: Folgueroles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Osona region.

carrer.name: Fondal de Sant Martí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A low-lying road compared to the nearby road 'carretera de Ribes'. It leads to the old church 'Sant Martí de Provençals'.
carrer.anteriors: Fondo de San Martín; Ctra. de San Martín; Ctra. de la Cruz

carrer.name: Foneria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from metal smelting industry. The street is in the Zona Franca neighborhood.

carrer.name: Fonollar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Old Catalan family of noblemen. Bernat de Fonollar is mentioned as belonging to the court of King Jaume II in 1323. Humbert de Fonollar was the royal chaplain in Barcelona in 1395.

carrer.name: Fonolleda, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Is a place where fennel grows.

carrer.name: Font, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Paula Font i Cuyàs (Barcelona 1789 - 1870). Owner of the land located in the place called 'joc de la rutlla'. She was married to Joan Forasté i Moragas. She bequeathed the land to Paula Font i Casas, Joaquim Plans i Font, Francesc d'Assís Font i Bellsolà and Esperança Casas i Font.

carrer.name: Font Baliarda, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the house 'Can Baliarda' in San Juan de Horta. The street is behind the cemetery.

carrer.name: Font Castellana, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: The name was created when the Can Baró neighborhood underwent development in the area near the avenue 'avinguda de la Mare de Déu de Montserrat'.

carrer.name: Font d'Arboç, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: On the road called 'camí de Mas Guimbau', in the borough of Vallvidrera.

carrer.name: Font de Canyelles, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: There are records of Canyelles as a place name dating from 991.

carrer.name: Font de la Mulassa, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: Next to the Fargas stream, located on the northern slope of the hill 'Turó de la Rovira'.

carrer.name: Font de la Mulassa, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Popular place name in the 'fuente de Fargas' neighbourhood.

carrer.name: Font de Sant Miquel, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the stream of which there are records dating back to 1390. The name of the square dates from before 1609.

carrer.name: Font del Coll, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Takes its name from the stream 'Font-rúbia' (place name recorded in 1099), near the 'Coll 'cemetery.

carrer.name: Font del Lleó, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Font del Lleó, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: It went around a restaurant bearing this name established by Joan Balet. The name is taken from a Barroque style stone lion ('lleó') that could be found in the old washhouse. It belonged to property called 'finca de Santa Caterina'.
carrer.anteriors: Fuente del León; Font del Lleó, 29/01/1929

carrer.name: Font del Mont, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: On the road 'carretera de les Aigües', lying on the eastern slope of the centre of Vallvidrera.

carrer.name: Font del Mont, Escales de la
carrer.descripcio: The name is a revival of oral tradition. This place had always been known locally as "escales de la Font del Mont".

carrer.name: Font del Mont, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Leads into the street bearing the same name.

carrer.name: Font del Mont, Torrent de la
carrer.descripcio: Leads down from the road between Tibidabo and Vallvidrera to the road 'carretera de les Aigües'.

carrer.name: Font del Racó, Parc de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Font del Remei, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: On the southern slope of the cemetery 'Mare de Déu del Coll', converging with the Coll stream.

carrer.name: Font del Roure, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: An area located at the end of the street 'calle de Costa Pacheco', in the Horta-Guinardó district.

carrer.name: Font dels Ocellets, Jardins de la
carrer.descripcio: A stream that was popular with the local inhabitants flowed here. Before development of the area took place, it formed part of the property 'la Estela', owned by the Count of Vallcabra. It was the only natural spring water in the Les Corts district and flowed out at 67 metres above sea level. The gardens are located half way up the road 'carrer de Jiménez i Iglesias', in the Les Corts district.

carrer.name: Baix del Mas Sauró, Camí
carrer.descripcio: In memory of a farmhouse that existed at this place of Vallvidrera.

carrer.name: Font d'en Fargues, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: 'Can Fraguas' (or 'Fargas') is the name of an old country house mentioned in 1300, belonging to the Fargas de Casanovas family since 1734. It is a building of great interest with a wide gallery and large buttresses and is surrounded by pine trees.

carrer.name: Font d'en Fargues, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the 'passeig'.

carrer.name: Font d'en Magués, Torrent de la
carrer.descripcio: The name of a stream that separated 'Torre Baró' and 'Ciutat Meridiana' neighborhoods.

carrer.name: Font d'en Quintana, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: Adopted its name from the property called 'Can Quintana'. The pathway is located where the Can Quintana stream changes name as it crosses the 'Can Carreras' property.

carrer.name: Font Florida, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name, meaning flowery, is justified by the surrounding streets 'Crisantem' (chrysanthemum), 'Begònia' (begonia), 'Hortènsia' (hydrangea), 'Gessamí' (jasmine) and 'Lotus' (lotus).

carrer.name: Font Florida, Parc de la
carrer.descripcio: An open space located between the streets 'calle de la Font Florida' and 'calle la de la Mineria'. The name has the same origin as the street name.

carrer.name: Font Honrada, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Records of the stream date back to the 11th century. One document mentions the donation of "farming land found in the borough of Font Onrada de Montjuïc".

carrer.name: Font i Sagué, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Norbert Font i Sagué (Barcelona 1874 - 1910). Clergyman. Geologist, spelaeologist and writer. He was a member of the Science Academy and of the Board of Museums of Barcelona. He founded the Museum of Petrography.

carrer.name: Fontanella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Pere Fontanella (Olot, Garrotxa 1576 - Perpignan, Roussillon 1649). Lawyer and politician. Chief councilor, elected between 30th November 1640 and 30th November 1641. Together with Pau Claris he proclaimed the Catalan Republic and the union with France.

carrer.name: Fontanelles, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Xavier Fontanelles i Calaf, Pasqual i Prats (Capellades, Anoia 1773 - Barcelona 1852). Catalan nobleman. He was bestowed the title of Marquis of Casa Fontanelles by Queen Isabel II in 1849. Landowner.

carrer.name: Fontanet, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: One of the oldest families from the village of Horta. Charles IV of Austria stayed at the house 'Can Fontanet', which is near the square, in 1709, when he reigned Barcelona.
carrer.anteriors: Baja or bda. de Fontanet; Alta de Fontanet

carrer.name: Fontcoberta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep de Foncoberta, married to Mª Dolors Perramon i Comas del Brugar, who inherited the land in 1844. She was the daughter Francesc Xavier de Perramon i de Caramany.

carrer.name: Fonteta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A village in the Baix Empordà region. ). The street is among those in the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Fontova, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Lleó Fontova i Mareca (Barcelona 1838 - 1890). Actor and playwright.

carrer.name: Fontrodona, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Fontrodona i Vila (Sant Pol de Mar, Maresme 1813 - Barcelona 1873). Notary to the owners of the land where the street was built: Pau Codorniu i Busquets and Pau Valls i Mas. The land belonged to the Marquis of Castellbell. He was married to Joana de Gomis. He died of typhoid. Ignasi Fontrodona i Vila (1812 - 1890), lawyer who may have influenced the street name.

carrer.name: Font-rúbia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Benedictine monastery in the borough of Barcelona (Santa Maria del Coll de Font-rúbia). Records of the name date from 1099.

carrer.name: Fonts, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: A square located between the streets 'calle de Clariana', 'calle Quito, calle Ciutat d'Asunción and calle Caracas', in the center of which there is a fountain ('font') with several spouts. The Plaza de las Fuentes neighbor's association made the proposal for the name.

carrer.name: Fontserè i Mestre, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Fontserè i Mestre (Barcelona ? 1829 - Barcelona 1897). Master builder. He won the tender for Barcelona's Ciutadella park with the slogan "parks are to cities what lungs are to humans". The students of architecture Cristòfor Cascante and Antoni Gaudí assisted him.

carrer.name: Font-trobada, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: It lies between 'passeig de Montjuïc' and 'passeig de Miramar'. It is an old place name.

carrer.name: Foradada, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the rock formation in the 'Comtal' irrigation channel which until recently flowed here.

carrer.name: Forasté, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc d'Assís Forasté i Iglésias died intestate in 1877. He bought an area of land from Mercedes Craywinckel Fernández i Hurtado de Mendoza in 1870.

carrer.name: Forestal de Can Castellví de Dalt, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Forms part of the 'Can Pasqual' park. Named after a farmhouse. Popularly called 'Can Pascol'.

carrer.name: Forestal de Can Pasqual, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the farmhouse.

carrer.name: Forestal de la Budellera, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Forms part of the 'Vallvidrera' park. The name comes from a property called 'bedollera' ('birch grove') because of the great number of birch trees that used to grow there.

carrer.name: Forestal de la Meca, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the local area.

carrer.name: Forestal de Montbau, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the neighborhood surrounding it.

carrer.name: Forestal de Sant Cebrià, Parc
carrer.descripcio: It was the area's original name.

carrer.name: Forestal de Santa Creu d'Olorda, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the local area.

carrer.name: Forestal de Torre Baró, Parc
carrer.descripcio: It takes its name from the neighborhood, Torre Baró, an abbreviation of Torre del Baró. The name, in turn is derived from the Baron of Pinós, lord of the Vallbona estate.

carrer.name: Forestal de Vallvidrera, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the local area.

carrer.name: Forestal de Vil·lajoana, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the villa that can be found there. It forms part of the Vallvidrera park.

carrer.name: Forestal del Tibidabo, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the area surrounding it.

carrer.name: Forestal del Turó de Maria, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Named after the local area.

carrer.name: Foret, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Georges Foret i Renaudin, an industrialist who set up his business in the area.

carrer.name: Formatgeria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: It was a place where, from the 15th century onwards, cheese vendors set up stalls. The name of the street dates from before 1579.

carrer.name: Formentera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Balearic island, 'Ophiusa'. The Archbishop of Tarragona conquered it in 1235.

carrer.name: Formentor, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A peninsula of Majorca, in the borough of Pollença.

carrer.name: Formiga, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street's name commemorated a monologue by Ignasi Iglésias, first performed in 1904.

carrer.name: Forn, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: There used to be a kiln in one of the houses in the street.

carrer.name: Forn de la Fonda, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Records show that in 1579 the street was called 'de la Fonda' because of the inn ('fonda') found there. Later on, the name testified to the presence of an oven ('forn') at this renowned inn, located at the end of this cul-de-sac.

carrer.name: Fort Pienc, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: A small defensive fortress by that name stood here, as an advance garrison of the Citadel (la Ciutadella) of Barcelona. It was built by order of General Pius of Savoy, after the War of Spanish Succession.

carrer.name: Fortuna, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A village in Murcia, near the river Segura and south of Iecla. 'Segura' and 'Iecla' are the names of roads in the same neighborhood.

carrer.name: Fosca, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A hamlet in the borough of Palamós (Baix Empordà).

carrer.name: Fossar de les Moreres, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The old parish cemetery of Santa Maria del Mar church. Many of those who died in the 1714 uprising were buried here.

carrer.name: Fra Eloi de Bianya, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Ayats i Plantalech (la Vall de Bianya, Garrotxa 1875 - ? 1936). Capuchin monk.

carrer.name: Fra Juníper Serra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Miquel Serra i Ferrer (Petra, Majorca Oriental 1713 - Monterrey, California 1784). He founded the Franciscan missions in Alta California. He also founded the cities of San Diego and San Francisco, amongst others. When he professed his faith he changed his name to Juníper, popularly known as Ginebró.

carrer.name: Fra Juníper Serra, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Fra Luis de Granada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Luis de Sarria (Granada 1504 - Lisbon 1588). Writer and preacher.
carrer.anteriors: Fray Luis de Granada; Jaca, 13/01/1933; Fray Luis de Granada, 19/11/1929; Núm. 28 (map of Les Corts), 29/01/1925

carrer.name: Fraga, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Baix Cinca region.

carrer.name: França, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to France, the country in western Europe.

carrer.name: França Xica, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The first important business to be set up in the neighborhood was called 'la España' ('Spain'), which the owned publicised using a sign with big letters. Soon afterwards, a competitor moved in giving his business the name 'la França' ('France'), using even bigger letters than his rival. The whole neighborhood soon became known as 'la França' and the street as 'la França Xica '('little France').

carrer.name: Francesc Alegre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Humanist and writer (15th century). City councillor between 1480 and 1486. Honorary citizen (1492). The consul for Catalonia in Palermo (1479).
carrer.anteriors: Franciso Alegre; Av. de Rosa Tort; Londres

carrer.name: Francesc Boix i Campo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Boix i Campo, the Catalonian photographer of Mauthausen, was born in Barcelona on 31st August 1920, in the Carrer de Margarit, 17. In 1936 he collaborated in the edition of Juliol, together with Joaquim López Raimundo and Teresa Pàmies. As a refugee in France, he joined the 28th Foreign Workers Company in 1939. He was taken prisoner by the Germans in 1940, and was deported to the Mauthausen extermination camp. The Germans put him in charge of the photographic developing section which catered for all the photographs which they were taking to document the history of the camp, until the time of the prisoners' release. Boix took advantage of their liberation in order to carry out a photographic report on the camp. These photographs, together with those that were taken from the Germans, constitute the most impressive graphic document of what took place there. Boix was summoned to declare as a witness in the Nuremberg trial and later in Dachau, in a trial against 61 war criminals from Mauthausen. During the last years of his life he worked as a reporter in France, Alghero, Prague, Budapest and Greece. He died in 1951 aged 31 in Paris, in the Hospital d'Arcueil. The name of this street, together with those of other thoroughfares in the area, refers to the struggle for peace and human rights.

carrer.name: Francesc Bolòs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc de Bolòs i Germà (Olot, Garrotxa 1773 - 1844). Pharmacist and naturalist. Corresponding member of the academies of Science and Art, of Medicine and Surgery and the Fine Letters Academy of Barcelona.
carrer.anteriors: Francesc de Bolòs i Germà; Antoni Miracle

carrer.name: Francesc Cambó, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Cambó i Batlle (Verges, Baix Empordà 1876 - Buenos Aires 1947). Politician, lawyer and financier. Founder and leader of the 'Lliga Regionalista' party. Councilor for Barcelona (1901). Member of parliament (1933). He promoted Catalan culture.

carrer.name: Francesc Carbonell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Carbonell i Bravo (Barcelona 1768 - 1837). Scientist, philosopher, doctor, chemist and pharmacist.

carrer.name: Francesc Layret, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Layret i Foix (Barcelona 1880 - 1920). Lawyer and politician. Councilor for Barcelona in the VII district. Leader of the party 'Partit Republicà Català' (1917) and member of parliament for Sabadell. He was assassinated.

carrer.name: Francesc Macià, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Macià i Llussà (Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1859 - Barcelona 1933). President of the Generalitat. He proclaimed the Catalan Republic as an integral state of the Iberian Federation.
carrer.anteriors: Calvo Sotelo, 07/03/1939; Germans Badia, 1936; Alcalá Zamora, 23/09/1932

carrer.name: Francesc Pérez-Cabrero, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Pérez-Cabrero i Ferrater (Barcelona 1854 - 1914). Composer and conductor. He was a gifted singing coach and taught Maria Barrientos.

carrer.name: Duc de la Victòria, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Passage referring to the same dedication of the street.

carrer.name: Francesc Tarafa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Tarafa i Savall (Llerona, Vallès Oriental 1495 - Rome 1556). Canon of Barcelona. Archivist, chronicler and city historian.

carrer.name: Francesc Tàrrega, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Tàrrega i Eixea (Vila-real, Plana Baixa 1852 - Barcelona 1909). Guitarist and composer.

carrer.name: Francesca Bonnemaison, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Bonnemaison i Farriols (Barcelona 1872 - 1949). Pedagogue. She promoted education for women. She was the librarian for the charity library the 'Obra de Buenas Lecturas', which she managed to turn into a veritable reference library for working class women and which later became the 'Institut de Cultura i Biblioteca Popular per a la Dona'. She won the literary contest the 'Jocs Florals' in 1892. She contributed to the newspaper 'La Veu de Catalunya' using the pseudonym 'Franar'.

carrer.name: Francisco Giner, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco Giner de los Ríos (Ronda, Malaga 1839 - Madrid 1915). Andalusian philosopher, pedagogue and writer.

carrer.name: Francisco Manzano, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco Javier Manzano, postmaster general for Barcelona between 1808-1809. Unwilling to swear allegiance to King Joseph Bonaparte, he was imprisoned in Monjuïc.

carrer.name: Francolí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the river in the Camp de Tarragona region.

carrer.name: Franqueses, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Les Franqueses del Vallès. A borough in the Vallès Oriental region and after a petition made to the city of Barcelona in 1385, known as 'carreratge', the borough is one of the streets of Barcelona. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city.

carrer.name: Fraternitat, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Pays homage to one of the three principles adopted by the French Revolution.

carrer.name: Frederic Marès, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Frederic Marès i Deulovol (Portbou, Alt Empordà 1893 - Barcelona 1991). Sculptor and collector. National Prize for Sculpture (1923), first prize for sculpture at the Barcelona Universal Exhibition (1929). Director of Barcelona's art schools the 'Escola d'Arts i Oficis Artístics' (1946) and the 'Escola Superior de Belles Arts de Sant Jordi' (1947). The City of Barcelona Gold Medal (1948). The Cross of the order 'Orden de Instruçao Publica' (Portugal, 1950). Awarded the' Gran Cruz de Alfonso X el Sabio' (1951). President of the Sant Jordi Royal Academy of Fine Arts (1963). Numerary member of the San Fernando Academy of Fine Arts (1965). Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres de France (1970). The 'Creu de Sant Jordi' from the Generalitat de Catalunya (1986) and an Honorary medal from Barcelona's Lawyer's Association (1991).

carrer.name: Frederic Mompou, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Frederic Mompou i Dencausse (Barcelona 1893 - 1987). Musician. His father being Catalan and his mother French, he began his studies in Barcelona and finished them off in Paris with Ferdinand Motte-Lacroix and Marcel Samuel-Rousseau. His contact with the new French school (at a Fauré concert in Barcelona) made him decide to compose music.

carrer.name: Frederic Rahola, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Frederic Rahola i Tremols (Cadaqués, Alt Empordà 1858 - 1919). Writer, legal adviser and economist.

carrer.name: Frederic Soler, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Frederic Soler i Hubert (Barcelona 1839 - 1895). Pseudonym Serafí Pitarra. Poet and dramatist. Founded the 'Teatre Català' theatre society. The fact that there was a certain Frederic Soler i Martí, mayor of the borough of Sant Gervasi between 1886 and 1887, is merely a coincidence.

carrer.name: Frederica Montseny, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Frederica Montseny i Mañé (Madrid 1905 - 1994). From a very early age she started to write about literature, philosophy and feminist issues. She joined the CNT branch of the Union for Liberal Professionals (1931-1933). She joined the FAI in 1933. She was a member of the CNT's regional committee in Catalonia. Minister of Health (1936-1937). She stopped the 'Hechos de mayo' uprising in 1937 and survived an attempt on her life. Her ideas are published in 'El anarquismo militante y la realidad española' (1937), 'La' 'commune de Paris y la revolución española' (1937), etc. During her exile in Toulouse she wrote 'Mujeres en la cárcel' (1949), 'Cien días de la vida de' 'una' 'mujer' (1949), 'Heroínas' (1964), etc.

carrer.name: Fredolic, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: A mushroom growing to between 5 and 7 cm, with a convex cap, dark grey in colour, fibrous and scaly, and with a greyish white stem. It grows mainly in pine groves and is edible.

carrer.name: Freixa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Freixa i Vilardaga (Vilada, Berguedà 1848 - Barcelona 1910), master builder, he drew up the plans to develop the land in the area known as Joaquim Modolell del Puig i de Vallmajor, at the end of the 19th century.

carrer.name: Freixures, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: So called because of the offal vendors who used to trade in this street.
carrer.anteriors: Freixuras; Queralt; Rovira; Torre d'en Ripoll

carrer.name: Freneria, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It would seem that the name is a corrupted form of 'farineria' (flour mill), which once stood nearby.

carrer.name: Freser, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A river in the Pyrenees, a tributary of the river Ter.

carrer.name: Frida Kahlo, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Magdalena Carmen Frieda Kahlo Calderón. (Coyoacán 1907 - Mexico City 1954). Painter. Married to Diego Rivera, in 1929, her paintings were a reflection of the local folklore and above all of her life. Her work synthesized expressionist and surreal elements.

carrer.name: Frígola, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Bonaventura Frígola i Frígola (Castelló d'Empúries, Alt Empordà 1829 - 1901). Composer. The dedication was first made in 1980.

carrer.name: Fructuós Gelabert, Pas de
carrer.descripcio: Fructuós Gelabert i Badiella (Barcelona 1874 - 1955). Film director. He was the son of a carpenter. In 1897 he made a film camera, the first in the country, and began his highly commendable work in the field of film. He is considered to be the founder of Catalan film-making.

carrer.name: Fruita, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Forms part of the group of streets in Barcelona's Jewish neighborhood.

carrer.name: Fulton, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Robert Fulton (Little Britain, Pennsylvania 1765 - New York 1815). Engineer. American inventor. He worked in England and France where he drew up plans to build a submarine with self-propelling torpedoes. In 1798 he build the first submarine to use propellers.

carrer.name: Funoses Llussà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Funosas i Llussà, wife of Eugeni Duran Borrell, owner of the Casa Móra property, which had once belonged to his grandfather, Marià Borrell i Miralpeix, who gave the name to the 'Borrell' neighborhood.

carrer.name: Fusina, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name meant, in old Catalan, a foundry. A foundry gave the name to a street that used to lie just to the right of the 'Pla d'en Llull' area, at the top of the Born neighborhood, over the Comtal irrigation channel, where the street now runs as we know it.

carrer.name: Fusteria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Located where Barcelona's shipyards once stood. The ships were called 'fustes' and the shipwrights were called 'fusters'.

carrer.name: Gabarnet, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Artur Gabarnet i Rosés (Barcelona 1889 - 1970), landowner. He bought the land in 1921 from Miquel Valls i Freixas. It was inherited by his children Artur and Dolors Gabarnet i Vives.

carrer.name: Gabriel Alomar, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Gabriel Alomar i Vilallonga (Ciutat de Mallorca 1873 - Cairo, Egypt 1941). Essayist, poet and politician. He was ambassador to the Spanish Republic in Italy (1932-34) and in Egypt from 1937. He wrote under the pseudonym Biel de la Mel.

carrer.name: Gabriel Ferrater, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Gabriel Ferrater i Soler (Reus, Baix Camp 1922 - Sant Cugat del Vallès, Vallès Occidental 1972), writer and linguist. He also wrote poetry and also worked as a translator.

carrer.name: Gabriel Miró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Gabriel Miró i Ferrer (Alicante 1879 - Madrid 1930), writer and journalist.
carrer.anteriors: Lletra A (b. Puente de las Vacas); Mir y Miró; Lletra A (b. Puente de las Vacas)

carrer.name: Gabriel y Galán, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after José Mª Gabriel y Galán (Frades de la Sierra, León 1870 - Guijo de Granadilla, Extremadura 1905), Castilian poet. Joan Maragall considered him one of the most reputed Spanish classical writers of the 20th century.
carrer.anteriors: Pje. Rigalt; Cebada (without effectiveness); San Jacinto

carrer.name: Gabriela Mistral, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Vicuña, Chile 1889 - New York 1957). Pseudonym of Lucila Godoy i Alcayaga, Chilean poet. She wrote in a simple, lyrical and lively language. She held several teaching positions in Chile, Mexico and consulates. She published, amongst others, 'Desolación' (1922), 'Ternura' (1924), 'Tala' (1938), 'Lagar' (1954), etc. She was awarded the Nobel prize for literature in 1945.

carrer.name: Gaià, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the river that has its source in the hills of Brufaganya and Queralt and flows into the Mediterranean after crossing the Camp de Tarragona, near the Tamarit castle (Tarragonès).

carrer.name: Gaiolà, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Antoni de Gayolà i de Desprat, landowner. He owned 10 acres. He was succeeded by his daughter Matilde de Gayolà i de Casanovas in 1862 who owned the land until 1873.

carrer.name: Galba, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named the 15th century Catalan sculptor.

carrer.name: Galceran Marquet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (1366 - 1410). Vice-admiral of Catalonia. Marquet is the name of an old Catalan family of seamen and great merchants.

carrer.name: Galícia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Area in the Northeast of the Iberian Peninsula.

carrer.name: Galileu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Galileo Galilei (Pisa 1564 - Arcetri, Tuscany 1642), Italian physicist and astronomer. He defended the heliocentric system and invented the hydrostatic scales. He also discovered the Moon's craters, Venus' phases and Jupiter's satellites.

carrer.name: Gall, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: This square became known by the name given to the whole area.

carrer.name: Galla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: La Galla was the name given to Gall's wife, owner of the fields around the place where the street was later opened.

carrer.name: Galla, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Gal·la Placídia, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (4th century ? - Rome 450). Named after the Roman Empress, daughter of Theodosius the Great, wife of the Visigoth king Ataúlfo who established his court in Barcelona. She became widowed and was married a second time to the patrician Constantius who would become Emperor in 421.

carrer.name: Gallecs, Davallada de
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Gallecs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town belonging to Mollet del Vallès (Vallès Oriental) borough and a street of Barcelona. This city made a petition, in 1385, to be integrated into Barcelona through a procedure called 'carreratge'. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city.

carrer.name: Gállego, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the river in Aragon, one of the Ebro's affluents.

carrer.name: Galtés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: According to the municipal archives, this street was named after the owner of the site although a name is never given. For this reason, in the 1980 street nomenclature this street was attributed to Pius Galtés i Llibre (Barcelona 1844 - Sabadell, Vallès Occidental 1911). He was a naturalist and part of the religious order Escuelas Pías.

carrer.name: Gandesa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in Terra Alta. The street was given this name in 1943, as were many others (most of them were never used or have since been given a different name), "in memory of the epic and unforgettable battles" of the Civil War (1936 to 1939).

carrer.name: Gandhi, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi (Porbandar 1869 - New Delhi 1948), lawyer, politician and philosopher, leader of the movement in favor of the independence of India, best known by his honorary title of 'mahatma 'Gandhi. He was imprisoned in several occasions and in 1948 died at the hands of a Hindu extremist.

carrer.name: Ganduxer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Francesc d'Assís Ganduxer i Garriga (Corró d'Avall, Vallès Oriental ? - 1858), landlord of the surrounding properties and head of a family of landowners. He married Rita Aymerich and left everything to Pau Ganduxer i Aymerich (Corró d'Avall 1812 - Granollers, Vallès Oriental 1882), who married Josepa Carrencà.

carrer.name: Garbí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Punta de Garbí, cape of the Baix Empordà coast.

carrer.name: Garcia Cambra, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Mariano García Cambra, Director in 1930 of the Military Co-operative for the construction of economical housing estates in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Garcia Fària, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Pere Garcia Fària (Barcelona 1858 - 1927). Road engineer and architect. He was head of the sanitation department of the Town Hall of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Garcia i Robles, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the musician Josep Garcia i Robles (Olot, Garrotxa 1834 - Barcelona 1910). He was part of the Orfeó Català foundation and of the Music Association of Barcelona.

carrer.name: García-Mariño, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the lawyer Miquel García-Mariño de la Cortina (Tarragona 1850 - Barcelona 1905) who lived on this street. He was a clerk in one of the first instance courts of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Garcilaso, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Garcilaso de la Vega, son of García Suárez de Figueroa and Sancha de Guzmán (Toledo 1503 - Niza 1536). He took the name Lasso de la Vega, his grandmother's, Elvira, the sister of the marquis of Santillana. He was an officer, a writer and a poet. He wrote in Castilian and was considered the first humanist poet to use popular language.
carrer.anteriors: Estevanez; Ctra. de la Sagrera a Horta; Ctra. Nueva de Horta

carrer.name: Garcini, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Estate Casa Garcini, former Torre de la Concepció, located in the Trinxera fields. In the beginning of the 19th century, it belonged to Josep Gaietà Garcini de Salomó who then left it to his son Josep Maria Garcini i Pellicer. In 1832, it belonged to Manuela de Magarola i d'Ardena (1788 - 1859), wife of Felip Ignasi de Miquel i de Blondel.

carrer.name: Gardènia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the flower gardenia. This street is located in the Font de la Guatlla neighborhood, where many streets have been named after flowers or plants.

carrer.name: Gardunya, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Prison courtyard and the noisiest part of the Boqueria market. Also known as "la Gardunya".

carrer.name: Garigliano, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the delimiting river between Lacio and la Campania, in Italy. Near the river, on the 28 of December 1503, there was a battle with the same name in which the Catalan-Aragonese army, headed by Gonzalo de Córdoba, known as "el Gran Capitán", beat the French army. This battle was part of the war started by Fernando II to conquer Naples.

carrer.name: Garona, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the river in Gascuña y Guiena, Occitania. It's source is in Vall d'Aran and it flows into the Atlantic Ocean after passing the Girona estuary.

carrer.name: Garric, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Garric is a type of conifer tree. It is part of a set of streets named after flowers and trees.

carrer.name: Garriga i Bachs, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Andreu Garriga i Bachs, mayor of Barcelona in 1927. He donated a house to the city and instructed that it be demolished and in its place be built a monument to the independence war heroes from Barcelona, executed in 1809.

carrer.name: Garriga i Roca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Miquel Garriga i Roca (Alella, Maresme 1804 - Barcelona 1888), architect and urbanist. He designed the Liceu and the first extension plan.
carrer.anteriors: Av. de Manuel Alonso; Rovira y Trias; Horta

carrer.name: Garrigó, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The land where this square is now located used to belong to Mas Garrigó de Horta.

carrer.name: Garriguella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Alt Empordà region.

carrer.name: Garrofers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: This street adopted the name of an old hamlet called "de los Garrofers", where, according to the records, eighteen families lived in 1860.

carrer.name: Garrofers, Passatge dels
carrer.descripcio: This street gets its name from the carob tree.

carrer.name: Garrotxa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Region of the principality of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Gas, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Serviced the old gas factory.

carrer.name: Gas, Espigó del
carrer.descripcio: Breakwater that adopted the name of an old gas factory that existed in the area.

carrer.name: Gasela, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Gasela means gazelle - this street is part of a set of streets that were given names of game. All these streets end in the 'rambla del Caçador' (Avenue of the Hunter).

carrer.name: Gaspar Cassadó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Gaspar Cassadó i Moreu (Barcelona 1897 - Madrid 1966), cello player and composer, son of Joaquim Cassadó. He started his studies in Barcelona but finished them in Paris. He was a disciple of Pau Casals. Open to all music styles, his way of playing made the interpretation of contemporary pieces for cello easier. He taught at the Academia Chigiana in Sienna and, in 1958, he was appointed to the chair of perfectionism of the Staaliche Hochschule für Musik in Cologne. He composed several oratorios, one concert, and chamber music which gained him international recognition. Since 1969, following the proposal of Carmen Bravo, widow of Mompou and Alícia de la Rocha, the international cello competition Gaspar Cassadó is held every two years In Florence.

carrer.name: Gatcpac, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: GATCPAC (Grup d'Arquitectes i Tècnics Catalans per al Progrés de l'Arquitectura Contemporània). This Association was created in Barcelona in 1930 - it is the Catalan section of the CIRPAC. Publishers of the magazine 'AC'. This group participated in the creation of the Catalan Architect's Union which had as Secretary-Treasurer Torres i Clavé.

carrer.name: Gatell, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: This street is part of a set of streets all with names of trees and plants.

carrer.name: Gato Pérez, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Javier Patricio Pérez Álvarez, Gato Pérez (Buenos Aires 1951 - Barcelona 1990), musician. His parents were of Spanish origin. From a very young age he showed an interest in rock and Pampa music. From 1971 to 1977 he created many country-rock, pop-rock and jazz-rock bands. In 1977, he invented the existential rumba. Some of his best known songs include: 'El Ventilador', 'Rumba de los años 60', 'Gitanos y Morenos', 'Barca', 'Cielo y Ola'.

carrer.name: Gatosa, Escala de la
carrer.descripcio: This street is part of a set of streets all with names of trees and plants.

carrer.name: Gatuelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Gatuelles is the name of a Catalan family that owned land in the area where this street is now.

carrer.name: Gaudí, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Antoni Gaudí i Cornet (Reus, Baix Camp 1852 - Barcelona 1926) Catalan architect.
carrer.anteriors: General Primo de Rivera, 1939; Gaudí, 1931; General Primo de Rivera; Diagonal de San Pablo

carrer.name: Gaudí, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Antoni Gaudí i Cornet (Reus, Baix Camp 1852 - Barcelona 1926) Catalan architect.

carrer.name: Gavà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in the Baix Llobregat region.

carrer.name: Gayarre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Julián Gayarre Garjón (Roncal, Navarra 1844 - Madrid 1890), tenor.

carrer.name: Gaziel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Agustí Calvet i Pascual, a journalist and writer, known by his penname Gaziel. He was born in Sant Feliu de Guíxols, in the Baix Empordà region of Catalonia, on 7th October 1887. Together with his parents, he moved to Barcelona, where he first took a degree in Law, which he later completed with another in Philosophy and the Humanities. He obtained his doctorate in Madrid in 1911. From 1911 to 1914 he was the Secretary of the Historical and Archaeological Section of the Institut d'Estudis Catalans. He was the correspondent for La Vanguardia newspaper during the First World War. After joining the permanent staff of La Vanguardia, he took up posts in 1920 in the management of the newspaper, of which he was finally appointed Editor in 1933. During the Spanish Civil War he took up residence abroad. When he returned to Spain in 1940 he lived in Madrid, where he managed a publishing firm. He finally settled in Barcelona where he devoted himself fully to literary pursuits using Catalan as his only language. He died in Barcelona, on 12th April 1964, in the Carrer de Copèrnic, 5.

carrer.name: Gegants, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: One of the houses in this street, which had a very high gate, was used to keep the giants and other popular puppets used for processions during religious holidays.

carrer.name: Gelabert, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Joaquim Gelabert i Rosés (Sarrià 1804 - Les Corts 1871), landowner. He was the son of Josep Gelabert del Coscoll and of Joaquima Rosés i Cuyàs. The Galaberts were an important family in the village of Les Corts in Sarrià.

carrer.name: Gelida, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in the Alt Penedès region.

carrer.name: General Álvarez de Castro, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Mariano Álvarez de Castro (Burgo de Osma 1749 - Figueres, Alt Empordà 1810). He defended Girona in 1809, took part in the attack to Gibraltar, in the War of the First Coalition and in the war against Portugal.

carrer.name: General Bassols, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Joaquim de Bassols i de Maranyosa (Barcelona 1797 - 1877) military governor of Barcelona and Menorca. He was 'Capitán General' of the Baleares, Aragon and Castile, and war minister of Amadeo I (1871).

carrer.name: General Batet, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Domènec Batet i Mestres (Tarragona 1872 - Burgos 1937), army officer. He was a volunteer in Cuba where he obtain the rank of colonel and then that of brigade general in 1925. He was first sent to Alicante and then to Tarragona. In 1926, he was accused of being involved in the military coup against the dictatorship, attempt known as the "the night of San Juan", and he was arrested but later the court found him innocent. After the declaration of the Republic he was appointed head of the Fourth Division in Barcelona. He distinguished himself by his obedience of civil authority, his respect for the Catalan autonomic system and for the extreme discretion characteristic of all his actions. He was appointed head of the Sixth Division, in Burgos, where he tried to prevent a new military coup. He was arrested and shot on the 18th of February 1937.

carrer.name: General Castaños, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Francisco Javier Castaños y Aragorri (Madrid 1758 - 1852). Duke of Bailén, (for his bravery in combat) and Marquis of Portugalete. He was 'Capitán General' of Catalonia (1815-1820) during which time he was responsible for the promotion of many urbanization projects in Barcelona.

carrer.name: General Mendoza, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Pedro de Mendoza (Guadix 1487 - in the Atlantic 1537). In 1534, he was appointed 'Primer Adelantado', governor and general captain of the lands and tribes of the Plata region. He organized the 14 boat and 2150 men expedition which left Sanlúcar de Barrameda on the 24th of August 1535. On the 22nd of February 1536 he founded, in the banks of the Plata, a fortress he named Nuestra Señora de Santa María del Buen Aire, devoted to the patron saint of seamen.

carrer.name: General Mitre, Ronda del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Bartolomé Mitre y Martínez (Buenos Aires 1821 - 1906). Army officer, politician, writer and poet, he was also an historian, a bibliographer and a translator. He founded the newspaper 'La Nación'. He was the first president of the Argentinean Republic (1862-1868) and in 1863 obtained Spain's recognition of the independence of Argentina. The biography of his son, Bartolomé Mitre y Vedia, writer and journalist, editor of 'La Nación', was included in the proposal to dedicate a street in Barcelona to Mitre, but this street is clearly named after the President of Argentina. The proposal was accepted by Carreras Candi.
carrer.anteriors: General Mitre, 30/07/1929; Mitre (President of the Argentine Republic), 23/12/1913 (without effectiveness); Gran Via de Ronda (a section), 29/01/1925

carrer.name: General Moragues, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Josep Moragues i Sobrevia, signed Mas (Sant Hilari Sacalm, Selva 1669 - Barcelona 1715). An officer in the army, he was governor of Seu d'Urgell and served King Carlos III. He was made prisoner and executed by the followers of Philip V. His head remained displayed at the Portal de Mar in Barcelona until 1727.

carrer.name: General Vives, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Pere Vives i Vich (Igualada, Anoia 1859 - Madrid 1938), aeronaut and military engineer. In 1912 he took part in the bombing of Maroco. The 1980 street nomenclature, states that this street is dedicated to Francesc Dionís Vives i Planes (Valencia, Horta 1755 - ? 1840), who was also an army officer. He distinguished himself during the Independence War. Given the choice, we would say that the dedication is to Joan Miquel Vives i Feliu (Barcelona ? - Ciudad Rodrigo, León 1809). He was field-marshal during the War of the First Coalition. He was appointed commander of the twenty thousand "miqueletes" voluntaries, who were joined by the "voluntarios honrados" (the honored voluntaries) from Valencia, and succeeded in beating the French and freeing the Baixa Cerdanya. In 1808, he was appointed 'capitán general' of Catalonia, and headed the siege of the city of Barcelona organized against Napoleonic occupation.
carrer.anteriors: General Vives, 1939; Xic de les Barraquetes, 1932; General Vives Vich, 28/09/1926; General Vives (Town Hall of Sarrià); General Weyler, 1915; Casamitjana; Infanta (a section), before 1900; Princesa (a section)

carrer.name: Gènova, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Genoa, city and harbor in the Northeast of Italy.

carrer.name: George Orwell, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Eric Arthur Blair (Motihari, Bengala 1903 - London 1950), English writer. In 1936, he joined the POUM and took part in the Spanish civil war, which he describes in his book 'Homage to Catalonia'. His best literary achievement was his novel and political allegory 'Animal Farm'.

carrer.name: George R. Collins, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after George Roseborough Collins (Massachusetts, EE.UU. 1917 - 1993), art historian. He taught Art History at Columbia University, in New York. His specialization was modern architecture and Hispanic art. He realised important studies about Gaudí, Gustavino and several other Catalan architects and urbanists. He was President of the Association Amigos de Gaudí, and he created, in New York, the Catalan Art Institute. In the USA, he published 'Antoni Gaudí' (1960), in English, 'Arturo Soria y la Ciudad Lineal' (1968), as well as several essays about Gaudí and the study of the use of the Catalan dome in America. In 1977, he was appointed corresponding academician by the Polytechnic University of Barcelona. The suggestion to name this street after him came from the Sant Jordi Royal Academy of Fine Arts, who chose that it be behind the Gaudí Cathedral.

carrer.name: Geranis, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Geranis means geranium in Catalan. This street is part of a set of streets in the Rectoret neighborhood which were all given names of plants and flowers.

carrer.name: Gerard Piera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Gerard, Grau or Guerau Piera i Piera, alias "Guelardo" (1831 - 1906). He was mayor of the old village of Les Corts from 1871 to 1897, year when it became part of Barcelona. He was an example of adapting to different regimes: Amadeo I, the First Republic and the Restoration, but, at the same time, he was considered a good administrator of municipal finances.

carrer.name: Germans Desvalls, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after Antoni (el Poal, Pla d'Urgell 1666 - Viena 1724) and Manuel (? 1674 - Viena 1774) Desvalls i de Vergós. Catalan army officers and politicians, partisans of the Austrias, better known as Caballeros de Poal (1666-1774).

carrer.name: Germans Rubió i Bellver, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Marià Rubió i Bellver, army officer and engineer. He was born in Tarragona on 24th November 1862. He planned the reform of the military fortress of Maó in Minorca, the Balearic Islands, Spain, in 1883, and took part in the preparations for the Universal Exhibition held in Barcelona in 1888. He took up residence in Barcelona, and in 1904 started his collaboration with the Tibidabo S.A. company for the works to renew the funicular and to carry out the urban development of the mountain. In 1914 he was appointed Director General of the engineering services of the Universal Exhibition of 1929. He published numerous articles in La Vanguardia, which in 1917 were compiled in a book, and wrote many other works. He died in Nice, Provence, on 9th February 1938. Joan Rubió i Bellver, architect, was born in Reus, in the Baix Camp region of Catalonia, in 1871. He was a disciple and collaborator of the famous Catalonian architect Antoni Gaudí, with whom he worked until 1905. He belonged to the last generation of Modernists. Of all the buildings erected by him in Barcelona, we should singe out El Frare Blanc (The White Friar), the Casa Golferichs, and the Casa Isabel Pomar. He favored the Lliga Regionalista political party, and collaborated with Prat de la Riba in the Barcelona Provincial Council (Diputació de Barcelona) and later in the Mancomunitat (First Catalonian Autonomous Government). He was elected Councilor of Barcelona Town Council in the 1905 elections, as well as President of the Cercle Artístic de Sant Lluc (Artistic Circle of St Luke). He died in Barcelona, on 31st January 1952, in the Via Laietana, 190.

carrer.name: Germans Serra, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after Pere and Jaume Serra (14th century). Catalan painters. There is reference to their other two brothers, Francesc and Joan, but no paintings of theirs have survived.

carrer.name: Germans Serra, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Gernika, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Gernika, a city in Bizcaia, in the Basque Country. On 26th April 1937 it was bombed by the German planes of the Condor Legion sent by Hitler to collaborate with Franco's army. Gernika was of old the symbol of Basque liberties, and now, after the bombing, is the symbol of peace, reconciliation and human rights. The name of this street, together with those of other thoroughfares in the area, refers to the struggle for peace and human rights.

carrer.name: Gespa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Gespa means grass in Catalan. This street is part of a set of streets which were all named after plants and flowers.

carrer.name: Gessamí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Gessamí means jasmine in Catalan. This street is part of a set of streets in the Font de la Guatlla neighborhood which were all named after plants and flowers.

carrer.name: Getsemaní, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Orchard near the Eastern wall of Jerusalem, where Jesus prayed and was arrested on the last night. This street is located in the neighborhood of the Vall d'Hebron, where the streets are all named after places in the Holy Land.

carrer.name: Gignàs, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Corruption of the name Gim Nas or Guillem Nas. There is record of someone by that name living in Barcelona in the year 1391 - he is mentioned as the "naviero de la vieja Barcelona" ("shipowner of old Barcelona"). From 1512, the street appears as Gimnàs. The spelling "Gignàs" appears as consequence of a royal order in 1860 to "change all the street names still in local dialect" into Castilian, the official language in Spain.

carrer.name: Gimbernat, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after Antoni de Gimbernat i Arboç (Cambrils, Baix Camp 1734 - Madrid 1816), surgeon, and his son Carles Gimbernat (Barcelona 1765 - Banheras de Bigorra 1834), doctor and geologist who made the first geological map of Switzerland.

carrer.name: Ginebra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Old path that led to "Ginebra", an shanty town located around the fortress of San Carlos.

carrer.name: Ginecòs, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: In 1923, the doctors Climent Selvas, Enric Baldocchi, Emili Ardèvol and Joan Riera, together with businessman Josep Lafitte, founded the Ginecòs Institute, after which this passageway is named.

carrer.name: Ginestera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street that makes a match with the Romaninar street, situated in the extreme southwest of the city center of Vallvidrera.

carrer.name: Giralt el Pellisser, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: An accounting book of the shoemaker's guild of 1487 mentions a charity Guerau Pelliser gave to the confraternity of San Marco. That fellow Guerau, or Giralt, el Pellisser, must really have been a furrier of word and deed.

carrer.name: Girasol, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the herbaceous plant called sunflower. Passageway situated between the streets named Sant Antoni Maria Claret and Trobador. Name given on the whim of the urban developers.

carrer.name: Gírgola, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: Kind of lignicolous, robust, fleshy and sticky mushroom with eccentric foot and white spores.

carrer.name: Gíriti, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: There is documentary evidence that the street was already open in 1492. Its name proceeds from "gírate" because of its zigzag course.

carrer.name: Girona, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: City and capital of Gironès. The name comes form the Greek 'Ieron', in Latin 'Gerunda'. It appears in the street label proposal of the Eixample made by Víctor Balaguer (by 1865), "per a honra i gloria de la inmortal ciutat" (for the honor and glory of the immortal city). Iberian city that belongs to the Ausetan group. Roman settlement on the Via Augusta. Occupied by the Arabs in 714 and liberated in 785 by Charlemagne who founded the county of Girona, unified with that of Barcelona by Guifré 'el Pelós' in 878. Girona was frequently besieged in the Rippers' War and the continuous wars with France.

carrer.name: Gironella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Torre Gironella property was one of the most important of Sarrià for its extension, palace, gardens, fountains and woods. Antoni de Gironella was the last owner with this surname until 1850, when he began to buy part of the property to Josep Buigas i Gauran.

carrer.name: Gitanilla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: One of Cervantes exemplary novels.

carrer.name: Gleva, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Village belonging to the municipality of Les Masies de Voltregà (Osona). The name was in the sanctuary dedicated to the Virgin, called Our Lady of the Glod, consecrated in 1767.

carrer.name: Glòria, Baixada de la
carrer.descripcio: The neighbors wanted to compare the tiresome climbing of the street with the accession "to Glory".

carrer.name: Glòries Catalanes, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Square dedicated to the civilian and military glories of Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: Glorias, 07/03/1939; Glorias Catalanas, 04/02/1931; Glorias, 30/07/1929; Glorias Catalanas, 1865

carrer.name: Goldoni, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Carlo Goldoni (Venice 1707 - Paris 1793). Italian playwright.

carrer.name: Gòlgota, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Hill situated northeast from Jerusalem, better known as Calvary. We remember that this street belongs to the Vall d'Hebron neigborhood where the streets are named after places and villages of the Holy Land.

carrer.name: Gombau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Name of a distinguished Catalan family who gave various councilors to the city.
carrer.anteriors: Mare de Déu de la Parra; Brujas

carrer.name: Gomis, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Casimir de Gomis i de Ros, landowner. Owner of Can Gomis.

carrer.name: Gomis, Baixada de
carrer.descripcio: Casimir de Gomis i de Ros, owner in 1854. Married to Rosa de Portolà i Guinart. During the yellow fever epidemic in 1870, the General Captaincy was installed in Can Gomis, an important mansion of Vallcarca.

carrer.name: Gomis, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: The same dedication as the street.

carrer.name: Góngora, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Luis de Góngora y Argote (Cordoba 1561 - 1627). Poet.

carrer.name: González Tablas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Santiago González-Tablas i García-Herreros (Pamplona, Navarra 1879 - Tazarut, Morocco 1922). Lieutenant colonel of infantry in the African War, killed in action when conquering the position of Ain el Grana.

carrer.name: Gordi, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Dead-end street. The former name was "Casa Gordi" ("Casa Jordi" on some documents). There was a coffee house in this place. In 1846, its owners were Jaume Barbarà and Agnès Boada.

carrer.name: Gósol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in the Berguedà region. Name suggested by the historian Roca was agreed by the town hall of Sarrià in 1922.

carrer.name: Goya, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco de Goya y Lucientes (Fuendetodos, Aragon 1746 - Burdeos 1828). Painter and engraver.

carrer.name: Goya, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The same dedication as the street.

carrer.name: Gràcia, Travessera de
carrer.descripcio: This street crosses the ancient village. Its route corresponds to the Via Francisca, documented in 1057.

carrer.name: Gràcia, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Its origin was agreed by the liberal Town Hall of 1821 which entrusted the project to the foreman Ramon Plana. After the dissolution of the Town Hall in 1824 due to the reestablishment of the absolutist regime, the project was taken over by the general captain of Catalonia, the marquis of Campo Sagrado. The construction of the promenade started on August 28th 1824. Imposing a tax of 20 'reales de vellón' on every slaughtered pig, it was possible to pay the cost and to finish the works in 1827.
carrer.anteriors: Pi y Margall, 16/04/1931; Gracia; Camí de Jesús

carrer.name: Gràcia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ancient village, independent municipality since 1820 (liberal period of three years), forms part again of Barcelona with the return of the absolutist regime, declares its independence in 1850 and, finally, is incorporated into Barcelona in 1897. Its name comes from the monastery of Santa Maria de Gràcia founded by the Carmelites in 1626, which was the beginning of the village settlement.

carrer.name: Gran Capità, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Gonzalo Fernández de Córdoba y de Herrera (Montilla, Cordoba 1453 - Granada 1515). Military man. Viceroy of Naples (1505-1507). He fought for Isabella the Catholic against Juana the Beltraneja and participated in the war against Granada. From 1495 on, he fought for Ferran II of Catalonia-Aragon, against the French.

carrer.name: Gran de Gràcia, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: The main street of the ancient village of Gràcia.
carrer.anteriors: Mayor de Gracia; Nicolás Salmerón; Gracia; Salmerón; Mayor

carrer.name: Gran de Sant Andreu, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: It includes the main street and its former extension called "carrer de les Cases Noves". The name corresponds to the church dedicated to the apostle, founded long time ago at the foot of the Roman via that connected Barcelona to the Vallès.
carrer.anteriors: San Andrés; Eugenio Pararera; Ctra. de Ribas

carrer.name: Gran Vista, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A street with a wonderful panoramic view.

carrer.name: Granada del Penedès, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Granada is an ancient toponym of this place documented in 991. This fact has to prevail over any story told later. In the nomenclature of 1980, the toponym of Penedès was added so that the street was dedicated to the municipality in the Alt Penedès region. The purpose of this change was to avoid confusion with the formerly existing street Granada, called nowadays Ciutat de Granada. Due to all these changes, the originality of the toponym was lost.

carrer.name: Granadella, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in the Les Garrigues region. The street belongs to the Milans del Bosch housing estate where the streets are dedicated to towns and places of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Granados, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Enric Granados i Campiña (Lleida, Segrià 1867 - on the sea near to Dieppe 1916). Composer and pianist. One of the creators of the modern Catalan piano school.

carrer.name: Granja, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Already before 1877, there was established in this street a farm house that served as an agriculture school for the training of foremen and experts. Experimental farm whose director was Ermengol Gorria.

carrer.name: Granja Vella, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The toponym of the Granja Vella (Old Farm) was recovered. It belonged to the Saint Jerome monastery of la Vall d'Hebron, of the ancient borough of Horta de Sant Joan.

carrer.name: Granollers, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town of the Vallès Oriental region and street of Barcelona. We remember that after petition made to the city of Barcelona in 1406, known as 'carreratge', the town is considered as a street of Barcelona. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city.

carrer.name: Granollers, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Town of the Vallès Oriental region. The passageway owes its name to the street it leads into.

carrer.name: Grases, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Grases i Hernàndez (1836 - 1886). Owner. Royal broker. One of the promoters of the urban development of the "França Xica" neighborhood. He was married to Joaquima Fabrés i Coll in 1859.

carrer.name: Grassot, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Antoni de Grassot, owner of the terrain called "camp d'en Grassot", situated in the place known as "caputxins Vells". In 1870, his heirs Romà and Dolors de Grassot i Elies promoted the urban development of the property.

carrer.name: Gratallops, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Priorat region. The street belongs to a group of streets situated at the foot of Vallvidrera and dedicated to Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Grau, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Lineage of owners of about 50 ares ('mujada') of land where the passageway was opened. Bonaventura Grau i Artés, farmer who died in 1826, was the first of whom we have reference. He was succeeded by Pere Grau i Serra until 1893; Bonaventura Grau i Gaig, until 1920; Pere Grau i Martí, until 1947, and Miquel Grau Vallcibera.

carrer.name: Grau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fabrici Grau, owner of the land known as "camp de l'Empedrat", provostship allodium of the month of March of the cathedral church.

carrer.name: Grau i Torras, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: For the purpose of installing schools, Francesc Grau i Torras granted in 1859 to the city the three houses numbered, respectively, 25, 27 and 29 in this street and 24, 26 and 28 in the Guítert (formerly Sant Ramon) street.

carrer.name: Grau Miró, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Grau Miró, a Catalonian monk of the 11th century, who donated the land of the little shrine of the ermita del Coll or de la Font-rúbia, already attested to in 1099 (currently the shrine of Mare de Déu del Coll), together with other possessions, to the monastery of Sant Cugat, in the Vallès Occidental region of Catalonia, next to Barcelona.

carrer.name: Graus, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality in the ancient county of Ribagorza.

carrer.name: Gravina, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Federico Carlo Gravina (Palermo 1756 - Cadiz 1806). Sicilian seaman serving the Bourbons of Spain.

carrer.name: Graziella Pareto, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Engràcia Pareto i Homs (Barcelona 1889 - Roma 1973). Soprano. She used the artistic name of Graziella. She sang in the Liceu in 1906 and made her official debut in the Royal Theater of Madrid (1908) with 'La sonámbula'. Later on, she performed in Parma, Rome and the Scala of Milan, in the Covent Garden, in the Fenice, etc. Considered as one of the best chromatic sopranos all over the world. She recorded many disks. Her performances and voice received very good criticism. The musicologist Roger Alier judges her as singer "of exquisite diction, outstanding fidelity in the score, elegant phrasing and clean and homogeneous voice". Born in Ciutat Vella. Proposal made by Luis Pareto Martí.

carrer.name: Grècia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street was named after Greece, the Mediterranean European country.

carrer.name: Greco, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Doménikos Theotokópoulos (Candía, Creta 1541 - Toledo 1614). Painter who developed his creativity in Spain.

carrer.name: Greenwich, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The meridian passes through the Greenwich observatory that is considered the prime meridian 0.

carrer.name: Gregal, Moll de
carrer.descripcio: Gregal, from the Latin 'Graecalis', Greek wind (whose direction is determined by the imaginary line that connects Masalia and Emporion), that indicated the direction where the ships of Phocaea and Massilia came from, passing the Creus cape and heading directly for Ampurias.

carrer.name: Gresolet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Sanctuary of the municipality of Saldes (Berguedà).
carrer.anteriors: Infants, 1931; Cresolet, 1931; Grimbau; Infantes; Gresolet (Town Hall of Sarrià)

carrer.name: Grèvol, Passeig del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the holly tree. It belongs to a group of streets named after plants and flowers.

carrer.name: Grèvol, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The passageway owes its name to the holly tree. It belongs to a group of streets named after plants and flowers.

carrer.name: Grífols, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Llorenç Grífols i Roig (Barcelona 1887 - 1968). Property manager for the Capdevila, owners of the land that, when being divided into plots, gave rise to the Capdevila passageway and to the Grífols street. He was manager of the property from 1933 to 1941, until the sisters Maria and Anna Capdevila i Marcenario sold it to him in 1942.

carrer.name: Groc, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Surname of a family with properties in this street.

carrer.name: Grunyí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Name derived from Grony, surname of a rich and distinguished family who resided in Barcelona when in 1257 the new municipal regime was established. Until 1346, there were 14 members of this family who wore the consistorial dress.

carrer.name: Guadalajara, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: City of New Castile.

carrer.name: Guadalete, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: River of Andalusia after which the combat that decided the fall of the Iberian peninsula in the hands of the Moslems (711) was named.

carrer.name: Guadalquivir, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: River in Andalusia. Street that belongs to the group of streets dedicated to rivers of the Iberian peninsula, situated in the Polvorí neighborhood.

carrer.name: Guadiana, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Rivers of the Iberian peninsula.
carrer.anteriors: Carranza (without effectiveness); Duque de Tetuán ?; Tetuán ?

carrer.name: Gualbes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Patrician lineage who lived in Barcelona already in the first third of the 14th century according to documentary evidence. Many councilors and a few chief councilors with the surname Gualbes are mentioned in the historical documents of the 14th and 15th century.

carrer.name: Guarda Anton, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A private guard of the S.A. El Tibidabo urbanization.

carrer.name: Guarderia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in Can Caralleu where the names were given on a whim of the urban developers making reference to what was found in the respective place: streets named Talaia (watch tower), Pins (pines), Escales (stairs), etc.

carrer.name: Guàrdia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jaume de Guàrdia i d'Ardèvol was the last owner of the place named after him. The street was inaugurated in the 17th century in the property owned by the family Guàrdia i Aymerich. Jaume Guàrdia paid the pavement and the drainage of the new street. According to some documents the Guàrdia family proceed from a noble lineage of the Conflent region.

carrer.name: Guàrdia Urbana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Homage to the local police which was founded 150 years ago in Barcelona. The street owes its name to the local police headquarters situated in this street.

carrer.name: Guardiola, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Maria Guardiola and her husband Joan Giol, owners of the terrains in this place in the early 19th century. Their heirs were Juan Giol i Guardiola, until 1857, and Rafael Giol i Pujol, coachman, until 1872.

carrer.name: Guardiola i Feliu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Guardiola i Feliu (Sant Andreu, 19th century), descendant of a modest family, amassed wealth and prestige with his commercial activities. The parochial church bell tower was constructed at his expenses. Moreover, he contributed to the enlargement of the poorhouse by paying the construction costs of a building wing.

carrer.name: Guatemala, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Central American country.

carrer.name: Guatlla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the quail bird. The neighborhood where the street is situated is known as the "Font de la Guatlla" (quail's spring).

carrer.name: Guayaquil, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: City in the South American Republic of Ecuador. Street situated in the industrial estate of the Bon Pastor neighborhood where the streets are named after places and cities in Latin America.
carrer.anteriors: San Martín de Porres; Colonización (without effectiveness)

carrer.name: Güell, Parc
carrer.descripcio: Eusebi Güell i Bacigalupi (Barcelona 1846 - 1918). He promoted the urban development of one of his properties, being at charge of the project the architect Gaudí. The Town Hall bought the property converting it into a city park.

carrer.name: Güell, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the lineage of Barcelona's industrialists and patricians. The head of the family, Gabriel Güell, lived in 1558 in Torredembarra.

carrer.name: Guerau de Liost, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pen name of the Catalan poet Jaume Bofill i Mates (Olot, Garrotxa 1878 - Barcelona 1933). Poet, politician and journalist.

carrer.name: Guifré, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Guifré I known as "'el Pelós'" (before 840 - 897). Count of Urgell, Cerdanya and Conflent. In 878 he ascended to count of Barcelona and of the littoral regions. He started the formation of Old Catalonia and the Catalan dynasty which would last until King Martin's death (1410).

carrer.name: Guillem, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Felipe Guillén (Sevilla 1492 - Brasil, after 1561). Mathematician and scientist. After having worked as pharmacist in Seville, he moved to Portugal and later to Brazil, dedicated to scientific studies. He acquired reputation for having an easy way to determine the length of a place. He had knowledge of the magnetized needle deviation observed in the discovering journeys to America. He constructed the first deviation needle device known in Spain that was the presented to the King of Portugal in 1525. This is the dedication mentioned in the nomenclature of 1980, given the imprecision in the street name approval in 1907.

carrer.name: Guillem Abiell, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona ? - Palermo, Sicily 1420). Master builder. In 1407, he contracted the works of the cloister of the Holy Cross Hospital (Hospital de la Santa Creu) and in 1415 he was master bilder of the church dedicated to Our Lady of the Pine (Santa Maria del Pi). He also intervened in the Sant Jaume church.

carrer.name: Guillem de Llúria, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Catalan knight who figures in the list of noblemen rewarded with lands in the Kingdom of Valencia in 1238 by Jaume I after having finished the conquest.
carrer.anteriors: Guillermo de Lauria; Roger de Lauria; Guillermo de Lauria; Roger de Lauria; Degollada ?

carrer.name: Guillem Sagrera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Felanitx ? 1380 - Naples 1454). Architect and sculptor who intervened in the cathedral of Girona and the market of the City of Mallorca.

carrer.name: Guillem Tell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: 14th century. Hero of the Helvetian independence. Taking into account the approval date of the street name and the category of the persons approved in those times, the dedication significance is maintained. The existence of a famous notary in Barcelona, called Guillem August Tell i Lafont (1861 - 1929), is considered as a simple anecdote.

carrer.name: Guilleries, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Mountainous massif in the extreme northeast of the Catalan prelittoral range.

carrer.name: Guinardó, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Toponym that corresponds to the neighborhood name proceeding from the ancient Mas Guinardó that existed before 1622 and was mentioned in 1697, as well as on documents of 1706 and 1713, among others, when Barcelona was besieged in the War of the Spanish Succession.

carrer.name: Guinardó, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: The park adopted the name of the neighborhood that proceeds from the Mas Guinardó property.

carrer.name: Guinardó, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Guinardó, Ronda del
carrer.descripcio: For the ancient Mas Guinardó.

carrer.name: Guineueta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street adopted the name of the neighborhood that proceeds from the Can Guineueta farmhouse.

carrer.name: Guineueta, Parc de la
carrer.descripcio: The park adopted the name of the neighborhood that proceeds from the Can Guineueta farmhouse.

carrer.name: Guineueta Vella, Ronda de la
carrer.descripcio: For the toponym of Can Guineueta Vella.

carrer.name: Guipúscoa, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Guitard, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Gausbert Witard, or Geribert Guitard. Noble knight of the viscounts of Barcelona (12th century). He restored the Sant Pau del Camp monastery (1117) destroyed 30 years before by the Almoravides. He and his wife Rotladis have their sepulcher in the monastery with the following epitaph: "Hic jacent monasterii fundatores"

carrer.name: Guitert, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Avel·lí Guitert de Cubas (Barcelona 1841 - 1914). Chronicler who investigated the history and facts of Barceloneta, as a secretary of the deputy mayor in the forties and fifties.

carrer.name: Guspí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Village that belongs to the municipality of Sant Ramon de Portell (Segarra). Street situated in the Milans del Bosc housing estate where the streets are named after villages and places in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Gustavo Bécquer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Gustavo Adolfo Domínguez Bastida (Sevilla 1836 - Madrid 1870) adopted the name of one of his father's ancestors. Romantic poet.

carrer.name: Gutenberg, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Johann Gensfleisch Gutenberg (Mainz 1400 ? - 1468). Credited with invention of printing from movable type.

carrer.name: Gutenberg, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: H, Passatge
carrer.descripcio: Most of the streets in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca designated with letters run in the North-South direction, while streets designated with numbers run in the East-West.

carrer.name: Haifa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Haifa, city and harbor in Israel.

carrer.name: Haití, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Antilles, La Española island.

carrer.name: Harmonia, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Street in the Montbau neighborhood, where the city planners gave all the streets related names: Ritme, Poesia, Lírica, etc.

carrer.name: Harry Walker, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the old plant Autoaccesorios Harry Walker, S.A., producer of building accessories and car spare parts.

carrer.name: Hartzenbusch, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Spanish writer Juan Eugenio de Hartzenbusch (Madrid 1806 - 1880). He was a member of the Spanish Academy, director of the Escuela Normal (1854-1862) and of the Spanish National Library (1862-1875).

carrer.name: Havana, Passeig de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the capital city of Cuba, Havana, founded in 1514 by Diego Velázquez, the island's governor. Havana became twin city of Barcelona the 25th October 1993.

carrer.name: Havaneres, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Named after a type of creole dance and song typical from the Antilles played with different percussion instruments. It has a slow rhythm and 6/8 time.

carrer.name: Hedilla, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Named after Salvador Hedilla y Pineda (Peña-Castillo, Santander 1884 - Barcelona 1917) aviator who founded the first aviation school in Prat de Llobregat. He died in Barcelona in an air crash.

carrer.name: Hèlsinki, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Finnish capital, host to the Olympic Games in 1952.

carrer.name: Henry Dunant, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Named after Jean-Henry Dunant (Geneva 1828 - Zurich 1910). Philanthropist and intellectual, he was the founder of the International Red Cross. He was in Castiglione on business when the injured started coming in from Solferino (1859). Having decided to raise international awareness to the situation of the war injured, he published 'Un souvenir de Solférino'. Together with four of his compatriots, he authored the first Geneva Convention (1864) and had a strong role in seeing it accepted by governments all over the world. In 1867, he was accused of fraud and expelled from the Geneva International Committee. He was forgotten and lived in poverty until his name was finally cleared and he received an award from the federal council. The Empress Fedorovna assigned him an allowance and he received the first Nobel Peace Prize (1901). The idea of naming this street after him came from the presidency of the Red Cross and from the mayor of Barcelona, Mr X. Casas.

carrer.name: Hercegovina, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: The same as the street.

carrer.name: Hercegovina, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Region of former Yugoslavia. It is situated south of Bosnia, between Montenegro and Dalmatia.

carrer.name: Hèrcules, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: This street is located near the Roman temple of Hercules. The name of Hercules is the Latin form of Heracles, son of Zeus. An old legend, which persisted until the 12th century, mistakenly maintained that Barcelona was named and founded by Hercules.

carrer.name: Herenni, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Herenni was a 5th century Neoplatonic philosopher. He was a disciple of Damascio and wrote an essay on Aristotle's 'Metaphysics'. According to Duran and Sanpere, this square was the last in a series of streets and squares to be named after Hispano-roman or Roman authors (Seneca, Luca, Virgil, Horace, Cicero...) {JMH}. The 1980 street nomenclature stated that this square was named after Cayo Poncio Herenni (4th century B.C.), a General in the Samnite army, an ancient country of central and southern Italy. In the year 321 B.C., he beat four roman legions at the C'audium' canyon (now "horcas caudinas"). To humiliate them, he forced the Roman troops to pass under a yoke and then let them go unhurt. Later, in 305 B.C., his army was beaten and he was killed by those he had humiliated.

carrer.name: Hernán Cortés, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Named after a Spanish Conquistador (Medellín, Extremadura 1485 - Castillejo de la Cuesta, Seville 1547). Carlos I appointed him governor and captain of Nueva España, Mexico (1522).

carrer.name: Heroïnes de Girona, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Company of Santa Barbara, created by the marquis of Coupigny, second commandant-general of the Catalan army.
