carrer.descripcio: Gardens named after Reverend Miquel Costa i Llobera (Pollença, Northern Majorca 1854 - Ciudad de Mallorca (now Palma de Mallorca), 1922). Writer and ecclesiast. Member of the Royal Academy for Spanish and of the Institute for Catalan Studies. Pontific canon of Majorca.

carrer.name: Mossèn Epifani Lorda, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Reverend Epifani Lorda i Roig (Arenys de Mar, Maresme, 1896 - Barcelona, 1964). Rector of the Trinitat parish.
carrer.anteriors: Reverendo Epifanio Lorda; Reverendo Padre Lorda

carrer.name: Mossèn Ferran Palau, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Reverend Ferran Palau i Jover (Granollers, Vallès Oriental, 1921 - Barcelona, 1990). Priest and lawyer. Rector of the parish of Sant Jeroni de Montbau (1964-1989). In memory of his full dedication to the Montbau neighborhood, where he founded the Fomentation of Culture institution. In the parish house, several subjects were taught, specially to young people living in this neighborhood. As a lawyer, he gave free legal advice and assistance to many neighbors with legal problems.

carrer.name: Mossèn Jacint Verdaguer, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Reverend Jacint Verdaguer i Santaló (Folgueroles, Osona, 1845 - Vallvidrera, Barcelona, 1902). Priest, poet, and romantic writer. Author of the poem 'L'Atlàntida', represented by the monument there is on this square.
carrer.anteriors: Mossén Jacinto Verdaguer; Mossén Cinto Verdaguer

carrer.name: Mossèn Joan Cortinas, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Reverend Joan Cortinas i Guinart (Santa Coloma de Gramenet, Barcelonès, 1908 - Barcelona, 1991). Presbyterian. Known as "father Bottle". Since he arrived at the Bon Pastor parish in 1940, he worked tirelessly for his parishioners. He achieved conversion of two confronted communities (the 'Cases Barates' (=low-cost housing), and the Sanchis y Estadella housing estate) of the Bon Pastor neighborhood. As there were not sufficient schools for the many children, in 1960 he promoted parish schools, partly paid with the money obtained by collecting empty Cava (champagne grown in Catalonia) bottles. This is where his nickname comes from.

carrer.name: Mossèn Josep Bundó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Reverend Josep Bundó i Vidal (La Bisbal del Penedès, Baix Penedès, 1876 - Barcelona, 1963). Rector of the parish of San Antoni de Pàdua.

carrer.name: Mossèn Josep Pedragosa, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Reverend Josep Pedragosa i Monclús (Sant Esteve de Palautordera, Vallès Oriental, 1872 - Barcelona, 1957). Priest and educator. He dedicated his life to the protection of minors, and to the rehabilitation of delinquents allowed to leave the prison. Chaplain of the Model Prison, he founded the Patronage for Former Prisoners and Abandoned Children, as well as the Family House, a home for prospect delinquents and delinquents in rehabilitation. The farm "Granja Agrícola" at Plegamans (Vallès Occidental), created by him, was the first Follow-up Department. In 1921 he was designated owner member and inspector of the institutions under the Juvenile Court, and in 1929, commissar of Charity of the Town Council. He created the Industrial Colony of Our Lady of the Port for minors, and the Farming Colony of Martorelles (Vallès Oriental) for adults, the Association of Invalid Concessionaires of Municipal Public Urinaries, the Entity of Car Parking Concessionaires, the Local Organization and Raffle of the Blind, etc. From 1939 until his death he lived in ostracism. He published many works talking about his achievements.

carrer.name: Mossèn Juliana, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Juliana i Boadella (Sant Martí de Provençals, Barcelona, 1868 - 1936). Administrator of the Cristo Rey parish, at La Sagrera.
carrer.anteriors: Párroco Juliana; Llobregat; Santa Eulàlia, before 1900

carrer.name: Mossèn Masdexexart, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Masdexexart i Castellà (Mataró, Maresme, 1892 - Barcelona, 1965). Rector of Sant Miquel dels Sants, at Gràcia. Founder of the Catholic Charity Associations.

carrer.name: Mossèn Miquel Vall i Mundó, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Reverend Miquel Vall i Mundó (Barcelona, 1925 - 1988). Priest. On March 12, 1949, he was ordained Presbyterian in the parish of San Vicent de Sarrià. Later he was rector of the parish of Santa Maria Reina during 27 years (1961-1988), founding the chapel of Maria Reina in the Can Caralleu neighborhood. His helpful and generous character, and the strong impulse he gave to the neighborhood during those difficult years, are the reasons why everybody remembered him with love, wishing to honor him giving his name to a street or square of this neighborhood. Dedication proposed by the Association of Neighbors and Owners of Can Caralleu.

carrer.name: Mossèn Quintí Mallofrè, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Reverend Quintí Mallofrè i Suriol (Sant Quintí de Mediona, Alt Penedès, 1876 - Barcelona, 1936). Administrator of Sant Andreu de Palomar.

carrer.name: Mossèn Vives, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Reverend Camil Vives i Roig (Gelida, Alt Penedès, 1861 - Barcelona, 1931). Musician and mathematician. Choirmaster of the Asylum of San Juan de Dios. One of the founders of the Catalan Pedagogical Academy.

carrer.name: Mossèn Xiró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Reverend Lluís Xiró i Roig (Girona, 1869 - Barcelona, 1936). Rector of the parish of Sant Gervasi from 1916 until his death.
carrer.anteriors: Reverendo Doctor Xiró, 09/12/1965; Evangelistas (without effectiveness); Caridad (without effectiveness)

carrer.name: Motors, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Motors Street, in a group of streets named after items related with industry.

carrer.name: Mozart, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Johann Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Pertl (Salzburg, Austria, 1756 - Vienna, Austria 1791). Austrian composer.

carrer.name: Muga, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: River descending from the Pyrenees to flow into the Mediterranean. It rises from the plain beneath the Muga (1,186 m high), South of the Montnegre (1,425 m), on the border between Vallespir and Alt Empordà, and along 5.5 km from Hostals de la Muga (on both riversides), it is the border between Spain and France.

carrer.name: Mühlberg, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: German town, where the fact of arms occurred which gave Charles V the victory over the troops of the Esmalcalda League (April 24, 1547).
carrer.anteriors: Núm. 4 (Casa Baró); Cristóbal Litran; Núm. 4 (Casa Baró)

carrer.name: Mulassa, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after the Mulassa fountain, place-name.

carrer.name: Mulet, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Passageway named after Antoni Mulet i Orfila (Mahón, Menorca, 1821 - Gràcia, Barcelona, 1882). Painting teacher, and owner of the place since 1868.

carrer.name: Munic, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Munich, capital city of Bavaria, Germany, where the Olympic Games of 1972 took place.

carrer.name: Municipi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: So named because of the nearby town hall of the old village of Sant Martí de Provençals.

carrer.name: Munné, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Eulàlia Munné, last "pubilla" of Cal Munné, married to Valentí Estruch. Her heir was Onofre Estruch i Munné (Sants, Barcelona, 1804 - 1874).

carrer.name: Munner, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Vicenç Munner i Valls (Barcelona, 1828 - 1879). Pharmacist and chemist. Lecturer of Chemical Analysis at the University of Barcelona since 1868. He studied mineral waters, publishing remarkable works on his findings.

carrer.name: Muntadas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Antoni Muntadas i Campeny (Igualada, Anoia, 1816 - Barcelona, 1880). Manufacturer. Together with his brothers he founded the company La España Industrial.

carrer.name: Muntaner, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Muntaner de Sesfàbregues (Peralada, Alt Empordà, 1265 - Ibiza, 1336). Medieval chronicler. Chamberlain of Jaume III, and Mayor of Ibiza. Captain of the Almogavers.
carrer.anteriors: Collbató (incorporated to it), 05/09/1907; San Jerónimo (incorporated to it), before 1863; Garriga, 29/03/1874; Núm. 23 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Muntanya, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The borough of Sant Martí de Provençals was divided into four areas: La Sagrera, El Clot, El Taulat, and La Muntanya. The latter included the hilly part of the township to which this street name refers.

carrer.name: Muntanya, Rambla de la
carrer.descripcio: This boulevard crosses the Mas Guinardó housing estate from the foot to the top of the hills.

carrer.name: Muntanya de Montserrat, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the mountain and Monastery of Our Lady of Montserrat, Catalan spiritual and religious stronghold.

carrer.name: Muntanyola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after this borough of Osona, within a small street group on the hilly side of Vall d'Hebron, named after Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Mur, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Former borough of Pallars Jussà, in 1972 annexed to Guàrdia de Noguera; now its official name is Castell de Mur. After an old noble Catalan family, originally living in the homonymous castle of which they were the Lords. The Barony of Mur, with its lordly jurisdiction centered on the castle, belonged to the Mur family until the end of the XV century. Street within the Milans del Bosch housing estate, where streets are named after Catalan places and villages

carrer.name: Mura, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Street named after this borough of Bages, within a small street group on the hilly side of Vall d'Hebron, named after Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Múrcia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Murcia, capital city of the homonymous region in South-East Spain.
carrer.anteriors: Provenza (2nd section), before 1900; Lletra J (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Muret, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Town in Languedoc, France, in 1214 scenario of the Battle of Muret, fought between the Catalan- Occitan forces commanded by Pere I (who died on the battlefield), and French crusaders commanded by Simon IV of Montfort.

carrer.name: Múrgola, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the morchella, an edible mushroom of brown or yellowish-brown color.

carrer.name: Murillo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Bartolomé Esteban Murillo (Seville, 1617 - 1682). Painter of the Sevillan School, basically known for his religious paintings. President of the Academy for Painting and Sketching founded by himself (1660).

carrer.name: Murtra, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Monastery of the Saint Hieronymus Order (Sant Jeroni de la Murtra), within the borough of Badalona (Barcelonès). Built in 1416, in relation with the change of residence of the Monastery of Sant Jeroni de Mont Olivet, founded in 1413 by the merchant Bertran Nicolau near Sant Pere de Ribes. Though almost in ruins, it is still a place of archaeological interest.

carrer.name: Muses, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: So named in honor of the nine Muses, the Greek protecting goddesses of sciences and arts: Calliope, Clio, Polymnia, Euterpe, Terpsicore, Erato, Melpomene, Talia, and Urania.

carrer.name: Música, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: So named in honor of music, one of the fine arts. The same as Muses, this street belongs to a street group of the Montbau neigbhorhood named after related topics.

carrer.name: Musitu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Elisa Musitu i Garcia-Navarro (Barcelona, 1843 - 1891). Wife of Felip Bertran d'Amat, owner of the lands, and daughter of Ramón Musitu i Worster, from Cartagena. Name given to this street by Josep Bertran i Musitu, landowner at Putget, in honor of his mother, when planning its opening.

carrer.name: Nació, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name was changed for the first time when Sant Martí de Provençals was incorporated in 1897, because of its duplicity with a street in Les Corts; afterwards, the street was named "la Internacional" by the Town Hall, and finally the Francoist authorities renamed it "Nación", in clear reference to the Spanish nation.

carrer.name: Nadal, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Nadal i Ferrater (? - 1864). Owner. He bought four hectares, sixteen ares and sixteen centiares in 1830. He was succeeded by his son Joan Nadal i Pujolà. The street was considered to be dedicated to the grandson: Josep Maria de Nadal i Vilardaga (Barcelona 1839 - 1908), mayor of Barcelona in 1896. Member of the Spanish Corts. The fact that the urban development took place in 1870 seems to suggest that the street was actually dedicated to Joan Nadal i Ferrater.

carrer.name: Nadal, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The square was established in 1890 in the terrains of Camp d'en Nadal. The person honored by the Nadal street belongs to the same family.

carrer.name: Naïm, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ancient village of Galilee, near to Nazareth. Street situated in the Vall d'Hebron neighborhood where the streets are dedicated to places of the Holy Land.

carrer.name: Napoleó, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Nickname of Antonio Fernández i Soriano (Casas Ibánez, Albacete 1827 - Barcelona 1916), photograph established in the Rambla. He bought a terrain in 1875 from the Maignon family of French origin. He was married to Anna Tifon i Cassaus. The consorts undertook to grant the four meter width of the passageway so that it could be constructed.

carrer.name: Nàpols, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Naples, city and ancient kingdom of Italy that between 1443 and 1707 was part of the Catalan-Aragonese crown. The name was given in memory of its conquest made by Alfons IV of Catalonia and Aragon.

carrer.name: Naranco de Bulnes, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Peak of the Cantabrian Mountains, situated in the central part of the Picos de Europa, in the limit of Asturias, Leon and Cantabria.

carrer.name: Narbona, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: City of Languedoc (Occitania). Reconquered from the Moslems in 759, see of the archbishop whom the Catalan counties of the Spanish March depended on. The religious restoration in the counties was carried out with the Frankish liturgy, and not with the Visigothic liturgy that disappeared completely.

carrer.name: Narcís Oller, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Narcis Oller i Moragas (Valls, Alt Camp 1846 - Barcelona 1930). Prolific novelist and narrator, considered as the dean of the modern Catalan novel.

carrer.name: Narcisa Freixas, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Narcisa Freixas i Cruells (Sabadell, Vallès Occidental 1859 - Barcelona 1926). Composer and pedagogue. Her children's songs were known in whole Spain and were declared useful for education by the government.

carrer.name: Natzaret, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Palestine city in Israel. Street situated in the Vall d'Hebron neighborhood where the streets are dedicated to places of the Holy Land.

carrer.name: Nau, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A ship was the advertisement of a very old pub situated in the street (and established in a house owned by Felip Bertran i d'Amat). It was called "Taberna de la Nau" and formerly "Taberna de les Mamelles". The fact that the street was called "de la Nau d'en Gim Nas" led some historian to relate the name to Guillem Nas, personage of the 14th century, mentioned in 1391 as "shipper of old Barcelona".
carrer.anteriors: Adolfo Max; El Mistich; Taberna de la Viuda

carrer.name: Nau Santa Maria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The Admiral's ship of Christopher Columbus in his first journey to America.
carrer.anteriors: Nao de Santa María, 07/07/1942; Lletra B (Enlargement of Les Corts); Luis Ulloa, 1936; Lletra B (Enlargement of Les Corts)

carrer.name: Naus de La Maquinista, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: The street name refers to the La Maquinista industrial plant established in this place of Sant Andreu between 1917 and 1991.

carrer.name: Navarra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Southern region of the former Basque Country. Its political history starts in the 11th century with the foundation of a state, unified later on with a central part of Aragon. For a short time, it was part of the Catalan-Aragonese kingdom. Street index version of 1980. Actually, the street was dedicated to Josep Oriol Navarra i Valentí (1808 - 1856). Physician. Married to Vicenta Felipa Linés i Badia, owner of the place.

carrer.name: Navarro i Reverter, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Navarro i Reverter (Valencia, Horta 1844 - Madrid 1924). Forest engineer. Politician. Vice president of the International Exhibition of Barcelona in 1888. Minister of Finance (1895, 1897 y 1906). Member of the Academy of Sciences and the Spanish Academy. As he achieved that the village of Sarrià was not included in the Royal Decree of incorporation of 1897, the Town Hall of Sarrià declared him adoptive son, dedicating him a street.

carrer.name: Navata, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Village of Alt Empordà.

carrer.name: Nebuloses, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the Rectoret neighborhood where a group of streets are named after astronomic terms such as Júpiter, Estrella Polar and Firmament.

carrer.name: Negociant, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The passageway adopted the name of a house known as the "casa del negociant" whose owner was Bartomeu Cortés i Planas in the 19th century.

carrer.name: Negrell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Surname of a family who owned the Port castle in the 18th century. In 1879 Eulàlia Negrell claimed the lands of the castle.

carrer.name: Negrevernís, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Old-established family of Sarrià. This surname appears among councilors and juries of the historical village. Owners of the lands situated in this place. As we have been informed, their mansion is the oldest house of Sarrià.

carrer.name: Nemesi Ponsati, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Nemesi Ponsati i Solà (Barcelona 1897 - 1980). Pharmacist. Sport promoter. He was president of Barcelona swimming club (Club Natación Barcelona).

carrer.name: Nen de la Rutlla, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: The sculpture 'El nen de la rutlla', situated in the lower part of the Guinardó park became a symbol of the neighborhood.

carrer.name: Nena Casas, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The property Ca la Nena Casas, comprising 178,715 square meters in the 19th century, was owned by the Castellnou family who bought it from Pau Vicenç Sabater i Serra in 1703.

carrer.name: Neopàtria, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The duchy conquered by Alfons Frederic of Aragon (1319) supported by Catalan troops. Neopatria was maintained until 1390. One of the titles of the King of Spain.

carrer.name: Neptú, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Neptune, Latin name for Poseidon, Greek god of the sea; like Zeus is the god of the heaven and the earth and Hades of the underworld.

carrer.name: Neptú, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Neptune, the god of the sea.

carrer.name: Nerbion, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: River of the Basque Country that flows through Bilbao.

carrer.name: Neu de Sant Cugat, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: For the subterranean depots suitable for storing the snow that was carried down to be sold in Barcelona. The indication of "Sant Cugat" is due to the nearby parish church of Sant Cugat del Rec.
carrer.anteriors: Nieve de San Cucufate, before 1900; Neu; Aderó

carrer.name: Niça, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: City de Provence, Occitania. The name comes from the Greek 'Nicea', founded by the Greeks from Phocaea by the 5th century B.C.

carrer.name: Nicaragua, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Central American republic of Nicaragua.

carrer.name: Nicolás Salmerón, Pla de
carrer.descripcio: Nicolás Salmerón y Alonso (Alhama la Seca, Almería 1830 - Pau, Gascuña 1908). Republican politician and professor for philosophy. Presiding member of the Partido Democrático, Member of the Spanish Corts and defender of the First International. Minister of Justice in the Figueres' republican government (1873), President of the Congress and later on President of the Executive Government. He resigned from this office when he refused to sign some death sentences. During the Restoration, he had to exile himself in París. Back again in Madrid in 1884, he was elected Member of Parliament and recovered his chair as professor. He founded the Partido Republicano Centralista, characterized by anti-federal tendencies. Nevertheless, thanks to his policy of republican union he succeeded in repeating the electoral triumph of his candidature in Gràcia. He was one of the most important promoters of the Solidaridad Catalana, created in 1906. Dedication proposed by the Municipal Council of the district of Gràcia.

carrer.name: Nicolau de Sant Climent, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Sant Climent belong to an important noble family (initially merchants from Lleida) who gave councilors and ambassadors to the city in the 14th and the following centuries. But we do not know anybody in this family with the name Nicolau. However, we know for sure that a Nicolau de Sant Climent bought a house situated in this street. There is documentary evidence that the street already existed "in both sides" in the year 1492.

carrer.name: Nil, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Nile, the river of northeastern Africa.

carrer.name: Nil, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The same dedication as the street.

carrer.name: Nil Fabra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Nil Maria Fabra i Deàs (Blanes, Selva 1843 - Madrid 1903). Journalist and writer. Correspondent of the 'Diario de Barcelona' in Madrid and in the Austro-Prussian and Franco-Prussian wars.
carrer.anteriors: Nilo Fabra; Laureano Figuerola; Tibidabo, before 1900

carrer.name: Nínive, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ancient city of Assyria, on the left bank of the Tigris river. Street name historically linked to the streets of the Vall d'Hebron neighborhood dedicated to biblical themes.

carrer.name: Nobel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Alfred Bernhard Nobel (Estocolmo 1833 - San Remo 1896). Swedish industrial chemist who invented the dynamite and established the prizes with his name.

carrer.name: Noguera Pallaresa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: River of the Pyrenees, tributary of the Segre.

carrer.name: Noguera Ribagorçana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: River of the Pyrenees, tributary of the Segre.

carrer.name: Nogués, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Caterina Nogués i Tapís (Barcelona 1831 - 1883). Wife of Ignasi Ventalló i Llobateras (1812 - 1885). Lawyer in Terrassa (Vallès Occidental). Owner of four and a half 'mujadas' (more than two hectares) since 1862.

carrer.name: Nord, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Name adopted for its position in relation to Barcelona's Spanish Village (Poble Espanyol) and, partially, to the Montjuïc mountain.

carrer.name: Nord, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Within the multiple squares of the former village of Gràcia, this square was located in the most northern part of the urban area in the 19th century.

carrer.name: Notariat, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: For the building of the notarial college established in this street in 1881, short time after its opening. The notarial college of Barcelona was created by the king Joan I on May 6th 1395, although the Catalan notaries act as such at least since 1224, as it is proved by the 'Catàleg de notaris catalans' between 1224 and 1456.

carrer.name: Nou, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the number of the bus that starts from this square.

carrer.name: Nou, Moll
carrer.descripcio: Pier situated in the inner industrial harbor.

carrer.name: Nou Barris, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Name corresponding to the neighborhood.
carrer.anteriors: Pals (nombre not official); Sa Riera (nombre not official)

carrer.name: Nou Barris, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: A square located at the crossing of Carrer de Formentera, Carrer del Vesuvi and Carrer de la Florida. It takes its name from the 8th District, in the Nou Barris quarter of the city.

carrer.name: Nou de Dulce, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Domingo Dulce de Guerrero Garay (Sotés, La Rioja 1808 - Els Banys d'Arles, Vallespir 1869). Marquis de Castell-florite. Spanish military man. General captain of Catalonia from 1858 to 1862.

carrer.name: Nou de la Rambla, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: This street was opened in 1788 on initiative of the general captain of Catalonia (1778-1789) and chief magistrate of Barcelona, Francisco González de Bassecourt, conde del Asalto, after who it was named. Nevertheless, it was always known popularly with the current name, officially recognized during the Second Republic and again in 1979.
carrer.anteriors: Conde del Asalto, 1939; Nou de la Rambla, 1931

carrer.name: Nou de Porta, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: It gives access to the Porta neighborhood.

carrer.name: Nou de Sant Francesc, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: For the monastery of minor friars established near the street.
carrer.anteriors: Nueva de San Francisco; Primero de Mayo; Nueva de San Francisco, before 1865

carrer.name: Nou de Santa Eulàlia, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street dedicated to the co-patron saint of Barcelona.
carrer.anteriors: Nueva de Santa Eulalia; Santa Eulàlia

carrer.name: Nou de Zurbano, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Martín Zurbano y Bavas (Logroño Varea 1788 - 1845). He fought in the Independence War. In 1840 he supported the liberal movement. Made field marshal. Executed with two of his sons.

carrer.name: Nou Pins, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Urban space situated between the streets named Nou Pins, Tissó, Pablo Iglesias and Conveni. Name given by the neighbors of the place and whose official recognition was requested by the neighborhood.

carrer.name: Nou Pins, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: For a group pf pine trees situated at the end of the street.

carrer.name: Nova, Plaça
carrer.descripcio: The square was established in 1355 when the City Council decided to channel the waters from the Collserola mountains to the Sant Jaume square. On October 30th 1355, the buildings in front of the Bishop's Palace began to be demolished. In April of 1358 the square was finished and received its current name.
carrer.anteriors: Nueva, before 1358; Vázquez Mella, before 1928; Nueva, before 1900

carrer.name: Nova Icària, Platja de la
carrer.descripcio: Public space created on the occasion of the urban development of the Vila Olímpica of Poblenou.

carrer.name: Nova Icària, Parc de
carrer.descripcio: In memory of the imaginary island where Étienne Cabet situated the action of his philosophical novel 'Voyage to Icaria', a description of a land where the communism was put into practice. In 1846-1847, some followers of Cabet established a community in Poblenou, an area that was called Icària or Nova Icària because of this community.

carrer.name: Nova Mar Bella, Platja de la
carrer.descripcio: Public space set up on the occasion of the urban development works for the Olympic Games of 1992.

carrer.name: Novell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc de Novell i de Borràs (siglo XVIII). Landowner who in 1761 granted the terrains of the property, that later on were known as "Can Bruixa", to Guerau Piera, married to Agnès Llopart.

carrer.name: Novelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street name refers to the villages of Novella Alta and Novella Baixa. Street situated in the Milans del Bosch housing estate where the streets are named after Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Nulles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Alt Camp situated on the hydrographical back side between the rivers Francolí and Gaià, in good quaternary land.

carrer.name: Numància, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Celt Iberian city that won fame for its resistance offered to Rome in the second century B.C.

carrer.name: Número 1, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, where, with few exceptions, streets designated with letters run in the North-South direction, while streets designated with numbers run in the East-West direction.

carrer.name: Número 11, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 34, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 40, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 41, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 42, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 43, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 5, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 50, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 60, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 61, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Número 62, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: Street situated in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca.

carrer.name: Núria, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Valley of the Pyrenees where in its middle can be found the sanctuary of Our Lady of Núria.

carrer.name: Oblit, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Action of forgetting. Loss of memory. Street situated on the margin of the perimeter of the urban development project map for Mas Guinardó. In contrast to the other streets of the project, this street was omitted when assigning names. This can be concluded from reading the plans.

carrer.name: Obradors, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: For being the street in which the potters of the neighborhood worked.

carrer.name: Ocata, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: The name already appears in 1200 when the furriers bought a terrain in the so-called Ocata place in order to establish the guild building. This building stood there until Ocata was included in the part of the Ribera neighborhood that had to be demolished in order to construct the Citadel (1714). Corruption of 'Eucata', name of the military school that existed in this place.

carrer.name: Occidental, Moll
carrer.descripcio: Near to the Sec pier.

carrer.name: Ocellets, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Proposal made by the neighborhood as it is called popularly.

carrer.name: Ocells, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: In the late 15th century, a cross-street was opened that joined "d'en Cortines" street with the Sant Pere square, passing by the property known as "Horta dels Ocells".

carrer.name: Odissea, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: Hexametric Greek poem attributed to Homer. It describes the Odysseus' adventures in his attempt to return home to Ithaca. Public space located in the recreation zone of the restyled Barcelona harbor.

carrer.name: Oest, Moll de l'
carrer.descripcio: Western pier number one. Near to the Morrot station.

carrer.name: Ogassa, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Village of Ripollès. Street located in the Ramon Albó housing estate where the streets are named after Catalan villages and places.

carrer.name: Ojeda, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Alonso de Ojeda (Cuenca 1468 - Santo Domingo 1515). Navigator and explorer from Castile. He participated as captain in Christopher Columbus' second expedition. In 1499, he explored the Venezuelan coasts and northern Brazil.

carrer.name: Olèrdola, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Village of Alt Penedès. Old city and castle of the borough of Olèrdola. Street belonging to a group of streets named after Catalan villages: Capellades, Montornès, Cardedeu and Palou.

carrer.name: Olesa, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Olesa de Montserrat. Village of Baix Llobregat.

carrer.name: Olga Sacharoff, Jardins d'
carrer.descripcio: Olga Nicolaievna Sacharoff (Tiflis, Georgia 1889 - Barcelona 1967). Paintress and illustrator. Resident in Barcelona since 1916. She participated in the vanguard movements in Catalonia; firstly of Cubist style, later influenced by Modigliani and Rousseau. Ingenious and tender work. Gold Medal of the city of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Oli, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: The oil sold in the near "l'Oli" square, nowadays inexistent, was stored in this street.

carrer.name: Oliana, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Village of Alt Urgell on the Solsonès border. This street completes the group of streets named after Cardona and Dénia.

carrer.name: Olímpic, Passeig
carrer.descripcio: For Olympia, Ancient Greek city where the Olympic games were held.

carrer.name: Olivé, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Olivé i Alsina (el Masnou, Maresme 1819 - Barcelona 1882). In 1871, he became owner of the lands of the place. He was married to Anna Maristany.

carrer.name: Olivé i Maristany, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Olivé i Maristany (Masnou, Maresme 1851 - Barcelona 1923). Owner who bought the lands in 1887. He was married to Mercè Gumà i Surís, native of Matanzas.

carrer.name: Olivera, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Tree of the Mediterranean region where it is widely cultivated. Street situated in Poble Sec, on the northern slope of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Olivereta, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: Public space recovered between the streets named Bacardí, Carreras i Candi, Canalejas and Sugranyes.

carrer.name: Olles, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: For the potters' sales stands that formerly were established in this square.

carrer.name: Olof Palme, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Sven Olof Joachim Palme (Stockholm 1927 - 1986). Swedish social democratic politician. In 1969, he became chairman of his party and Prime Minister. He died at the hands of an assassin.

carrer.name: Olot, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Village of Garrotxa. Street situated next to the entrance of the Güell park.

carrer.name: Olvan, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Village of Berguedà, between Berga and Gironella.

carrer.name: Olzinelles, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Ramon d'Olzinelles i de Romero inherited the land situated in the "camp de la Plaça", formerly "camp de Cal Tet" from his wife Josepa de Fos i de Ravella. He was succeeded by his son Hermenegil d'Olzinelles Fos i Ravella, Count of Olzinelles.
carrer.anteriors: Canónigo Pibernat (joined to it); Iglesia; Olzinellas, before 1900

carrer.name: Om, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the deciduous elm tree that can be found nearly all over Europe. It grows above all in riverside forests.

carrer.name: Onyar, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: River in Catalonia, right tributary of the Ter river. It rises in the northeastern boundaries of the Guilleries (Santa Bàrbara mountain, 854 m) in the municipality of Brunyola (La Selva).

carrer.name: Onze de Setembre, Rambla de l'
carrer.descripcio: September 11th 1714, the day on which Barcelona surrendered to Philip V of Castile, after a siege of 14 months.
carrer.anteriors: rbla. (change of location); 20/12/1979, pg. de l'Onze de Setembre; Pº de los Mártires de la Tradición

carrer.name: Or, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Street belonging to the group of streets named Perla and Robí, as well as the Diamant square. Name assigned by the jeweler Josep Rossell, owner of the property.

carrer.name: Ordi, Passatge de l'
carrer.descripcio: Named after the herbaceous plant called barley. One of the most important cereals used as base for making beer.

carrer.name: Orduña, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Enormous, 600 meter high crag that rises above the valley that separates the provinces of Álava and Vizcaya. Sources: the nomenclature file. The nomenclature of a street group was approved in which every street was named after a peak.

carrer.name: Orellana, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Francisco de Orellana (Trujillo 1511 - Amazonas 1546). Conqueror. He went to America in 1528 and joined Francisco Pizarro's expedition in Peru. He explored the Amazon river and the Venezuelan coasts.

carrer.name: Oreneta, Carrer de l'
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the bird called swallow. Oreneta and Cigne (swan), two streets of Gràcia, one followed by the other, dedicated to these charming birds.

carrer.name: Orfila, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Mateu Josep Orfila i Rotger (Mahón, Menorca 1787 - París 1853). Physician and chemist. Professor of medicine in Paris. Thanks to his popular works of great importance, he enjoyed high prestige.

carrer.name: Orgues, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Properly 'àrguens', from the Greek word 'arganon' (instrument). They represent a kind of crane used for loading and unloading heavy goods. The porters used them in the Lonja de Mar (market) and stored them because of its weight in a site of this street, near to the working place.

carrer.name: Orient, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: Situated in the eastern part of the old borough of Sàrria, near the border with Sant Gervasi.

carrer.name: Oriol, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Pere Oriol i Alemany (Barcelona 1840 - 1900). Merchant and owner of the land he bought from the sisters Batista i Basté in 1897. The street index, when being accepted officially in 1955 without indicating any dedication, proposed the name of Josep Oriol i Bernadet (El Far d'Empordà, Alt Empordà 1811 - Les Escaldes, Andorra 1860). Architect.

carrer.name: Oriol Mestres, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Oriol Mestres i Esplugas (Barcelona 1815 - 1895). Architect. Member of the Mestres family of master builders and architects. Together with the architect Garriga i Roca he constructed the Gran Teatro del Liceo, inaugurated on April 4th 1847. It seems that the project was originated by the French architect called Vignier.

carrer.name: Orís, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Osona and an important lineage of this place with see in the Orís castle.

carrer.name: Oristà, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Osona situated in the central valley of the Gavarresa torrent, between Bages and Lluçanès.

carrer.name: Oristany, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: City of western Sardinia in the province of Cagliari. Group of streets with Italian toponyms, situated in the southeastern part of Besòs.

carrer.name: Ormuz, Passatge d'
carrer.descripcio: A stretch of sea between Iran and the Oman peninsula, which links the Persian Gulf to the Arabian Sea. This lane is located in the Area of Logistic Activities (Zona d'Activitats Logístiques, ZAL) in Barcelona harbor, where the thoroughfares are dedicated to the world's seas and oceans.

carrer.name: Orpí, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Anoia.

carrer.name: Òrrius, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Maresme, on the border with Vallès Oriental, situated on the eastern slopes of the Literal cordillera (Séllecs hill, 534 m, on whose top the rests of an important Iberic village, popularly called "el Castellot", can be found).

carrer.name: Ortigosa, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: The street was named after Ortigosa de Cameros, a village in the Spanish province of Logroño, the birthplace of Simeón García de la Riva on 18th February 1823. He died on 31st May 1889. His widow and children, the proprietors of the estate, established as a condition of the cession of the estate for the opening of the street that the latter should bear the name of town in which their husband and father had been born.

carrer.name: Osca, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Square named after Huesca, city of Aragon and capital of the province with the same name. Historically, it was one of the few Aragonese cities loyal to Jaume de Urgell after the death of Martin I of Catalonia and Aragon (1410).

carrer.name: Osi, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Bishop of Cordoba (Cordoba 256 - 358). Catechist and advisor of the emperor Constantine. He presided the first Ecumenical Council summoned up in Nicaea in 325 and was considered the main opponent to the arianism. He redacted the 'Credo', symbol of Nicaea.
carrer.anteriors: Osio; Baderrida; Osio; Bederrida (Town Hall of Sarrià); Balmes; Convenio

carrer.name: Osona, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Catalan region. Nevertheless, it seems that the street name was agreed in order to give proof of the existing surname of Osona in some censuses carried out in the 16th century, as it was done simultaneously for other surnames in 1929 when this agreement was reached.

carrer.name: Óssa Major, Passatge de l'
carrer.descripcio: The constellation of Ursa Major. Passageway that belongs to the Rectoret neighborhood, together with the square Firmament square and the Júpiter street.

carrer.name: Óssa Menor, Plaça de l'
carrer.descripcio: The northern constellation of Ursa Minor.

carrer.name: Otero Pedrayo, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Otero Pedrayo (Orense 1888 - 1976). Writer and politician. Belonging to the creative generation of the modern Galician prose: novelist, playwright and poet of the Galician language. Professor for Geography of the university of Santiago.

carrer.name: Otger, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Otger Cataló. Legendary personage imagined to explain the origin of the word 'catalán' and to give some precedents for the Catalan Reconquest prior to the Frank intervention and independent from the same. Otger, governor of Aquitaine (734), was accompanied by the Nine Barons of the Fame: Dapifer de Montcada, Galceran de Pinós, Hug de Mataplana, Guillem de Cervera, Guillem de Cervelló, Pere Alemany, Girbert de Ribelles, Roger d'Erill and Ramon d'Anglesola. They swore together with Otger in his castle of Cataló, "revenge and war" against the Arabs, in defense of the faith and to free the occupied countries.

carrer.name: Òtranto, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Italian city on the Adriatic coast. In 1481, the allied forces of the King of Naples, Ferdinand I, the Pope and other Italian states achieved a great victory over the Turks (who in 1480 had taken and plundered the city after a siege of 17 days, killing more than 700 Christians). This victory was attributed to the intervention of the Virgin on Francis of Paula's prayers. From this date on, the Minims adored her as their patron saint called Our Lady of the Victory.

carrer.name: Albarrasí, Carrer d'
carrer.descripcio: Town in Aragon (Teruel).

carrer.name: Ovidi Montllor, Plaça d'
carrer.descripcio: Ovidi Montllor i Mengual, singer and actor, was born in Alcoi on 4th February 1942. He made his début in Alcoi in 1961. In Barcelona he performed with independent theatre groups in 1967 and later with the theatrical companies of Adrià Gual and Núria Espert. In 1968 he launched his career as singer, using his own music and texts by the Catalonian poets Salvador Espriu and Pere Quart, and also by himself. He made various recordings. From 1974 onwards he starred in a number of films. He died in Barcelona, on 10th March 1995. He lived in the Carrer de Sostres, 3.

carrer.name: Pablo Iglesias, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pablo Iglesias Posse (Ferrol, La Coruña 1850 - Madrid 1925). Politician and socialist leader in Galicia. He founded the Spanish Socialist party (PSOE) in 1879.

carrer.name: Pablo Neruda, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ricardo Eliecer Neftalí Reyes (Parral, Linares, Chile 1904 - Isla Negra, Magallanes 1973). Poet. Consul in Madrid and Barcelona. Winner of the Lenin Peace Prize (1953) and the Nobel Prize for Literature (1973)

carrer.name: Pablo Sáenz de Barés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pablo Sáenz de Barés (1899 - 1939). Spanish journalist and writer.

carrer.name: Paca Soler, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Francesca de Paula Soler i Valester, "la Paca" (Barcelona 1833 - 1884). One of the most well known actresses in the Pitarra theatre group. She was married to Salvador Ros.

carrer.name: Pacífic, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name makes a reference to a good man, who owned a small house in the street, called Josep or Joan Urpí, "a meek and kindly man". He was a tile maker by trade.

carrer.name: Padilla, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Juan de Padilla (Toledo 1484 - Villalar 1521). Spanish aristocrat. Dissatisfied with the politics of King Carlos I, he joined the nationalist and anti-Flemish faction, represented by the 'comunidades' (rebels) in Castile. He was made commander of the militia fighters in Toledo and as field marshal of the rebel troops he occupied Medina and Tordesillas. However, his attempts to gain support from Queen Juana failed. When disagreements arose between the rebel fighters, he was in favor of continuing the fight. He was defeated in Villalar, along with Bravo and Maldonado. The three ware taken captives (23rd April 1521) and executed on the following day.
carrer.anteriors: Luis Pellicer; Núm. 42 (Cerdà plan); Padilla, before 1900

carrer.name: Pàdua, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A city in the Veneto region, Italy.

carrer.name: Pagès, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Martí i Gausachs (Gràcia, Barcelona 1801 - 1879) and his son, Jacint Martí i Hortal (Barcelona 1836 - 1916), were owners of the land where the road was built. Mention is made of 'passatge de Pagès' in records from this era. As another street bore the passageway's original name, it seems that the present name was chosen in 1897 by adopting the owner's nickname. The historians Roca and Comas made a proposal to dedicate the street to Anicet de Pagès i de Puig (Figueres, Alt Empordà 1844 - 1902). Poet and scholar.

carrer.name: Països Catalans, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: The concept of the Catalan nation and the set of territories where the Catalan language is spoken.

carrer.name: Paixalet, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: In former times the stream bearing this name ran here. It was a continuation of the Dragó stream, on the other side of the street 'carrer Major'. The latter ran where the street dedicated to the architect from Sant Andreu, Joan Torres I Guardiol, now lies.

carrer.name: Palafolls, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Maresme region, to the right of Tordera and to the left of Montnegre.

carrer.name: Palafox, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: José Rebolledo de Palafox y Melci (Zaragoza 1776 - Madrid 1847). Field marshal of Aragon and senator. He defended Zaragoza in the War of Independence.
carrer.anteriors: Panameña (without effectiveness); Santa Teresa; San Magín

carrer.name: Palamós, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Baix Empordà region and a street in Barcelona. In the 15th century, the town made a petition, known as 'carreratge', to the city of Barcelona whereby the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city. The street, which begins in the Prosperitat neighborhood, is considered to be the main artery in the Trinitat Nova area.

carrer.name: Palau, Pla de
carrer.descripcio: The square was originally built where the beach widens out towards the islets Maians and Puig de les Falzies. It was initially a trading place between importers and merchants. The city authorities thus decided to build the 'porxo del forment' (wheat exchange) in 1389. In the 15th century it became a place for dying, storing and trading cloth. The Generalitat ordered the construction of a building in the square where taxes were to be paid, and in 1380 the 'Llotje' (Exchange) was built and later extended, as well as premises for money exchangers. From the 17th century onwards the square became a centre of political activity. The old cloth market was converted in 1668 into the 'Palau dels Lloctienets' (Deputies' Palace) and later into the 'Palau Reial' (Royal Palace), which was destroyed by fire in 1875.

carrer.name: Palau, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: It takes its name from the Royal Palace ('Palau)', as it lies where the palace one stood.

carrer.name: Palau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In the area where the palace 'Palau Reial Menor' stood until 1855 when it was knocked down to make way for a road and to build houses. The palace began life in the 13th century as the Knights Templar's Chapter House. When a papal decree dissolved the order in 1317, the property was passed on to the Hospitallers of St John of Jerusalem until 1328. It was then acquired by the Bishop of Vic and his chapter. On 14th December 1370 Pere 'el Cerimoniós' gained possession of the palace. His intention was to build a royal residence to please his wife, Queen Elionor, to whom he made a gift of the property. During her lifetime the palace was known as the Queen's Palace ('Palau de la Reina').

carrer.name: Palau de la Música, Carrer del
carrer.anteriors: Sant Francesc de Paula 12/06/1980, San Francisco de Paula; Rosset; Melicol

carrer.name: Palaudàries, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Palaudàries i Pujol, owner of the property called 'les Hortes de Sant Bertran'. The area was developed in around 1880.

carrer.name: Palau-solità, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name of an old village that is now joined to Sant Genís de Plegamans to form the borough of Palau-solità i Plegamans, in the Vallès Occidental region (formerly Palau de Plegamans).

carrer.name: Palautordera, Baixada de
carrer.descripcio: Santa Maria de Palautordera and Sant Esteve de Palautordera, boroughs in the Vallès Oriental region.

carrer.name: Palència, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Palencia, a province and city in the region of Castile and Leon.

carrer.name: Palerm, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A Sicilian city. When Pere II conquered Sicily, Barcelona's local parliament established the first consulate there in 1285.

carrer.name: Palestina, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The traditional name, in particular since the Jewish uprising in 132-135, for the ancient country of Canaan or Israel, of which the ancient region of Judea formed part of the Roman province of Syria. It is also called the Holy Land. The name is connected with the ancient Philistines. At present, the area is divided between the states of Israel and Jordan, as well as the autonomous state of Palestine.

carrer.name: Paletes, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Previously 'carrer de San Antonio'. The name was changed as Saint Anthony is the patron saint of masons ('paletes'). The street thus pays tribute to those who have worked in the building trade.
carrer.anteriors: Desplà; Paletes; Desplá; Paletes; San Antonio

carrer.name: Palla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name dates from 1355. At that time a tax on straw ('palla') was introduced. Until 1626, straw was weighed in the square 'plaça Nova'.

carrer.name: Pallars, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A line of Catalan counts. Hugo Roger, Count of Pallars (15th century), leader of the rebellion against King Joan II.

carrer.name: Palma, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from an eye-catching palm tree that was planted here when the area was developed.

carrer.name: Palma de Sant Genís, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named in memory of the martyr Sant Genís.
carrer.anteriors: Palma de San Ginés, 19/11/1929; La Palma

carrer.name: Palma de Sant Just, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street name 'Palma' can be traced back to at least 1224. There are also records dating from 1447 that mention the name. In 1601 it was called 'Forn de la Palma'. In 17th century texts it was called 'd'en Palma' or on occasion 'de San Just'. The word 'Palma' can mean plane or plateau. The addition of 'San Just' is due to the fact that the street passes in front of the church bearing this name.
carrer.anteriors: Palma de San Justo, before 1865; Capità Urribarri

carrer.name: Palmera de Sant Martí, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: A neighborhood in the Sant Martí de Provençals area.

carrer.name: Palmeres, Passatge de les
carrer.descripcio: Due to the two giant palm trees ('palmeres') that grow here. The passageway is located between' passeig de Fabra i Puig' and 'carrer Cartellà'.

carrer.name: Palmeres, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: Due to the palm trees that grow there.

carrer.name: Paloma, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Some scholars have said that the name comes from an old sea chantey sung by the sailors who returned from America. However, the most likely explanation is that the street was assigned an animal name 'paloma' (dove), as was the case with other street names in the area ('Lleó' - lion -, 'Tigre' -tiger -, etc.). According to popular folklore, 'Tigre, Lleó' and 'Paloma' (the three streets were built at the same time) were the names of the dogs that guarded the orchards that once stood here and probably belonged to the property developer.

carrer.name: Palomar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Records of the place name can be traced to 991. It is associated with the Sant Andreu district and was the former name of the village.
carrer.anteriors: Jesús Lázaro; Cº Antiguo de Santa Coloma

carrer.name: Palou, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: An old village which now forms part of Granollers (Vallès Oriental region). The street is part of a group in the Coll neighborhood named after other places in the same region: Capellades, Montornès and Cardedeu.

carrer.name: Pals, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Baix Empordà region. The street is among those on the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Pamplona, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named 'Pampeluna' by the Romans and Iruña by the Basques. The Kingdom of Navarre came into being at the end of the 9th century and Pamplona was made its capital. Sancho Abarce proclaimed himself King of Pamplona. The Kingdom of Navarre was independent until the Catholic Kings conquered it in 1512.
carrer.anteriors: Castillejos (1st section); Fontova; Castillejos; Núm. 43 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Panamà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Central American country. When the land was developed in 1852, the landowner named the street 'Paranà'. Many of the street names in the Pedralbes area, which at first might seem inappropriate, were chosen for personal connections the original landowners had with different places. Such is the case of 'carrer de Montevideo'.

carrer.name: Panissars, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name makes reference to the battle of Panissars (30th September 1285), in which King Pere II defeated the French. This historical event is recorded in Ramon Muntaner's 'Crònica'. This harbour town, in the Albera region, separates the Vallespir region from the Alt Empordà region.

carrer.name: Panorama, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the panoramic view from here.

carrer.name: Panses, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the stalls selling raisins ('panses') that used to be in the street.

carrer.name: Pantà, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: The road once led to Vallvidrera marsh ('pantà').

carrer.name: Pantà de Tremp, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the reservoir ('pantà') which, despite its name, is in the borough of Talarn (Pallars Jussà region).

carrer.name: Pantomima, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A street in the Montbau neighborhood that forms part of a group of streets dedicated to Mime, Poetry, Song, Dance and Rhythm.

carrer.name: Panxampla, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: The name of one of the last bandits to have operated in the 19th century in the area around Vallvidrera de la Serra. According to the local popular tradition, which is still very much alive, he was murdered in Santa Ceru d'Olorda.

carrer.name: Papin, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Denis Papin (Chinetany, Blois 1647 - London 1714). French physicist and inventor. He developed the first steam engine.

carrer.name: Papiol, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Baix Llobregat region, which stretches along the river's left bank (on the borough's south-eastern boundary).

carrer.name: Paradís, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It is found on the highest point of Mount Táber. There is a mill wheel on the ground in front of Catalonia's Ramblers Club to mark this fact. The following are amongst the many theories as to the origins of the name: 1) 'Paradís' (paradise) is a place full of trees, a garden in other words; 2) 'Paradís' is a deformation of 'pereis' or 'perais' which is derived from the Catalan 'pera' or 'pedra', meaning 'stony ground', which is what the area must have looked like after Almansor destroyed the Roman temple (985) that stood here before the road was built.

carrer.name: Paraguai, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Paraguay, the South American country.

carrer.name: Paral·lel, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: This public highway was officially opened on 8th October 1894. The name comes from the fact that the street runs along the earth's parallel of latitude 41º22'34'', north; all be it in very rough terms from a strictly scientific point of view.
carrer.anteriors: C. del Marqués del Duero, 1939; Av. Francisco Layret; Marqués del Duero, 1874; Paralelo, 1859

carrer.name: Parc, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Before 1860 this street ran through the grounds of the convent of San Francisco, where a depot ('parc') for the military engineering corps had been established.

carrer.name: Parc de la Budellera, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A place name taken from the Budellera spring. The latter, in turn, took its name from the property called 'la Bedollera', so called because of the great number of birch ('bedoll') trees that grew here. There is one claim that there used to be a workshop that made guitar strings from animal gut here.

carrer.name: Parc Logístic, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: An avenue next to the Parc Logístic de la Zona Franca, running parallel with the ronda del Litoral ring road. It is located between the Carrer 2 and the Carrer 3.

carrer.name: Parcerisa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Xavier Parcerisa i Boada (Barcelona 1803 - 1876). Sketcher, lithographer and painter. The street was originally dedicated to him. Over the years, the name was deformed to 'Parcerisses'. In 1981 the original name was restored.

carrer.name: Pardo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The dedication to Valentí Pardo i Lanuza, landowner, who lived in New York at the end of the 20s, could not be confirmed for the closing of this edition.

carrer.name: Pare Eusebi Millan, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Eusebi Millan i Alonso (Quiñoneria, Soria 1886 - Alella, Maresme 1956). Belonged to the Piarist religious order. He was responsible for making basketball a popular sport in Catalonia, which he began to teach on the playing fields of the school Escoles Pies de Sant Antoni in 1921.

carrer.name: Pare Fidel Fita, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Fidel Fita i Colomer (Arenys de Mar, Maresme 1835 - Madrid 1917). Clergyman. Jesuit and historian. Member of the Spanish Academy, the San Fernando Academy of Fine Arts, the Barcelona Academy of Fine Arts and the Archaeological Institutes of Berlin and Coimbra.
carrer.anteriors: Padre Fidel Fita,29/03/1922; Pere Rebassó, 28/08/1885; San Severo

carrer.name: Pare Gallifa, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Gallifa i Arqués (Sant Boi de Lluçanès, Osona 1775 - Barcelona 1809). Monk in the monastery of Sant Gaietà, Barcelona. Rector and one of the Ciutadella martyrs. A hero in the War of Independence.
carrer.anteriors: Padre Gallifa; Melchor de Palau; Joaquin Costa ?, 1919 ?

carrer.name: Pare Jacint Alegre, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jacint Alegre i Pujals (Terrassa, Vallès Occidental 1875 - Barcelona 1930). Jesuit who founded the order of Cottolengo.
carrer.anteriors: Padre Jacinto Alegre; Fuente del Carbón; Cº de la Fuente del Carbón

carrer.name: Pare Laínez, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Diego Laínez (Almazán, Soria 1512 - Rome 1565). Jesuit. He succeeded Saint Ignatius as General of the Society of Jesus.
carrer.anteriors: Padre Laínez; Sol y Ortega; Zola; Campos, before 1900

carrer.name: Pare Manjón, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Andrés Manjón y Manjón (Sargentes, Burgos 1846 - Granada 1923). Spanish pedagogue and canon lawyer.

carrer.name: Pare Manyanet, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Josep Manyanet i Vives (Tremp, Pallars Jussà 1833 - Barcelona 1901). Clergyman. Pedagogue. He founded the schools 'Institut dels Fills de la Sagrada Família', in Tremp, and 'Instituto de les Filles de la Santa Casa de Natzaret', in Aiguafreda, in the Vallès Oriental region. A branch of this institution is to be found in this street
carrer.anteriors: Padre Mañanet; Ra. de Horta (a section)

carrer.name: Pare Mariana, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Juan de Mariana (Talavera de la Reina 1536 - Toledo 1624). Historian and Jesuit.

carrer.name: Pare Miquel de Sarrià, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Miquel Baixeras i Ribas (Sarrià, Barcelona 1741 - 1810). Capuchin monk. Popular preacher.

carrer.name: Pare Pérez del Pulgar, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: José Agustín Pérez del Pulgar (1875 - ?). Jesuit. Spanish scientist.

carrer.name: Pare Rodés, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Lluís Rodés i Campderà (Santa Coloma de Farners, Selva 1881 - Biniaraix, Majorca 1939). Jesuit. Astronomer. Director of the Ebro Observatory.

carrer.name: Pare Roldós, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Josep Maria Roldós i Móra (Sant Vicenç de Llavaneres, now Sant Vicenç de Montalt, Maresme 1851 - Barcelona 1920). Member of the Minim religious order. He restored the order, which had fallen into decline.

carrer.name: Pare Secchi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Angelo Secchi (Reggio Emilia 1818 - Rome 1878). Jesuit. Italian astronomer. Director of the Rome Astronomical Observatory. As a point of interest, he was the first person to mention the canals on Mars.

carrer.name: Paredes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Paredes (18th century). Lieutenant colonel of the engineering corps. The Marquis of Mina, who was the field marshal of Catalonia between 1742 and 1767, put him in charge of the construction work to build the Barceloneta neighborhood (1753).

carrer.name: Parellada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name of the property which the road crosses.
carrer.anteriors: T. de Canyadó; T. de Parellada (a section); T. de l'Estadella (a section)

carrer.name: París, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Paris, the capital of France.

carrer.name: París, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: The owners of the land where the passageway was built named it to testify to Josep Xifré i Daiving's stay in Paris.

carrer.name: Parlament, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It commemorates Catalonia's former parliament (which was different to the national parliament). The national parliament was an assembly with legislative powers which the king summoned and presided. The Catalan parliament, on the other hand, was only summoned to deal with emergency situations.

carrer.name: Parsifal, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Wagner's opera. Many of the street names in the Rectoret neighborhood were chosen by its inhabitants.

carrer.name: Pas de l'Ensenyança, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name recalls the original convent which was opened on 28th April 1657 by the nuns belonging to the order of the Company of Mary. They were a branch of the Ignatian order of Saint Benedict who dedicated themselves to teaching. They arrived from Beziers in 1650.
carrer.anteriors: Paso de la Enseñanza; De la Municipalidad; Dels Torners

carrer.name: Pascual i Vila, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Pascual i Vila (Mataró, Maresme 1895 - Barcelona 1979). Chemist. He studied science and pharmacy in Barcelona. He was a professor of organic chemistry in Salamanca (1922), Seville (1925-1934) and Barcelona (1934-1965), where he set up the Barcelona School of Research into Organic Chemistry.

carrer.name: Passerell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the linnet ('passerell'), the bird. It was named at the same time as the nearby passageway 'passatge de la Cadernera', which means 'goldfinch'.

carrer.name: Passerell, Baixada del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Passerell, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pasteur, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Louis Pasteur Roqui (Dôle 1822 - Villeneuve-l'Étang, Marnes-la-Coquette 1895). French biologist. Dean at the Science Faculty in Lille (1854). Director of the institute bearing his name (1888). He discovered the rabies vaccine.

carrer.name: Pastrana, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in Castile.

carrer.name: Patriarca, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The name was changed from 'passatge de Sant Josep' as another street bears this name.

carrer.name: Pau, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Located between the streets 'carrer del Concili de Trento' and 'carrer de l'Empordà'. It adopted the name of the housing estate La Pau. The name was requested to mark 25 years of peace ('pau') under Franco.

carrer.name: Pau, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: It commemorates the Bergara peace ('pau') pact in 1875, which is the year in which the passageway was built.

carrer.name: Pau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A city in Languedoc. It forms part of a series of highways in the neighborhood to the southwest of the river Besòs, which are dedicated to towns in the Languedoc and Northern Catalonian regions.

carrer.name: Pau Alcover, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Alcover i Guitart (Barcelona, circa 1804 ' Santa Coloma de Farners, La Selva 1832). Poet and philologist. He studied philosophy and law in Barcelona and Cervera, and spoke several languages. He was an amateur botanist and painter. He was declared tax officer of Santa Coloma de Farners. He was married to Maria Bargués, from Cervera. {JPI: Els carrers de Barcelona: Sant Gervasi}
carrer.anteriors: Pablo Alcover; Jaime Piquet (2nd section); Libertad, before 1900

carrer.name: Pau Casals, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Casals i Defilló (El Vendrell, Baix Penedès 1876 - San Juan de Puerto Rico 1973). Composer, conductor and cello player of international renown. He promoted foundations which encouraged the spreading of music.
carrer.anteriors: General Goded,25/05/1939; Pablo Casals,23/05/1934; Víctor Hugo,03/01/1933

carrer.name: Pau Claris, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Claris i Casademunt (Barcelona 1586 - 1641). Politician and clergyman. President of the Generalitat (1638-1641). He proclaimed the Catalan Republic under the protection of France.

carrer.name: Pau Ferran, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Tàrrega, Urgell ? - 1649). Knight and philanthropist. He bequeathed about one hundred thousand ducats to the Convalescence Home, annexed to the Holy Cross Hospital (Hospital de la Santa Creu). Construction work on the building had been interrupted due to a lack of funds.
carrer.anteriors: Pablo Ferrán; Lletra J (Casa Móra residential area)

carrer.name: Pau Feu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Originally the street was called 'carrer d'en Feu', a long-established family in the Les Corts district who had supplied the authorities of Sarrià with lawyers, jurists and advisors. In 1929 the Christian name Pau was added to the street name in honour of one particular member of the family. The Llança family, who owned the land where the street was built, became related by marriage to the Feu family in the 18th century when Martí de Llança i Palou married Maria Antònia Feu i Ravella.
carrer.anteriors: Pablo Feu; Acacias Blancas; Lletra A (Finca Llanza residential area)

carrer.name: Pau Gargallo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Gargallo i Catalán (Maella, Terra Alta 1881 - Reus, Baix Camp 1934). Classicist sculptor of great stylistic expression. Head of the department of sculpture in the Trades and Crafts High School (1917-1923).

carrer.name: Pau Hernández, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: (Rubielos de la Cérida, Teruel 1852 ' Roma 1921). Spanish Jesuit. Historian, pedagogue, and writer. Passageway opened in the lands owned originally by Faustino León Arroyo, neighbor of Cintruénigo, Navarre.

carrer.name: Pau Romeva, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Romeva i Ferrer (Barcelona 1892 - 1968). Pedagogue, politician and writer. He used the pseudonym "Rocatallada". Principal of the Ausiàs Marc group of schools (1931), member of Catalonia's parliament (1932) and one of the founder members of the party 'Unió Democràtica de Catalunya'.

carrer.name: Pau Sabater, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Sabaté i Lliró, also known as "Tero", was born in Algerri, in the Noguera region of Catalonia, in 1884. As a union leader, he militated in the CNT trade union and was the president of the Dyers Union. He was murdered on 19th July 1919 in the Carretera de Montcada, near Torre Baró, by gunmen paid by the employers' association. He left a companion, Josepa Ros, with their three small children. This is the outcome of a request by the Torre Baró neighbors' association in order to retrieve a part of the history of the district.

carrer.name: Pau Vila, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Vila i Dinarés (Sabadell, Vallès Occidental 1881 - 1980). Pedagogue and geographer. He founded the school 'Escuela Horaciana'. Professor. Member of the Institute for Catalan Studies, Honorary Prize for Catalan Literature (1976). Doctor 'honoris' 'causa' at the Autonomous University of Barcelona. He founded three schools of geography in Catalonia, Colombia and Venezuela.

carrer.name: Paul Claudel, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Paul Claudel (Villeneuve-sur-Fére, Aisne 1868 - Paris 1955). Poet and playwright. Member of the Académie Française. He was ambassador for France in Japan, China, USA, Austria, etc.

carrer.name: Pavelló Albéniz, Passeig del
carrer.descripcio: Isaac Manuel Francisco Alveníz i Pascual (Camprodon, Ripollès 1860 - Kanbo, Lapurdi, Basque Country 1909). Pianist and composer. Despite the fact that in all parish and notary records the name is spelt 'Alveníz', the correct spelling is 'Albéniz', which is also the name of a village in the province of Vizcaya.

carrer.name: Pavia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A city in Lombardy. A battle of the same name took place there in which Carlos I of Spain liberated the city from Francis I of France and made him prisoner (24th February 1525).

carrer.name: Pearson, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the avenue.

carrer.name: Pearson, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Frederick Stark Pearson (Lowell, Massachusetts 1858 - the 'SS Lusitania' 1915). American engineer and financier. He promoted the creation of two companies: Barcelona Traction, Light and Power, Company Limited, locally known as 'La Canadiense' and the Sociedad Riegos y Fuerzas del Ebro.

carrer.name: Pebràs, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the milk mushroom ('pebràs'). The mushroom has a voluminous funnel-shaped cap varying from between 6 to 20 cm in width.

carrer.name: Pedraforca, Placeta del
carrer.descripcio: A mountain in the pre-Pyrenean mountain range.

carrer.name: Pedraforca, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A mountain in the pre-Pyrenean mountain range.

carrer.name: Pedralbes, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: The main street in the urban center bearing the same name: formerly 'Petras Albas', meaning 'white stones'. Pedralbes was also an old family name.

carrer.name: Pedralbes, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from the monastery around which a small urban centre grew. In 986 the name was recorded as 'Petras Albas'.

carrer.name: Pedregar, Baixada del
carrer.descripcio: An old word meaning 'stony ground'.

carrer.name: Pedrell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Felip Pedrell i Sabaté (Tortosa, Baix Ebre 1841 - Barcelona, 1922). Composer, musicologist and editor. He started a national lyric theatre in Spain. He taught Manuel de Falla, Enrique Granados and Robert Gerhard, amongst others.

carrer.name: Pedrell, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pedrera del Mussol, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after a quarry that used to exist on the mountain of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Pedreres, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Near a quarry that used to exist on the Mountain of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Pedret, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A village in the Alt Empordà region. The street is among those on the Ramon Albó housing estate where most street names are dedicated to towns and villages in the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Pedró, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: 'Pedró' means an obelisk or pedestal which supports a monument. Since 1673, there has been a monument to Saint Eulalia in the square which replaced an image of Saint Hipolite. It is possible that the original monument was a cross.
carrer.anteriors: Padró, before 1865; Padró de San Hipólito

carrer.name: Pedró de la Creu, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the limit cross ('pedró de la creu') set on an inscribed column that once stood in Sarrià.
carrer.anteriors: Cruz; Cruz de Padrón; Esplugas; Cruz de Padrón; Esplugas (Town Hall of Sarrià); Cruz (wide part, joined); San José (narrow part, joined)

carrer.name: Pedro i Pons, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Agustí Pedro i Pons (Barcelona 1898 - 1971). Doctor. He was the dean and a professor of pathology and clinical medicine at the faculty of medicine in Barcelona. He was also the chairman of the Academy of Medical Science and Medicine of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Pedro Muñoz Seca, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Pedro Muñoz Seca (Puerto de Santa María 1881 - Paracuellos del Jarama 1936). Writer of comedies. He created the comedy genre know as 'astracanada'.

carrer.name: Pedrosa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A cove on the Costa Brava, in the borough of Palafrugell (Baix Empordà). The street is in the Trinitat Nova area where many of the highways are dedicated to towns and villages on the Costa Brava.

carrer.name: Pegàs, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The fabled winged horse engendered by Poseidon and the Gorgon Medusa. The name comes from the lorry and car factory whose trade name was 'Pegaso'.

carrer.name: Peira, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: The name of the old farmhouse 'Ca la Peira'. It was on property belonging to the Marquis of Castellbell.

carrer.name: Peixos, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the house 'casa' 'd'en Peix' which stood here in the 18th century. There were fish ('peixos') on its shield.

carrer.name: Pelai, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The first king of Asturias, 8th century. In Catalan the name is either 'Pelai' or 'Pelagi'.

carrer.name: Pelfort, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Pelfort i Manció. A former city councillor. He left the city a valuable legacy in the form of the Pelfort Prize. In 1922 when the nomenclature agreement was made, the house where he lived for many years, Can Pelfort, still stood in the street then called 'carrer de les Tres Cases'.

carrer.name: Pellaires, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the furrier's ('pellaires') workshop (for tanners and leather workers) that was set up in the Sant Martí de Provençals district.

carrer.name: Penedès, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: One of the regions in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Penedides, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: In 1699 the Sisters of Penitence ('penedides') built a convent in the street 'carrer de Sant Pau' on the corner of the side street which now bears this name. The convent closed in 1835.
carrer.anteriors: Arrepentidas, before 1699; Tapias; Trav. de las Huertas

carrer.name: Peníscola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough of Baix Maestrat. Pope Benedict XIII (the Pope Luna) made the place famous as he set up residence there.

carrer.name: Penitents, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the neighborhood. It was so called because of the six hermits who settled here in around 1860. They were led by Father Palau, a preacher and publisher, who published 'El Ermitaño' in about 1868.

carrer.name: Penyal, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The road was originally dedicated to Norberto Peñasco y Galí (Madrid 1839 - Barcelona 1901). Lieutenant colonel. He owned the land where the road was built.

carrer.name: Peñalara, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The highest mountain in the Guadarrama Sierra. The street forms part of the Turó de la Peira neighborhood, where all the highways are dedicated to Spanish place names.

carrer.name: Pep Ventura, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Josep M. Ventura i Casas (Alcalá la Real, Jaén 1817 - Figueres, Alt Empordà 1875). A composer who created the modern 'sardana'.
carrer.anteriors: José Ventura; Pep Ventura (Town Hall of Sarrià); Funicular

carrer.name: Peracamps, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In memory of the battle (1840) which liberated Peracamps during the Carlist War. Antonio van Halen y Sarti (Cadiz 1792 - Madrid 1858), who at the time was Catalonia's field marshal, was wounded. He was conceded the title Count of Peracamps. According to Joan Amades, the street name pays tribute to van Helen, despite his pitiful performance during the bombing of Barcelona (1842).

carrer.name: Perafita, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Osona. The street is located in the Ciutat Meridiana neighborhood, where most of the roads are dedicated to towns and places in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Perals, Torrent de
carrer.descripcio: A stream bearing the name 'Perals de' 'Casa Planas' or 'Perals de Masferrer', flows through the 'Can Bruixa' property belonging to the Piera family.

carrer.name: Perdius, Costa de les
carrer.descripcio: A street in the Rectoret neighborhood, where many of the names were chosen by its inhabitants.

carrer.name: Pere Blai, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona ? - 1620). Architect and master builder. He was responsible for the newer part of the Palace of the Generalitat attached to the Gothic construction. He introduced Greco-Roman purism to Catalonia. He also designed the palace's Sala de Sant Jordi and the façade which gives onto the square 'plaça de Sant Jaume.'

carrer.name: Pere Calders, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Calders i Rossinyol (Barcelona 1912 - 1994). Narrator, journalist and sketcher. His writings attained a great lyrical quality by combining fantasy and humor, and very often satire. His works include: 'La glòria del doctor Larén',' Gent de l'alta vall', 'Aquí descansa Nevares',' L'ombra de l'atzavara', etc. He contributed to the newspapers 'Diario Mercantil' and 'Avui'. He was awarded the City's Golden Medal for his artistic achievements.

carrer.name: Pere Coromines, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Coromines i Montanya (Barcelona 1870 - Buenos Aires 1939). A writer who produced a great number of works dealing with many subjects. Politician, lawyer, economist, journalist and historian. He drew up the Núria Autonomous Statutes. Founder member of the Institute for Catalan Studies (1907). City councillor (1909). Chairman of the left-wing coalition 'Unió Federal Nacionalista'. Member of parliament (1910 and 1914) and represented 'Esquerra Republicana' (1936). Chairman of Barcelona's Athenaeum (1928-1930). Minister of Justice for Catalonia's autonomous government under President Macià.

carrer.name: Pere Costa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Costa i Cases (Vic, Osona 1693 - Berga, Berguedà 1761). Sculptor, architect and heraldist. Pau Costa's son. An outstanding representative of Catalonia's Baroque style with Classicist influences. He was the first Catalan sculptor to be admitted to the San Fernando Academy (1754).
carrer.anteriors: Costa; Lletra D (Casa Vélez residential area)

carrer.name: Pere d'Artés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (14th and 15 centuries). Courtier and patron of the arts. Member of the royal court of justice under King Martin. One of his family's ancestral homes still stands in this street and is of great artistic interest.

carrer.name: Pere Falqués, Plaça de
