carrer.descripcio: Pere Falqués i Urpí (Sant Andreu de Palomar, Barcelona 1850 - 1916). Chief city architect (1889). He was responsible for two of the palaces built for the Universal Exhibition in Barcelona (1889). Chairman of Catalonia's Architects Association (1889-1900).

carrer.name: Pere Figuera i Serra, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1929 - Limoges, France 1970). Catalan patriot. He completed his primary education at the 'Grup Escolar Francesc Macià' and his secondary education at 'the Col·legi de la Salle de la Bonanova'. Later he trained to be a chemical engineer at the 'Escola Industrial' and graduated in law at the University of Barcelona. While at the 'Escola Industrial', through Josep M Ainaud de Lasarte, he come into contact with the group 'Grup Torras i Bages', the FNEC and the 'Front Universitari de Catalunya'. He was one of the driving forces behind the magazine 'Ictini' and the first editions of the university publication 'Antologies Poètiques'. Highly sensitive to the importance of the Catalan language, he fought tirelessly for any cause that required his participation. He was killed in an accident near Limoges when he was 41. The proposal was made by the de Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district authorities. The square's naming ceremony took place on 5th October.

carrer.name: Pere II de Montcada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere II de Montcada (1267 - 1300). Royal seneschal, baron of Aitona i Soses. He married Elisenda de Pinós. Father to Queen Elisenda, who married Jaume II and who founded the monastery of Pedralbes. He was the son of Pere I de Montcada and Sibila de Abarca and the grandson of Guillem Ramon I, who was married to Constancia de Aragon, the illegitimate daughter of King Pere I.
carrer.anteriors: Pedro II de Montcada; Pedro II de Aragón; Lletra C (Casa Móra residential area)

carrer.name: Pere IV, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere IV of Catalonia, known as the Constable of Portugal (? 1429 - Granollers, Vallès Oriental 1466). He was the son of Pere, Duke of Coimbra, the King of Portugal's second son, who was married to Isabel, King Jaume II's eldest daughter. When King Joan II left the throne unoccupied, the Catalan nation proclaimed Pere king. He was crowned in 1463 and reigned for two and a half years. He was buried in the church Santa Maria del Mar.

carrer.name: Pere Joan, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A sculptor of the quattrocento style, master craftsman and doctor of medicine. He was the author of the medallion of Sant Jordi (1418) on the frontispiece of the Generalitat's courtyard in the street 'carrer del Bisbe'.

carrer.name: Pere Llobet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona ? - 14th century). Master builder. He oversaw the building of the City Hall's' Saló de Cent' (Room of the 100 Jurors) between 1369 and 1373.
carrer.anteriors: Pedro Llobet; Lletra B (Casa Móra residential area)

carrer.name: Pere Moragues, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1330 - 1388). Sculptor, silversmith and master architect. One of Catalonia's best 14th century artists.

carrer.name: Pere Oller, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Girona 14th - 15th centuries). Sculptor. Inhabitant of Girona; one of the best Medieval Catalan Sculptors.

carrer.name: Pere Pau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Pau Sabadell i Banús, owner of the land from 1776, when he inherited it from his father Josep Sabadell i Vallhonesta. His son, Josep Sabadell i Riera, owned the land until 1846. The land remained in the family, first passing onto Andreu Sabadell i Pujades until 1897 and finally to Anderu Sabadell i Nubiola.

carrer.name: Pere Ripoll, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Built in 1890 by the Ripoll brothers, who christened the street using their surname. When Sant Martí was made a borough of Barcelona in 1897, the street was renamed to avoid confusion with another bearing the same name in the city. Pere Ripoll was an agronomist from Angelsola (Urgell). In 1616 he wrote a treatise demonstrating the benefits of a well-organised irrigation system on the Segrià plain.

carrer.name: Pere Rodríguez, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Rodríguez i Bartra (Banyoles, Pla de l'Estany 1889 - Barcelona 1948). Building contractor. From 1927 he owned four properties in the passageway, which had belonged to the Torné and Martí families.

carrer.name: Pere Sala, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Sala i Vilaret (Vic, Osona 1839 - Barcelona 1916). Philosopher and journalist. Editor of 'El Diluvio' for fifteen years.

carrer.name: Pere Serafí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? 1505 - Barcelona 1567). Poet and painter, known as "lo Grec". In 1565 he published 'Dos llibres', a collection of 170 poems in Catalan.

carrer.name: Pere Terré i Domènech, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1910 - 1995). He worked for the organisation ENASA and was also a musician and composer. He was an actively involved in community projects in the Sant Andreu area. He set up orchestras, cultural magazines, etc. On retiring he became the chairman of the association for senior citizens 'Casal d'Avis', a post he held for twenty years.

carrer.name: Pere Vergés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Vergés i Farnés (Barcelona 1896 - 1970). Teacher who was involved with the 'Escola Nova' movement which set new teaching trends. He was the principal of the school 'Escola del Mar' in 1921.

carrer.name: Perea, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: An old Jewish region east of Jordan. The street is located in the Vall d'Hebron neighborhood, where most of the streets are named after towns and places in the Holy Land.

carrer.name: Perelló, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Records of the name date back to the 11th century in the maritime area of Sant Martí de Provençals. The 1980 nomenclature proposed that the street should pay homage to Miquel Perelló (Palma de Majorca 1674 - 1730). Baroque sculptor. His works include the doorway of the Servite convent 'Nostra Senyora del Bonsuccés' (1690).

carrer.name: Perera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the pear tree ('perera'). It is located in the Rectoret neighborhood, in the Vallvidrera area, and is part of a group of streets named after shrubs and trees.

carrer.name: Pérez Galdós, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Benito Pérez Galdós (Las Palmas de Gran Canaria 1843 - Madrid 1920). Prolific writer, playwright and columnist. Member of the Spanish Academy (1897). Liberal who supported progressist reforms.

carrer.name: Perill, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The danger ('perill') involved in using this street because of the potholes and lack of night-time lighting gave this street its name. It seems that the original name was 'Pelegrí', a tribute to Pelegrí Viladiu, a textile manufacturer.

carrer.name: Periodistes, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the Co-operative set up by a section of the Press Association, which was created to build a group of houses for journalists ('periodistes').

carrer.name: Peris i Mencheta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Peris i Mencheta (Valencia, Horta 1844 - Barcelona 1916). Journalist and politician. He founded the newspaper 'El Noticiero Universal'.

carrer.name: Peris i Mencheta, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Perla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the pearl ('perla'). The shelly concretion used by jewellers, which forms inside oysters and other molluscs. The street forms part of a group of streets named by a jeweller.

carrer.name: Permanyer, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: The first passageway to be built in the Eixample district (before 1865). It pays tribute to Francesc Permanyer i Tuyet (Barcelona 1817 - Madrid 1864). Lawyer, politician and writer. He was a militant in the 'Partit Moderat' and later in the 'Unió Liberal'. He was the mayor of Barcelona in 1856, member of parliament, vice-president of Congress and Foreign Minister. Secretary of the Academy of Jurisprudence and member of the Fine Arts Academy.

carrer.name: Peronella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? 1136 - Barcelona 1173). Queen of Aragon and Countess of Barcelona, wife of Ramon Berenguer IV.

carrer.name: Perot lo Lladre, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Perot Rocaguinarda was the faction leader of the 'nyerros '(members of one of the two groups into which Catalan nobles were divided at the end of the 16th century and the beginning of the 17th century). He had his headquarters in the Montseny region, until 1611 when, under the terms of a pact, he went to Italy as a captain of the Spanish army (VB). The historians Roca and Comas disagree with this hypothesis as, according to them, the street bore this name before the 17th century. They sustain that the name could come from Pedro Ladrón Ridaure, an Aragonese gentleman and friend of King Jaume II.

carrer.name: Perpinyà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Perpignan, the capital of Roussillon. It forms part of a series of highways to the southwest of the river Besòs, which are dedicated to towns in the Languedoc and Northern Catalonian regions.

carrer.name: Perú, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Peru, the South American Republic. The proposal for the name was made by the trading organization 'Círculo de la Unión Mercantil Hispano-Americana de la Casa de América', to mark the centenary of the battle of Ayacucho (9th December 1824). The battle was won by General Sucre and gave rise to Peru's independence, as well as that of the rest of the South American continent.

carrer.name: Pes de la Palla, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the warehouses for straw ('palla') that existed here. The straw that came into and left the city was weighed here.

carrer.name: Pescadors, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Pays homage to the fishermen ('pescadors') and their families who lived in the houses in this street.

carrer.name: Pescadors, Moll de
carrer.descripcio: The wharf ('moll') located on entering the dock 'dàrsena del Comerç'.

carrer.name: Pescateria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Records the fact that an arcaded building existed here between 1601 and 1848 where there were fishmonger's ('pescateria'). It was located between this very same street and 'carrer de Calders'.

carrer.name: Petons, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: A cul-de-sac, which for many years was rather dark. It is possible that people named the street, meaning 'kisses', because it was an appropriate place for lovers to meet. Another possible explanation is that the name comes from Joan Pontons, who in 1651 lived in the nearby Portal Nou area. In irony people changed it to "Petons". According to legend, prisoners condemned to death in the Ciutadella prison were allowed to say farewell to their families here.

carrer.name: Petra Kelly, Jardí de
carrer.descripcio: Petra Karin Kelly (Bavaria 1947 - Bonn 1992). Environmentalist leader who in 1979 founded the German Green Party. She was a pioneer in environmentalist politics and a pacifist who protested against the escalation of nuclear arms. Petra Kelly and her ideological and sentimental companion, Gert Bastian, were the first environmentalist members of parliament in the Bundestag between 1983 and 1990. They organised non-violent protests against the nuclear arms race and the violation of human rights all over the world. The end of the Cold War, the unification of Germany (to which the Green Party was opposed), the adaptation of green politics by the establishment and the divisions within her own party led to a crisis and to Kelly's subsequent political alienation. In October 1992 she committed suicide with Gert Bastian. The proposal for the dedication was made by the city's Department of Urban and Environmental Development.

carrer.name: Petrarca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesco Petrarca (Arezzo 1304 - Arqua Petrarca, Veneto 1374). Italian Humanist and poet. A prolific writer of noted egocentric qualities.

carrer.name: Petritxol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A corrupted form of 'pedritxol', arising from the fact that the street prevented carriages - although not pedestrians - passing through it as there was a stone bench ('pedritxol') at one end of it. According to other sources, it was the name of a Catalan family who owned the land or some houses in the street. A further version suggests that the word comes from 'portitxol', meaning porch way. Records of the name can be traced back to 1340 and 1352.

carrer.name: Petxina, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Before the Boqueria market opened people set up stalls in this street, next to the walls of the convent of Sant Josep, selling shellfish ('petxina').

carrer.name: Peu de la Creu, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the monastery (13th century) belonging to the Trinitarian order. The monastery was known as 'Peu de la Creu'.

carrer.name: Pi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The street, the two squares and the church adopted the name of the big pine tree ('pi') in front of the church, originally known as 'església de la Mare de Déu dels Reis'.

carrer.name: Pi, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: An old legend says that there used to be a pinewood here and that at the foot of one of the pine trees ('pi') people would worship an image of the Virgin Mary. Records reveal that a chapel existed here in the year 958 under the shadow of a big pine tree.

carrer.name: Pi, Placeta del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pi Forcat, Passeig del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of a pine tree ('pi') with a forked ('forcat') tree trunk.

carrer.name: Pi i Margall, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Pi i Margall (Barcelona 1824 - Madrid 1901). President of the First Republic.

carrer.name: Picalquers, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Surname of an old Catalan family of note. The family had a castle in the borough of Esplugues de Llobregat (Baix Llobregat), at the foot of a mountain called Sant Pere Mártir, which they owned as far back as the year 1165. The castle and its lands, called the Quadra de Picalquers, remained within the hands of the family until 1325 when it was sold to Pere Terré, who lived in Barcelona. In the mid-17th century it became the property of Josep d'Ardena, Count of Darnius and field marshal of Catalonia. Ignasi Joan de Picalquers (17th-18th centuries) was conceded the county of Picalquers. He made a name for himself as a soldier. Amongst other undertakings in the War of Succession against King Philip V's Franco-Spanish troops, he defended Barcelona in 1706 and Girona in 1711. The Picalquers family owned a house in this street.

carrer.name: Picasso, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Pablo Ruíz Picasso (Malaga 1881 - Mougins, Provence 1973). Painter, illustrator, engraver, sculptor and ceramist of worldwide fame.
carrer.anteriors: Martínez Anido; General Martínez Anido; Indústria

carrer.name: Picó i Campamar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Picó i Campamar (Pollença, Southern Majorca 1848 - Barcelona 1916). Writer. Master of the art of poetry. Co-founder of the organisation 'Jove Catalunya' and the Catalan language Academy (1881). He was the chairman of Catalonia's Rambling Association and the Athenaeum.

carrer.name: Piera, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Vicenç Piera i Amigó (1785 - 1866). Owner of the land where the passageway was built, in the place called 'lo camp del soldat' (the soldier's field). It then belonged to Josep Piera i Piera (1821 - 1892). Vicenç Piera i Galtés was the landowner from 1893.

carrer.name: Pierola, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Anoia region.

carrer.name: Pierre de Coubertin, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pierre de Frédy, Baron of Coubertin (Paris 1863 - Geneva 1937). French pedagogue, he introduced physical education in schools. He promoted the modern Olympic movement and was president of the International Olympic Committee (1896-1925).

carrer.name: Pietat, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: It took its name from one of the oldest doorways in the church in this street. The name in turn comes from the retable above the doorway.

carrer.name: Pieyre de Mandiargues, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: André Pieyre de Mandiargues (Paris 1909 - 1991). Writer. Influenced by Surrealism and modern art, he wrote novels and poetry. A keen traveller, he wrote 'Al margen', based on his experiences in Barcelona, the novel is set in the red-light neighborhood. The book won the Goncourt Prize in 1967. The urban space dedicated to this author is located at the crossroads of the streets 'carrer de Sant Ramon' and 'carrer del Marquès de Barberà'.

carrer.name: Piferrer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pau Piferrer i Fàbregas (Barcelona 1818 - 1848). Poet, writer, literary, music and art critic.
carrer.anteriors: Bruch, before 1900; San Agustín; Lletra F (Llaveria residential area)

carrer.name: Pinar del Río, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Pinar del Río, a Cuban city and the capital of the province bearing the same name.

carrer.name: Pineda, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: In reference to Puig de Jorba pine forest ('pineda').

carrer.name: Pineda, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Maresme borough. Originally named because of the great number of pine trees on the hill.

carrer.name: Pins, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A village in the borough of Vilopriu (Baix Empordà). The street belongs to the Ramon Albó housing estate, where most of the highways are named after towns and villages the province of Girona.

carrer.name: Pins de Can Caralleu, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: 'Pins' (pine trees) describes the area surrounding the street.

carrer.name: Pintor Alsamora, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Onofre Alsamora i Perecaula (Barcelona 1810 - 1880). Painter, disciple of Barcelona's Lonja School of Art. He was the son of Jaume and Josepa, who married on 4th June 1803. On 13th November 1837 Onofre Alsamora married Josepa Calls i Lacoma, who was the daughter of a painter. On 18th August 1853, he married his second wife, Eulàlia Merino i Ferràs.
carrer.anteriors: Rialp; Valentí y Camp; Rialp (a section)

carrer.name: Pintor Casas, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Casas i Carbó (Barcelona 1866 - 1932). Painter and sketcher. Member of the International Painting Society.

carrer.name: Pintor Fortuny, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Marià Fortuny i Marsal (Reus, Baix Camp 1838 - Rome 1874). Painter, illustrator and engraver. The first great international painter of the Catalan Renaissance style.

carrer.name: Pintor Gimeno, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Gimeno i Arasa (Tortosa, Baix Ebre 1858 - Barcelona 1927). Painter and sketcher. The street was given its name in 1949 (it was previously called 'carrer de la Noguera') at the request of the association the 'Reial Cercle Artístic'. The artist had lived for many years in this street until his death.

carrer.name: Pintor Josep Pinós, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Josep Pinós i Comes (Barcelona 1866 - 1916). Belonged to the same group as Rusiñol, Casas, Mir, etc. Philanthropist.

carrer.name: Pintor Mir, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Mir i Trinxet (Sants, Barcelona 1873 - Barcelona 1940). Landscape painter. Gold Medal at the Fine Arts international Exhibition (1907) and at the 1929 International Exhibition in Barcelona, amongst other awards.

carrer.name: Pintor Pahissa, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Pahissa i Laporta (Sants, Barcelona 1846 - Barcelona 1928). Self-taught sketcher, illustrator and landscape painter. A disciple of Martí i Alsina.
carrer.anteriors: Lletra E (Plan of Les Corts); Núm. 52

carrer.name: Pintor Pradilla, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francisco Pradilla y Ortíz (Villanueva del Gállego, Aragon 1846 - Madrid 1921). Painter. Director of Madrid's Prado museum (1896-1898) and the Spanish Academy of Fine Arts in Rome.

carrer.name: Pintor Ribalta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Ribalta (Solsona, Solsonès 1565 - Valencia, Horta 1628). Painter who used "tenebrist" naturalism influenced by the new Italian trend.

carrer.name: Pintor Tapiró, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pintor Tapiró, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Josep Tapiró i Baró (Reus, Baix Camp 1836 - Tánger 1913). Painter, close friend of Marià Fortuny. He was awarded prizes for many of his exhibits.

carrer.name: Pintura, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Pays tribute to the art of painting ('pintura').

carrer.name: Pinyol, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Piñol i Escrivà owned the land in the area between 1911 and 1920.

carrer.name: Pinzón, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Martín Alonso Pinzón (Palos de Moguer, Eastern Andalusia 1441 - La Rábida 1493) and Vicente Yáñez Pinzón (Palos de Moguer ? - ? 1523). Navigators. They were, respectively, the commanders of the caravels 'La Pinta' and 'La Niña', on Columbus' first voyage of discovery.

carrer.name: Piquer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Originally dedicated to Francesc Piqué (18th century). He farmed the San Beltrán property on which the street was built. The historians Roca and Comas made a proposal to the authorities for the street to honor Josep Piquer i Cerveró (Tudela ? - Barcelona 1900). Musician. A Catalan by adoption, he cultivated local popular music.

carrer.name: Piquer, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Gabriel Piqué, father to Josep Piqué i Rovira and Oleguer Piqué i Rovira, landowners in the 1920's.

carrer.name: Pirineus Espanyols, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: The street was initially called 'carrer de los Pirineus Orientals'. It was changed to its present name under the dictatorship of Primo de Rivera.

carrer.name: Pistó, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The word means 'piston'. The only available version about the origins of the name is that someone who lived there painted the name in black at the top of the street. He or she was tired of not knowing the name of the street as it had been built for some time without ever had a name assigned to it.

carrer.name: Pisuerga, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A river in Castile. A tributary of the River Duero.

carrer.name: Pitàgores, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Samos 580 ? B.C. - Metapontium, Magna Grecia 497 B.C.). Greek philosopher and mathematician. Fleeing from the tyrant Polycrates, he settled in Kroton, Magna Grecia, where he founded a philosophical, political and religious community which served as a model.

carrer.name: Pitàgores, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pius XII, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Eugenio Pacelli Graziosi (Rome 1876 - Castellgandolfo 1958). The name of the square was assigned in 1951, when Pope Pious XII was still alive, as a sign of appreciation from Barcelona. A pontifical mass was held in the square to celebrate the 35th Eucharistic Congress in 1952.

carrer.name: Pizarro, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco Pizarro González (Trujillo, Extremadura 1478 - Lima, Peru 1541). Conquistador. The Toledo agreement ('capitulación') made him governor, captain general and 'adelantado' of the new territories he might discover.

carrer.name: Pla, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Pla i Moreu (Barcelona 1843 - 1911). Owner of the land where the passageway was built between 1877 and 1893.

carrer.name: Pla de Fornells, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The surrounding area was traditionally known by this name.

carrer.name: Pla de Fornells, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: It takes its name from the surrounding area.

carrer.name: Pla dels Cirerers, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name, meaning 'cherry trees', suggests that fruit trees must have grown here at one time.

carrer.name: Pla Llorenç, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: Place name in the Vallvidrera area near Can Castellví.

carrer.name: Plana, Baixada de la
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from the fact that the street is located where the property known as 'la plana de Can Tarrida' used to be. An urban settlement emerged here in the 13th century and later became the borough of Horta.

carrer.name: Plana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In reference to the property la 'plana de Can Tarrida'.

carrer.name: Plana, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the 'baixada'.

carrer.name: Planell, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Leopold Planell i Porqueres (1885 - 1953). Councilor for Les Corts. The following is an extract from council records: "Antoni Martín, in representation of the proprietors in the unnamed passageway located on Travessera Vella de Les Corts, between the streets Vilamari and Tarragona, requests that: in view of the fact that Councilor Antoni Cuyàs, who worked on the urban renewal of the area, already has a street dedicated to him, the passageway should be named after Sr Leopold Planell, reserve councilor for the district of Les Corts".

carrer.name: Planella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Planella i Piera (Sarrià ? - 1865). Councilor of Sarrià who, during the 1865 cholera epidemic, set an example of charity and community spirit to his fellow neighbors. He was mayor for the period 1863 to 1864.

carrer.name: Planeta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Next to the square 'plaça del Sol', in the Gràcia district.

carrer.name: Plantada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In 1883, the Casamitjana i Banús brothers conceded a piece of land measuring 5,936 m2 to Miquel Plantada i Arís. He was a primary school teacher from Montcada who lived in the Sant Gervasi neighborhood. The land, where the street was built, was part of a property called Mas Pomaret in the Sariambell area. The ground rent, including all inherent rights to the land, was 280·25 pesetas per annum, with a capital outlay of 9341,82 pesetas at a rate of 3%.

carrer.name: Plata, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The element silver ('plata'). It is thought that there used to be an establishment here selling silver to silversmiths.

carrer.name: Platí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The ductile metallic element, whose symbol is Pt, atomic number 78 and belongs to group VIII in the periodic table. It was discovered in 1735 in South America by Antoinio de Ulloa, a knowledgeable Spanish sailor who first named the metal 'platina'.

carrer.name: Platja d'Aro, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A tourist resort on the Costa Brava and now the biggest borough of Castell d'Aro (Baix Empordà).

carrer.name: Plató, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Athens or Aegina Island 428 B.C. - 347 B.C.). Greek philosopher. He founded The Academy in Athens.

carrer.name: Plegamans, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Initially called 'carrer d'en Marimon', and then later 'carrer de Plegamans', as a tribute to Marimon de Plegamans, an illustrious patriarch who owned land in this street. The Plegamans family are descendants of the Catalan nobleman Dalmau de Plegamans, who in 1151 was the captain general of Ramon Berenguer IV's squadrons.

carrer.name: Plom, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to lead ('plom'), the metal. It forms part of Zona Franca neighborhood, where the streets are named after commonly used tools and industrial materials.

carrer.name: Plutó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Latin name for Hades, god of the netherworld (just as Zeus was ruler of the heavens and Poseidon god of the waters).

carrer.name: Pobla de Lillet, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Berguedà.

carrer.name: Poble Romaní, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Name of the gypsy peoples and their language. The street pays tribute to the gypsy community which has settled in this area, around the square 'plaça del Raspall'.

carrer.name: Poblenou, Escullera del
carrer.descripcio: The result of the urban renewal in Poblenou's maritime area which was undertaken for the Olympic Games.

carrer.name: Poblenou, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: A public open space which has recently been developed and which adopted the name of the neighborhood.

carrer.name: Poblenou, Rambla del
carrer.descripcio: The popular name by which this street is known. It bears the same name as the neighborhood.
carrer.anteriors: Pg. del Triomf; Pº del Triunfo; Núm. 50 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Poble Sec, Mirador del
carrer.descripcio: An open area in the city located between 'passeig de Montjuïc' and 'carretera de Montjuïc', in the Sants-Montjuïc district.

carrer.name: Poblet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Santa Maria de Poblet Cistercian monastery, in the borough of Vimbodí (Conca de Barberà), founded in the 12th century.

carrer.name: Poesia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Pays homage to the art of poetry ('poesia'). A street in the Montbau neighborhood which forms part of a group of streets dedicated to the arts.

carrer.name: Poeta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Pays homage to the "rural poets" of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Poeta Boscà, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Boscà i Almogàver (Barcelona 1492 - 1542). Nobleman and soldier who served the Catholic King. He was the first Catalan writer who showed a preference for writing in Spanish rather than in Catalan. In addition, his literary group in Barcelona became a focal point in spreading the ideas of the Renaissance literary movement.
carrer.anteriors: Poeta Boscán; San Carlos; Francisco Magriñá

carrer.name: Poeta Cabanyes, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Manuel de Cabanyes i Ballester (Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1808 - 1833). Pre-Romanticist poet. However, the street owes it name to Francesc Cabanyes. He was a captain of the militia known as the 'miquelets'. His company was among the Catalan troops who defeated the Spanish army in the battle of Montjuïc on 26th January 1641. The qualifier 'poet' was added to the street name 'carrer de Cabanyes' in 1949 and thus the homage the city had paid to the Catalan patriot since the 19th century was replaced by the above mentioned poet.

carrer.name: Poeta Eduard Marquina, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: Eduard Marquina i Angulo (Barcelona 1879 - New York 1946). Writer. A leading figure in Spanish theatre. He created works of lyric poetry.

carrer.name: Poeta Masifern, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Masifern i Marcó (La Bisbal, Baix Empordà 1862 - Barcelona 1936). Poet and composer of 'sardanas' and popular songs.

carrer.name: Poliol, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the pennyroyal. A perennial highly aromatic plant, with oval leaves and pink or lilac-blue flowers. The street forms part of a group of highways dedicated to flowers, plants and shrubs.

carrer.name: Pollancre, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to the poplar tree. It belongs to the salicaceae family. The street forms part of a group of highways dedicated to shrubs and trees.
carrer.anteriors: Pg. de la Mare de Déu de la Salut

carrer.name: Pollença, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the northernmost part of Majorca, set against the rugged backdrop of the Sierra de Tramuntana.

carrer.name: Polònia, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Poland. The country in Central Europe in the Vistula and Oder river basins.

carrer.name: Polvorí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the 'camí'.

carrer.name: Polvorí, Escales del
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the steps ('escales') which lead to the Polvorí area.

carrer.name: Polvorí, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: The street led to a 17th century arsenal ('polvorí') which stood here for many years.

carrer.name: Pom d'Or, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: According to Balaguer, the name is due to a golden doorknob ('pom d'or') found on one of the houses in the street. According to Sampere i Miguel, it is a deformation of 'pont d'or' (the golden bridge), named because of an archway at one end of the street from where a tradesman's signboard with gold motifs once hung.

carrer.name: Pomar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Andreu Pomar i Santandreu (1827 - ?). Mason. He acquired the from land Pere Ventura i Canadell in 1866.

carrer.name: Pomaret, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the old farmhouse "Can Pomaret", which has been converted in the Modernist style and now houses a mental institution.

carrer.name: Pompeu Fabra, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Pompeu Fabra i Poch (Gràcia 1868 - Prada, Conflent 1948). Grammarian and lexicographer. He was the author of the Catalan dictionary 'Diccionari general de la llengua catalana'.

carrer.name: Pompeu Gener, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Pompeu Gener i Babot (Barcelona 1848 - 1920). Polygraph. Known as Peius. From a scientific, cosmopolitan and progessionist background, he took part in the First Pro-Catalan Congress (1880).

carrer.name: Ponce de León, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Juan Ponce de León (Santevós de Campos 1460 - Cuba 1521). Conquistador. He took part in the conquest of Grenada (1492) and Hispaniola. He was the governor of Boringuen, Puerto Rico.

carrer.name: Poncelles, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: 'Poncell' means bud. The street forms part of a group of highways named after trees and plants.

carrer.name: Pons i Clerch, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Llorenç Pons i Clerch (Barcelona 1830 - 1909). Manufacturer. He gave up the land for development on the condition that the square would be named after him.

carrer.name: Pons i Gallarza, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Lluís Pons i Gallarza (Sant Andreu de Palomar, Barcelona 1823 - Sóller, Western Majorca 1894). Poet. He studied philosophy and the arts, as well as law. He was a professor of rhetoric and poetry at the Institute de Barcelona (1849-1861). In 1861 he went to the Balearic Islands where he taught Spanish history and geography at the 'Institut de Balears'. Master of poetry in 1867.
carrer.anteriors: Pons y Gallarza; San Lorenzo, before 1900

carrer.name: Pons i Serra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Alexandre-Maria Pons i Serra (Barcelona 1859 - 1907). He owned a property on this street called 'el Clos de Vilana'. City Councilor (1904-1906).
carrer.anteriors: Pons y Serra; Pons; Cº Vecinal de Sarriá a Esplugues; Cº Antiguo de Pedralbes

carrer.name: Pons i Subirà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: 19th century. A journalist from Sant Martí de Provençals. He took an active interest in the political and cultural life of Sant Martí in the 1860's and 1870's.

carrer.name: Pont, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Led to the bridge ('pont') that crossed the Comtal irrigation channel.

carrer.name: Pont de Sant Martí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Recalls the bridge ('pont') built over a stream to aid traffic flow. The road leads to the bridge that crosses the railway line, the 'pont del Treball', and the Comtal irrigation channel.
carrer.anteriors: Puente de San Martín, before 1900; E. Boal

carrer.name: Pont del Treball, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Workers living in Sant Martí crossed this bridge to go to the glass factory in la Verneda.

carrer.name: Pontevedra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Pontevedra, a town in Galicia.
carrer.anteriors: Carretana (without effectiveness); San Francisco de Paula, before 1865

carrer.name: Pontils, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of Conca de Barberà. The street belongs to the Eduard Aunós housing estate, where the streets are named after towns and villages in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Pontons, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough in the Alt Penedès region.

carrer.name: Ponts, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough of La Noguera. It forms a set with the parallel street 'carrer Borges Blanques.'

carrer.name: Ponts de La Maquinista, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: In reference to the bridges ('ponts') built by iron manufacturer 'La Maquinista Terrestre y Marítima'. The company conducted business in the area between 1917 and 1991. The street is located within the shopping complex 'La Maquinista' between the roads 'carrer de Naus de La Maquinista' and 'carrer de Trens de La Maquinista', in the Sant Andreu district.

carrer.name: Porrera, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Priorat region. The road was formerly called 'carrer del Priorat' but was changed as another street in Barcelona bore this name. In this way the name has preserved the idea of the region by adopting that of one of its most important villages.

carrer.name: Port de la Selva, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Alt Empordà region.

carrer.name: Port Olímpic, Parc del
carrer.descripcio: Adopted the name of the nearby port bearing the same name.

carrer.name: Port Romà, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: In memory of the Ibero Roman settlement and port located south of Montjuïc. Many remains of the settlement have been found: silos, a roman quarry, kilns for firing amphorae, etc.

carrer.name: Port Vell, Mirador del
carrer.descripcio: A open space created when the port of Barcelona was rebuilt.

carrer.name: Porta, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: This passageway crosses the road 'carrer de Porta.'

carrer.name: Porta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: According to municipal records, the name of the street pays tribute to Pascual Porta i Margarit, a teacher and graduate in Philosophy and Arts. In 1869 he ran several schools. He was the principal of the school 'Colegio Peninsular de Barcelona'. He wrote several books, 'Història universal', amongst others.

carrer.name: Portadores, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: This street used to be full of master carpenters who, amongst other things, made vessels to transport wine on horse drawn carts. The name dates back to before 1778.

carrer.name: Portaferrissa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the heavily studded gateway that was built when the Rambla city walls were raised (1260). There was also an iron rod on the gate which served to contrast units of length. In 1374, mention is made of an inn near the 'porta ferrissa' (iron gateway): the name, therefore dates from at least the 14th century.

carrer.name: Portal de la Pau, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: This gateway ('portal') was built into the city walls on the seafront on 19th November 1850 to give access to the city from the wharf. The project was entrusted to Simó Ferré. Later, a marble tablet was put up to commemorate the peace ('pau') that the Marquis del Duero, the captain general, obtained in 1849.
carrer.anteriors: Puerta de la Paz; Junta Revolucionaria; Revolución, before 1873

carrer.name: Portal de l'Àngel, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: It includes the former 'Àngel' gateway and 'plaça de Santa Anna'. The name dates from the 15th century. Access to the gateway was gained by crossing a bridge. It is said that when Saint Vicenç Ferrer visited Barcelona in 1419, an angel appeared to him here and told him that his mission was to guard the city.
carrer.anteriors: Puerta del Ángel; Pl. Santa Ana (joined to it); Fivaller, before 1865; Portal

carrer.name: Portal de Santa Madrona, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It is the only part of Barcelona's three city walls that still stands. Building was begun in 1641 and completed in 1644. The name was given to the road because it led to Santa Madrona church at the foot of Montjuïc.
carrer.anteriors: Puerta de Santa Madrona, before 1900; Rbla. (o pg.) de Santa Madrona, 1865

carrer.name: Portal Nou, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In the past two other gateways bore the name 'Portal Nou'. One was built in 1297 (at one end of the Ribera neighborhood) and the other is mentioned in documents describing the fight against the 'Rondors' on 26th October 1625. In this case, the name refers to the newest of the gateways bearing this name. It was built at the same time as the Ciutadella, some time after 1716, destroyed in the 1843 uprising and knocked down in 1855 at the same time as the city walls.

carrer.name: Portbou, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Borough of the Alt Empordà region.

carrer.name: Portell, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Place name. Named after the 'Coll del Portell', a hill found on the way from Horta to Sant Cugat del Vallès. It was formerly called Portell de Valldaura as it crossed a royal estate bearing this name.
carrer.anteriors: Cº Casa Mora; Cº Coll de Portell; Cº Casa Durán

carrer.name: Portlligat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A neighborhood in the borough of Cadaqués (Alt Empordà). The street is in the Trinitat Nova area where many of the highways are dedicated to towns and villages on the Costa Brava.

carrer.name: Porto, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Porto (Oporto), the Portuguese city. This street in the Horta neighborhood forms part of a group together with the nearby streets named Tajo (Tagus), Lisboa (Lisbon) and Estoril.

carrer.name: Portocristo, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: A public square in the Porta neighborhood, where most of the streets are dedicated to places in Majorca. The name was put forward by the local inhabitants.

carrer.name: Portolà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rosa de Portolà i Guinart (Agullana, Alt Empordà 1821 - Barcelona 1890). Owner of the land where the street was built. She was married to Casimir de Gomis i de Ros, an important local landowner

carrer.name: Ports d'Europa, Avinguda dels
carrer.descripcio: The name, meaning 'Ports of Europe', comes from the fact that the port of Barcelona is nearby.

carrer.name: Portugal, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Owes its name to Portugal, the European country on the Iberian Peninsula.

carrer.name: Portugalete, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A town in the region of Vizcaya, near Bilbao.

carrer.name: Porxos, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Named because of the arcade ('porxos') that links the square with the highway' Gran Via de Les Corts Catalanes'. It is under the buildings that separate the two urban spaces.

carrer.name: Posoltega, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in Chinandega, in western Nicaragua. A disaster zone in the aftermath of Hurricane Mitch and the mudslide on the slopes of La Casita Volcano.

carrer.name: Potosí, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: A city in Bolivia. It is a stretch of the road 'carrer de Potosí' which is geographically different to the rest of the street.

carrer.name: Potosí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A city in Bolivia. The street belongs to an industrial estate in the Bon Pastor area, where the street names are dedicated to cities and places in Latin America

carrer.name: Pou, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Belongs to a group of streets describing characteristics of the area as it was before: 'Pou '(well), 'Molí' (windmill), 'Nou Pins '(pinewood) and 'Vinyar' (vineyard).

carrer.name: Pou de la Cadena, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It has had the same name since 1778. The name probably comes from the innovation of using a chain ('cadena') to draw water from wells rather than a rope.

carrer.name: Pou de la Figuera, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name dates from the 14th century.

carrer.name: Pou de la Figuereta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: An old highway in the Ciutat Vella district.

carrer.name: Pou de la Riera, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In reference to the Sant Miquel stream ('riera'), along which the first inhabitants of the old district of Gràcia settled.

carrer.name: Pou de l'Estanc, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: An old street in the Ciutat Vella district, it runs into the street 'carrer Rere Palau. '

carrer.name: Pou de l'Estany, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name of this street dates back to at least 1658. It is highly likely that it has had the same name since 1320 as records from this period reveal that permission was granted to relocate an oven that a citizen owned "in the area near 'pou de l'estany'".

carrer.name: Pou Dolç, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In reference to one of the wells ('pou') that could once be found in the Ciutat Vella district.

carrer.name: Prada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A town in Northern Catalonia, in the Conflent region. It forms part of a series of highways to the southwest of the river Besòs, which are dedicated to towns and cities in Northern Catalonia.

carrer.name: Praga, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Prague, the city in Bohemia and the capital of the Czech Republic.

carrer.name: Prat, Carretera del
carrer.descripcio: It takes its name from El Prat de Llobregat, a borough in the Baix Llobregat region.

carrer.name: Prat, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim de Prat i de Roca (1804 - 1872). He owned the property, called 'La Fontana', where the street now lies. Honorary councilor. Knight of the royal order 'Real de Ronda'. In 1831 he married Maria Ventura d'Abadal i Caballeria.

carrer.name: Prat de la Riba, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Enric Prat de la Riba i Sarrà (Castellterçol, Vallès Oriental 1870 - 1917). President of the Autonomous Community. Doctor of Law.

carrer.name: Prat d'en Rull, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Rull i Arbenach (18th - 19th centuries), a textile manufacturer who specialised in dying cloth. He set up the first cloth-dying business in the Les Corts district in 1786. His son, Joan Rull i Camarasa, carried on with the business.

carrer.name: Prats de Molló, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Vallespir region named after the events that took place there in 1926 when an invasion by the Catalan group 'Estat Català', led by Francesc Macià was thwarted.

carrer.name: Prats de Rei, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Anoia region.

carrer.name: Prats i Roquer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Prats i Roquer (Sant Martí Sarroca, Alt Penedès 1821 ' Barcelona, 1894). Prats i Roquer donated 80,000 pesetas to the savings bank Caixa de Barcelona to build cheap housing in that place. In 1927, during the First Dictatorship, a proposal was made to change the street name 'Prats i Roqué' to 'Marquès de Caldes de Montbui'. It seems that the Caixa d'Estalvis was opposed to this change.
carrer.anteriors: Prats y Roqué; Pablo Sabater; Prats y Roqué; Prats

carrer.name: Premià, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Premià de Mar, a borough in the Maresme region and a street name in Barcelona. In 1480, the town made a petition to the city of Barcelona in 1385, known as 'carreratge'. According to the terms of the petition, the inhabitants of the borough enjoyed the same rights and privileges as the inhabitants of the city.

carrer.name: Presseguer, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name means 'peach tree'. The street forms part of a group bearing the names of shrubs and trees.

carrer.name: Prim, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the 'rambla'.

carrer.name: Prim, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the 'rambla'.

carrer.name: Prim, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Prim i Prats (Reus, Baix Camp 1814 - Madrid 1870). Army officer and liberal politician. Military governor of Barcelona (1843). Count of Reus and Viscount of Bruc. Field marshal of Puerto Rico (1847). He took part in the Morocco campaign and led the army who fought in the Mexican War.

carrer.name: Primavera, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: A bucolic name for a passageway on Montjuïc Mountain.

carrer.name: Primer de Maig, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named because many demonstrations to celebrate the First of May have taken place here.

carrer.name: Príncep d'Astúries, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: The title given to the first in line of succession to the Spanish throne.
carrer.anteriors: Príncipe de Asturias, 07/03/1939; Prat de la Riba, 26/08/1931; Príncipe de Asturias, 09/09/1925; Ra. de Cassolas

carrer.name: Príncep de Girona, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: The Prince of Girona was the title given to the first in line of succession to the Catalan-Aragonese crown. The title was created in 1416 for King Alfons's eldest son who later ruled as Alfons IV. The present king, Juan Carlos I bestowed the title to his son Felipe in 1977.

carrer.name: Príncep de Viana, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Carlos of Aragon (Peñafiel, Castile and Leon 1421 - Barcelona 1461). He was the son of Joan II and Blanca of Navarre. He was the crown prince to the throne of Aragon and Navarre but was disinherited at the request of his stepmother.

carrer.name: Príncep d'Espanya, Moll del
carrer.descripcio: A wharf located in the southern part of the port.

carrer.name: Príncep Jordi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jordi de Hessen Darmstadt (Darmstadt 1669 - Barcelona 1705). Field marshal. He was appointed the Royal Deputy of Catalonia and Councillor of State to the Catalan-Aragonese crown. Grandee of Spain and made a knight of the order Toisón de Oro. He took Gibraltar, which he defended as governor. He took part in the battle of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Princesa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Isabel de Borbón y Borbón (Madrid 1831 - 1931). The street was built in 1853. The name pays homage to the Infanta Isabel, daughter of Queen Isabel II. She was proclaimed Princess of Asturias before the birth of her brother Alfonso, the future King Alfonso XII. She married Cayetano of the Two Sicilies, Count of Girgenti.
carrer.anteriors: Pablo Iglesias; Princesa, before 1853; Cádiz (a section)

carrer.name: Priorat, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A region of Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: Priorato; Beato Oriol, before 1900; Gos ? (very old)

carrer.name: Proclamació, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: In 1833 a proclamation ('proclamació') was made whereby, at the age of three, Maria Isabel Luisa (Madrid 1830 - Paris 1904), daughter to Fernando VII and Maria Cristina de las Dos Sicilias, became Queen Isabel II of Spain. This historic occasion is reflected in the name of the street.

carrer.name: Profeta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It is possible that the name is taken from Mayerbeer's opera, which was in vogue at the time the street was built.

carrer.name: Progrés, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The street is located between the roads 'carrer de la Llibertat' and 'carrer de Siracusa'. The area has always been a fervent supporter of progress ('progrés').

carrer.name: Provença, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Provence ('Provença') in the Languedoc region. King Ramon Berenguer III ruled over the region and was succeeded by his descendants from the House of Barcelona until 1245 when King Ramon Bereguer V of Provence died without male heirs. The name commemorates the union of Provence and Catalonia through the marriage of Dolça of Provence to the Count of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Provençals, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: From the place name 'Sant Martí de Provençals'. The word 'Provençals' probably originated from the settlers who arrived in the 9th and 10th centuries after the reconquest of Barcelona, some of whom were from Provence.

carrer.name: Providència, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from Divina Providència convent. It was founded in 1849 by sister Maria Teresa Argullo (Sarrià 1813 - Badalona, Barcelonès 1853) and destroyed in 1936. It faced onto the street 'carrer Ample de Gràcia' (now 'carrer Verdi') which explains why the street was also known as 'carrer de les Monges' - 'monges 'meaning nuns. It was given its present name by Messrs Masens, Rabassa and Torrente, who promoted the development of the area.

carrer.name: Pruit, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in Osona. The street is located in the Torre Baró neighborhood where most of the streets are dedicated to towns and places in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Pruit, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in Osona.

carrer.name: Prunera, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Prunera i Mariné, master builder, he bought the land where the passageway 'passatge Joan Forasté i Cambó' was built in 1875.

carrer.name: Puerto Príncipe, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A town in the province of Camagüey in Cuba, which was founded in 1515 as Santa Maria de Puerto Principe.

carrer.name: Puig Aguilar, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: In reference to an old place name that can be traced back to 919. It is a hill near Sierra Serola.

carrer.name: Puig Castellar, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from a mountain in the Marina Mountain Range, in the borough of Santa Coloma de Gramenet (Barcelonès), which is 300 m high. The remains of an Iberian settlement were discovered at the very top of the mountain. It was established by the Ibero Laietan peoples (5th or 4thcenturies BC) and lasted until 195 BC when it was sacked and burnt to the ground by the Roman legion led by Marco Porcio Caton during the Second Punic War.

carrer.name: Puig de Jorba, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from an area of land on the lands and dominions of the Marquis de la Manresana. It was owned by Manuel Maria Sivatte i Llopart (1866 - 1931). Records of 'Jorba' as a place name can be traced back to the year 991.

carrer.name: Puig d'Óssa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Comes from the old place name 'Monte de Ursa', records of which can be traced back to the year 986.

carrer.name: Puig i Cadafalch, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Puig i Cadafalch (Mataró, Maresme 1867 - Barcelona 1957). Architect, archaeologist, art historian and politician. President of the Autonomous Community of Catalonia. He co-founded the Institute for Catalan Studies. He lectured at Barcelona's School of Architecture.

carrer.name: Puig i Valls, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Puig i Valls (Tarragona 1845 - 1920). Publicist and forestry engineer. He established the Tree Festival. He drew up the plans for the Manresa to Cardona (Bages) railway line.

carrer.name: Puig Madrona, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: The passageway was once called 'passatge de la Muntanya', but was changed as it coincided with the name of another street in the city. The present name is taken from the beautiful mountain located between Papiol (Baix Llobregat) and Rubí (Vallès Occidental), whose stunning outline is an outstanding feature in the Vallès area.

carrer.name: Puigcerdà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Cerdanya region.

carrer.name: Puigcerdà, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Cerdanya region.

carrer.name: Puiggarí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Puiggarí i Llobet (Barcelona 1821 - 1903). Sketcher. Art historian. Lawyer. Archivist for the City Hall of Barcelona from 1867, he later became the head keeper of the archives. A member of the Fine Arts Academy and corresponding member of the Academy of San Fernando. (1865).

carrer.name: Puiggener, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Carles de Puiggener, Orís i Descatllar, Marquis of Castelldosrius, Baron of Santa Pau y Orís, Lord of Montescot. Owner of the land where the street was built. He conceded four properties to Miquel Vintró.

carrer.name: Puigmartí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Puigmartí (? - Barcelona 1863). Textile manufacturer. He made important contributions to further industry in Catalonia. He fitted his factories in Gràcia with steam powered machinery.

carrer.name: Puig-reig, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Berguedà region.

carrer.name: Puigxuriguer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Tomàs Puiguriguer i Burges (Barcelona 1793 - 1871). Presbyter. Canon of the Holy Cathedral of Barcelona. Knight of the Royal Order of Carlos III. He owned the land where the street was built. One of the cathedral's most notable canons. The correct spelling of his surname is 'Puigxuriguer'.

carrer.name: Pujades, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jeroni Pujades (Barcelona 1568 - Castelló d'Empúries, Alt Empordà 1635). Poet and chronicler. He wrote 'Crònica universal del Principat de Catalunya'. Doctor of Law, auditor of the High Court, and proxy general and judge for the county of Empúries. He was born in the street 'carrer de Sant Honorat'.

carrer.name: Pujades, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as the street.

carrer.name: Pujalt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A borough in the Anoia region, as is 'Pierola', the name of another street with which it forms a crossroads.

carrer.name: Pujol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Baptista Pujol i Riu (Barcelona 1835 - 1898). Concert pianist and piano teacher.

carrer.name: Pujolet, Passatge d'en
carrer.descripcio: The name of the passageway, as is the case of the street, makes a reference to the estate known as 'Can Pujolet'.

carrer.name: Puríssima, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The doctrine that the Virgin Mary was conceived free from all stain of original sin ('Puríssima Concepció'). The street is in the Horta neighborhood.

carrer.name: Puríssima Concepció, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from the Roman Catholic doctrine of the Immaculate Conception ('Puríssima Concepció'). The street is in the Poble Sec neighborhood.

carrer.name: Putget, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Leads to the hill bearing this name.

carrer.name: Quatre Camins, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: An ancient place name of the spot where four paths intersected: the way to Bellesguard; the old Sarrià path; the street of Raval - leading to the ancient urban centerof Sant Gervasi; and the path of Can Canals - which led, among other properties, to the Pedralbes estate, which in the 19th century was the property of the Marchioness of Moragas. The street of Quatre Camins used to go past the properties owned by Trinitat de Fontcuberta and Carmen de Dalmases.

carrer.name: Queixans, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A town of the Baixa Cerdanya region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Quer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This is the name of a castle in the municipality of Prats de Lluçanès, in the Osona region of Catalonia. The street is part of a group of houses named Ramon Albó, where the different ways are named after spots and towns in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Queralt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This is a mountain range on whose slope stands the Catalan city of Berga and the shrine of Our Lady that receives the mountain's name.

carrer.name: Quesada, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada (Córdoba 1499 - Mariquita, Nueva Granada 1579). A conquistador. He was the Marshall and councilor ('concejal') of Bogotá, and 'adelantado' of Nueva Granada. He came from a noble family and in 1535 he left for the West Indies as the General Auditor. He explored the Magdalena river (1536-1537). In 1538 he started the colonization of the new kingdom of Granada by founding the cities of Santa Fe de Bogotá, Vélez and Tunja.

carrer.name: Quetzal, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: This was named after the 'quetzal', the sacred bird of Central America, which features in the shield and the flag of the Republic of Guatemala.

carrer.name: Quevedo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco de Quevedo y Villegas (Madrid 1580 - Villanueva de los Infantes 1645). A poet and prose writer in the Spanish language. One of the leading figures in Spanish Baroque literature.

carrer.name: Química, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A street running parallel to another named Física street leading to Mineria street, in the northern area of the Zona Franca neighborhood.

carrer.name: Quintana, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: A surname of an ancient Barcelona lineage. Among the relevant personalities with this surname, the following could be singled out: a Quintana who in the year 1391, under the reign of Joan I, was in charge of a galley in an expedition to Sardinia; Miquel Quintana, a city lawyer in 1534; Joan Quintana, "egregious and magnificent doctor in 'quiscun dret '(all aspects of the Law)", towards the middle of the 16th century; 'misser' Miquel Quintana, a son of the former, a juror of the Council in 1563; 'misser 'Quintana, a Court regent in the Council of Aragon in 1601, and, throughout the 17th century, a great many Quintanas figure as members of the Catalan judicial system.

carrer.name: Quintana, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Quintana i Coronas (1864 - 1948). A carpenter. He bought some lands in this area, where this passage which received his name was opened in 1922.

carrer.name: Quito, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This street is named after the city of Quito, in Ecuador, the capital of the State. The street is located in the industrial Bon Pastor neighborhood, where most of the streets are named after cities in Latin America.

carrer.name: Rabassa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Rabassa i Pla was born in Malgrat de Mar, in the Maresme region of Catalonia. He owned the land on which this street was opened. Together with Miquel Masens i Soler and Manuel Torrente Flores, he bought a set of three pieces of land, all of which proceeded from the Alegre de Dalt bequest.

carrer.name: Rabí Rubèn, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: This street alludes to Rabbi Isaac Ben Reuben, Izchaq ha-Barkeloní (Barcelona 1073 - 1113), a Jewish poet of great renown. He wrote a commentary on the 'Ketubot' section of the 'Talmud'. He translated books from Arabic into Hebrew. Some of his works were subsequently printed in Amsterdam. Like most Barcelona Jews, he was probably buried in the Montjuïc Jewish cemetery (Montjuïc, in fact, means the Mountain ('mont') of the Jews ('juïc')). And it is for this reason that his name has been given to a street on the lower part of this mountain.

carrer.name: Rábida, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A Franciscan monastery located at Palos de la Frontera, in Huelva, Spain. Columbus lived there in 1485. He was well received by the friars there, and they lent full support to his project.

carrer.name: Radas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Agustí Radas. A Catalan soldier of the 17th century. He was the captain of the troops which, during the siege of Barcelona in 1651, defended the convent and the shrine of Santa Madrona, a fortified position on the mountain of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Radi, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Street named after the chemical element whose symbol is Ra and the atomic number 88. It is a street in the Zona Franca neighborhood, where most of the lanes are named after elements in the periodic table and tools used in industry.

carrer.name: Rafael Batlle, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Batlle i de Miquelerena (1889 - 1954). A physician who was the last Mayor of Sant Vicenç de Sarrià (1918-1921) and later town councilor of Barcelona (1922).

carrer.name: Rafael Benet, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Benet i Vancells (Terrassa, Vallès Occidental 1889 - Barcelona 1979). A painter and art scholar. He presided over the Cercle Artístic de Sant Lluc (1929), and was a member of the Sant Jordi Academy of Fine Arts and of the 'Societat Catalana d'Estudis Històrics'. He was also a corresponding member of the San Fernando Academy. He was named Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres in 1959.

carrer.name: Rafael Campalans, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Campalans i Puig (Barcelona 1887 - Torredembarra, Tarragonès 1933). Politician, writer, and industrial engineer. He was a Professor of Electrical Engineering and Physics at the Escola d'Agricultura, and Director of the Escola del Treball (1917).
carrer.anteriors: Carrer de Rafael Campalans 14/06/1991, Pau Claris; Pablo Clarís, before 1900

carrer.name: Rafael Capdevila, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Capdevila de Barceló (Barcelona 1883 - 1951). A Barcelona town councilor during the dictatorship of General Primo de Rivera. He was the head of the City Volunteers ('sometent') from District 10. He was awarded a medal of military merit. He lived in this street.

carrer.name: Ràfols, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Francesc Ràfols i Fontanals (Vilanova i la Geltrú, Garraf 1889 - Barcelona 1965). Art scholar, architect and painter.

carrer.name: Raimon Casellas, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Raimon Casellas i Dou (Barcelona 1855 - Sant Joan de les Abadesses, Ripollès 1910). Journalist and art critic. An historian of Catalan painting.

carrer.name: Raimon Noguera, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Raimon Noguera i Guzman, lawyer, was born in Barcelona on 9th January 1897, in the Carrer Ribot, 8. He obtained his Law degree in 1917 and worked as a Notary from 1922. He worked in Barcelona from 1935 ad right up to his retirement in 1972. He was an archivist, and was elected Dean of the Catalonian Association of Notaries (Col·legi de Notaris de Catalunya). He was a member of the Acadèmia de Jurisprudència i Legislació de Catalunya and of the Institut d'Estudis Catalans. He was the promoter and legal advisor of many cultural institutions and foundations. His participation in the creation of the Barcelona Picasso Museum proved decisive. He died in Barcelona on 19th May 1990. He lived in the Passeig de Gràcia, 101.

carrer.name: Rajoler, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A street named after a tile-maker or seller with a workshop in that street (the Catalan for tile is 'rajola').

carrer.name: Rajolers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: There was a small group of houses here in 1860 known as the tile workshops ('les rajoleries'). The name is a homage to the skilled tile-makers of the Sants neighborhood of Barcelona ('els destres rajolers de Sants').

carrer.name: Ram de l'Aigua, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: The name recalls the fact that most of the numerous manufacturing industries in the town of Sant Martí (18th and 19th centuries) stood on this area. In addition, it recalls the abundance of water that was here. This is the name that the residents have preserved for the place. Finally, for almost a century a well-known textile dyeing and starching industry, S. F. Vila, stood in this area.

carrer.name: Rambla, la
carrer.descripcio: A promenade which separates the first walled area of Barcelona from the Raval area. It runs from the harbor to Plaça de Catalunya. It began to undergo urban development in the middle of the 18th century, at which time it was simply a path and an occasional water-course, with King Jaume's walls on one side and the convent buildings on the other.
carrer.anteriors: Rbla. de las Flores; Rbla. de San José, before 1865; Rbla. de Santa Mónica, before 1865; Rbla. de los Estudios, before 1900; Rbla. de los Capuchinos, before 1900; Rbla. del Centro; Rbla. de Canaletas, before 1900

carrer.name: Ramelleres, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: The industry devoted to the preparation of bouquets started here in the 16th century (the Catalan for bouquet is 'ram'). On 18th May 1601, all the flower-ladies or 'ramelleres' established there walked beautifully attired in a procession to pray to Saint Raymond of Penyafort, who had just been canonized.

carrer.name: Ramiro de Maeztu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramiro de Maeztu Witney (Vitoria 1874 - Aravaca, Madrid 1936). Writer, essayist and diplomat. Member of the Real Academia Española - the Academy of the Spanish Language (1934).

carrer.name: Ramis, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Domènec Ramis i Pañella (1805 - ?) A textile manufacturer who became the owner of a property bestowed in his favor in 1849 and located in a place known as "the Old Capuchins". He was married to Lutgarda Agustí i Vilena. He built a factory in that street which was one of the first to be built in the Gràcia area. In the Nomenclature of 1980 we find it named after Joan Ramis i Ramis (Maó, Minorca 1746 - 1819), a scholar, historian and lawyer.

carrer.name: Ramon Albó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Albó i Martí (Barcelona 1872 - 1955). Sociologist and lawyer. He owned a number of properties in the area.

carrer.name: Ramon Amadeu, Placeta de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Amadeu i Grau (Barcelona 1745 - 1821) was a Baroque sculptor of Neoclassical tendencies who did a lot of work on representations of the manger. He was a member of the Barcelona Sculptors' Guild (1770) and of the San Fernando Academy. He resided in the city of Olot for some time.

carrer.name: Ramon Batlle, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Batlle i Ribas (Barcelona 1837 - 1906). Textile technician who invented the Catalan frame. He founded the first school for the teaching of mechanical weaving.

carrer.name: Ramon Berenguer el Gran, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Berenguer III, known as ''el Gran'' (the Great) (Rodés, Roergue 1082 - Barcelona 1131). Count of Barcelona from 1096.
carrer.anteriors: Berenguer el Grande; 11 de Noviembre 1918, approved on 13/11/1918; Berenguer el Grande

carrer.name: Ramon Berenguer el Vell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Berenguer I, known as 'el Vell' (the Old) (before 1023 - Barcelona 1076). Count of Barcelona from 1035. Son of Berenguer Ramon I and his first wife, Sancha of Castile.

carrer.name: Ramon Calsina, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Calsina i Baró (Barcelona 1901 - 1992), painter, draftsman and engraver. He trained in the Baixas academy (1912) and in the Llotja school (1920). In 1964 he was awarded the Ynglada-Guillot international drawing prize. He has a very personal, precise and stylized manner of drawing - a kind of magical realism.

carrer.name: Ramon Mas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A carpenter from the Ribera area of the Barceloneta neighborhood of Barcelona. He was well known as one of the leaders of the City Volunteers. He was killed at the Ciutadella castle in Barcelona, during the Spanish War of Independence.

carrer.name: Ramon Miquel i Planas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1874 - 1950). Bibliophile and scholar. He was the President of the 'Institut Català de les Arts del Llibre 'and a member of the Academy of Fine Letters and of the Academy of Fine Arts of Sant Jordi.

carrer.name: Ramon Riera, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Josep Narcís Riera i Moliner (Barcelona 1875 - 1937). Lithographer and draughtsman. He is associated with an councilor of the town of Sant Andreu in 1911 responsible for the final urban development of the Carrer Malats. He made improvements in market-places and replaced a fountain that contained a street-light in the Plaça d'Orfila.

carrer.name: Ramon Rocafull, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A Catalan nobleman. Head of the Barcelona Regiment, he defended Salses from the attacks of the French (1503).

carrer.name: Ramon Trias Fargas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1922 - El Masnou, Maresme 1989). Economist and politician. Bachelor of Economics and Doctor of Laws. Master of Arts from the University of Chicago. Numerary member of the Institute for Catalan Studies (1968). Professor of Public Finances at the Faculty of Economic Sciences of the Universitat de Barcelona (1969). A man of liberal convictions, he founded the party called Esquerra Democràtica de Catalunya (1975). Member of the Spanish Parliament on behalf of the Pacte Democràtic de Catalunya (1977) and subsequently of Convergència i Unió (1979). Member of the Tri-lateral Commission from 1979. Minister of Economy and Finances of the Generalitat de Catalunya (Catalan Autonomous Government) (1980). Councilor and Leader of the Opposition at Barcelona Town Council (1983-1987). Senator for Barcelona (1986). President of the Center for Autonomous Community Relations (1988). Minister of Economy of the Generalitat de Catalunya (Catalan Autonomous Government) (1988).

carrer.name: Ramon Turró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ramon Turró i Darder (Girona 1854 - Barcelona 1926). Biologist, philosopher and journalist. Member of the Acadèmia de Medicina de Barcelona. President of the Societat de Biologia and of the Societat Catalana de Filosofia de Barcelona. Head of Barcelona's Microbiological Laboratory. Member of the Institute for Catalan Studies.

carrer.name: Ramón y Cajal, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Santiago Ramón y Cajal (Petilla de Aragón 1852 - Madrid 1934). Spanish histologist. Professor of Histology at Madrid University. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1906. In his articles for the press, he used a pseudonym - "Doctor Bacteria".
carrer.anteriors: Doctor Ramón y Cajal; Zurbano, before 1900; Caballers (very old)

carrer.name: Raquel Meller, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Marquès i López (Tarazona, Aragon 1888 - Barcelona 1962). Singer. Her career started in 1907 under the artistic name of Raquel Meller. She was the first singer at the Arnau theater of Barcelona in 1911. She made her debut at the Parisian Olympia in 1919 and performed in London, Berlin, New York and Buenos Aires. The music for Charles Chaplin's film 'City Lights' included 'The Violet Seller' in her honor. She performed in Barcelona until 1943.

carrer.name: Raset, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This street was opened in land once owned by Magí Modolell del Puig i Negrevernís, whose son Vicenç Modolell i Vallmajor, in his will dated 28th December 1861, mentioned a granddaughter of his by the name of Gaietana Raset i Vallmajor de Batllori.

carrer.name: Rasos de Peguera, Avinguda dels
carrer.descripcio: An area of the foothills of the Catalan Pyrenees forming an anticlinal fold.

carrer.name: Rasos de Peguera, Jardins dels
carrer.descripcio: An area of the foothills of the Catalan Pyrenees forming an anticlinal fold, in the north-western area of Berga.

carrer.name: Raspall, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: There used to be a shop in this square showing a large brush ('raspall 'in Catalan).
carrer.anteriors: Santa Joaquina de Vedruna, 29/04/1959; Madre Vedruna; Roque Barció, 05/09/1907; Igualdad, before 1900

carrer.name: Ratés, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Jacinto de Ratés i de Babot (Malgrat de Mar, Maresme 1799 - Barcelona 1879). Doctor of Medicine. Landowner in the area of Sant Martí de Provençals. There are documents proving that in 1871 up to eight different pieces of land were his property in that town. Two of them lay at either side of the property through which the street was opened. There is no evidence to suggest that the land of the lane was his own. He married Josepa Jordana and later Teresa Vinyoles.

carrer.name: Rauric, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: A very ancient Catalan family name, going back to the Visigothic period. Some documents of the 14th century that mention this name are still extant. For instance, in 1335 a certain Arnau Raurich ceded some ground rents to one Romeu Çacosta.

carrer.name: Raval, Rambla del
carrer.descripcio: An urban area created on the basis of the Pla Central del Raval de Ciutat Vella. It includes the streets of Sant Jeroni and La Cadena, which are integrated into the new area.

carrer.name: Ravella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A very common surname in the Sant Gervasi neighborhood where this street is. In 1896 Pau Rabella and Francesc Rabella were landowners in the then town of Sant Gervasi, but no connection can be found with the naming of the street. Etymologically speaking, 'ravella', 'revella' and 'rabella' is the feminine of 'revell' or 'rabell', which could come from Latin 'rebellis' (rebel).

carrer.name: Rec, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In the twelfth and thirteenth centuries, this street was a water-course where the excess waters from the Comtal irrigation channel were disgorged, giving movement to the mills that were there before finally flowing into the sea.
carrer.anteriors: Rech, before 1865; Boca de Rech; Molins de Mar

carrer.name: Rec Comtal, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The waters of the Comtal irrigation channel used to flow along here. This was a Roman channel restored by Count Mir toward the end of the tenth century.

carrer.name: Recesvint, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? - Gérticos 672). A Visigoth king (649 - 672), son of Khindasvint. He convened the seventh, ninth and tenth Councils of Toledo and published the 'Liber iudiciorum'.
carrer.anteriors: Recesvinto; Arquímedes (a section); San José, before 1900

carrer.name: Rector Bruguera, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc d'Assís Bruguera i Lladó (Barcelona 1802 - 1870). Priest. Rector of the parish of Sant Miquel in the Barceloneta neighborhood. He died of yellow fever after having aided his parishioners to fight the disease.
carrer.anteriors: Guàrdies Salvat i Manzano; San Andrés, before 1900

carrer.name: Rector de Vallfogona, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Vicenç Garcia i Torres (Tortosa, Baix Ebre 1582 - Vallfogona de Riucorb, Conca de Barberà 1623). A popular poet who signed his works with the name of Rector de Vallfogona.

carrer.name: Rector Oliveras, Jardins del
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Oliveras i Prats, parish priest, was born at L'Hospitalet de Llobregat in 1884. He was the rector of the parish church of La Concepció in Barcelona. He died in 1953.

carrer.name: Rector Oliveras, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Jaume Oliveras i Prats (L'Hospitalet de Llobregat 1884 - Barcelona 1953). He was the Rector of the Concepció parish church.
carrer.anteriors: Párroco Oliveras; Iglesia de la Concepción

carrer.name: Rector Triadó, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Vicenç Maria Triadó i Constansó (Barcelona 1833 - 1923), Rector of the church of the Sant Àngel Custodi of Barcelona, from 1882 to 1893. On taking possession of the church, he found a very poor building and an even poorer rectory. His actions, together with the activities that he promoted (for instance, even asking the Imperial House of Austria for alms), allowed him to build a new church. During the plague and the fevers of the nineteenth century he was one of the first to care for the sick.
carrer.anteriors: Párroco Triadó; Jaime de Urgel, el Desdichado; Ángeles López de Ayala; Baró de Griñó; Canónigo Pibernat; Sarrià; Santa Isabel ?

carrer.name: Rector Ubach, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Fèlix Ubach i Claris (Berga, Berguedà 1779 - Barcelona 1864). Rector from 1817 (and for forty-seven years) of the parish church of Sants Gervasi i Protasi, in the then independent village of Sant Gervasi de Cassoles. He promoted the building of the first important church in the village, which enlarged the original small church of the town.
carrer.anteriors: Párroco Ubach, 19/08/1868; Amadeo Colldeforns; Averroes, 27/09/1876 (a section)

carrer.name: Rector Voltà, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Joan Voltà (Masquefa, Anoia 1731 - Sarrià 1791). Rector of the parish church of Sarrià from 1777 till the day of his death. He fomented the works for the new parish church.
carrer.anteriors: Párroco Voltá; Rector Voltá (Town Hall of Sarrià); Iglesia

carrer.name: Rectoret, Avinguda del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the caretaker at Can Planas, who used to help out in the church of Vallvidrera and was for this reason named "el rectoret" (the little Rector).

carrer.name: Rectoria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The Rectory of the parish church of Sant Joan d'Horta is in this street.

carrer.name: Redemptor, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Jesus Christ the Redeemer. Through the death of Jesus a 'condigna redemptio' is offered to God on behalf of humanity represented by Jesus Christ, God-made-man, as a price for the salvation of mankind.
carrer.anteriors: Redentor; Virgen de Montserrat; Sin nombre

carrer.name: Regàs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Camp d'en Regàs, an estate also known as "Camp de la Figuera". The street was opened in 1868. The surname Regàs is widely spread in Sant Gervasi, and it is difficult to associate it with any specific person.

carrer.name: Regent Mendieta, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Jaime Álvarez de Mendieta y García de la Cuesta López y Escobedo (Valladolid 1759 - Barcelona 1816?). Judge, Dean and acting President of the Audiència de Barcelona (Barcelona High Court). On the 9th of April 1809 he refused to swear loyalty to the government imposed by the Napoleonic forces. 'Regent 'is the name used to refer to the magistrate presiding over a territorial 'Audiència.'
carrer.anteriors: Regente Mendieta, 19/11/1929; Lletra F (Map of the enlargement of Les Corts), 29/01/1925

carrer.name: Regent Mendieta, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the street.

carrer.name: Regomir, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the street.

carrer.name: Regomir, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: At the beginning of the eleventh century, Count Mir began the restoration of the old Roman channel in order to ensure irrigation, provide power to the mills, and bring water to the city gates. He directed the flow on to the Merdançà stream, deviating the flow of the latter from the old harbor and taking the channel to the sea along the foot of the city walls until the point of the downward path eventually known as "del Regomir".
