A more credible version is that it is a family surname, taking into account that family surnames take their origin from names of places. Mateu Regomir was a City Councilor in 1258. The 'Castrum' 'Regominorum' is mentioned in the year 1025.

carrer.name: Rei, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: This is the King's Square because the palace of the Counts of Barcelona and the associated chapel of Santa Àgata stand in front of it. It dates from the thirteenth century. It has witnessed innumerable historical events throughout the centuries.

carrer.name: Rei Martí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Martí I 'the Humane', King of Catalonia and Aragon (Perpignan, Roussillon 1356 - Barcelona 1410). The last King of the Catalan royal house.
carrer.anteriors: Rey Martín; Gedró (from Gayarre to Joanot Martorell); Francesc Batiste; Santa Ana, before 1900

carrer.name: Reial, Plaça
carrer.descripcio: This square stands where the old monastery of the Capuchin friars formerly stood, which was built in 1718 and pulled down in 1848. Its royal name comes from the fact that Queen Isabel II laid the first stone of what should have been a monument to King Fernando 'el Católico', which in the end was not erected.

carrer.name: Reig i Bonet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Reig i Bonet (Barcelona ? - 1868). Manufacturer. Deputy Mayor of Barcelona in 1864. Knight of the Real Orden de Carlos III, by appointment of Queen Isabel II in 1859. He was the representative of Spain and Royal Commissioner in the London Exhibition of 1862. In the street that bears his name he built a huge silk manufacturing plant from 1856 to 1863 which became one of the leading plants in the industry and was responsible for the urban advancement of that neighborhood. He bought the estate from Eulàlia Simó i Farriols.

carrer.name: Reina Amàlia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Maria Josepha Amalia of Saxony (? 1803 - Aranjuez, Madrid 1829). Third wife of Fernando VII. The name was given to the street to commemorate the visit of the royal consorts to Barcelona on 4th December 1827.
carrer.anteriors: Amàlia, before 1865; Reina Doña Josefa Amalia

carrer.name: Reina Cristina, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Maria Christina of Naples (Naples 1806 - Paris 1878). The fourth wife of Fernando VII, mother of Isabel II. After the death of Fernando (1833) she was the Queen Regent in Spain. She was forced to abdicate in 1840, at which time she retired to Paris.

carrer.name: Reina Elionor, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Elionor of Sicily (? 1325 - Lleida, Segrià 1375). Queen of Catalonia and Aragon. Third wife of King Pere 'el Cerimoniós '('the Lover of Ceremony'), who gave her as a present the Queen's Palace (next to the street), pulled down in 1855 to build houses for rent.

carrer.name: Reina Elisenda de Montcada, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: (? 1292 - Sarrià 1364). Third wife of Jaume II and daughter of Pere de Montcada, she erected the Monastery of Pedralbes.
carrer.anteriors: Ctra. de Cornella a Fogás de Tordera; Ctra. de Esplugas (a section)

carrer.name: Reina Maria Cristina, Avinguda de la
carrer.descripcio: Maria Christina of Habsburg-Lorena (Moravia 1858 - Madrid 1929). Second wife of Alfonso XII and mother of Alfonso XIII.
carrer.anteriors: Pi y Maragall; América; Reina Maria Cristina

carrer.name: Reina Maria Cristina, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the avenue.
carrer.anteriors: Alejandro Lerroux; Reina Maria Cristina; Luis Bello

carrer.name: Reina Victòria, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Victoria-Eugenia of Battenberg (Balmoral Castle, Scotland 1887 - Lausanne, Switzerland 1969). Daughter of Prince Henry of Battenberg and Princess Beatrice of Great Britain (youngest grand-daughter of Queen Victoria). Wife of Alfonso XIII (they married on 31st May 1906).
carrer.anteriors: Mariana Pineda, 26/08/1931; Reina Victòria, 21/01/1915; Escornalbou, 05/09/1907; Reina Regente, 03/05/1901; Batllori, 05/01/1876;

carrer.name: Reina Victòria, Jardins de la
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the street.

carrer.name: Reineta, Camí de la
carrer.descripcio: This is the name of the most characteristic and popular amphibious animal of the Collserola range behind Barcelona. It has smooth green skin, long thin legs, and "fingers" ending in adhesive disks. The blue variety, which appears as the result of a lack of a certain pigment, has triggered a rush to capture these specimens, and this is endangering the survival of the species.
carrer.anteriors: Alt de Mas Sauró ; C. de l'Atzavara (a section)

carrer.name: Reis Catòlics, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Fernando II of Catalonia and Aragon, named 'el Católico' (Sos, Aragon 1452 - Madrigalejo 1516), King of Castile (Fernando V), Sicily (Fernando II) and Naples (Fernando III), and Isabel of Castile, named 'la Católica' (Madrigal de las Altas Torres 1451 - Medina del Campo 1504), Queen of Castile-Leon, and of Catalonia and Aragon).

carrer.name: Reixac, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Reixac (fifteenth century), painter to "the Lord King". Member of a family of artists. The street is part of a number of thoroughfares in the South-West part of the Besòs neighborhood dedicated to artists.

carrer.name: Rellotge, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: It was opened in 1862 by Arnús and Codina, owners of the land. There used to be a large clock in the middle of the thoroughfare with the time in the different capitals of the world, and the days of the month and the lunar phases.

carrer.name: Rembrandt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Harmensz van Rijn (Leiden 1606 - Amsterdam 1669). Painter. The leading exponent of seventeenth century Dutch art. Of classicist leanings, he was influenced by Caravaggio.

carrer.name: Remei, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after Our Lady of All Remedies (Mare de Déu del Remei), titular of the Les Corts parish church. This Marian advocation appeared in the fourteenth century as a result of the plagues that ravaged Europe. This Advocation bears some relationship with the Trinitarians.

carrer.name: Renaixença, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: This refers to 'La Renaixença', the nineteenth century period responsible for the renaissance of Catalan language and literature.

carrer.name: Renart, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Renart i Arús (Sarrià 1783 - Barcelona 1853). Architect, urban designer and theater decorator, the precursor of the 19th century renaissance of Catalan theater. He was the leading Catalan urban planner before Ildefons Cerdà, and a defender of the City's monumental heritage. Member of the Barcelona Academy of Fine Letters (1822).

carrer.name: Repartidor, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: There appears to have lived a water-seller in this street.

carrer.name: República Argentina, Avinguda de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after Argentina, a Latin American republic.
carrer.anteriors: Pº de la Diputación, 1879; Ctra. de Sant Cugat; Hermosilla (a section), 1870

carrer.name: República Dominicana, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A country in Central America, the capital of which is Santo Domingo. It occupies part of the island which Columbus named Hispaniola and which, in 1682, was divided between France (the territory was subsequently named Haiti), and Spain. It was the first European settlement in the New World, with the first university, church, cathedral and royal court. With the approval of this name, the list of Latin American countries represented in street names in Barcelona was completed. The approval of these names began in 1908.

carrer.name: Requesens, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A dynasty of merchants and citizens already established in Tarragona during the thirteenth century. One of the most famed member of this lineage was Lluís de Requesens i de Zúñiga (Barcelona 1528 - Brussels 1576). Great Knight Commander of Castile of the Order of Saint James. Advisor of Juan de Austria. Ambassador in Rome before Pius IV. Son of Juan de Zúñiga i Avellaneda and Estefania de Requesens i Rois de Liori, he took up her mother's name for inheritance purposes.

carrer.name: Rere el Cementiri Vell, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: It means 'Behind the Old Cemetery', the Cemetery of the East or of Poblenou, the first Barcelona necropolis outside the walls.

carrer.name: Rere Palau, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Literally 'behind the Palace', the street owes its name to the fact that it stood behind the Palau dels Lloctinents, later Royal Palace, built in 1668 by an order of Philip IV. The palace disappeared after a fire in 1875.
carrer.anteriors: Detrás Palacio; Antonio Ulled; Detrás Palacio, before 1900

carrer.name: Rere Sant Just, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the fact of being behind the church of Sant Just.

carrer.name: Residència, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The street owes its name to a residence for widows of army officers.

carrer.name: Reus, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the municipality of Reus in the Baix Camp region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Revolució de Setembre de 1868, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: A revolutionary coup known as "la Gloriosa", promoted by Generals Prim, Topete and Serrano, aimed at the dethronement of Queen Isabel II.

carrer.name: Rialb, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rialb (originally written Rialp), from Latin 'rivo albo'. A philanthropist from Sant Andreu de Palomar. A character associated with the Baron of Rialp (Rialb), an industrialist and Councilor of the Town Hall. The surname Rialb is found among the landowners of the area, like Josep de Peguera i Rialb (eighteenth century), father of Joan de Peguera i Bayllet, who has a street dedicated to him.

carrer.name: Ribagorça, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: One of the regions of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Ribelles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A small town in the municipality of Bassegoda, in the La Garrotxa region of Catalonia. The street belongs to the Ramon Albó group of buildings, where thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in the Girona province.

carrer.name: Ribera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: An old quarter of Barcelona, partially razed by Philip V in order to build the Ciutadella fortress.

carrer.name: Ribes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Ribes de Freser, a municipality of the Ripollès region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Ribes, Carretera de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the street.

carrer.name: Ricard Canals, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Ricard Canals i Llambí (Barcelona 1876 - 1931). Self-taught painter. He was a companion of Nonell, Pichot and Mir. He exhibited in the main cities of Europe and in New York (1902).

carrer.name: Ricard Zamora, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ricard Zamora i Martínez (Barcelona 1901 - 1978). A famous sportsman and goal-keeper.

carrer.name: Ricard Zamora, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Ricard Zamora i Martínez, a sportsman, was born in Barcelona on February 14th 1901, in Carrer Diputació 189. He was a renowned goalkeeper. Since 1920, he played for the Spanish national soccer team on forty-six occasions. He played for several Spanish Premier League (Primera Divisió) teams: for Espanyol from 1916 to 1919, for FC Barcelona from 1922 to 1931, and for Real Madrid from 1931 to 1936. He was the Spanish national coach in 1952 and worked as Technical Secretary for Espanyol since 1957. He also worked as a sports journalist since 1935. He died on September 8th 1978. He used to live in Carrer del Comte d'Urgell 33.

carrer.name: Ricardo Calvo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ricardo Calvo Agostí (Madrid 1875 - 1966). Spanish actor.

carrer.name: Ricardo Villa, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ricardo Villa (Madrid 1871 - 1935). Spanish composer. Founded the Banda Municipal de Madrid (1909). He conducted the Teatro Real orchestra.

carrer.name: Ricart, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Miquel Ricart i Domènec owned a piece of land from the Camp de la Sínia. He was succeeded by his son, Miquel Ricart i Catà.

carrer.name: Riego, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael del Riego y Tuñas (Santa Maria de Tuñas, Asturias 1785 - Madrid 1823). Army officer of Liberal leanings. He fought against Napoleon. Field Marshall, and Captain-General of Galicia and Aragon. Member of Parliament. He started the movements of insurrection which eventually led to the re-establishment of the 1812 Constitution in 1820.

carrer.name: Riells, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Riells de Montseny (its official name is Riells i Viabrea). A municipality of the La Selva region in Catalonia. The street belongs to the Ramon Albó group of buildings, where thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in the Girona province.

carrer.name: Riera Alta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: An old stream that took the waters from Valldonzella. A document from 1498 speaks of a group of houses facing "the street leading to the new walls through where the Valldonzella stream used to flow".

carrer.name: Riera Baixa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The lower continuation of Riera Alta.
carrer.anteriors: Riera Baja, before 1900; Riera Baja d'en Prim, before 1865

carrer.name: Riera de Sant Miquel, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A place name. An old sandy spot down the Collserola stream.

carrer.name: Riera de Tena, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The Tena stream took its name from a cartwright's workshop, named Can Tena, which stood along its course. The same happened with the Escuder stream, of which it is in fact a continuation, which took the name from the old Can Escuder farmhouse.

carrer.name: Riera de Vallcarca, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A stream that increases the waters of the L'Olla torrent.

carrer.name: Riera d'Horta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after a stream which owed its name to the old town of Sant Joan d'Horta, which it crossed. Next it flowed down to Sant Martí de Provençals through the La Sagrera area, and run parallel to the Besòs river until it flowed into the sea.
carrer.districtes: NOU BARRIS (08) SANT ANDREU (09) SANT MARTÍ (10)

carrer.name: Riereta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: This street used to be a watercourse in older days.

carrer.name: Rio de Janeiro, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Rio de Janeiro, the Brazilian city which had been the federal capital until 1960.

carrer.name: Ríos Rosas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antonio de los Ríos Rosas (Ronda 1812 - Madrid 1873). An Andalusian politician.

carrer.name: Ripoll, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: An old Catalan family which has produced important people. Among them, Jaume Ripoll i Vilamajor (Preixana, Urgell 1779 - Santa Eugènia de Berga, Osona 1841), ecclesiastic and scholar; Antoni de Ripoll (seventeenth century), lawyer, university Professor and Great Judge of Catalonia; Brother Francesc Ripoll (seventeenth century), theologian, General Preacher of the Holy Land, etc.

carrer.name: Ripollès, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A natural region of Catalonia. Nevertheless, it would appear that the agreement (accorded in 1908) was meant for the Ripoll river.

carrer.name: Ripollet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Ripollet del Vallès, a municipality of the Vallès Occidental region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Rita Bonnat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rita Jeanne Felícia Bonnat Dezermeaux (Madrid 1803 - Bordeaux 1882). A nun from the Sisters of the Holy Family of Bordeaux, which had a convent in Barcelona. At the end of the nineteenth century they bought the country estate of the Augustinians of Les Corts, where they set up the community and school of Our Lady of Loreto. The streets of the area are meant as a reminder of this - Bordeus, Loreto and Rita Bonnat.

carrer.name: Ritme, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after rhythm. A group of thoroughfares in the Montbau neighborhood dedicated to related themes - Dansa, Cançó, Pantomima, Lírica, Mímica.

carrer.name: Riu de la Plata, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A great estuary of South America on the Atlantic Coast.

carrer.name: Riu de l'Or, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The Gold River ('Río de Oro') was an old Spanish colony in West Africa. In the famous Catalan fifteenth century map preserved in the French National Library in Paris the discovery made by Jaume Ferré can be read: 'Partich l'uxer d'En Jac Ferrer per anar al Riu de l'Or el jorn de Sen Lorens que és a X de agost i fo en l'any MCCCXLVI',
carrer.anteriors: Río de Oro, 07/07/1942; Pje. del Cadci

carrer.name: Riudarenes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Riudarenes, a municipality of the La Selva region of Catalonia. The name was awarded (1907) in remembrance of the tragic sacking and destruction of the town by the Castilian troops during the war of 1640.

carrer.name: Riudaura, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Properly speaking, 'Ridaura' (a form more akin to the compound names with 'riu '(river), which tend to drop the 'u' when this is no longer pronounced). A municipality of the La Garrotxa region of Catalonia, at the source of the Ridaura river, in the Western confines of the region.

carrer.name: Riudecanyes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Riudecanyes, a municipality of the Baix Camp region of Catalonia. It had formed part of the Comuna del Camp de Tarragona and belonged to the barony of Escornalbou.

carrer.name: Riudoms, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Riudoms, a municipality of the Baix Camp region of Catalonia. The street belongs to the Eduard Aunós group of buildings, where thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Rius i Taulet, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc de Paula Rius i Taulet (Barcelona 1833 - Olèrdola, Alt Penedès 1890). Politician and Mayor of Barcelona (1872-1873, 1874, 1881-1884 and 1886-1889). Marquis of Olèrdola. He is famous for the numerous urban transformation projects of the city undertaken by him, and as organizer of the Universal Exhibition of Barcelona in 1888.

carrer.name: Rivadeneyra, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Manuel Rivadeneyra (Barcelona 1805 - Madrid 1872). Publisher and printer.

carrer.name: Rivero, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the 'Baixada'.

carrer.name: Rivero, Baixada de
carrer.descripcio: Nicolás María Rivero (Sevilla 1814 - Madrid 1878). Lawyer and doctor. He went into politics and contributed to the success of the September Revolution of 1868 in Spain. He presided over the Spanish constituent Parliament in 1869. Mayor of Madrid (1868).

carrer.name: Robacols, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Name of a country house and farm in El Clot.

carrer.name: Robador, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Name of a Catalan family. A deed of 1363 already mentions this street with exactly the same name, and it is a street prior to 1265.

carrer.name: Robert Gerhard, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Robert Gerhard i Ottenwaelder (Valls, Alt Camp 1895 - Cambridge 1970). Musician. Music Professor at the Escola Normal, of the Generalitat de Catalunya (Catalan Autonomous Government) in 1931. He worked in the music section of the Biblioteca de Catalunya.

carrer.name: Robert Gerhard, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Robert Gerhard i Ottenwaelder (Valls, Alt Camp 1895 - Cambridge 1970). Musician.

carrer.name: Robert Robert, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Robert Robert i Casacuberta (Barcelona 1828 - Madrid 1873). Writer and politician. At the age of 21 he moved to Madrid where he wrote for different newspapers. He founded the 'Diario Madrileño'. As a keen member of the Partido Democrático, he took active part in the Revolution of 1854. After an article published by him in the 'Tio Crispín' satyrical journal which he himself had founded, he was imprisoned in 1855 for two years in El Saladero, from which he came out gravely ill. >From 1856 he became an active member of the editorial committee of 'La Discusión'. He returned to Barcelona for political motives in 1864, taking up accommodation in Sant Pere Més Alt, number 4, 2nd story. He published the leaflet 'Al partido democrático' (1865), where he defended an 'entente' between Pi i Margall and Castelar. He married Joana López y Martínez on April 1st 1865 at the parish church of Santa Maria del Pi. She was from El Ferrol, in Galicia, Spain. He published in Barcelona a set of 26 articles in Catalan. He even wrote some poetry and in 1866 he acted as Secretary of Barcelona's Floral Games (a poetry contest). After the September Revolution he was councilor of Barcelona (1868) and member of the Spanish Parliament for Manresa (1869). He founded 'El Cohete', which he continued publishing from Madrid, where he moved again. In 1873 he was named Ambassador of the Spanish Republic in Switzerland, an appointment he was never able to take up.

carrer.name: Robí, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the ruby, the precious stone. The name is part of a group of thoroughfares named by jeweler Josep Rossell i Imbert in 1850, when he promoted the opening of the streets. He gave them names of precious stones and metals.

carrer.name: Robínia, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the robinia, a type of shrub. It is part of a group of streets that bear names of trees and shrubs.
carrer.anteriors: Av. Doctor Fleming; Enginyer La Cierva

carrer.name: Robrenyo, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Robrenyo i Tort (Barcelona 1780 - the Caribbean Sea 1838). Actor, playwright and poet.

carrer.name: Roc Boronat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Roc Boronat i Font, politician and writer. He was born in the Poblenou district of Barcelona on 6th December 1897, in the Carrer del Llatzeret, 18. During the dictatorship of General Primo de Rivera he managed, together with Josep Rovira, the office of Francesc Macià that had been set up in Toulouse (Languedoc). He took part in the Prats de Molló uprising (Fets de Prats de Molló) in 1926. In 1931 he went back to Barcelona and joined the Esquerra Republicana political party, and was elected a member of the Barcelona Town Council, representing that party. After 1939, he went into exile in Mexico, where he wrote several plays. He was the Founder and first President of the Association of the Blind of Catalonia, from which institution he devised and implemented the lottery of the blind ("cupó del cec"), the use of the white stick, and the award of a pension. He died in Mexico in 1965.
carrer.anteriors: Lutxana, 12/06/1980 ; Luchana, 07/03/1939 ; Cardoner, 17/03/1908 ; Luchana, betore 1900 ; Núm. 48 (Cerdà Plan)

carrer.name: Roca, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Margarita Roca, mother of Carles and Jacint Barbany i Roca, from Santa Eulàlia de Ronçana. They were landowners since the beginning of the twentieth century.

carrer.name: Roca, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Surname of a Catalan lineage from which take their origin some important people, among them: Pere de Roca, city councilor in 1277; 'mossèn' Joan de Roca, a notable who attended the burial of Queen Violant, widow of King Joan I, in 1431; and Joan de Roca, Professor of Philosophy in the early seventeenth century.

carrer.name: Roca i Batlle, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Roca i Batlle (1742 - 1811). Owner of the land. He was succeeded by Joaquim de Prat i de Roca (1803 - Moià, Bages 1871). The estate subsequently became the property of Josep Maria de Prat i d'Abadal.
carrer.anteriors: San José (a section), 28/08/1885; Mañé y Flaquer ?

carrer.name: Rocabertí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A Catalan noble family. During the dictatorship of General Primo de Rivera the name was given to this street to honor Bernat Hug de Rocabertí i d'Erill (1415 ? - 1479), poet, Commander of the Order of St John, Commander of the army of King Joan II, and contributor to the victory of the latter against Pere IV 'el Conestable', at Prats de Rei, on 28th February 1465, thus ensuring the stay of the Trastámara line in the Crown of Aragon.
carrer.anteriors: Fernando de Sagarra; Rocabertí, 19/11/1929; Fernando de Sagarra (Town Hall of Sarrià); Montserrat

carrer.name: Rocabruna, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Rocabruna, a town in the old municipality of Beget in the Garrotxa Catalan region. In 1969 Beget was joined to Camprodon, in the Ripollès region. The street belongs to the Ramon Albó group of buildings, where thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in the Girona province.

carrer.name: Rocafort, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Bernat de Rocafort (? - Aversa, Campania 1309). One of Roger de Flor's lieutenants in the Almogàvers Expedition. On the Roger's death, Rocafort took over as head of the Catalan Company, as that army was known.

carrer.name: Rodes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Greek isle of Rhodes, in the Aegean sea.

carrer.name: Rodrigo Caro, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Utrera 1573 - Seville 1647). Archaeologist, historian, lawyer and poet.

carrer.name: Rodríguez, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Rodríguez i Martra (Reus, Baix Camp 1835 - Barcelona 1893). Known as 'Josepet de Sants', he was a coffee trader and owner of a spot which became very famous during the September 1868 Revolution. He was a popular character in the vicinity. It is known that in 1873 he led two Republican battalions.

carrer.name: Rogent, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Elies Rogent i Amat (Barcelona 1821 - 1897). Architect. Professor of Topography at the School of Master Builders. Professor at, and first Principal of, the Barcelona School of Architecture. Member of the Academy of Sant Jordi.

carrer.name: Roger, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: We come across a Miquel Casimir Arrau Roger, procurator and representative of the Pujol and the Solà families, who owned the land of the area. It was suggested that the street be named after Pere Roger, a fourteenth century preacher and monk at the monastery of Ripoll.

carrer.name: Roger de Flor, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? 1268 - Adrianopolis, present-day Edvine, Turkey, 1305). A knight and adventurer. He led the Almogàvers Expedition to the East.
carrer.districtes: CIUTAT VELLA (01) EIXAMPLE (02) GRÀCIA (06) SANT MARTÍ (10)

carrer.name: Roger de Flor, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the street.

carrer.name: Roger de Llúria, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Roger de Lloria (habitually Llúria) e d'Amichi (Scalea, Calabria 1250 - Valencia, Horta 1305). Admiral of the Catalan armies of the Crown of Aragon.
carrer.anteriors: Lauria; Roger de Lauria, before 1900; Núm. 31 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Roig, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Surname of a Catalan family. There is evidence to show that the street already had this name in 1617. There is a Guillem Roig who was a Councilor in 1255.

carrer.name: Roig i Solé, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Roig i Solé (Reus, Baix Camp 1835 - Barcelona 1918). Sculptor. Member of the Barcelona Academy of Sciences and Arts. He is the author of the figure 'La senyoreta del paraigua' (Lady with umbrella) in the Ciutadella park.

carrer.name: Roine, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A street named after the Rhone, a river in Western Europe. It is the longest river of France.

carrer.name: Roís de Corella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Roís de Corella (Gandia, Safor 1433/1443 - Valencia, Horta 1497). Prolific and varied writer. He was master of Theology.

carrer.name: Roja de la Ciutat Meridiana, Plaça
carrer.descripcio: Named after Moscow's Red Square, by popular request of the neighbors.

carrer.name: Roma, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named for the same reason as is the avenue.

carrer.name: Roma, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the city of Rome, the capital of the Italian Republic.

carrer.name: Romà Macaya, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Romà Macaya i Gibert (Barcelona 1844 - 1923). He was a member of the Committee of the Universal Exhibition of 1888. He owned land in the Tibidabo mountain. Together with Dr. Andreu and Mas Yebra, they constituted 'S.A. El Tibidabo', a company that would undertake to urbanize the mountain.

carrer.name: Romaní, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Romaní i Puigdengolas (Capellades, Anoia 1830 - 1914). Lawyer and politician. Member of the Academy of Fine Letters (1884). Founder of the 'Revista Regional' (1884-1893).

carrer.name: Romaninar, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A spot formerly covered in rosemary ('romaní') shrubs . It evokes the natural area in which it is located.

carrer.name: Romans, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Onofre Romans i Company, Royal Import-Export Broker (1790 ? - Barcelona 1866). Married to Francesca Jordà i Gelabert, they owned five 'mujades' of land of the Casa Bertran estate, where the street was opened.

carrer.name: Romeu, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Meant as a homage to all those who walk to a holy shrine for penitential motives.

carrer.name: Romeus de Sant Medir, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Sant Medir was a farm house turned into country chapel, in the Collserola mountains of Barcelona. Since 1830, as a result of various pledges taken by people, meetings ('aplecs') began to take place there. Little by little, varied and different groups of friends ('colles') began to join in the event, having to save money throughout the year in order to pay for the expenses of the gathering. The number of Sant Medir' colles' is now fairly important. Most of them are to be found in Barcelona's Gràcia district, but some others exist in other districts - Sant Gervasi, Sants, Sarrià, etc.

carrer.name: Ròmul Bosch, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Ròmul Bosch i Alsina (Calella, Maresme 1852 - Barcelona 1923). Politician and ship owner. Mayor of Barcelona (1905).

carrer.name: Roquetes, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Named after a little hill within the old boundaries of Sant Andreu de Palomar.

carrer.name: Roquetes, Plaça de les
carrer.descripcio: A public area located in the same area as the neighborhood.

carrer.name: Ros, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Baudili Ros i Rodés (Sant Boi de Llobregat, Baix Llobregat 1831 - Barcelona 1905). A builder who purchased this land from Miquel Hortal i Martí in 1877. He was married to Maria Hortal i Arisó. Joan Baptista de Ros, the owner of the land, opened the passage in 1870.

carrer.name: Ros de Olano, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antonio Ros de Olano (Caracas, Venezuela 1808 - Madrid 1886). Army officer and writer. He presided over the Floral Games (poetry contest) of the Catalan Language in 1877. He inaugurated them delivering a speech in Catalan, quite exceptionally. A Member of the Spanish Parliament and life Senator. Minister of Instruction and Public Works and Buildings. He created the 'Escuelas Normales' in Spain and approved the new army uniform, which included the cap which, in his honor, was called the 'ros'.

carrer.name: Rosa, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The De la Rosa family owned in 1830 a large house here, which was pulled down in order to open a street and build new houses. Even though the street first received the name of "travessia del carrer dels Còdols", there is evidence that in 1836 was already known as Carrer de la Rosa.

carrer.name: Rosa Leveroni, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Rosa Leveroni i Valls (Barcelona 1910 - Cadaqués, Alt Empordà 1985). Poetess and librarian. She had a degree in Philosophy and Letters. Co-founded and wrote for 'Ariel' magazine.

carrer.name: Rosa Luxemburg, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: (Zamosc, Poland 1871 - Berlin 1919). Leader of the German socialists and revolutionaries. She studied natural sciences and political economics at Zurich University. She took part in the failed uprising of the Spartachians (a revolutionary faction within the SPD) against the government in January 1919. She was arrested and executed by the German army.

carrer.name: Rosa Sabater, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Rosa Sabater i Parera (Barcelona 1927 - Mejorada del Campo 1983). Pianist. She taught at the international piano courses held at Santiago de Compostela and in the conservatory of Freiburg im Briesgau.

carrer.name: Rosa Sensat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rosa Sensat i Vilà (El Masnou, Maresme 1873 - Barcelona 1961). Teacher. Directress of the Escola de Bosc, of the Barcelona City Council (1914-1930), and of the Grup Escolar Milà i Fontanals, of the Patronat Escolar (1930-1939).
carrer.anteriors: Zamora (a section); Zamora (a section); Vila Olímpica 4 (not official)

carrer.name: Rosales, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Eduardo Rosales y Gallina (Madrid 1836 - 1873). Painter. Member of the Academy of San Fernando. Gold Medal in Madrid. He worked on portraiture and landscape painting. A genuine representative of Castilian Romantic painting.

carrer.name: Rosalía de Castro, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rosalía de Castro de Murguía (Santiago de Compostela 1837 - Padrón 1885). Galician writer. She wrote in Galician as well as in Spanish.

carrer.name: Rosari, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: There used to be a small chapel dedicated to Our Lady of the Rosary in it.

carrer.name: Rosella, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the poppy flower. The name was freely given by the urbanizers of the area, and it is an apt one given the proximity of the natural green spaces of the hills of Collserola.

carrer.name: Roser, Placeta del
carrer.descripcio: Advocation of Our Lady. This is the popular name of this place.

carrer.name: Roser, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: One of the oldest streets of Poble-sec, initially known as "de la Verge del Roser". It was later translated as "calle del Rosal".

carrer.name: Roserar, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: An appropriate name for this area (the rose garden), where buildings are isolated and surrounded by gardens.

carrer.name: Rosés, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquima Rosés i Cuyàs, who died in the then town of Les Corts in 1853. She owned the land through which the street was opened.

carrer.name: Rosic, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Name of a Catalan family. This street, with identical name, is found as early as the fifteenth century.
carrer.anteriors: Rosich, before 1865; Mirallers; Catà; Sentmenat; Guillem de la Cerca

carrer.name: Rossell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Àngela Rosell i Inglés (? - 1943). Wife of Joaquim Taxonera i Cassà, owner of the land through which the street was opened.

carrer.name: Rosselló, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: A Catalan region of the far North-Eastern corner of the Principality, annexed to France in 1659 (Peace of the Pyrenees).

carrer.name: Rosselló i Porcel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Bartomeu Rosselló i Porcel, or Rosselló-Pòrcel (City of Majorca 1913 - El Brull, Osona 1938). Writer and poet in the Catalan language.

carrer.name: Rossend Arús, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rossend Josep Ramon Arús i Arderiu (Barcelona 1844 - 1891). Journalist and playwright. He donated to the City his house in the Passeig de Sant Joan and the public library bearing his name.

carrer.name: Rossend Nobas, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Rossend Nobas i Ballbé (Barcelona 1849 - 1891). Sculptor. Among others, he sculpted the monument to Rafael Casanova, Barcelona's Head Councilor in 1714.

carrer.name: Rossinyols, Avinguda dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the nightingales. The neighbors of the Rectoret neighborhood decided on the name.

carrer.name: Roura, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Roura i Estrada (Sant Feliu de Guíxols, Baix Empordà 1785 - Barcelona 1860). Chemist and Professor of Chemistry. In 1846 he discovered what became known as white powder. Member of the Academy of Sciences and Arts, and Principal of Barcelona's Industrial School. This thoroughfare opened in the land owned by Josep Valeta d'Arquer.

carrer.name: Roura, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: In 1901 Joaquim de Càrcer i d'Amat, Marquis of Castellbell, sold the land of this passage to Josep Maria de Sivatte i Llopart. At the close of this edition, it has not yet been possible to ascertain the true motivation behind this dedication, although it is clear that it has nothing to do with the name of a proprietor.

carrer.name: Rovelló, Torrent del
carrer.descripcio: On the path Alt from Mas Sauró to Vallvidrera les Planes.

carrer.name: Rovira, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Bartomeu Rovira i Mandri (? - 1872). He owned land in the area known as "Antic Joncar". He was married to Mariana Mariner i Calvet. The heirs were Joan, Jacint, and Joaquima Rovira i Mariner.

carrer.name: Rovira i Trias, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Rovira i Trias (Barcelona 1816 - 1889). Barcelona City Architect since 1867. He won the prize for the expansion (Eixample) of Barcelona, which never materialized. He is responsible for the urbanization project of the land where the square stands, a fact which motivated the dedication.

carrer.name: Rovira i Virgili, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona 1882 - Perpignan, Roussillon 1949). Writer, historian, journalist, lawyer and politician. He was the President of the Catalan Parliament in exile. He was one of the founders of Acció Catalana party and Acció Republicana de Catalunya, fused later into Acció Catalana Republicana.

carrer.name: Rubén Darío, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pen name of Félix Rubén García Sarmiento (1867 - 1916), the Nicaraguan poet.
carrer.anteriors: Solidaridad; Ignacio Iglesias; Solidaridad; San Antonio

carrer.name: Rubens, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Peter Paulus Rubens (Siegen, Westfalia 1577 - Anvers 1640). Flemish painter of fine composer perfection, the highest exponent of Baroque painting.

carrer.name: Rubinstein, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Anton Rubinstein (Vykhvatinec, Podolia 1829 - Petersburg 1894). Russian composer and pianist. Head of the Conservatory of Petersburg. Founder of the Russian Music Society (1850).

carrer.name: Rubió i Balaguer, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jordi Rubió i Balaguer (Barcelona 1887 - 1982). Philologist and historian. Librarian and researcher. Curator of the Biblioteca de Catalunya. University Professor. Member of the Institute for Catalan Studies and of the Academy of Fine Letters, correspondant of the Spanish Academy. Catalan Letters Award of Honor. Gold Medal of the Generalitat de Catalunya (1980).

carrer.name: Rubió i Lluch, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Rubió i Lluch (Valladolid 1856 - Barcelona 1937). Professor of General Literature at the universities of Oviedo and Barcelona. Historian. Numerary Member of the Academy of Fine Letters. President of the Institute for Catalan Studies. Numerary Member of the Academy of Fine Arts, Correspondant of the Madrid's Academy of History, and of the Spanish Academy. Spanish consul in Greece.

carrer.name: Rubió i Lluch, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Rubió i Lluch (Valladolid 1856 - Barcelona 1937). Professor, historian and man of letters.

carrer.name: Rubió i Ors, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Rubió i Ors (Barcelona 1818 - 1899). Writer and university Professor. His poems, published in 1841 under the pen name of 'Lo Gaiter del Llobregat', together with the ode 'La patria' by Aribau, are responsible for the bloom of the Renaixença (renaissance) of the Catalan editorial world. He was the President of the Academy of Fine Letters, and of the Floral Games poetical contest in 1890.

carrer.name: Rubió i Tudurí, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Nicolau Maria Rubió i Tudurí (Maó, Menorca 1891 - Barcelona 1981). Architect, garden landscaper, urban planner and writer. Among others, he is responsible for the gardens of the Royal Palace of Bederrida (badly named of Pedralbes) in Barcelona, in 1927.

carrer.name: Ruíz de Padrón, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antonio José Ruíz de Padrón (San Sebastián de la Gomera, Canary Islands 1757 - Galicia 1823). Politician. Member of Parliament in 1811, he defended the abolition of the Tribunal of the Holy Office. He was abbot of San Jorge de Villamartín de Valdeorras, Orense, in 1810.

carrer.name: Rull, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Joan de Rull i Arnabach (1755 - 1820). Nobleman. Manufacturer of 'indianes', specializing in dyes and colors. In 1786 he built in Les Corts the first dyeing establishment. His son Joan de Rull i Camarasa (1799 - 1854) carried on with the business.

carrer.name: Rustullet, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Rustullet i Casademunt (Crespià, Pla de l'Estany 1847 - Barcelona 1918). He owned the land through which this passage was built. His heirs were Andreu, Francesca and Teresa Rustullet i Costa.

carrer.name: Sa Tuna, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Seaside quarter of the municipality of Begur, Baix Empordà, situated in the Sa Tuna cove. Carrer de la Trinitat Nova, where many thoroughfares are named after villages and places on the Costa Brava.

carrer.name: Sabastida, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Properly speaking, Sebastida, after Can Sebastida de Joan Sebastida, magistrate of Barcelona in 1449. The house had a Gothic chapel in its entrance. It was the property of Erill Cardona Fons i Desplà, Baron of Albi, until it was demolished.

carrer.name: Sabateret, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Formerly there co-existed two streets with the name of Bonanat Sabater, one of which, to distinguish it from the other, adopted the name of "Carrer del Sabateret", either because it was shorter than the other or because the person who had properties in it was a younger relative of the previously-mentioned Bonanat, or even because this younger person was of slight stature.

carrer.name: Sabino Arana, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Sabino Arana Goiri (Abando, Bilbao 1865 - Pedernales 1903). Politician. Founder of the Basque Nationalist Party. Between 1883 and 1888 he studied Law in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Sacedón, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Sacedón, a municipality of Guadalajara, in Spain.

carrer.name: Safareigs, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: The public laundries of Barcelona were in this street. Its name was "the King's laundry".

carrer.name: Safo, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Sapho, the Greek poetess, was born in Mytilene, in the isle of Lesbos, in the 7th century BC. She was the daughter of Scamandronimon and Cleis. She always lived on the island, except during a period of exile in Sicily. Her verses are known by the name of Epithalamia, a delicate stylization of popular motives. She wrote some famous poems dedicated to the girls that lived with her. Her poetry makes eternal the instants of the love she experienced. She died in Lesbos in the 6th century BC. Plato named her The Tenth Muse.

carrer.name: S'Agaró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A place on the Costa Brava, in the Baix Empordà region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Sagàs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A municipality of the Berguedà region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Sagrada Família, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the same Family as was the lane.

carrer.name: Sagrada Família, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: The Holy Family of Nazareth, with which the work by Gaudí is associated. The lane is situated on the slope of the Güell Park, next to the Cottolengo (Home for those with mental disabilities).

carrer.name: Sagrada Família, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the church of the same name, which stands in front.

carrer.name: Sagrat Cor, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The former Carrer de Santa Madrona. As this name coincided with that of another street in Barcelona, it was agreed (on 23rd August 1922) to call the street "del general Moragues". Josep Moragues i Sobrevia, who signed his name MAS (Sant Hilari Sacalm, La Selva 1669 - Barcelona 1715), the hero of the Catalan resistance to the French and Castilian forces in the War of Spanish Succession. The first dictatorship (of Primo de Rivera) substituted the name of the street for the present one (9th August 1927) "in memory of the foundation in 1846, in the same street, of a nuns' school of the Institute of the Sacred Heart, in which annually some one-hundred-and-fifty girls received free education."
carrer.anteriors: Sagrado Corazón; Sagrat Cor; Sagrado Corazón, 09/08/1927; General Moragas; Beata Magdalena Barat; Santa Magdalena; Santa Madrona

carrer.name: Sagrera, Baixada de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the neighborhood, which receives its name from the "sacraria" formerly existing in front of the church of Sant Martí de Provençals. A "sacraria" is an enclosure in which cellars, silos, and a graveyard are set out around a consecrated chapel, and which is consequently under the protection of the Church and enjoys ecclesiastical immunity.

carrer.name: Sagrera, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The municipality of Sant Martí was formerly divided into four neighborhoods: La Sagrera, La Muntanya, El Clot, and El Taulat. The existence of these four neighborhoods is recalled in streets named after them. La Sagrera is the oldest neighborhood. In 1359 it had seventeen households.

carrer.name: Sagristà, Passatge d'en
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Les Corts farmhouse known as "Can Sagristà del Pla", which was the property of the Sagristà family from the eighteenth century. In accordance with the project approved by the Town Council of Les Corts, the Passatge d'en Sagristà was opened in 1877. The last proprietor was Gaspar Sagristà i Vila.

carrer.name: Sagristans, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Although certain scholars have stated that the name is owing to the fact that the sacristans of the Cathedral resided there, it is more probable that the street - the name of which, like that of the one which it crosses, used to be "dels Capellans" - came to be called "dels Sagristans" because it formed a pair with the other one: for sacristans are necessarily the companions of "capellans" (priests).

carrer.name: Sagués, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Sagués i Quintana (Gràcia 1838 - Sant Gervasi 1896). A veil weaver and the proprietor of the lot at the beginning of the street. He purchased the block of land, which measured five 'mujades', from Josep Cid i Ferrer, a canon at Vic cathedral, in 1871. In 1877 the Town Council of Sant Gervasi agreed to the urban-development project. In 1872 he married María del Remei Calvet i Sagrera, to whom he dedicated a street.

carrer.name: Sagunt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street owes its name to Sagunto, a municipality of the Camp de Morvedre region next to Valencia, Spain. An ancient Iberian and subsequently Roman city, it was the only coastal city to the south of the Ebro that would not recognize the overlordship of the Carthaginians.

carrer.name: Saint Louis, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from Saint Louis, a city in the state of Missouri, USA. The street is named in memory of the Olympic Games of 1904.

carrer.name: Sal, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: There doubtless existed in this street a salt warehouse associated with the salting of fish.

carrer.name: Saladrigas, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Rafael Saladrigas i Massagué, a textile-maker whose factory was in this place. The Rafael Saladrigas y Hermanos company bought the property in 1898. After the death of Rafael Saladrigas, his brothers Joan and Francesc carried on the business, together with Jaume Saladrigas Lafarga and Manuel Saladrigas i Freixas, partners in the firm.

carrer.name: Salamanca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Salamanca, a city in Castile-Leon.

carrer.name: Saldes, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street owes its name to Saldes, a municipality of the Berguedà region of Catalonia, which extends to the southern slopes of el Cadí (Serra Pedregosa).

carrer.name: Salern, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Salerno, the capital city of Campania, Italy. The street forms part of a group of thoroughfares dedicated, in the south-western neighborhood of el Besòs, to Italian cities.

carrer.name: Sales i Ferré, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Manuel Sales i Ferré (Ulldecona, Montsià 1843 - Vinaròs, El Baix Maestrat 1910). Historian and sociologist. Professor of Metaphysics in the Universidad Libre de Murcia in 1871; of Geography and History in the Universidad Literaria de Sevilla in 1874; and of Universal History in the Universidad de Sevilla as of 1882. From 1899 until 1910 he was Professor of Sociology in Madrid, where he founded the Institute of Sociology.
carrer.anteriors: Sales y Ferrer; Escultor Johan; Sales y Ferrer; Habana ?; Font Catalana ?

carrer.name: Saleta, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Xaviera de Saleta i Descatllar (1791 - 1869), Marchioness of Montsolís and proprietress of estates in that area.

carrer.name: Saleta, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Francesca Xaviera de Saleta i Descatllar (1791 - 1869), Marchioness of Montsolís and proprietress of estates in that area.

carrer.name: Salines, Carrer de les
carrer.descripcio: Referred to in documents as "carrer de les Salines", possibly in reference to the sale of salt. The Badal Hermanos firm owned a property in this street. In 1921 the dedication of the street to the organist Francisco Salinas (Burgos 1513 - Salamanca 1590) was proposed. There is no official confirmation that this dedication was actually approved.

carrer.name: Sallent, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Sallent, a municipality of the Bages region of Catalonia, in the valley of the Llobregat river, which crosses the boundary of the municipality from north to south, setting out from the Sallent gorge on the outskirts of the Bages plain.

carrer.name: Salomó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Salomó, a municipality of the Tarragonès region of Catalonia. The street belongs to the Milans del Bosch group of buildings, where the thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in Catalonia.

carrer.name: Salou, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Salou, a municipality of the Tarragonès region of Catalonia, though until recently it belonged to the municipality of Vila-seca de Solcina.

carrer.name: Salses, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josepa Salses i Moles (Llívia, Cerdanya 1812 - Barcelona 1871). The wife of Marià d'Oriola, de Cortada, de Junquers i Ibàñez, Count of la vall de Merlès, proprietor of the Can Cortada estate in the lands which he yielded for the opening of the street. In the 1980 street guide it was dedicated to Salses, a municipality of el Rosselló.

carrer.name: Salvà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Salvà i Campillo (Barcelona 1751 - 1828). Physician, teacher, and researcher. He founded the first Catalan meteorological station.

carrer.name: Salvador, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: A family of botanists. Joan Salvador i Boscà (Calella, Maresme 1598 - Barcelona 1681). Jaume Salvador i Pedrol, son of the former (Barcelona 1649 - 1740), city councilor in 1698. Joan and Josep Salvador i Riera, sons of Jaume, and scientists of note.

carrer.name: Salvador Alarma, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Alarma i Tastàs (Barcelona 1870 - 1941). Decorator and stage designer. He decorated the La Paloma ballroom, and painted the decorations of the Liceu Barcelona Opera House.

carrer.name: Salvador Allende, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Allende Gossens (1909 - Santiago de Chile 1973). Chilean physician and politician. President of Chile. From his youth he was a militant in the Socialist Party. He died in the military take-over.

carrer.name: Salvador Aulet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Barcelona 1782 - 1809). A trader and money-broker. One of the main participants in the Ascension Day plot (1809) against the French troops occupying Barcelona. One of the martyrs of the Ciutadella fortress in Barcelona.

carrer.name: Salvador Espriu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Espriu i Castelló (Santa Coloma de Farners, La Selva 1913 - Barcelona 1985). Writer, poet, and the major playwright of the post-Civil War period.

carrer.name: Salvador Espriu, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Espriu i Castelló (Santa Coloma de Farners, La Selva 1913 - Barcelona 1985). Writer, poet, and the major playwright of the post-Civil War period. In 1982 he received the City of Barcelona Gold Medal and refused the Cross of Alfonso X the Wise.

carrer.name: Salvador Mundí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Mundí i Roure (Castelló d'Empúries, Alt Empordà 1861 - 1922). A pedagog, honored for his dedication throughout more than twenty-five years to his work as a primary-school teacher in Sant Vicenç de Sarrià. An excellent amateur pianist, as a youth he played the 'tenora', a species of oboe, in order to pay for his studies. He was at the forefront of the labor movement within his profession.
carrer.anteriors: Cuyàs (joined to Dalmases); Dalmases (1st section), before 1900

carrer.name: Salvador Riera, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Riera i Giralt (Barcelona 1847 - 1916). Landowner. Son of Josep Riera. At the end of the nineteenth century he bought some portions of estates (in which the lane is to be found) proceeding from the Torre Llobeta property, formerly Mas Montaner and Can Basté de les Parets, lands which had belonged to the Marquis of Castellbell. He was married to Cecilia Estapé i Maynou.

carrer.name: Salvador Riera, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Riera i Giralt (Barcelona 1847 - 1916). Landowner.

carrer.name: Salvador Seguí, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Seguí i Rubinat (Tornabous, Urgell 1886 - Barcelona 1923). A working-class leader. Known as El Noi del Sucre.

carrer.name: Salvat Papasseit, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Joan Salvat Papasseit (Barcelona 1894 - 1924). Writer, poet, and journalist.

carrer.name: Salze, Camí del
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the deciduous willow-tree. A pathway between the Església road and the Sant Cugat pathway in Vallvidrera.

carrer.name: Salze, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to the willow-tree, 'Salix alba', of the family of the 'salicaceae'. A street in the neighborhood of El Coll.

carrer.name: Samaniego, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Félix María Sánchez Zabala, Samaniego (Laguardia 1745 - 1801). A Castilian writer of fables. He adopted his father's second surname: Samaniego. Before his death he ordered his works to be burnt, and it would seem that only his celebrated 'Fábulas' were saved.

carrer.name: Samaria, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Historical region of Palestine, between Galilee and Judea. It forms part of a group of thoroughfares situated in the suburb of Vall d'Hebron and with names relating to the Biblical texts.

carrer.name: Samsó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Samsó (nineteenth century). He fought for the independence of the Gràcia district in Barcelona.

carrer.name: San Pedro de Abanto, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This refers to the armed clash which occurred in the Third Carlist War on 25 February 1874 in the hamlet of the same name in Biscay, close to the Bilbao estuary (district of Balmaseda) between the Carlist forces of Ollo, Lizárraga and Andéchaga, and the liberal forces under General Moriones, in which there were more than two thousand casualties.

carrer.name: Sancho de Ávila, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Ávila 1523 - Lisbon 1583). A Castilian captain, commander of the guards and field master general of the Duke of Alba. He fought in the Netherlands - where he conquered Antwerp (1576) - and in Portugal, where he conquered Oporto (1580).

carrer.name: Sancho Marraco, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Sancho Marraco (La Garriga, Vallès Oriental 1879 - Barcelona 1963). A musician who scored many popular Catalan songs.

carrer.name: Sanet, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Sanet, a municipality of the Marina Alta region. The street belongs to the Milans del Bosch group of buildings, where the thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in the Països Catalans (lands historically associated with Catalonia and the Catalan language).

carrer.name: Sanllehy, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Domènec Joan Sanllehy i Alrich (Barcelona 1847 - 1911). Politician. Mayor of Barcelona by a Royal Decree (1906). On resigning he made way for the for Albert Bastardas i Sanpere, the President of the Cercle del Liceu, to stand in as Mayor. He married Anna Girona i Vidal, daughter of the banker Manuel Girona i Agrael and future Marchioness of Caldes de Montbui.

carrer.name: Sanpere i Miquel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Salvador Sanpere i Miquel (Barcelona 1840 - 1915). Politician, historian, and non-practising architect. He volunteered for the African war. A member of the Barcelona Academy of Fine Letters and of the Madrid Academy of History.

carrer.name: Sant Adrià, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It owes its name to Sant Adrià de Besòs, a municipality of the Barcelonès region of Catalonia. It adopts the name of the old church of Saint Adrian (a sixth-century martyr), mentioned in 1012.
carrer.anteriors: San Adrián, 30/06/1914; Rbla. de San Andrés (a section)

carrer.name: Sant Agustí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Augustinus Aurelius (Tagaste 354 - Hippo 430). Saint Augustine. Son of Saint Monica and the magistrate Patricius. Writer, theologian, and philosopher. Eloquent rhetorician and popular orator. Bishop of Hippo.

carrer.name: Sant Agustí, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: The Augustinian monks of the Ribera neighborhood would be expelled from their monastery in 1718 because it was included in the area of the future Ciutadella fortress which Philip V had ordered to be built. By way of compensation, a large vacant lot between the streets of Sant Pau and L'Hospital was given to them. The first stone of the new convent building was laid on 12th December 1728. When the monks were no longer there - as a consequence of the seizing of Church property in 1835 - the monastery church became a parish church. The area between the church and the Carrer de l'Hospital, previously closed off and used for the burial of the monks, was opened as a public square.

carrer.name: Sant Agustí Vell, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Its former name was Plaça de Sant Agustí, in reference to the Augustinian monastery that was established there in 1309, and which was largely demolished in 1718 in the construction of the Ciutadella fortress. The congregation went to a new monastery in the Raval area. From then on the square has been called Sant Agustí Vell.

carrer.name: Sant Alexandre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Saint Alexander, a bishop. Martyr in Rome in the third century AD. Son of Saint Felicity. The name was given to the street by Alexandre de Bacardí i Janer, the proprietor of the estate.

carrer.name: Sant Andreu, Riera de
carrer.descripcio: It adopts the name of the former municipality of Sant Andreu de Palomar.

carrer.name: Sant Antoni, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Saint Anthony of Padua (Lisbon 1190/1195 - Padua 1231). Franciscan, preacher and theologian. Doctor of the universal Church and miracle-worker. Son of Fernando Martín de Bulloes and Teresa Traveira de Azevedo.
carrer.anteriors: C. de Sant Antoni, 12/06/1980; C. de San Antonio

carrer.name: Sant Antoni, Travessia de
carrer.descripcio: The name comes from the fact that this street is a crossroad of the Carrer d'Astúries, which formerly was known as the Carrer de Sant Antoni.
carrer.anteriors: C. de la Travesía de San Antonio

carrer.name: Sant Antoni, Ronda de
carrer.descripcio: A circular road opened on the site of the slopes leading to the city wall constructed in 1377. It adopted the name of the portal of the monastery of Saint Anthony.

carrer.name: Sant Antoni Abat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This street was already in existence in the fifteenth century. Saint Anthony the Abbot (Coma, in the region of the Thebaid about 250 - 356). Egyptian abbot, considered the founder of monastic and hermitic life. The patron of domestic animals. The name is given to the street by a hospital which was opened in 1430 under the advocation of the saint and run by the regular canons of the order corresponding to him. At the beginning of the nineteenth century the building was granted to the Piarist Fathers.

carrer.name: Sant Antoni Abat, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Under the same dedication as is the street.

carrer.name: Sant Antoni dels Sombrerers, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after a chapel which was in the street and was maintained by the hatters' guild.

carrer.name: Sant Antoni Maria Claret, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni Maria Claret i Clarà (Sallent 1807 - Fontfroide, Languedoc 1870). Founder of the Congregation of the Missionaries of the Heart of Mary. Canonized in 1950. In 1897 his remains were brought from France to the mission-house in Vic.
carrer.anteriors: Av. Sant Antoni Maria Claret; Mutualitat; Arquebisbe Pare Claret; Coello; Arzobispo Padre Claret
carrer.districtes: EIXAMPLE (02) GRÀCIA (06) HORTA-GUINARDÓ (07) SANT ANDREU (09) SANT MARTÍ (10)

carrer.name: Sant Baltasar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: One of the Three Wise Men who went to Bethlehem to adore the child Jesus.

carrer.name: Sant Bartomeu, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Nathanael Ber-Talmai. Martyr. Saint Bartholomew: Aramaic patronymic of Ber-Talmai, the son of Talmai. He was from Cana in Galilee (first century AD), and one of the twelve apostles. The street was opened in 1819 at the request of the proprietor of the estate, whose name was Bartomeu.

carrer.name: Sant Bartomeu de la Quadra, Costa de
carrer.descripcio: Village of the municipality of Molins de Rei, in the Baix Llobregat region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Sant Benet, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Benedict of Nursia (Nursia, Umbria 480 - Montecassino, Lazio 547). Abbot, founder of monasteries and organizer of monastic life in the West. The name may be attributable to Benet Malvehy, who occupied the lane with his silk factory at the beginning of the twentieth century.

carrer.name: Sant Bernabé, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Joseph Barnabas ('Bar-Nebuhah': son of prophecy), called Joseph the Levite (Cyprus, first century AD). One of the first disciples of the apostles. Companion of Saint Paul.

carrer.name: Sant Bernat, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Bernard of Clairvaux (Fontaines-lès-Dijon, Champagne 1090 - Clairvaux, Burgundy 1153). Abbot and reformer of the Cistercians. Canonized by Alexander III in 1174. Proclaimed Doctor of the Church by Pius VIII in 1830.

carrer.name: Sant Bernat Calbó, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Mas Calbó, Reus, Baix Camp 1180 - Vic, Osona 1243). Abbot of the monastery of Santes Creus and Bishop of Vic. He accompanied King Jaume, together with St Raymond of Penyafort, in the conquest of Valencia. Titular saint of the church situated in the same square.

carrer.name: Sant Bertran, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: This recalls the name of the "orchards of Saint Bertrand", a name proceeding from an ancient sanctuary that stood at the foot of Montjuïc from 1313 until the beginning of the nineteenth century, when it was destroyed by the Napoleonic forces. Saint Bertrand, bishop of Comminges (Isle Jourdain, Gers, halfway through the eleventh century to 1123). In 1309, Clement V proclaimed him a saint. In this instance, the name Bertrand is the mother's name. The father of the saint was called d'Eixarch.
carrer.anteriors: San Beltrán, before 1865; Company F. López

carrer.name: Sant Bertran, Moll de
carrer.descripcio: A pier situated in front of the Miramar crest.

carrer.name: Sant Bonaventura, Carreró de
carrer.descripcio: Giovanni Fidanza di Ritello, Bonaventura di Bagnoregio (Bagnoregio, Viterbo 1221 - Lyon 1274), Saint Bonaventure. Cardinal Archbishop of Albano. Doctor of the Church and known as the "Seraphic Doctor". He assumed the name of Bonaventure in the novitiate. The street took the name from a chapel which formerly stood in the street and was dedicated to the saint

carrer.name: Sant Camil, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Camillo de Lellis e Compelli (Bucchiani di Chieti, Abruzzi 1550 - Roma 1614). Italian ecclesiastic, founder of the order now known as the Order of Saint Camillo de Lellis, regular clergy of the order of the Ministers of the Sick (Fathers of Good Death).

carrer.name: Sant Carles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Carlo Borromeo di Medicis (Castle of Arona, Lombardy 1538 - Milan 1584), Saint Charles. Cardinal Archbishop of Milan. Canonized in 1610 by Pius VI. The street was dedicated to St Charles because at that time the King was Charles III.
carrer.anteriors: San Carlos, before 1865; Durruti i Farràs

carrer.name: Sant Casimir, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Cracow 1458 - Vilnius, Lithuania 1484). Son of Casimir IV, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, and of Elizabeth of Hungary. Principal patron saint of Lithuania.

carrer.name: Sant Cebrià, Camí de
carrer.descripcio: St Cyprian of Horta was a hermitage at the foot of the Collserola range. It existed in the 12th century.

carrer.name: Sant Crispí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A Bishop of Pavia who died in 466.

carrer.name: Sant Crist, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Representation of Jesus Christ nailed on the cross, the central figure of the iconographic subject of the crucifixion. In the street there was a small chapel constructed in 1860 which had this advocation.

carrer.name: Sant Cristòfol, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Under the same dedication as is the street.

carrer.name: Sant Cristòfol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Saint Christopher was a legendary martyr of the persecution carried out by Decius (249 - 251). The name, "bearer of Christ" was given him for having carried Jesus across a river on his shoulders. The patron saint of travelers and pedestrians.

carrer.name: Sant Cugat, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (? - Castrum Octavianum 306). A Christian martyr from Barcelona. Mentioned by Aurelius Prudentius (about 400 AD) as a martyr who ennobled Barcelona. The author dedicates the following brief sentence to him: "Barcino claro Cucufate freta surget." He died in 306 AD in the place called Castrum Octavianum, which, in his memory, was later called Sant Cugat. The square occupies the space where the church of Sant Cugat del Rec used to stand.

carrer.name: Sant Cugat, Carretera de
carrer.descripcio: Also known as Carretera de l'Arrabassada. It leads to the municipality of Sant Cugat del Vallès.
carrer.anteriors: From Gracia to Manresa by San Cugat

carrer.name: Sant Cugat, Camí de
carrer.descripcio: Sant Cugat del Vallès. Municipality of the Vallès Occidental region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Sant Cugat del Vallès. The municipality of the Vallès Occidental region of Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: San Cugat del Vallés; 05/09/1907; San Vicente, before 1900

carrer.name: Sant Dalmir, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Rome, second century AD). Bishop and martyr.

carrer.name: Sant Delfí, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Pamplona ? - Bordeaux 404). Saint Delphinus, Bishop of Bordeaux. Through his example he converted St Paulinus afterwards Bishop of Nola.

carrer.name: Sant Domènec, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Domingo de Guzmán (castle of Caleruega Burgos about 1170 - Bologne 1221), Saint Dominic. Son of Félix de Guzmán and Juana de Aza. Founder of the Dominican order of preachers. Instituted the Rosary in 1206.

carrer.name: Sant Domènec de Santa Caterina, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: In memory of a doorway of the convent founded by St Dominic, known as the Convent of St Catherine, which was near this street. On St Dominic's day a fair dedicated to the sale of earthenware jugs was held around the convent church.
carrer.anteriors: Santo Domingo de Santa Catalina; Sergent de Milícies Francesc Vela

carrer.name: Sant Domènec del Call, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street was previously called "de la Sinagoga Major" (Great Synagogue), and is situated in the old Jewish neighborhood of Barcelona, the "Call". Given over to pillage and sacking on 5th August 1390, and with the Jews expelled who had formerly lived there, the street took the new name in memory of the first monastery of preaching friars that St Dominic had established, not very far from the place, in his visit to Barcelona in 1219.
carrer.anteriors: Santo Domingo del Call, before 1865; M. Manonellas; Carnicerías; Sinagoga Mayor; Santo Domingo

carrer.name: Sant Elies, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: St Elias I (430 - 518). Patriarch of Jerusalem. Hermit on Mt Nitria in Egypt. The land on which the street was opened was the property of Josep Elías i Busquets (Begur, Baix Empordà? - Barcelona 1858). Doctor of Laws. The name was given at the caprice of the proprietor, who wanted to dedicate the street to a St Elias with some relationship to Jerusalem, given that in this street there stood at that time the Monastery of Jerusalem.

carrer.name: Sant Elm, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? - Formiae 303). Saint Elmo, Bishop of Campagna, Italy. It corresponds to the same St Erasmus, patron of navigators, and also to St Telmo.

carrer.name: Sant Eloi, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Limoges 588 - Noyon 660). French goldsmith. Bishop of Noyon.

carrer.name: Sant Erasme, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The same St Elmus or St Telmus. The street was opened in 1850 in the estate of Erasme de Gònima, proprietor of a printed-fabric factory established in 1780 in the Riera Alta.

carrer.name: Sant Eudald, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Italy 405 - Aix, Ariège 452). Martyr. His tradition is very much alive in Catalonia. His relics were venerated in the monastery of Ripoll from 978 onwards. In 1886 they were transferred to Aix-les-Thermes. The dedication was made by Eudald Forns, the proprietor who granted land for the construction of the Vallcarca viaduct.

carrer.name: Sant Eusebi, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? - about 309/310 in Sicily). Pope and martyr. According to the 'Liber pontificalis', he was of Greek origin.

carrer.name: Sant Felip, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: One of the twelve apostles, an inhabitant of Bethsaida. The name of the lane comes from the fact that it is a crossroad of the street that was called Sant Felip, and today Zaragoza, in which in the period of the opening of the street (1880) an oratory dedicated to St Philip Neri had begun to be built.

carrer.name: Sant Felip Neri, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Olaguer de Montserrat, Chancellor of Catalonia and subsequently Bishop of Urgell, established the Congregation of Secular Priests of St. Philip Neri in this place towards the end of May 1673.

carrer.name: Sant Felip Neri, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Filippo Romolo Neri Soldi (Florence 1515 - Rome 1595), St Philip Neri. Jesuit preacher. Founder of the Oratory.

carrer.name: Sant Feliu de Codines, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality of the Vallès Oriental region of Catalonia.

carrer.name: Sant Feliu de Guíxols, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Municipality of the Baix Empordà region of Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: San Feliu de Guíxols; Gravina, before 1900

carrer.name: Sant Ferran, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Fernando III, King of Castile and Leon (Leon 1199 - Seville 1252). Canonized in 1671.

carrer.name: Sant Ferriol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Rome ? - Vienne, France, 312). Roman tribune. Martyr. The name of the street comes from a small chapel which is said to have stood in this place and which was dedicated to the saint.

carrer.name: Sant Francesc, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Under the same dedication as is the street. It recalled Francesc Buxó i Oliana, the former proprietor of the place.

carrer.name: Sant Francesc, Placeta de
carrer.descripcio: The Capuchin Friars who took up residence in the now non-existent monastery which has become the Plaça Reial gave this little square the name of St Francis of Assisi, as he was the patriarch of the Capuchin Order.

carrer.name: Sant Francesc, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Giovanni de Bernardone, St Francis of Assisi (Assisi 1182 - 1226). Founder of the Franciscan order. He was the son of Pietro de Bernardone, known as Moriconi, and of Giovanna de Bourlemont, known as della Pica. As a child he was called "il francese", which became Francesco.

carrer.name: Sant Francesc Xavier, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco Javier Jassu de Azpilcueta (castle of Xavier, Navarre 1507 - isle of Sancian, coast of China 1552), St Francis Xavier. Jesuit. Missionary and patron saint of missions. Apostle of the Indies and Japan.

carrer.name: Sant Francesc Xavier, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Under the same dedication as is the street.

carrer.name: Sant Frederic, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? - ? 838). Bishop and martyr of Utrecht.
carrer.anteriors: San Federico, before 1900; Mártires de Sans

carrer.name: Sant Fructuós, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (? - ? 259). Bishop of Tarragona. Martyr. The reason this street bears this name is that there used to be in that street a chapel from Montjuïc dedicated to the saint, which afterwards was known as "Santa Madrona" because of the relics which it contained.

carrer.name: Sant Gabriel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The Archangel Gabriel was the angel who greeted the Virgin with the words "Hail, Mary, full of grace". It was therefore owing to him that the town of Gràcia ("grace") received its name, and for this reason a street is dedicated to him. His name signifies "strength of God."

carrer.name: Sant Gaietà, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Gaetano de Thiene (Vicenza 1480 - Naples 1547). Jurist and priest. Founder of the order of the Theatines or regular clergy. The Bishop of Chietti or Theate was one of his collaborators, from which fact the name of the order proceeds.

carrer.name: Sant Galderic, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Ninth century). Historical patron saint of the Catalan peasantry and farmers. Son of a peasant family of Occitania. He entered the Benedictine order, and defended the peasants from the oppression and ill-treatment which they received from the feudal lords of the time. Canonized in 990.

carrer.name: Sant Gaudenci, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Fourth century - 410). Bishop of Brescia. Martyr.
carrer.anteriors: San Gaudencio; Asilo; Pje. de la Fuente; Cº de la Iglesia ?

carrer.name: Sant Genís, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Named after the ancient township of Sant Genís dels Agudells, at the foot of Collserola.

carrer.name: Sant Germà, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: He is laid to rest in one of the chapels of the cathedral of Girona. Nothing is known of his life.

carrer.name: Sant Gervasi, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: Martyr in Milan (fourth century AD). The name proceeds from the old municipality of Sant Gervasi de Cassoles. The original rural chapel under the advocation of the twin brother martyrs Gervasius and Protasius is mentioned as early as 987 AD. It was in the place known as "the broken cross" or "the castaway cross", which today is the Plaça de la Bonanova.
carrer.anteriors: Víctor Hugo (joined to it), 05/09/1907; Ctra. de Cornellá a Fogás de Tordera; Sant Gervasi, before 1895; Huarte, 1870

carrer.name: Sant Gervasi de Cassoles, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The former main street of Sant Gervasi, originating from a pathway which used to pass by the stream and which the municipality converted into a street by widening it in 1849. "Cassoles" comes, it would seem from "cases soles" (free-standing houses).
carrer.anteriors: San Gervasio de Cassolas, 16/08/1927; San Gervasio, 05/09/1907; Mayor, before 1851

carrer.name: Sant Gil, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Tenth century AD. Hermit of the valley of Núria, in the Pyrenees. The street was opened in approximately 1840. The name comes from a proprietor who was called Gil.

carrer.name: Sant Gregori Taumaturg, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: (Neocesarea del Ponto Polemoniaco about 213 - 270). Bishop.

carrer.name: Sant Guillem, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Guillaume de Toulouse, Duke of Acquitaine (768 - Gelone, Languedoc 812). Son of Theodoric, Count of Autun, and of Auda Martel. Charlemagne admitted him into his Council. He participated in the conquest of Barcelona in 801, and founded a number of monasteries.

carrer.name: Sant Hermenegild, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Visigothic prince, named governor of Hispalis (Seville) by his father Leovigild. He took the province of Baetica as the base for his rebellion against his father, who was an Arian and a persecutor of Catholics (580-585 AD). He died, a martyr for his beliefs, in 586. He was married to a Catholic, Indegard, the daughter of the king of Austrasia, and it was she who, with the assistance of St Leander, Bishop of Seville, converted him to Catholicism.

carrer.name: Sant Hipòlit, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Hippolyte of Rome (? - Sardinia 235). Martyr.

carrer.name: Sant Honorat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: The street dates back to at least 1325. The first public fountain was inaugurated in this street on 4th July 1356. Shortly afterwards, above the fountain a chapel was constructed with an image of the saint to whom the street is dedicated.

carrer.name: Sant Ignasi, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Eneko López de Loyola, son of Bertrán Ibáñez de Oñaz y de Loyola and of Marina Sánchez de Licona (Loyola, Guipúzcoa 1491 - Rome 1556). Founder of the Company of Jesus. He took the name Ignatius and the patronymic López, which was a long-standing one in his family. St Ignatius stayed on three occasions (1523, 1524, and 1528) in a house in this street which was the residence of a lady named Agnès Pujol, the widow of Pasqual.
carrer.anteriors: San Ignacio, before 1900; Forn dels Cotoners (antiguo); Simon Febrer (older)

carrer.name: Sant Ildefons, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Toledo 610 - 667). A street also called Alfons and Amfós. Writer. Archbishop of Toledo (657-667).

carrer.name: Sant Iscle, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It took the name of the ancient sanctuary of Sant Iscle de les Feixes, in Cerdanyola.
carrer.anteriors: San Acisclo; Cº Antiguo de San Acisclo (a section)

carrer.name: Sant Isidre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Madrid 1080 - 1130). Agricultural laborer. Patron saint of the peasants and of farmers. Gràcia, as the rural village that it then was, celebrated until 1850 its Festival on 15th May, the feast-day of St Isidore.

carrer.name: Sant Iu, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Ivo Hélory de Kermartin (castle of Le Minihy, near Tréguier, Kermartin, Lower Brittany 1235 - 1303). Lawyer, theologian, and judge. A Minorite. His name is given to the door of the Cathedral, which opens onto this square.

carrer.name: Sant Jacint, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Jacint Orfanell (La Jana, Baix Maestrat 1578 - Japan 1622). Martyr. Dominican missionary.

carrer.name: Sant Jaume, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Known as the Greater (Bethsaida? - Jerusalem 42). Son of Zebedee and brother of John the Evangelist. A late tradition made him into the evangelist of Hispania and originated the belief that his sepulchre was in Compostela.

carrer.name: Sant Jaume, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Its present form dates from 1841. Previously, it was the small junction formed by the intersection of the two thoroughfares which crossed the city from north to south and from east to west: Llibreteria-Escrivanies-Call and Bisbe-Ciutat-Regomir. It already existed in 1261, when it stood in front of the church of Sant Jaume, established in 1057. In the fourteenth century a porch was added where the councilors of the city gathered when they had to attend a public act as a body. In 1598 it was resolved to extend the Palau de la Generalitat to the little square in front of the porch of the church. In 1823 the Town Council decided to demolish the church and other buildings attached to it in order to form a large square, which is the present one, and which was opened in 1840 with the name Plaça de la Constitució.
carrer.anteriors: San Jaime; Constitución; República; Constitución; San Jaime, before 1820

carrer.name: Sant Jaume Apòstol, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Under the same dedication as is the lane.

carrer.name: Sant Joan, Passeig de
carrer.descripcio: One of the twelve apostles. Evangelist. This name was given to the boulevard in memory of the former Passeig de Sant Joan, or Passeig Nou, begun on in 1795 and finished in 1802, which verged on the slopes of the Ciutadella fortress, and which disappeared with the demolition of the latter.
