carrer.descripcio: Bernat de Vilamarí (? - ? 1516). Admiral of the Fleet. Lord of Palau-saverdera. Count of Capaccio. Captain-general of the army of the Crown of Catalonia and Aragon.

carrer.name: Vilamur, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Viscounty of Vilamur. A lineage from the old County of Pallars. Ramon d'Anglesola, Baron of Bellpuig and Viscount of Vilamur (Ramon II of Vilamur) stands out. It is also the reason of the dedication of a nearby street to Anglesola.

carrer.name: Vilana, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: An illustrious Sarrià family. The Notary Ramon Vilana i Perles was an important member of this family. He was Secretary to King Charles of Austria during the War of Succession. He retired to Vienna with the Monarch in 1710. The name of the street comes from the Torre Vilana, and old stately home in Sarrià, located on the spot where the boundaries of Sant Gervasi and Sant Vicenç de Sarrià met.

carrer.name: Vilanova, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Arnau de Vilanova (? 1238 - Genoa 1311). Doctor and philosopher. He was the first empiricist among scientists.

carrer.name: Vilapicina, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Name of the neighborhood, which originates from a small country chapel which stood in the area and alluded to in 1031 named Santa Eulàlia de Vilapicina. The names 'Villa Peciguina' (994) and 'Villa Picina' (998) are already found in tenth century documents. The name could mean "resin-glue kiln".

carrer.name: Vilardell, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: On land already mentioned in the eleventh century located near the 'Villa de Sanctis' (Sants neighborhood).

carrer.name: Vila-real, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Vila-real, a municipality of the Plana Baixa region of the Valencia province.

carrer.name: Vilaret, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Antònia Vilaret i Ojeda was the proprietress of part of the land previously owned by Antoni de Magarola i d'Ardena.

carrer.name: Vila-rodona, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Vila-rodona, a municipality of the Alt Camp region of Catalonia, which is crossed from North to South by the Gaià river. The name received municipal approval together with the Carrers de Bràfim and Nulles, three municipalities of the Alt Camp located in the same area.

carrer.name: Vilarós, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Vilarós i Hortal (Sarrià 1827 - Barcelona 1907). Proprietor of the land. Councilor of the former town of Sant Gervasi, now a district of Barcelona.

carrer.name: Vila-seca, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Vila-seca de Solcina, a municipality of the Tarragonès region of Catalonia. The street was dedicated in 1980. Although the street belongs to the Ramon Albó group of buildings, where thoroughfares are dedicated to places and villages in the Girona -not Tarragona-province, the dedication has been preserved.

carrer.name: Vilassar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Two municipalities in the Maresme region of Catalonia: Vilassar de Mar and Vilassar de Dalt. Vilassar asked in 1419 for unity with Barcelona through the formula of the 'carreratge'.

carrer.name: Vilatorta, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Sant Julià de Vilatorta, a municipality of the Osona region of Catalonia. A street in the Torre Baró neighborhood where most thoroughfares are dedicated to towns in Catalonia.
carrer.anteriors: Bda. de Viladecols; Forn de Viladecols

carrer.name: Vil·la Amèlia, Jardins de la
carrer.descripcio: Name of a house owned by the Girona family. The name comes Amèlia de Vilanova i Nadal, the wife of Ignasi Girona. The house is next to Vil·la Cecília, which took its name from Cecília Gómez del Olmo, the wife of Eduard Conde, owner of the estate.

carrer.name: Vil·la Cecília, Jardins de la
carrer.descripcio: Name of the house owned by the Conde family. It takes its name from Cecília Gómez del Olmo, the wife of Eduardo Conde Giménez (Madrid 1840 - Sarrià 1914). At present the building is of municipal property and used as Sarrià's civic center.

carrer.name: Villar, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc de P. del Villar i Carmona (Barcelona 1860 - Geneva 1927). Municipal architect of Sant Martí de Provençals, author of the urban planning project which included the street.

carrer.name: Villarroel, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Antoni de Villarroel i Peláez (Barcelona 1656 - Segovia 1742). Supreme Commander of the Catalan forces defending Barcelona in the 1714 siege.

carrer.name: Villena, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Enrique de Villena y de Castilla (? 1384 - Madrid 1434). Writer. Count of Cangas and of Tineo (1398) and Grand Master of the Calatrava order (1404). Titular Marquis of Villena, Lord of Hiniesta. Víctor Balaguer described this same person as Enric d'Aragó.

carrer.name: Vimetera, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the osier tree. A lane in Vallvidrera dedicated to names of plants and trees, as in the rest of the area.

carrer.name: Vinaròs, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Vinaròs, a municipality of the Baix Maestrat region of the Valencia province. The name was given after the fishermen and mariners from this town who came to settle in this street.

carrer.name: Vint-i-sis de Gener 1641, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In memory of the armed clash that took place in Montjuïc on 26th January 1641, in which the troops of Philip IV, under the command of Los Vélez, were routed by the Catalan forces during the Rippers' War (1641). The architects of the deed were Pau Claris, President of the Generalitat; Joan Pere Fontanella, Chief Councilor; and the army leaders, namely Francesc de Cabanyes, Francesc de Tamarit, Joan Bautista Montfar, Josep d'Ardena, Josep de Pinós, Joan de Copons, Caselles, Radas, Tapioles and others.
carrer.anteriors: Veintiseis de Enero; 23/03/1911; General Ibañez; Dos de Mayo

carrer.name: Vintró, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Vintró i Vintró (1784 - 1865). Proprietor of the land in the area known as "peça dels enamorats".

carrer.name: Vintró, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Vintró i Vintró (1784 - 1865). Owner of the land. He was succeeded by his son Pere Vintró i Sacristán. The name is supposedly dedicated to the family and the farmhouse which it represents.

carrer.name: Vinya, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: To remember the vineyards in the Guinardó area.

carrer.name: Vinya Llarga, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A description of a piece of land i the area (the long vineyard).

carrer.name: Vinyals, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Magí Vinyals i Sabaté (Barcelona 1856 - 1928). Proprietor. He bought the land in 1900. He was married to Teresa Graells.

carrer.name: Vinyar, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: The Vineyard. A street next to the Carrers del Pou (the well), del Molí (the mill) and dels Nou Pins (the nine pine trees), all of which contribute to make a description of the former landscape of the area.

carrer.name: Vinyassa, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: The reason of the name is the nearby water channel of La Vinyassa.

carrer.name: Vinyeta, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: A diminutive of 'vinya' (vineyard). A lane located on the Northern slopes of the mountain of Montjuïc.

carrer.name: Violant d'Hongria, Reina d'Aragó, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Andreua Arpád de Courtenay (Hungary 1216 - Huesca 1251). Queen of Catalonia and Aragon. Lady of Montpellier, Baroness of Omeladès and Viscountess of Millau. Second wife of King Jaume I. The name was given to the street in 1943, to replace the name "Yolanda" by request of Hungarian Hispanist Oliver Brachfelch, on the occasion of the publication of a biography of the Queen and as a "homage to Hungary".
carrer.anteriors: Violante de Hungria "Reina de Aragón ", 16/03/1943; Yolanda; Rolanda; Sadurní (a section)

carrer.name: Violer, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the wallflower ('violer'). Together with the "Carrer dels Geranis" (geraniums) and "Carrer del Presseguer" (peach tree), to which it leads, they form a union.

carrer.name: Violer, Passatge del
carrer.descripcio: Part of a group of thoroughfares named after names of flowers and plants.

carrer.name: Virgili, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Pere Virgili i Bellver (Vilallonga del Camp, Tarragonès 1699 - Barcelona 1776). Surgeon. Founder and first Principal of the Col·legi de Cirurgia de Barcelona (1760). He was chamber surgeon of King Fernando VI.

carrer.name: Viriat, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: (Mons Herminius, on present-day Serra da Estrêla Portuguese range ? - ? 139 BC). Portuguese (Lusitan) shepherd and leader in the fight against Roman domination.

carrer.name: Virrei Amat, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Manuel d'Amat i de Junyent (Vacarisses, Vallès Occidental 1704/1707 - Barcelona 1782). Spanish Viceroy in Peru from 1761 to 1776. A military man belonging to the order of Saint John of Jerusalem. Took part in campaigns in Africa and Italy. He promoted expeditions to the Isles of Pascua and Tahiti. He had a house in this spot.

carrer.name: Virreina, Passatge de la
carrer.descripcio: Viceroy Amat built a palace for his wife, Maria Francesca Fiveller de Clasquerí i de Bru, and made a present of it to her.

carrer.name: Virreina, Plaça de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after the stately home built for his wife by Viceroy Amat. In1877 it was demolished in order to make room for building the church of Sant Joan, started in 1878 and finished in 1884. The square in front of the main entrance to the church was urbanized and received the name it still bears today.

carrer.name: Virtut, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Named after virtue - the customary practice of good and of the moral laws.

carrer.name: Vista Bella, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: A reference to the fair view and the panorama that one could enjoy from the spot.

carrer.name: Vistalegre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: It recalls a high vantage point from one of the houses in the Raval neighborhood. In 1804 permission was granted to bothers Antoni and Joan Bautista Brugada to open a street through lands with orchards which was part of their property.

carrer.name: Vista-rica, Carretera de
carrer.descripcio: After the name of the house in the vicinity, near the road to Sant Cugat.

carrer.name: Vitrària, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The botanic name of the plant popularly known in Catalan as 'morella roquera'.

carrer.name: Viver, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Viver-i-Serrateix, a municipality of the Berguedà region of Catalonia, between the Merola and Navel rivers.

carrer.name: Vivers, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the nurseries in the Montjuïc mountain, near the Avinguda de l'Estadi.

carrer.name: Volart, Rambla de
carrer.descripcio: Joaquim Volart i Pou, a notary who wrote the deed of sale of the land which had to be urbanized in order to open a number of streets, one of which is the actual rambla, opened in 1896.
carrer.anteriors: C. de Ampúrias; Ignacio Iglesias (without effectiveness); Guinardó

carrer.name: Voló, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: Named after El Voló, a former Catalan village today in French Roussillon. The French translated it as Le Boulou. It had even been translated into Spanish as "Calle del Balón".

carrer.name: Volta de la Perdiu, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Some establishments in this short street used to serve fried lungs and heart of partridge ('perdiu').
carrer.anteriors: Arco de la Perdiz; Perdiz; Arco de Nuestra Señora de la Ayuda

carrer.name: Volta del Remei, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: It starts right in front of the door of the Remei chapel, at the Sant Jaume parish church, an old convent of Trinitarians.

carrer.name: Volta dels Jueus, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: Some Jews who had converted to Catholicism used to live in this street.

carrer.name: Volta dels Tamborets, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: A reference to the job of the 'tamboriners', one of the branches of old naval joinery which used to be carried out in workshops around the Born area at the time of King Jaume I.
carrer.anteriors: Arco dels Tamborets; Barra dels Aucells; Volta; Arco de Santa Eulalia; Tamborinet; Cáules

carrer.name: Volta d'en Bufanalla, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The nickname of the owner of one of the houses in that street.

carrer.name: Volta d'en Colomines, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The name is a corruption of the surname Coromines, an old Barcelona family of many illustrious people, some of whom must have had some relation with this street at some stage: Joan Coromines, City Councilor in 1383, 1393 and 1406; Francesc Coromines, Councilor in 1411 and 1416; Pere Coromines, Chief Councilor in 1482 and 1496, and others throughout the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.

carrer.name: Volta d'en Dusai, Carrer de la
carrer.descripcio: The Dusai are a lineage of Honored Citizens of Barcelona (also known with the variants 'Durai', 'Durall', 'd'Usai 'or 'd'Usall') which has given the city some illustrious persons: ambassadors, mariners, representatives of the King ('veguers'), and councilors. Francesc Dusai is one of the Patricians who on 13th January 1764 helped launch the first Academy of Natural Sciences and Arts ever established in Spain.
carrer.anteriors: Arco de Dusay; Arco de la Señora Duralla

carrer.name: Voltes d'en Cirés, Jardins de les
carrer.descripcio: A public space recently recovered in Ciutat Vella.

carrer.name: Voluntaris Olímpics, Plaça dels
carrer.descripcio: Named as a tribute to all the Olympic volunteers during the Barcelona Olympic Games and Special Olympics of 1992.

carrer.name: Wagner, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Wilhelm Richard Wagner (Leipzig 1813 - Venice 1883). German composer.

carrer.name: Walter Benjamin, Jardins de
carrer.descripcio: Walter Benjamin (Berlin 1892 - Port Bou 1940). German writer and critic. After his studies in his home city and Tubingen, he did his doctorate in Bern. He lived temporarily in Eivissa/Ibiza and he exiled himself in Paris in 1933 for fear of the Nazi persecution, given his condition as a Jew. In 1940 he moved to Lourdes with the idea of crossing the Pyrenees into Spain, but his attempt failed. He finally took his life in Port Bou. From his writings we should single out 'The Concept of Criticism in German Romanticism' and 'Origins of the German 'Trauerspiel''.

carrer.name: Washington, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: George Ball Washington (Bridges Creek, Virginia 1732 - Mount Vernon, Virginia 1799). First President of the Union (United States of America). Chief General of the North American Army in 1798.

carrer.name: Watt, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: James Watt (Greenock 1736 - Handsworth, Scotland 1819). Engineer. He invented the steam engine.

carrer.name: Wellington, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Arthur Colley Wellesley, Duke of Wellington (Dublin 1769 - Walmer Castle, Kent 1852). British army officer and politician. Duke of Ciudad Rodrigo and Grandee of Spain. Prince of Waterloo. Chief General of the British Army in the Spanish peninsula during the Spanish War of Independence.

carrer.name: X, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: A street in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, where, with only a few exceptions, the streets named with letters follow a north-south direction, and those with names an east-west direction.

carrer.name: Xaloc, Moll de
carrer.descripcio: The Catalan name for the southeasterly wind, or sirocco.

carrer.name: Xandri, Plaça d'en
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Xandri farmhouse.

carrer.name: Xandri, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: Named after the Xandri farmhouse in the vicinity.

carrer.name: Xavier Nogués, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Francesc Xavier Nogués i Casas (Barcelona 1873 - 1941). Draftsman, engraver and painter. He belongs to the post-modernist generation, but he became the most representative artist of the 'Noucentisme' movement.

carrer.name: Xifré, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Josep Xifré i Casas (Arenys de Mar, Maresme 1777 - Barcelona 1856). A businessman who made an immense fortune in America. When he came to Barcelona to retire, he commissioned some houses to be built in the Pla de Palau (1835), which became popularly known as "Els Porxos d'en Xifré", or Xifré's Arcades. They were the work of architects Josep Buixareu and Francesc Vila.

carrer.name: Xile, Avinguda de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Chile, the South American state.

carrer.name: Xile, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: It adopted the name of the nearby Avinguda de Xile, after the South American state.

carrer.name: Xinxó, Passatge d'en
carrer.descripcio: Josep Xinxó i Canellas, attorney, proprietor of the land. He was succeeded by his son Francesc Josep Xinxó i Marton (Barcelona 1835 - 1910).

carrer.name: Xipre, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Cyprus, the island in the east of the Mediterranean Sea, to the south of the Anatolian peninsula.

carrer.name: Xiprer, Plaça del
carrer.descripcio: Named after the cypress tree. A square in Sarrià at the crossroads of Carrer Jaume Piquet and Carrer de la Mare de Déu de Núria.

carrer.name: Xiprer, Carrer del
carrer.descripcio: In the old Guinardó neighborhood, before the urbanization of the area, this street already existed. In times before the confiscation of Church goods in 1835, it was customary for houses in the little populated outskirts of the city to provide lodging for mendicant friars on their way when it got dark. To indicate the existence of a refuge, the farmhouse or the peasants of the area would plant one or two 'xiprers 'or cypress trees (no more) not too far, as a sign of the hospitality they were offering. It is possible that the name Carrer del Xiprer, in Torre Garcini, would have this origin.

carrer.name: Xiquets de Valls, Carrer dels
carrer.descripcio: Named after the group of people from the city of Valls involved in the Catalan tradition of erecting human castles or 'castells'.

carrer.name: Xuclà, Carrer d'en
carrer.descripcio: A corruption of the Catalan 'joglar' (minstrel or jongleur). A street already documented in 1387 and 1442 as 'Juglar'.

carrer.name: Y, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: A street in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, where, with only a few exceptions, the streets named with letters follow a north-south direction, and those with names an east-west direction.

carrer.name: Yucatán, Passatge de
carrer.descripcio: A stretch of sea between the Western coast of Cuba and the Yucatán peninsula (Mexico), which links the Gulf of Mexico with the Caribbean Sea. This lane is located in the Area of Logistic Activities (Zona d'Activitats Logístiques, ZAL) in Barcelona harbor, where the thoroughfares are dedicated to the world's seas and oceans.

carrer.name: Z, Carrer
carrer.descripcio: A street in the industrial estate of the Consortium of Barcelona's Zona Franca, where, with only a few exceptions, the streets named with letters follow a north-south direction, and those with names an east-west direction.

carrer.name: Zamora, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Named after Zamora, a city of Castile-Leon.
carrer.anteriors: Padilla (1st section); Luis Pellicer; Padilla; Núm. 42 (Cerdà plan)

carrer.name: Zenòbia Camprubí, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Zenòbia Camprubí i Aymar (Malgrat, Maresme 1887 - San Juan de Puerto Rico 1956). Writer. In 1916 he married the Spanish poet Juan Ramón Jiménez. She translated the literary works of Rabindranath Tagore from English into Spanish.

carrer.name: Zona Franca, Passeig de la
carrer.descripcio: It leads to the Zona Franca industrial state. Some large industries located here are exempt from paying tariffs.

carrer.name: Zona Sud, Moll de la
carrer.descripcio: A dock located in the southern area of the Harbor.

carrer.name: Zuloaga, Carrer de
carrer.descripcio: Ignacio de Zuloaga y Zabaleta (Éibar 1870 - Madrid 1945). Basque painter. A master portraitist, he had a very important international career and exhibited in the main cities of the world.

carrer.name: Zurbarán, Plaça de
carrer.descripcio: Francisco de Zurbarán (Fuentedecantos, Andalusia 1598 - Madrid 1664). Painter. He worked with Velázquez and was influenced by the art of Murillo.
